" [Jude]180-jude then dropped behind , waited a few minutes to recover breath , and went [home]3897-home with a consciousness of having struck a blow for [Christminster]180-jude . Through the intervening fortnight [he]180-jude ran about and smiled outwardly at [his]180-jude inward thoughts , as if [they]738-their were [people]658-people meeting and nodding to [him]180-jude - smiled with that singularly beautiful irradiation which is seen to spread on young faces at the inception of some glorious idea , as if a supernatural lamp were held inside [their]738-their transparent natures , giving rise to the flattering fancy that heaven lies about [them]738-their then . [He]180-jude honestly performed [his]180-jude promise to [the man of many cures]4040-the man of many cures , in whom [he]180-jude now sincerely believed , walking miles hither and thither among [the surrounding hamlets]4041-the surrounding hamlets as [the Physician 's agent in advance]4042-the physician 's agent in advance . On the evening appointed [he]180-jude stood motionless on [the plateau]4043-the plateau , at [the place where [he]180-jude had parted from [Vilbert]189-vilbert]4044-the place where he had parted from vilbert , and there awaited [his]180-jude approach . [The road - physician]4045-the road - physician was fairly up to time ; but , to the surprise of [Jude]180-jude on striking into [his]180-jude pace , which [the pedestrian]4046-the pedestrian did not diminish by a single unit of force , [the latter]444-the latter seemed hardly to recognize [[his]180-jude young companion]4048-his young companion , though with the lapse of the fortnight the evenings had grown light . [Jude]180-jude thought it might perhaps be owing to [his]180-jude wearing another hat , and [he]180-jude saluted [the physician]4032-the physician with dignity . "[721-physician] Well , [[my]0-i boy]696-my boy ? " said [the latter]444-the latter abstractedly . "[721-physician] [I]0-i 've come , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] [You]0-i ? who are [you]0-i ? Oh yes - to be sure ! Got any orders , [lad]741-lad ? " "[741-lad] Yes . " And [Jude]180-jude told [him]444-the latter the names and addresses of [the cottagers who were willing to test the virtues of the world - renowned pills and salve]4051-the cottagers who were willing to test the virtues of the world - renowned pills and salve . [The quack]4052-the quack mentally registered these with great care . "[741-lad] And the Latin and Greek grammars ? " [Jude]180-jude 's voice trembled with anxiety . "[741-lad] What about [them]742-them ? " "[742-them] [You]0-i were to bring [me]0-i [yours]743-yours , that [you]0-i used before [you]0-i took [your]0-i degree . " "[0-i] Ah , yes , yes ! Forgot all about it - all ! So many lives depending on [my]0-i attention , [you]0-i see , [[my]0-i man]719-my man , that [I]0-i ca n't give so much thought as [I]0-i would like to other things . " [Jude]180-jude controlled [himself]180-jude sufficiently long to make sure of the truth ; and [he]180-jude repeated , in a voice of dry misery , "[0-i] [You]0-i have n't brought ['em]745-'em ! " "[0-i] No . But [you]0-i must get [me]0-i some more orders from [sick people]746-sick people , and [I]0-i 'll bring the grammars next time . " [Jude]180-jude dropped behind . [He]180-jude was [an unsophisticated boy]4053-an unsophisticated boy , but the gift of sudden insight which is sometimes vouchsafed to [children]4054-children showed [him]180-jude all at once what shoddy humanity the quack was made of . There was to be no intellectual light from this source . The leaves dropped from [his]180-jude imaginary crown of laurel ; [he]180-jude turned to a gate , leant against it , and cried bitterly . The disappointment was followed by an interval of blankness . [He]180-jude might , perhaps , have obtained grammars from [Alfredston]20-alfredston , but to do that required money , and a knowledge of what books to order ; and though physically comfortable , [he]180-jude was in such absolute dependence as to be without a farthing of [his]180-jude own . At this date [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson sent for [his]163-phillotson pianoforte , and it gave [Jude]180-jude a lead . Why should [he]180-jude not write to [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster , and ask [him]409-the schoolmaster to be so kind as to get [him]409-the schoolmaster the grammars in [Christminster]180-jude ? [He]180-jude might slip a letter inside the case of the instrument , and it would be sure to reach the desired eyes . Why not ask [him]180-jude to send any old second - hand copies , which would have the charm of being mellowed by the university atmosphere ? To tell [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt of [his]180-jude intention would be to defeat it . It was necessary to act alone . After a further consideration of a few days [he]180-jude did act , and on the day of the piano 's departure , which happened to be [his]180-jude next birthday , clandestinely placed the letter inside the packing - case , directed to [[his]180-jude much - admired friend]4057-his much - admired friend , being afraid to reveal the operation to [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt [Drusilla]167-drusilla fawley , lest [she]555-his aunt should discover [his]180-jude motive , and compel [him]180-jude to abandon [his]180-jude scheme . The piano was despatched , and [Jude]180-jude waited days and weeks , calling every morning at [the cottage post office]4059-the cottage post office before [[his]180-jude great - aunt]505-his great - aunt was stirring . At last a packet did indeed arrive at [the village]410-the village , and [he]180-jude saw from the ends of it that it contained two thin books . [He]180-jude took it away into a lonely place , and sat down on a felled elm to open it . Ever since [his]180-jude first ecstasy or vision of [Christminster]180-jude and its possibilities , [Jude]180-jude had meditated much and curiously on the probable sort of process that was involved in turning the expressions of one language into those of another . [He]180-jude concluded that a grammar of the required tongue would contain , primarily , a rule , prescription , or clue of the nature of a secret cipher , which , once known , would enable [him]180-jude , by merely applying it , to change at will all words of [his]180-jude own speech into those of the foreign one . [His]180-jude childish idea was , in fact , a pushing to the extremity of mathematical precision what is everywhere known as [Grimm]192-grimm 's Law - an aggrandizement of rough rules to ideal completeness . Thus [he]180-jude assumed that the words of the required language were always to be found somewhere latent in the words of the given language by [those who had the art to uncover them]4062-those who had the art to uncover them , such art being furnished by the books aforesaid . When , therefore , having noted that the packet bore the postmark of [Christminster]180-jude , [he]180-jude cut the string , opened the volumes , and turned to the Latin grammar , which chanced to come uppermost , [he]180-jude could scarcely believe [his]180-jude eyes . The book was an old one - thirty years old , soiled , scribbled wantonly over with a strange name in every variety of enmity to the letterpress , and marked at random with dates twenty years earlier than [his]180-jude own day . But this was not the cause of [Jude]180-jude 's amazement . [He]180-jude learnt for the first time that there was no law of transmutation , as in [his]180-jude innocence [he]180-jude had supposed there was , in some degree , but [the grammarian]4063-the grammarian did not recognize it , but that every word in both Latin and Greek was to be individually committed to memory at the cost of years of plodding . [Jude]180-jude flung down the books , lay backward along the broad trunk of the elm , and was [an utterly miserable boy]4064-an utterly miserable boy for the space of a quarter of an hour . As [he]180-jude had often done before , [he]180-jude pulled [his]180-jude hat over [his]180-jude face and watched the sun peering insidiously at [him]180-jude through the interstices of the straw . This was Latin and Greek , then , was it this grand delusion ! The charm [he]180-jude had supposed in store for [him]180-jude was really a labour like that of [Israel]193-israel in [Egypt]19-egypt . What brains [they]4065-they must have in [Christminster]180-jude and [the great schools]4066-the great schools , [he]180-jude presently thought , to learn words one by one up to tens of thousands ! There were no brains in [his]180-jude head equal to this business ; and as the little sun - rays continued to stream in through [his]180-jude hat at [him]180-jude , [he]180-jude wished [he]180-jude had never seen a book , that [he]180-jude might never see another , that [he]180-jude had never been born . [Somebody]4067-somebody might have come along that way who would have asked [him]180-jude [his]180-jude trouble , and might have cheered [him]180-jude by saying that [his]180-jude notions were further advanced than those of [[his]180-jude grammarian]4068-his grammarian . But [nobody]4069-nobody did come , because [nobody]4069-nobody does ; and under the crushing recognition of [his]180-jude gigantic error [Jude]180-jude continued to wish [himself]180-jude out of [the world]706-the world . [V]194-v During the three or four succeeding years [a quaint and singular vehicle]4072-a quaint and singular vehicle might have been discerned moving along [the lanes and by - roads]4073-the lanes and by - roads near [Marygreen]1-marygreen , driven in a quaint and singular way . In the course of a month or two after the receipt of the books [Jude]180-jude had grown callous to the shabby trick played [him]180-jude by the dead languages . In fact , [his]180-jude disappointment at the nature of those tongues had , after a while , been the means of still further glorifying the erudition of [Christminster]180-jude . To acquire languages , departed or living in spite of such obstinacies as [he]180-jude now knew [them]4074-them inherently to possess , was a herculean performance which gradually led [him]180-jude on to a greater interest in it than in the presupposed patent process . The mountain - weight of material under which the ideas lay in those dusty volumes called the classics piqued [him]180-jude into a dogged , mouselike subtlety of attempt to move it piecemeal . [He]180-jude had endeavoured to make [his]180-jude presence tolerable to [[his]180-jude crusty maiden aunt]4075-his crusty maiden aunt by assisting [her]4075-his crusty maiden aunt to the best of [his]180-jude ability , and the business of [the little cottage bakery]4076-the little cottage bakery had grown in consequence . [An aged horse with a hanging head]4077-an aged horse with a hanging head had been purchased for eight pounds at a sale , a creaking cart with a whity - brown tilt obtained for a few pounds more , and in this turn - out it became [Jude]180-jude 's business thrice a week to carry loaves of bread to [the villagers]4078-the villagers and [solitary cotters immediately round [Marygreen]1-marygreen]4079-solitary cotters immediately round marygreen . The singularity aforesaid lay , after all , less in the conveyance itself than in [Jude]180-jude 's manner of conducting it along its route . [Its]180-jude interior was the scene of most of [Jude]180-jude 's education by "[0-i] private study . " As soon as the horse had learnt [the road]629-the road and [the houses at which [he]180-jude was to pause awhile]4081-the houses at which he was to pause awhile , [the boy , seated in front]4082-the boy , seated in front , would slip the reins over [his]180-jude arm , ingeniously fix open , by means of a strap attached to the tilt , the volume [he]180-jude was reading , spread the dictionary on [his]180-jude knees , and plunge into the simpler passages from [Caesar]195-caesar , [Virgil]196-virgil , or [Horace]197-horace , as the case might be , in [his]180-jude purblind stumbling way , and with an expenditure of labour that would have made [a tender - hearted pedagogue]4083-a tender - hearted pedagogue shed tears ; yet somehow getting at the meaning of what [he]180-jude read , and divining rather than beholding the spirit of the original , which often to [his]180-jude mind was something else than that which [he]180-jude was taught to look for . The only copies [he]180-jude had been able to lay hands on were old Delphin editions , because they were superseded , and therefore cheap . But , bad for [idle schoolboys]4084-idle schoolboys , it did so happen that they were passably good for [him]180-jude . [The hampered and lonely itinerant]4085-the hampered and lonely itinerant conscientiously covered up the marginal readings , and used them merely on points of construction , as [he]180-jude would have used [a comrade]4086-a comrade or [tutor who should have happened to be passing by]4087-tutor who should have happened to be passing by . And though [Jude]180-jude may have had little chance of becoming [a scholar]4088-a scholar by these rough and ready means , [he]180-jude was in the way of getting into the groove [he]180-jude wished to follow . While [he]180-jude was busied with these ancient pages , which had already been thumbed by [hands possibly in the grave , digging out the thoughts of these minds so remote yet so near]4089-hands possibly in the grave , digging out the thoughts of these minds so remote yet so near , the bony old horse pursued [his]180-jude rounds , and [Jude]180-jude would be aroused from the woes of [Dido]198-dido by the stoppage of [his]180-jude cart and the voice of [some old woman]4090-some old woman crying , "[0-i] Two to - day , [baker]747-baker , and [I]0-i return this stale one . " [He]180-jude was frequently met in [the lanes]4091-the lanes by [pedestrians]4092-pedestrians and [others]4093-others without [his]180-jude seeing [them]4091-the lanes , and by degrees [the people of [the neighbourhood]495-the neighbourhood]4094-the people of the neighbourhood began to talk about [his]180-jude method of combining work and play such [they]4094-the people of the neighbourhood considered [his]180-jude reading to be , which , though probably convenient enough to [himself]180-jude , was not altogether a safe proceeding for [other travellers along [the same roads]4097-the same roads]4096-other travellers along the same roads . There were murmurs . Then [a private resident of [an adjoining place]4099-an adjoining place]4098-a private resident of an adjoining place informed [the local policeman]4100-the local policeman that [the baker 's boy]4101-the baker 's boy should not be allowed to read while driving , and insisted that it was [the constable]4102-the constable 's duty to catch [him]180-jude in the act , and take [him]180-jude to [the police court at [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4103-the police court at alfredston , and get [him]180-jude fined for dangerous practices on [the highway]615-the highway . [The policeman thereupon]4105-the policeman thereupon lay in wait for [Jude]180-jude , and one day accosted [him]180-jude and cautioned [him]180-jude . As [Jude]180-jude had to get up at three o'clock in the morning to heat the oven , and mix and set in the bread that [he]180-jude distributed later in the day , [he]180-jude was obliged to go to bed at night immediately after laying the sponge ; so that if [he]180-jude could not read [his]180-jude classics on [the highways]4106-the highways [he]180-jude could hardly study at all . The only thing to be done was , therefore , to keep a sharp eye ahead and around [him]180-jude as well as [he]180-jude could in the circumstances , and slip away [his]180-jude books as soon as [anybody]4107-anybody loomed in the distance , [the policeman]4108-the policeman in particular . To do that official justice , [he]180-jude did not put [himself]180-jude much in the way of [Jude]180-jude 's bread - cart , considering that in such a lonely district the chief danger was to [Jude]180-jude [himself]180-jude , and often on seeing the white tilt over the hedges [he]180-jude would move in another direction . On a day when [Fawley]167-drusilla fawley was getting quite advanced , being now about sixteen , and had been stumbling through [the "[0-i] Carmen Saeculare]4109-the " carmen saeculare , " on [his]180-jude way [home]3897-home , [he]180-jude found [himself]180-jude to be passing over [the high edge of [the plateau]4043-the plateau]4111-the high edge of the plateau by [the Brown House]21-the brown house . The light had changed , and it was the sense of this which had caused [him]180-jude to look up . The sun was going down , and the full moon was rising simultaneously behind [the woods]4113-the woods in [the opposite quarter]4114-the opposite quarter . [His]180-jude mind had become so impregnated with the poem that , in a moment of the same impulsive emotion which years before had caused [him]180-jude to kneel on the ladder , [he]180-jude stopped the horse , alighted , and glancing round to see that [nobody]4069-nobody was in sight , knelt down on [the roadside bank]4116-the roadside bank with open book . [He]180-jude turned first to [the shiny goddess , who seemed to look so softly and critically at]4117-the shiny goddess , who seemed to look so softly and critically at [his]180-jude doings , then to [the disappearing luminary on the other hand]4118-the disappearing luminary on the other hand , as [he]180-jude began : "[0-i] Phoebe silvarumque potens [Diana]199-diana ! " The horse stood still till [he]180-jude had finished the hymn , which [Jude]180-jude repeated under the sway of a polytheistic fancy that [he]180-jude would never have thought of humouring in broad daylight . Reaching [home]3897-home , [he]180-jude mused over [his]180-jude curious superstition , innate or acquired , in doing this , and the strange forgetfulness which had led to such a lapse from common sense and custom in one who wished , next to being [a scholar]4088-a scholar , to be [a Christian divine]4121-a christian divine . It had all come of reading heathen works exclusively . The more [he]180-jude thought of it the more convinced [he]180-jude was of [his]180-jude inconsistency . [He]180-jude began to wonder whether [he]180-jude could be reading quite the right books for [his]180-jude object in life . Certainly there seemed little harmony between this pagan literature and [the mediaeval colleges at [Christminster]180-jude]4122-the mediaeval colleges at christminster , that ecclesiastical romance in stone . Ultimately [he]180-jude decided that in [his]180-jude sheer love of reading [he]180-jude had taken up a wrong emotion for [a Christian young man]4123-a christian young man . [He]180-jude had dabbled in [Clarke]200-clarke 's Homer , but had never yet worked much at the New Testament in the Greek , though [he]180-jude possessed a copy , obtained by post from [a second - hand bookseller]4124-a second - hand bookseller . [He]180-jude abandoned the now familiar Ionic for a new dialect , and for a long time onward limited [his]180-jude reading almost entirely to the Gospels and Epistles in [Griesbach]201-griesbach 's text . Moreover , on going into [Alfredston]20-alfredston one day , [he]180-jude was introduced to patristic literature by finding at [the bookseller]4125-the bookseller 's some volumes of the Fathers which had been left behind by [an insolvent clergyman of [the neighbourhood]495-the neighbourhood]4126-an insolvent clergyman of the neighbourhood . As another outcome of this change of groove [he]180-jude visited on Sundays all [the churches within a walk]4128-the churches within a walk , and deciphered the Latin inscriptions on fifteenth - century brasses and [tombs]4129-tombs . On one of these pilgrimages [he]180-jude met with [a hunch - backed old woman of great intelligence]4130-a hunch - backed old woman of great intelligence , who read everything [she]4130-a hunch - backed old woman of great intelligence could lay [her]4130-a hunch - backed old woman of great intelligence hands on , and [she]4130-a hunch - backed old woman of great intelligence told [him]180-jude more yet of the romantic charms of [the city of light]4131-the city of light and lore . [Thither]22-thither [he]180-jude resolved as firmly as ever to go . But how live in [that city]4132-that city ? At present [he]180-jude had no income at all . [He]180-jude had no trade or calling of any dignity or stability whatever on which [he]180-jude could subsist while carrying out an intellectual labour which might spread over many years . What was most required by [citizens]4133-citizens ? Food , clothing , and shelter . An income from any work in preparing the first would be too meagre ; for making the second [he]180-jude felt a distaste ; the preparation of the third requisite [he]180-jude inclined to . [They]4134-they built in [a city]4135-a city ; therefore [he]180-jude would learn to build . [He]180-jude thought of [[his]180-jude unknown uncle]4136-his unknown uncle , [[his]180-jude cousin]3917-his cousin [[Susanna]174-sue 's father]4138-susanna 's father , [an ecclesiastical worker in metal]4139-an ecclesiastical worker in metal , and somehow mediaeval art in any material was a trade for which [he]180-jude had rather a fancy . [He]180-jude could not go far wrong in following [[his]180-jude uncle]4140-his uncle 's footsteps , and engaging [himself]180-jude awhile with the carcases that contained [the scholar souls]4141-the scholar souls . As a preliminary [he]180-jude obtained some small blocks of freestone , metal not being available , and suspending [his]180-jude studies awhile , occupied [his]180-jude spare half - hours in copying the heads and capitals in [[his]180-jude parish church]4142-his parish church . There was [a stone - mason of a humble kind in [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4143-a stone - mason of a humble kind in alfredston , and as soon as [he]180-jude had found a substitute for [himself]180-jude in [[[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt 's little business]4145-his aunt 's little business , [he]180-jude offered [his]180-jude services to [this man]4146-this man for a trifling wage . [Here]3898-here [Jude]180-jude had the opportunity of learning at least the rudiments of freestone - working . Some time later [he]180-jude went to a church - builder in [the same place]4148-the same place , and under [the architect]4149-the architect 's direction became handy at restoring [the dilapidated masonries of [several village churches round about]4151-several village churches round about]4150-the dilapidated masonries of several village churches round about . Not forgetting that [he]180-jude was only following up this handicraft as a prop to lean on while [he]180-jude prepared those greater engines which [he]180-jude flattered [himself]180-jude would be better fitted for [him]180-jude , [he]180-jude yet was interested in [his]180-jude pursuit on its own account . [He]180-jude now had lodgings during the week in [the little town]4152-the little town , whence [he]180-jude returned to [Marygreen village]4153-marygreen village every Saturday evening . And thus [he]180-jude reached and passed [his]180-jude nineteenth year . VI At this memorable date of [his]180-jude life [he]180-jude was , one Saturday , returning from [Alfredston]20-alfredston to [Marygreen]1-marygreen about three o'clock in the afternoon . It was fine , warm , and soft summer weather , and [he]180-jude walked with [his]180-jude tools at [his]180-jude back , [his]180-jude little chisels clinking faintly against the larger ones in [his]180-jude basket . It being the end of the week [he]180-jude had left work early , and had come out of [the town]4154-the town by a round - about route which [he]180-jude did not usually frequent , having promised to call at [a flour - mill near [Cresscombe]6-cresscombe]4155-a flour - mill near cresscombe to execute a commission for [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt . [He]180-jude was in an enthusiastic mood . [He]180-jude seemed to see [his]180-jude way to living comfortably in [Christminster]180-jude in the course of a year or two , and knocking at the doors of one of [those strongholds of learning of which [he]180-jude had dreamed so much]4157-those strongholds of learning of which he had dreamed so much . [He]180-jude might , of course , have gone [there]3887-there now , in some capacity or other , but [he]180-jude preferred to enter [the city]414-the city with a little more assurance as to means than [he]180-jude could be said to feel at present . A warm self - content suffused [him]180-jude when [he]180-jude considered what [he]180-jude had already done . Now and then as [he]180-jude went along [he]180-jude turned to face the peeps of country on [either side of [him]180-jude]4160-either side of him . But [he]180-jude hardly saw [them]4161-them ; the act was an automatic repetition of what [he]180-jude had been accustomed to do when less occupied ; and the one matter which really engaged [him]180-jude was the mental estimate of [his]180-jude progress thus far . "[199-diana] [I]0-i have acquired quite [an average student]748-an average student 's power to read the common ancient classics , Latin in particular . " This was true , [Jude]180-jude possessing a facility in that language which enabled [him]180-jude with great ease to [himself]180-jude to beguile [his]180-jude lonely walks by imaginary conversations therein . "[0-i] [I]0-i have read two books of the Iliad , besides being pretty familiar with passages such as the speech of [Phoenix]202-phoenix in the ninth book , the fight of [Hector]203-hector and [Ajax]204-ajax in the fourteenth , the appearance of [Achilles unarmed]205-achilles unarmed and [his]205-achilles unarmed heavenly armour in the eighteenth , and the funeral games in the twenty - third . [I]0-i have also done some Hesiod , a little scrap of [Thucydides]206-thucydides , and a lot of the Greek Testament ... [I]0-i wish there was only one dialect all the same . " [I]0-i have done some mathematics , including the first six and the eleventh and twelfth books of [Euclid]207-euclid ; and algebra as far as simple equations . "[0-i] [I]0-i know something of [the Fathers]749-the fathers , and something of Roman and English history . " These things are only a beginning . But [I]0-i shall not make much farther advance here , from the difficulty of getting books . Hence [I]0-i must next concentrate all [my]0-i energies on settling in [Christminster]180-jude . Once [there]3887-there [I]0-i shall so advance , with the assistance [I]0-i shall there get , that [my]0-i present knowledge will appear to [me]0-i but as childish ignorance . [I]0-i must save money , and [I]0-i will ; and [one of [those colleges]4164-those colleges]4163-one of those colleges shall open [its]4163-one of those colleges doors to [me]0-i - shall welcome whom now it would spurn , if [I]0-i wait twenty years for the welcome . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll be D.D. before [I]0-i have done ! " And then [he]4165-he continued to dream , and thought [he]4165-he might become even [a bishop]4166-a bishop by leading [a pure , energetic , wise , Christian life]4167-a pure , energetic , wise , christian life . And what an example [he]4165-he would set ! If [his]4165-he income were L5000 a year , [he]4165-he would give away L4500 in one form and another , and live sumptuously for [him]4165-he on the remainder . Well , on second thoughts , [a bishop]4166-a bishop was absurd . [He]4166-a bishop would draw the line at [an archdeacon]4169-an archdeacon . Perhaps [a man]543-a man could be as good and as learned and as useful in the capacity of [archdeacon]4171-archdeacon as in that of [bishop]4172-bishop . Yet [he]4165-he thought of [the bishop]4173-the bishop again . "[0-i] Meanwhile [I]0-i will read , as soon as [I]0-i am settled in [Christminster]180-jude , the books [I]0-i have not been able to get hold of here : [Livy]208-livy , [Tacitus]209-tacitus , [Herodotus]210-herodotus , Aeschylus , [Sophocles]211-sophocles , [Aristophanes]212-aristophanes - " "[212-aristophanes] Ha , ha , ha ! Hoity - toity ! " The sounds were expressed in light voices on the other side of the hedge , but [he]4165-he did not notice them . [His]4165-he thoughts went on : "[213-euripides] - [Euripides]213-euripides , [Plato]214-plato , Aristotle , [Lucretius]215-lucretius , [Epictetus]216-epictetus , [Seneca]217-seneca , [Antoninus]218-antoninus . Then [I]0-i must master other things : [the Fathers]749-the fathers thoroughly ; [Bede]219-bede and ecclesiastical history generally ; a smattering of Hebrew - [I]0-i only know the letters as yet - " "[749-the fathers] Hoity - toity ! " "[749-the fathers] - but [I]0-i can work hard . [I]0-i have staying power in abundance , thank [God]177-god ! and it is that which tells .... Yes , [Christminster]180-jude shall be [my]0-i Alma Mater ; and [I]0-i 'll be [[her]751-her beloved son]752-her beloved son , in whom [she]751-her shall be well pleased . " In [his]4165-he deep concentration on these transactions of the future [Jude]180-jude 's walk had slackened , and [he]4165-he was now standing quite still , looking at the ground as though the future were thrown thereon by a magic lantern . On a sudden something smacked [him]4165-he sharply in the ear , and [he]4165-he became aware that a soft cold substance had been flung at [him]4165-he , and had fallen at [his]4165-he feet . A glance told [him]4165-he what it was - a piece of flesh , the characteristic part of a barrow - pig , which [the countrymen]4174-the countrymen used for greasing [their]4174-the countrymen boots , as it was useless for any other purpose . [Pigs]220-pigs were rather plentiful hereabout , being bred and fattened in large numbers in [certain parts of [North Wessex]23-north wessex]4175-certain parts of north wessex . On the other side of the hedge was [a stream]4176-a stream , whence , as [he]4165-he now for the first time realized , had come the slight sounds of voices and laughter that had mingled with [his]4165-he dreams . [He]4165-he mounted the bank and looked over the fence . On the further side of [the stream]4177-the stream stood [a small homestead]4178-a small homestead , having [a garden and pig - sties attached]4179-a garden and pig - sties attached ; in front of [it]4178-a small homestead , beside [the brook]4180-the brook , [three young women]4181-three young women were kneeling , with buckets and platters beside [them]4181-three young women containing heaps of pigs ' chitterlings , which [they]4181-three young women were washing in the running water . [One or two pairs of eyes]4182-one or two pairs of eyes slyly glanced up , and perceiving that [his]4165-he attention had at last been attracted , and that [he]4165-he was watching [them]4182-one or two pairs of eyes , [they]4182-one or two pairs of eyes braced [themselves]4182-one or two pairs of eyes for inspection by putting [their]4182-one or two pairs of eyes mouths demurely into shape and recommencing [their]4182-one or two pairs of eyes rinsing operations with assiduity . "[753-you] Thank [you]753-you ! " said [Jude]180-jude severely . "[753-you] [I]0-i DIDN'T throw it , [I]0-i tell [you]753-you ! " asserted [one girl]4183-one girl to [[her]4183-one girl neighbour]4184-her neighbour , as if unconscious of [the young man]4185-the young man 's presence . "[0-i] Nor [I]0-i , " [the second]4186-the second answered . "[0-i] Oh , [Anny]221-anny , how can [you]221-anny ! " said [the third]4187-the third . "[221-anny] If [I]0-i had thrown anything at all , it should n't have been THAT ! " "[221-anny] Pooh ! [I]0-i do n't care for [him]754-him ! " And [they]4182-one or two pairs of eyes laughed and continued [their]4182-one or two pairs of eyes work , without looking up , still ostentatiously accusing [each other]4188-each other . [Jude]180-jude grew sarcastic as [he]180-jude wiped [his]180-jude face , and caught [their]4182-one or two pairs of eyes remarks . "[0-i] [YOU]755-she did n't do it - oh no ! " [he]180-jude said to the up - stream one of the three . [She]755-she whom [he]180-jude addressed was [a fine dark - eyed girl]4189-a fine dark - eyed girl , not exactly handsome , but capable of passing as such at a little distance , despite some coarseness of skin and fibre . [She]755-she had a round and prominent bosom , full lips , perfect teeth , and the rich complexion of a Cochin hen 's egg . [She]755-she was [a complete and substantial female animal]4190-a complete and substantial female animal - no more , no less ; and [Jude]180-jude was almost certain that to [her]755-she was attributable the enterprise of attracting [his]180-jude attention from dreams of the humaner letters to what was simmering in the minds around [him]180-jude . "[755-she] That [you]756-you 'll never be told , " said [she]755-she deedily . "[756-you] Whoever did it was wasteful of [other people]757-other people 's property . " "[756-you] Oh , that 's nothing . " "[756-you] But [you]755-she want to speak to [me]0-i , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[755-she] Oh yes ; if [you]755-she like to . " "[755-she] Shall [I]0-i clamber across , or will [you]755-she come to the plank above here ? " Perhaps [she]755-she foresaw an opportunity ; for somehow or other the eyes of [the brown girl]4191-the brown girl rested in [his]180-jude own when [he]180-jude had said the words , and there was a momentary flash of intelligence , a dumb announcement of affinity in posse between [herself]755-she and [him]180-jude , which , so far as [Jude Fawley]180-jude was concerned , had no sort of premeditation in it . [She]755-she saw that [he]180-jude had singled [her]755-she out from [the three]4192-the three , as [a woman]4193-a woman is singled out in such cases , for no reasoned purpose of further acquaintance , but in commonplace obedience to conjunctive orders from [headquarters]4194-headquarters , unconsciously received by [unfortunate men]4195-unfortunate men when the last intention of [their]4195-unfortunate men lives is to be occupied with [the feminine]4196-the feminine . Springing to [her]755-she feet , [she]755-she said : "[755-she] Bring back what is lying there . " [Jude]180-jude was now aware that no message on any matter connected with [[her]755-she father]4197-her father 's business had prompted [her]755-she signal to [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude set down [his]180-jude basket of tools , picked up the scrap of offal , beat a pathway for [himself]180-jude with [his]180-jude stick , and got over the hedge . [They]4198-they walked in parallel lines , one on each bank of [the stream]4177-the stream , towards [the small plank bridge]4200-the small plank bridge . As [the girl]4201-the girl drew nearer to [it]4200-the small plank bridge , [she]4201-the girl gave without [Jude]180-jude perceiving it , an adroit little suck to the interior of each of [her]4201-the girl cheeks in succession , by which curious and original manoeuvre [she]4201-the girl brought as by magic upon its smooth and rotund surface a perfect dimple , which [she]4201-the girl was able to retain there as long as [she]4201-the girl continued to smile . This production of dimples at will was a not unknown operation , which many attempted , but only a few succeeded in accomplishing . [They]4198-they met in the middle of the plank , and [Jude]180-jude , tossing back [her]755-she missile , seemed to expect [her]755-she to explain why [she]755-she had audaciously stopped [him]180-jude by this novel artillery instead of by hailing [him]180-jude . But [she]755-she , slyly looking in another direction , swayed [herself]755-she backwards and forwards on [her]755-she hand as it clutched the rail of [the bridge]4202-the bridge ; till , moved by amatory curiosity , [she]755-she turned [her]755-she eyes critically upon [him]180-jude . "[755-she] [You]758-you do n't think [I]0-i would shy things at [you]758-you ? " "[758-you] Oh no . " "[758-you] [We]759-we are doing this for [[my]0-i father]3941-my father , who naturally does n't want anything thrown away . [He]3941-my father makes that into dubbin . " [She]755-she nodded towards the fragment on the grass . "[3941-my father] What made [either of [the others]762-the others]761-either of the others throw it , [I]0-i wonder ? " [Jude]180-jude asked , politely accepting [her]755-she assertion , though [he]180-jude had very large doubts as to its truth . "[3941-my father] Impudence . Do n't tell [folk]763-folk it was [I]0-i , mind ! " "[0-i] How can [I]0-i ? [I]0-i do n't know [your]758-you name . " "[0-i] Ah , no . Shall [I]0-i tell it to [you]758-you ? " "[0-i] Do ! " "[0-i] Arabella Donn . [I]0-i 'm living [here]3898-here . " "[0-i] [I]0-i must have known it if [I]0-i had often come this way . But [I]0-i mostly go straight along [the high - road]765-the high - road . " "[0-i] [[My]0-i father]3941-my father is [a pig - breeder]767-a pig - breeder , and [these girls]768-these girls are helping [me]0-i wash the innerds for black - puddings and such like . " [They]4203-they talked a little more and a little more , as [they]4203-they stood regarding [each other]4188-each other and leaning against the hand - rail of [the bridge]4202-the bridge . The unvoiced call of [woman]4206-woman to [man]575-man , which was uttered very distinctly by [Arabella]305-arabella 's personality , held [Jude]180-jude to the spot against [his]180-jude intention - almost against [his]180-jude will , and in a way new to [his]180-jude experience . It is scarcely an exaggeration to say that till this moment [Jude]180-jude had never looked at [a woman]4193-a woman to consider [her]4193-a woman as such , but had vaguely regarded the sex as beings outside [his]180-jude life and purposes . [He]180-jude gazed from [her]769-a nice - looking girl eyes to [her]769-a nice - looking girl mouth , thence to [her]769-a nice - looking girl bosom , and to [her]769-a nice - looking girl full round naked arms , wet , mottled with the chill of the water , and firm as marble . "[768-these girls] What [a nice - looking girl]769-a nice - looking girl [you]769-a nice - looking girl are ! " [he]180-jude murmured , though the words had not been necessary to express [his]180-jude sense of [her]769-a nice - looking girl magnetism . "[768-these girls] Ah , [you]770-you should see [me]0-i [Sundays]222-sundays ! " [she]769-a nice - looking girl said piquantly . "[768-these girls] [I]0-i do n't suppose [I]0-i could ? " [he]180-jude answered "[768-these girls] That 's for [you]769-a nice - looking girl to think on . There 's [nobody]4069-nobody after [me]0-i just now , though there med be in a week or two . " [She]769-a nice - looking girl had spoken this without a smile , and the dimples disappeared . [Jude]180-jude felt [himself]180-jude drifting strangely , but could not help it . "[769-a nice - looking girl] Will [you]769-a nice - looking girl let [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't mind . " By this time [she]769-a nice - looking girl had managed to get back one dimple by turning [her]769-a nice - looking girl face aside for a moment and repeating the odd little sucking operation before mentioned , [Jude]180-jude being still unconscious of more than a general impression of [her]769-a nice - looking girl appearance . "[0-i] Next Sunday ? " [he]180-jude hazarded . "[0-i] To - morrow , that is ? " "[769-a nice - looking girl] Yes . " "[769-a nice - looking girl] Shall [I]0-i call ? " "[0-i] Yes . " [She]769-a nice - looking girl brightened with a little glow of triumph , swept [him]180-jude almost tenderly with [her]769-a nice - looking girl eyes in turning , and retracing [her]769-a nice - looking girl steps down [the brookside grass]4209-the brookside grass rejoined [[her]769-a nice - looking girl companions]4210-her companions . [Jude Fawley]180-jude shouldered [his]180-jude tool - basket and resumed [his]180-jude lonely way , filled with an ardour at which [he]180-jude mentally stood at gaze . [He]180-jude had just inhaled a single breath from a new atmosphere , which had evidently been hanging round [him]180-jude everywhere [he]180-jude went , for [he]180-jude knew not how long , but had somehow been divided from [his]180-jude actual breathing as by a sheet of glass . The intentions as to reading , working , and learning , which [he]180-jude had so precisely formulated only a few minutes earlier , were suffering a curious collapse into a corner , [he]180-jude knew not how . "[0-i] Well , it 's only a bit of fun , " [he]180-jude said to [himself]180-jude , faintly conscious that to common sense there was something lacking , and still more obviously something redundant in the nature of [this girl who had drawn [him]180-jude to [her]4211-this girl who had drawn him to her]4211-this girl who had drawn him to her which made it necessary that [he]180-jude should assert mere sportiveness on [his]180-jude part as [his]180-jude reason in seeking [her]4211-this girl who had drawn him to her - something in [her]4211-this girl who had drawn him to her quite antipathetic to that side of [him]180-jude which had been occupied with literary study and the magnificent Christminster dream . It had been [no vestal]4212-no vestal who chose THAT missile for opening [her]4211-this girl who had drawn him to her attack on [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude saw this with [his]180-jude intellectual eye , just for a short ; fleeting while , as by the light of a falling lamp one might momentarily see an inscription on a wall before being enshrouded in darkness . And then this passing discriminative power was withdrawn , and [Jude]180-jude was lost to all conditions of things in the advent of a fresh and wild pleasure , that of having found a new channel for emotional interest hitherto unsuspected , though it had lain close beside [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude was to meet this enkindling one of the other sex on the following Sunday . Meanwhile [the girl]4201-the girl had joined [[her]4201-the girl companions]4210-her companions , and [she]4201-the girl silently resumed [her]4201-the girl flicking and sousing of the chitterlings in [the pellucid stream]4215-the pellucid stream . "[0-i] Catched un , [[my]0-i dear]772-my dear ? " laconically asked [the girl called [Anny]221-anny]4216-the girl called anny . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had thrown something else than that ! " regretfully murmured [Arabella]305-arabella . "[3952-lord] [Lord]3952-lord ! [he]774-he 's [nobody]4069-nobody , though [you]776-you med think so . [He]774-he used to drive [old Drusilla Fawley]167-drusilla fawley 's bread - cart out at [Marygreen]1-marygreen , till [he]774-he ' prenticed [himself]774-he at [Alfredston]20-alfredston . Since then [he]774-he 's been very stuck up , and always reading . [He]774-he wants to be [a scholar]4088-a scholar , [they]778-they say . [You]776-you need n't try to deceive [us]780-us ! What did [you]776-you stay talking to [him]774-he for , if [you]776-you did n't want un ? Whether [you]776-you do or whether [you]776-you do n't , [he]774-he 's as simple as [a child]781-a child . [I]0-i could see it as [you]776-you courted on [the bridge]4202-the bridge , when [he]774-he looked at ' [ee]783-ee as if [he]774-he had never seen [a woman]4193-a woman before in [his]774-he born days . Well , [he]774-he 's to be had by [any woman who can get [him]774-he to care for [her]4193-a woman]785-any woman who can get him to care for her a bit , if [she]4193-a woman likes to set [herself]4193-a woman to catch [him]774-he the right way . " VII The next day [Jude Fawley]180-jude was pausing in [[his]180-jude bedroom]4217-his bedroom with the sloping ceiling , looking at the books on the table , and then at the black mark on the plaster above them , made by the smoke of [his]180-jude lamp in past months . It was Sunday afternoon , four - and - twenty hours after [his]180-jude meeting with [Arabella Donn]305-arabella . During the whole bygone week [he]180-jude had been resolving to set this afternoon apart for a special purpose , - the re - reading of [his]180-jude Greek Testament - [his]180-jude new one , with better type than [his]180-jude old copy , following [Griesbach]201-griesbach 's text as amended by numerous correctors , and with variorum readings in the margin . [He]180-jude was proud of the book , having obtained it by boldly writing to [[its]4218-its [London]7-london publisher]4219-its london publisher , a thing [he]180-jude had never done before . [He]180-jude had anticipated much pleasure in this afternoon 's reading , under the quiet roof of [[[his]180-jude great - aunt]505-his great - aunt 's house]4221-his great - aunt 's house as formerly , where [he]180-jude now slept only two nights a week . But a new thing , a great hitch , had happened yesterday in the gliding and noiseless current of [his]180-jude life , and [he]180-jude felt as a snake must feel who has sloughed off its winter skin , and can not understand the brightness and sensitiveness of its new one . [He]180-jude would not go out to meet [her]505-his great - aunt , after all . [He]180-jude sat down , opened the book , and with [his]180-jude elbows firmly planted on the table , and [his]180-jude hands to [his]180-jude temples , began at the beginning : [HE]180-jude [KAINE DIATHEKE]164-jude Had [he]180-jude promised to call for [her]505-his great - aunt ? Surely [he]180-jude had ! [She]505-his great - aunt would wait indoors , [poor girl]4222-poor girl , and waste all [her]505-his great - aunt afternoon on account of [him]180-jude . There was a something in [her]505-his great - aunt , too , which was very winning , apart from promises . [He]180-jude ought not to break faith with [her]505-his great - aunt . Even though [he]180-jude had only Sundays and week - day evenings for reading [he]180-jude could afford one afternoon , seeing that [other young men]4223-other young men afforded so many . After to - day [he]180-jude would never probably see [her]505-his great - aunt again . Indeed , it would be impossible , considering what [his]180-jude plans were . In short , as if materially , a compelling arm of extraordinary muscular power seized hold of [him]180-jude - something which had nothing in common with the spirits and influences that had moved [him]180-jude hitherto . This seemed to care little for [his]180-jude reason and [his]180-jude will , nothing for [his]180-jude so - called elevated intentions , and moved [him]180-jude along , as [a violent schoolmaster]4224-a violent schoolmaster [a schoolboy]4225-a schoolboy [he]180-jude has seized by the collar , in a direction which tended towards the embrace of [a woman for whom [he]180-jude had no respect , and whose life had nothing in common with [his]180-jude own except locality]4226-a woman for whom he had no respect , and whose life had nothing in common with his own except locality . [HE]180-jude [KAINE DIATHEKE]164-jude was no more heeded , and the predestinate [Jude]164-jude sprang up and across [the room]4227-the room . Foreseeing such an event [he]180-jude had already arrayed [himself]180-jude in [his]180-jude best clothes . In three minutes [he]180-jude was out of [the house]504-the house and descending by the path across the wide vacant hollow of corn - ground which lay between [the village]410-the village and [the isolated house of [Arabella]305-arabella]4230-the isolated house of arabella in [the dip beyond [the upland]523-the upland]4231-the dip beyond the upland . As [he]180-jude walked [he]180-jude looked at [his]180-jude watch . [He]180-jude could be back in two hours , easily , and a good long time would still remain to [him]180-jude for reading after tea . Passing the few unhealthy fir - trees and cottage where the path joined [the highway]615-the highway [he]180-jude hastened along , and struck away to the left , descending the steep side of [the country]4234-the country to [the west of [the Brown House]21-the brown house]4235-the west of the brown house . Here at the base of [the chalk formation]4236-the chalk formation [he]180-jude neared [the brook]4180-the brook that oozed from [it]4236-the chalk formation , and followed [the stream]4177-the stream till [he]180-jude reached [[her]305-arabella dwelling]4239-her dwelling . A smell of piggeries came from the back , and the grunting of [the originators of that smell]4240-the originators of that smell . [He]180-jude entered [the garden]521-the garden , and knocked at the door with the knob of [his]180-jude stick . [Somebody]4067-somebody had seen [him]180-jude through the window , for [a male voice on the inside]4243-a male voice on the inside said : "[305-arabella] [Arabella]305-arabella ! Here 's [[your]305-arabella young man]786-your young man come coorting ! [Mizzle]223-mizzle , [[my]0-i girl]787-my girl ! " [Jude]164-jude winced at the words . Courting in such a businesslike aspect as it evidently wore to [the speaker]4244-the speaker was the last thing [he]164-jude was thinking of . [He]164-jude was going to walk with [her]305-arabella , perhaps kiss [her]305-arabella ; but "[223-mizzle] courting " was too coolly purposeful to be anything but repugnant to [his]164-jude ideas . What's - [your]305-arabella - name ? "[788-mr.] [I]0-i 'd rather go out at once , would n't [you]788-mr. ? " [she]0-i whispered to [Jude]164-jude . "[788-mr.] Yes , " said [he]164-jude . "[788-mr.] [We]789-they 'll walk up to [the Brown House]790-the brown house and back , [we]789-they can do it in half an hour . " [Arabella]305-arabella looked so handsome amid [her]305-arabella untidy surroundings that [he]164-jude felt glad [he]164-jude had come , and all the misgivings vanished that had hitherto haunted [him]164-jude . First [they]789-they clambered to the top of the great down , during which ascent [he]164-jude had occasionally to take [her]305-arabella hand to assist [her]305-arabella . Then [they]789-they bore off to the left along the crest into [the ridgeway]4248-the ridgeway , which [they]789-they followed till [it]4248-the ridgeway intersected [the high - road at [the Brown House aforesaid]4250-the brown house aforesaid]4249-the high - road at the brown house aforesaid , [the spot of [his]164-jude former fervid desires to behold [Christminster]180-jude]4251-the spot of his former fervid desires to behold christminster .
