[He]164-jude talked [the commonest local twaddle]4252-the commonest local twaddle to [Arabella]305-arabella with greater zest than [he]164-jude would have felt in discussing all the philosophies with [all the Dons in [the recently adored university]4254-the recently adored university]4253-all the dons in the recently adored university , and passed [the spot where [he]164-jude had knelt to [Diana]199-diana and [Phoebus]224-phoebus]4255-the spot where he had knelt to diana and phoebus without remembering that there were [any such people in the mythology]4256-any such people in the mythology , or that the sun was anything else than a useful lamp for illuminating [Arabella]305-arabella 's face . An indescribable lightness of heel served to lift [him]164-jude along ; and [Jude]180-jude , [the incipient scholar]4257-the incipient scholar , prospective D.D. , [professor]4258-professor , [bishop]4172-bishop , or what not , felt [himself]180-jude honoured and glorified by the condescension of [this handsome country wench]4260-this handsome country wench in agreeing to take a walk with [him]180-jude in [her]305-arabella Sunday frock and ribbons . [They]4261-they reached [the Brown House barn]4262-the brown house barn - the point at which [he]180-jude had planned to turn back . While looking over the vast northern landscape from [this spot]4263-this spot [they]4261-they were struck by the rising of a dense volume of smoke from [the neighbourhood of [the little town]4152-the little town which lay beneath [them]4261-they]4264-the neighbourhood of the little town which lay beneath them at [a distance of a couple of miles]4266-a distance of a couple of miles . "[788-mr.] It is a fire , " said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[788-mr.] Let 's run and see it - do ! It is not far ! " The tenderness which had grown up in [[Jude]180-jude 's bosom]4267-jude 's bosom left [him]180-jude no will to thwart [her]305-arabella inclination now - which pleased [him]180-jude in affording [him]180-jude excuse for a longer time with [her]305-arabella . [They]4261-they started off down [the hill]564-the hill almost at a trot ; but on gaining level ground at the bottom , and walking a mile , [they]4261-they found that [the spot of the fire]4269-the spot of the fire was much further off than it had seemed . Having begun [their]4261-they journey , however , [they]4261-they pushed on ; but it was not till five o'clock that [they]4261-they found [themselves]4261-they on the scene , - the distance being altogether about half - a - dozen miles from [Marygreen]1-marygreen , and three from [[Arabella]305-arabella 's]4270-arabella 's . The conflagration had been got under by the time [they]4261-they reached [it]4269-the spot of the fire , and after a short inspection of [the melancholy ruins]4271-the melancholy ruins [they]4261-they retraced [their]4261-they steps - [their]4261-they course lying through [the town of [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4272-the town of alfredston . [Arabella]305-arabella said [she]305-arabella would like some tea , and [they]4261-they entered [an inn of]4273-an inn of [an inferior class]4274-an inferior class , and gave [their]4261-they order . As it was not for beer [they]4261-they had a long time to wait . [The maid - servant]4275-the maid - servant recognized [Jude]180-jude , and whispered [her]4275-the maid - servant surprise to [[her]4275-the maid - servant mistress]4276-her mistress in the background , that [he]180-jude , [the student]4277-the student "[788-mr.] who kept hisself up so particular , " should have suddenly descended so low as to keep company with [Arabella]305-arabella . [The latter]444-the latter guessed what was being said , and laughed as [she]4275-the maid - servant met the serious and tender gaze of [[her]4275-the maid - servant lover]4279-her lover - the low and triumphant laugh of [a careless woman who sees [she]4275-the maid - servant is winning [her]4275-the maid - servant game]4280-a careless woman who sees she is winning her game . [They]4261-they sat and looked round [the room]4227-the room , and at the picture of [Samson]225-samson and [Delilah]226-delilah which hung on the wall , and at the circular beer - stains on the table , and at the spittoons underfoot filled with sawdust . The whole aspect of the scene had that depressing effect on [Jude]180-jude which [few places]4282-few places can produce like a tap - room on a Sunday evening when the setting sun is slanting in , and no liquor is going , and [the unfortunate wayfarer]4283-the unfortunate wayfarer finds [himself]4283-the unfortunate wayfarer with no other haven of rest . It began to grow dusk . [They]4261-they could not wait longer , really , for the tea , [they]4261-they said . "[788-mr.] Yet what else can [we]791-we do ? " asked [Jude]180-jude . "[788-mr.] It is a three - mile walk for [you]792-you . " "[788-mr.] [I]0-i suppose [we]791-we can have some beer , " said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[0-i] Beer , oh yes . [I]0-i had forgotten that . Somehow it seems odd to come to [a public - house]793-a public - house for beer on a Sunday evening . " "[791-we] But [we]791-we did n't . " "[791-we] No , [we]791-we did n't . " [Jude]180-jude by this time wished [he]180-jude was out of such an uncongenial atmosphere ; but [he]180-jude ordered the beer , which was promptly brought . [Arabella]305-arabella tasted it . "[791-we] Ugh ! " [she]305-arabella said . [Jude]180-jude tasted . "[791-we] What 's the matter with it ? " [he]180-jude asked . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't understand beer very much now , it is true . [I]0-i like it well enough , but it is bad to read on , and [I]0-i find coffee better . But this seems all right . " "[0-i] Adulterated - [I]0-i ca n't touch it ! " [She]305-arabella mentioned three or four ingredients that [she]305-arabella detected in the liquor beyond malt and hops , much to [Jude]180-jude 's surprise . "[0-i] How much [you]0-i know ! " [he]180-jude said good - humouredly . Nevertheless [she]305-arabella returned to the beer and drank [her]305-arabella share , and [they]791-we went on [their]791-we way . It was now nearly dark , and as soon as [they]791-we had withdrawn from the lights of [the town]4154-the town [they]791-we walked closer together , till [they]791-we touched [each other]4188-each other . [She]305-arabella wondered why [he]180-jude did not put [his]180-jude arm round [her]305-arabella waist , but [he]180-jude did not ; [he]180-jude merely said what to [himself]180-jude seemed a quite bold enough thing : "[0-i] Take [my]0-i arm . " [She]305-arabella took it , thoroughly , up to the shoulder . [He]180-jude felt the warmth of [her]305-arabella body against [his]180-jude , and putting [his]180-jude stick under [his]180-jude other arm held with [his]180-jude right hand [her]305-arabella right as it rested in its place . "[0-i] Now [we]794-they are well together , [dear]795-dear , are n't [we]794-they ? " [he]180-jude observed . "[794-they] Yes , " said [she]305-arabella ; adding to [herself]305-arabella : "[794-they] Rather mild ! " "[794-they] How fast [I]0-i have become ! " [he]180-jude was thinking . Thus [they]794-they walked till [they]794-they reached [the foot of [the upland]523-the upland]4286-the foot of the upland , where [they]794-they could see [the white highway]4288-the white highway ascending before [them]794-they in the gloom . From this point the only way of getting to [[Arabella]305-arabella 's]4270-arabella 's was by going up the incline , and dipping again into [[her]305-arabella valley]4290-her valley on the right . Before [they]794-they had climbed far [they]794-they were nearly run into by [two men who had been walking on the grass unseen]4291-two men who had been walking on the grass unseen . "[794-they] [These lovers]796-these lovers - [you]797-you find 'em out o ' doors in all seasons and weathers - [lovers]798-lovers and homeless dogs only , " said [one of [the men]647-the men]4292-one of the men as [they]794-they vanished down [the hill]564-the hill . [Arabella]305-arabella tittered lightly . "[794-they] Are [we]799-they [lovers]798-lovers ? " asked [Jude]180-jude . "[798-lovers] [You]797-you know best . " "[798-lovers] But [you]797-you can tell [me]0-i ? " For answer [she]305-arabella inclined [her]305-arabella head upon [his]180-jude shoulder . [Jude]180-jude took the hint , and encircling [her]305-arabella waist with [his]180-jude arm , pulled [her]305-arabella to [him]180-jude and kissed [her]305-arabella . [They]799-they walked now no longer arm in arm but , as [she]305-arabella had desired , clasped together . After all , what did it matter since it was dark , said [Jude]180-jude to [himself]180-jude . When [they]799-they were half - way up [the long hill]4295-the long hill [they]799-they paused as by arrangement , and [he]180-jude kissed [her]305-arabella again . [They]799-they reached the top , and [he]180-jude kissed [her]305-arabella once more . "[797-you] [You]801-you can keep [your]801-you arm there , if [you]801-you would like to , " [she]305-arabella said gently . [He]180-jude did so , thinking how trusting [she]305-arabella was . Thus [they]799-they slowly went towards [[her]305-arabella home]4296-her home . [He]180-jude had left [[his]180-jude cottage]4297-his cottage at half - past three , intending to be sitting down again to [the New Testament]24-the new testament by half - past five . It was nine o'clock when , with another embrace , [he]180-jude stood to deliver [her]305-arabella up at [[her]305-arabella father]4197-her father 's door . [She]305-arabella asked [him]180-jude to come in , if only for a minute , as it would seem so odd otherwise , and as if [she]305-arabella had been out alone in the dark . [He]180-jude gave way , and followed [her]305-arabella in . Immediately that the door was opened [he]180-jude found , in addition to [[her]305-arabella parents]4299-her parents , [several neighbours]4300-several neighbours sitting round . [They]4300-several neighbours all spoke in a congratulatory manner , and took [him]180-jude seriously as [[Arabella]305-arabella 's intended partner]4301-arabella 's intended partner . [They]4300-several neighbours did not belong to [his]180-jude set or circle , and [he]180-jude felt out of place and embarrassed . [He]180-jude had not meant this : a mere afternoon of pleasant walking with [Arabella]305-arabella , that was all [he]180-jude had meant . [He]180-jude did not stay longer than to speak to [[her]305-arabella stepmother]4302-her stepmother , [a simple , quiet woman without features or character]4303-a simple , quiet woman without features or character ; and bidding [them]4300-several neighbours all good night plunged with a sense of relief into the track over the down . But that sense was only temporary : [Arabella]305-arabella soon re - asserted [her]305-arabella sway in [his]180-jude soul . [He]180-jude walked as if [he]180-jude felt [himself]180-jude to be [another man from [the Jude of yesterday]4305-the jude of yesterday]4304-another man from the jude of yesterday . What were [his]180-jude books to [him]180-jude ? what were [his]180-jude intentions , hitherto adhered to so strictly , as to not wasting a single minute of time day by day ? "[801-you] Wasting ! " It depended on [your]4306-your point of view to define that : [he]180-jude was just living for the first time : not wasting life . It was better to love [a woman]4193-a woman than to be [a graduate]4308-a graduate , or [a parson]4309-a parson ; ay , or [a pope]4310-a pope ! When [he]180-jude got back to [the house]504-the house [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt had gone to bed , and a general consciousness of [his]180-jude neglect seemed written on the face of all things confronting [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude went [upstairs]4313-upstairs without a light , and the dim interior of [[his]180-jude room]4314-his room accosted [him]180-jude with sad inquiry . There lay [his]180-jude book open , just as [he]180-jude had left it , and the capital letters on the title - page regarded [him]180-jude with fixed reproach in the grey starlight , like the unclosed eyes of [a dead man]4315-a dead man : [HE]180-jude [KAINE DIATHEKE Jude]164-jude had to leave early next morning for [his]180-jude usual week of absence at [lodgings]4316-lodgings ; and it was with a sense of futility that [he]180-jude threw into [his]180-jude basket upon [his]180-jude tools and other necessaries the unread book [he]180-jude had brought with [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude kept [his]180-jude impassioned doings a secret almost from [himself]180-jude . [Arabella]305-arabella , on the contrary , made them public among all [[her]305-arabella friends]4317-her friends and [acquaintance]4318-acquaintance . Retracing by the light of dawn [the road]629-the road [he]180-jude had followed a few hours earlier under cover of darkness , with [[his]180-jude sweetheart]4320-his sweetheart by [his]180-jude side , [he]180-jude reached [the bottom of [the hill]564-the hill]4321-the bottom of the hill , where [he]180-jude walked slowly , and stood still . [He]180-jude was on the spot where [he]180-jude had given [her]4320-his sweetheart the first kiss . As the sun had only just risen it was possible that [nobody]4069-nobody had passed [there]3887-there since . [Jude]164-jude looked on [the ground]4325-the ground and sighed . [He]180-jude looked closely , and could just discern in the damp dust the imprints of [their]4326-their feet as [they]4326-their had stood locked in [each other]4188-each other 's arms . [She]4320-his sweetheart was not there now , and "[801-you] the embroidery of imagination upon the stuff of nature " so depicted [her]4320-his sweetheart past presence that a void was in [his]180-jude heart which nothing could fill . A pollard willow stood close to [the place]3987-the place , and that willow was different from all other willows in [the world]706-the world . Utter annihilation of the six days which must elapse before [he]180-jude could see [her]4320-his sweetheart again as [he]180-jude had promised would have been [his]180-jude intensest wish if [he]180-jude had had only the week to live . An hour and a half later [Arabella]305-arabella came along the same way with [[her]305-arabella two companions of [the Saturday]4331-the saturday]4330-her two companions of the saturday . [She]305-arabella passed unheedingly the scene of the kiss , and the willow that marked it , though chattering freely on the subject to [the other two]4332-the other two . "[802-he] And what did [he]802-he tell ' [ee]803-ee next ? " "[802-he] Then [he]802-he said - " And [she]305-arabella related almost word for word some of [his]802-he tenderest speeches . If [Jude]164-jude had been behind the fence [he]164-jude would have felt not a little surprised at learning how very few of [his]802-he sayings and doings on the previous evening were private . "[802-he] [You]804-you 've got [him]802-he to care for ' [ee]803-ee a bit , ' nation if [you]804-you han't ! " murmured [Anny]221-anny judicially . "[804-you] It 's well to be [you]804-you ! " In a few moments [Arabella]305-arabella replied in a curiously low , hungry tone of latent sensuousness : "[804-you] [I]0-i 've got [him]802-he to care for [me]0-i : yes ! But [I]0-i want [him]802-he to more than care for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i want [him]802-he to have [me]0-i - to marry [me]0-i ! [I]0-i must have [him]802-he . [I]0-i ca n't do without [him]802-he . [He]802-he 's [the sort of man [I]0-i long for]805-the sort of man i long for . [I]0-i shall go mad if [I]0-i ca n't give [myself]0-i to [him]802-he altogether ! [I]0-i felt [I]0-i should when [I]0-i first saw [him]802-he ! " "[0-i] As [he]802-he is [a romancing , straightfor'ard , honest chap]806-a romancing , straightfor'ard , honest chap , [he]802-he 's to be had , and as [a husband]807-a husband , if [you]808-you set about catching [him]802-he in the right way . " [Arabella]305-arabella remained thinking awhile . "[808-you] What med be the right way ? " [she]305-arabella asked . "[808-you] Oh [you]808-you do n't know - [you]808-you do n't ! " said [Sarah]227-sarah , [the third girl]4333-the third girl . "[808-you] On [my]0-i word [I]0-i do n't ! - No further , that is , than by plain courting , and taking care [he]802-he do n't go too far ! " [The third girl]4333-the third girl looked at [the second]4186-the second . "[0-i] [She]0-i DON'T know ! " "[0-i] ' Tis clear [she]0-i do n't ! " said [Anny]221-anny . "[0-i] And having lived in [a town]809-a town , too , as [one]810-one may say ! Well , [we]811-we can teach ' [ee]812-ee som'at then , as well as [you]808-you [us]811-we . " "[808-you] Yes . And how do [you]808-you mean - a sure way to gain [a man]543-a man ? Take [me]0-i for [an innocent]814-an innocent , and have done [wi]815-wi ' it ! " "[807-a husband] As [a husband]807-a husband . " "[807-a husband] As [a husband]807-a husband . " "[807-a husband] [A countryman that 's honourable and serious - minded such as [he]802-he]818-a countryman that 's honourable and serious - minded such as he ; God forbid that [I]0-i should say [a sojer]819-a sojer , or [sailor]820-sailor , or [commercial gent from [the towns]822-the towns]821-commercial gent from the towns , or [any of [them]822-the towns that be slippery with [poor women]824-poor women]823-any of them that be slippery with poor women ! [I]0-i 'd do [no friend]825-no friend that harm ! " "[802-he] Well , such as [he]802-he , of course ! " [[Arabella]305-arabella 's companions]4336-arabella 's companions looked at [each other]4188-each other , and turning up [their]4336-arabella 's companions eyes in drollery began smirking . Then [one]810-one went up close to [Arabella]305-arabella , and , although [nobody]4069-nobody was near , imparted some information in a low tone , [the other]4340-the other observing curiously the effect upon [Arabella]305-arabella . "[802-he] Ah ! " said [the last - named]4341-the last - named slowly . "[802-he] [I]0-i own [I]0-i did n't think of that way ! ... But suppose [he]802-he ISN'T honourable ? [A woman]4193-a woman had better not have tried it ! " "[4193-a woman] Nothing venture nothing have ! Besides , [you]827-you make sure that [he]802-he 's honourable before [you]827-you begin . [You]827-you 'd be safe enough with [yours]827-you . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had the chance ! [Lots of [girls]540-girls]828-lots of girls do it ; or do [you]827-you think [they]828-lots of girls 'd get married at all ? " [Arabella]305-arabella pursued [her]305-arabella way in silent thought . "[827-you] [I]0-i 'll try it ! " [she]305-arabella whispered ; but not to [them]828-lots of girls . VIII One week 's end [Jude]164-jude was as usual walking out to [[his]164-jude aunt]555-his aunt 's at [Marygreen]1-marygreen from [[his]164-jude lodging in [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4343-his lodging in alfredston , a walk which now had large attractions for [him]164-jude quite other than [his]164-jude desire to see [[his]164-jude aged and morose relative]4344-his aged and morose relative . [He]164-jude diverged to the right before ascending [the hill]564-the hill with the single purpose of gaining , on [his]164-jude way , a glimpse of [Arabella]305-arabella that should not come into the reckoning of regular appointments . Before quite reaching [the homestead]4346-the homestead [his]164-jude alert eye perceived the top of [her]305-arabella head moving quickly hither and thither over [the garden hedge]4347-the garden hedge . Entering the gate [he]164-jude found that three young unfattened pigs had escaped from [their]830-they sty by leaping clean over the top , and that [she]305-arabella was endeavouring unassisted to drive [them]830-they in through the door which [she]305-arabella had set open . The lines of [her]305-arabella countenance changed from the rigidity of business to the softness of love when [she]305-arabella saw [Jude]164-jude , and [she]305-arabella bent [her]305-arabella eyes languishingly upon [him]164-jude . The animals took advantage of the pause by doubling and bolting out of the way . "[827-you] [They]830-they were only put in this morning ! " [she]305-arabella cried , stimulated to pursue in spite of [[her]305-arabella lover]4279-her lover 's presence . "[830-they] [They]830-they were drove from [Spaddleholt Farm]25-spaddleholt farm only yesterday , where [Father]228-father bought ['em]831-'em at a stiff price enough . [They]830-they are wanting to get [home]3897-home again , [the stupid toads]833-the stupid toads ! Will [you]834-her shut the garden gate , [dear]795-dear , and help [me]0-i to get ['em]831-'em in . There are [no men folk]836-no men folk at [home]3897-home , only [Mother]229-mother , and [they]830-they 'll be lost if [we]838-we do n't mind . " [He]4279-her lover set [himself]4279-her lover to assist , and dodged this way and that over the potato rows and the cabbages . Every now and then [they]838-we ran together , when [he]4279-her lover caught [her]834-her for a moment and kissed [her]834-her . [The first pig]4349-the first pig was got back promptly ; [the second]4186-the second with some difficulty ; [the third a long - legged creature]4351-the third a long - legged creature , was more obstinate and agile . [He]4279-her lover plunged through a hole in the garden hedge , and into [the lane]493-the lane . "[839-he] [He]839-he 'll be lost if [I]0-i do n't follow ' n ! " said [she]0-i . "[0-i] Come along with [me]0-i ! " [She]0-i rushed in full pursuit out of [the garden]521-the garden , [Jude]164-jude alongside [her]0-i , barely contriving to keep [the fugitive]4354-the fugitive in sight . Occasionally [they]4355-they would shout to [some boy]4356-some boy to stop the animal , but [he]4279-her lover always wriggled past and ran on as before . "[0-i] Let [me]0-i take [your]840-your hand , [darling]841-darling , " said [Jude]164-jude . "[840-your] [You]840-your are getting out of breath . " [She]0-i gave [him]164-jude [her]0-i now hot hand with apparent willingness , and [they]4355-they trotted along together . "[840-your] This comes of [driving 'em [home]3897-home]842-driving 'em home , " [she]0-i remarked . "[844-they] [They]844-they always know the way back if [you]845-you do that . [They]844-they ought to have been carted over . " By this time [the pig]4357-the pig had reached an unfastened gate admitting to [the open down]4358-the open down , across which [he]4357-the pig sped with all the agility [his]4357-the pig little legs afforded . As soon as [the pursuers]4359-the pursuers had entered and ascended to [the top of the high ground]4360-the top of the high ground it became apparent that [they]4359-the pursuers would have to run all the way to [the farmer]526-the farmer 's if [they]4359-the pursuers wished to get at [him]4357-the pig . From [this summit]4362-this summit [he]4357-the pig could be seen as [a minute speck]4363-a minute speck , following an unerring line towards [[his]4357-the pig old home]4364-his old home . "[844-they] It is no good ! " cried [Arabella]305-arabella . "[846-he] [He]846-he 'll be there long before [we]847-we get [there]3887-there . It do n't matter now [we]847-we know [he]846-he 's not lost or stolen on the way . [They]849-they 'll see it is [ours]847-we , and send [un]846-he back . Oh dear , how hot [I]0-i be ! " Without relinquishing [her]305-arabella hold of [Jude]164-jude 's hand [she]305-arabella swerved aside and flung [herself]305-arabella down on the sod under a stunted thorn , precipitately pulling [Jude]164-jude on to [his]164-jude knees at the same time . "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i ask pardon - [I]0-i nearly threw [you]850-you down , did n't [I]0-i ! But [I]0-i am so tired ! " [She]305-arabella lay supine , and straight as an arrow , on [the sloping sod of [this hill - top]4366-this hill - top]4365-the sloping sod of this hill - top , gazing up into the blue miles of sky , and still retaining [her]305-arabella warm hold of [Jude]164-jude 's hand . [He]164-jude reclined on [his]164-jude elbow near [her]305-arabella . "[0-i] [We]851-they 've run all this way for nothing , " [she]305-arabella went on , [her]305-arabella form heaving and falling in quick pants , [her]305-arabella face flushed , [her]305-arabella full red lips parted , and a fine dew of perspiration on [her]305-arabella skin . "[0-i] Well - why do n't [you]850-you speak , [deary]852-deary ? " "[850-you] [I]0-i 'm blown too . It was all [up hill]853-up hill . " [They]851-they were in absolute solitude - the most apparent of all solitudes , that of empty surrounding space . [Nobody]4069-nobody could be nearer than a mile to [them]851-they without [their]851-they seeing [him]164-jude . [They]851-they were , in fact , on one of [the summits of [the county]4369-the county]4368-the summits of the county , and [the distant landscape around]4370-the distant landscape around [Christminster]180-jude could be discerned from where [they]851-they lay . But [Jude]180-jude did not think of that then . "[850-you] Oh , [I]0-i can see such a pretty thing up this tree , " said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[0-i] A sort of a - caterpillar , of the most loveliest green and yellow [you]850-you ever came across ! " "[0-i] Where ? " said [Jude]180-jude , sitting up . "[0-i] [You]850-you ca n't see [him]854-him there - [you]850-you must come here , " said [she]305-arabella . [He]164-jude bent nearer and put [his]164-jude head in front of [hers]305-arabella . "[850-you] No - [I]0-i ca n't see it , " [he]164-jude said . "[0-i] Why , on the limb there where it branches off - close to the moving leaf - there ! " [She]305-arabella gently pulled [him]164-jude down beside [her]305-arabella . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see it , " [he]164-jude repeated , the back of [his]164-jude head against [her]305-arabella cheek . "[0-i] But [I]0-i can , perhaps , standing up . " [He]164-jude stood accordingly , placing [himself]164-jude in the direct line of [her]305-arabella gaze . "[0-i] How stupid [you]850-you are ! " [she]305-arabella said crossly , turning away [her]305-arabella face . "[850-you] [I]0-i do n't care to see it , [dear]795-dear : why should [I]0-i ? " [he]164-jude replied looking down upon [her]305-arabella . "[230-abby] Get up , [Abby]230-abby . " "[230-abby] Why ? " "[230-abby] [I]0-i want [you]850-you to let [me]0-i kiss [you]850-you . [I]0-i 've been waiting to ever so long ! " [She]305-arabella rolled round [her]305-arabella face , remained a moment looking deedily aslant at [him]164-jude ; then with a slight curl of the lip sprang to [her]305-arabella feet , and exclaiming abruptly "[0-i] [I]0-i must mizzle ! " walked off quickly homeward . [Jude]180-jude followed and rejoined [her]305-arabella . "[0-i] Just one ! " [he]164-jude coaxed . "[0-i] Sha n't ! " [she]305-arabella said . [He]164-jude , surprised : "[0-i] What 's the matter ? " [She]305-arabella kept [her]305-arabella two lips resentfully together , and [Jude]180-jude followed [her]305-arabella like a pet lamb till [she]305-arabella slackened [her]305-arabella pace and walked beside [him]164-jude , talking calmly on indifferent subjects , and always checking [him]164-jude if [he]164-jude tried to take [her]305-arabella hand or clasp [her]305-arabella waist . Thus [they]4371-they descended to [the precincts of [[her]305-arabella father]4197-her father 's homestead]4372-the precincts of her father 's homestead , and [Arabella]305-arabella went in , nodding good - bye to [him]164-jude with a supercilious , affronted air . "[0-i] [I]0-i expect [I]0-i took too much liberty with [her]856-her , somehow , " [Jude]180-jude said to [himself]180-jude , as [he]180-jude withdrew with a sigh and went on to [Marygreen]1-marygreen . On Sunday morning the interior of [[Arabella]305-arabella 's home]4374-arabella 's home was , as usual , the scene of a grand weekly cooking , the preparation of the special Sunday dinner . [[Her]305-arabella father]4197-her father was shaving before a little glass hung on the mullion of the window , and [[her]305-arabella mother]4376-her mother and [Arabella]305-arabella [herself]305-arabella were shelling beans hard by . [A neighbour]4377-a neighbour passed on [her]4377-a neighbour way [home]3897-home from morning service at [the nearest church]4379-the nearest church , and seeing [Donn]305-arabella engaged at the window with the razor , nodded and came in . [She]0-i at once spoke playfully to [Arabella]305-arabella : "[0-i] [I]0-i zeed ' ee running with ' un - hee - hee ! [I]0-i hope ' tis coming to something ? " [Arabella]305-arabella merely threw a look of consciousness into [her]305-arabella face without raising [her]305-arabella eyes . "[857-he] [He]857-he 's for [Christminster]180-jude , [I]0-i hear , as soon as [he]857-he can get there . " "[857-he] Have [you]0-i heard that lately - quite lately ? " asked [Arabella]305-arabella with a jealous , tigerish indrawing of breath . "[0-i] Oh no ! But it has been known a long time that it is [his]857-he plan . [He]857-he 's on'y waiting here for an opening . Ah well : [he]857-he must walk about with [somebody]4067-somebody , [I]0-i s'pose . [Young men]859-young men do n't mean much now - a - days . ' Tis a sip here and a sip there with ['em]860-'em . ' Twas different in [my]0-i time . " When the gossip had departed [Arabella]305-arabella said suddenly to [[her]305-arabella mother]4376-her mother : "[0-i] [I]0-i want [you]0-i and [Father]228-father to go and inquire how the Edlins be , this evening after tea . Or no - there 's evening service at [Fensworth]26-fensworth - [you]0-i can walk to that . " "[0-i] Oh ? What 's up to - night , then ? " "[0-i] Nothing . Only [I]0-i want [the house]504-the house to [myself]0-i . [He]857-he 's shy ; and [I]0-i ca n't get [un]857-he to come in when [you]0-i are here . [I]0-i shall let [him]857-he slip through [my]0-i fingers if [I]0-i do n't mind , much as [I]0-i care for ' n ! " "[0-i] If it is fine [we]862-they med as well go , since [you]0-i wish . " In the afternoon [Arabella]305-arabella met and walked with [Jude]180-jude , who had now for weeks ceased to look into a book of Greek , Latin , or any other tongue . [They]862-they wandered up [the slopes]4381-the slopes till [they]862-they reached [the green track along [the ridge]4383-the ridge]4382-the green track along the ridge , which [they]862-they followed to [the circular British earth - bank adjoining]4384-the circular british earth - bank adjoining , [Jude]180-jude thinking of the great age of [the trackway]579-the trackway , and of [the drovers who had frequented [it]579-the trackway , probably before [the Romans]4387-the romans knew [the country]4234-the country]4386-the drovers who had frequented it , probably before the romans knew the country . Up from [the level lands below]4389-the level lands below [them]862-they floated the chime of church bells . Presently [they]862-they were reduced to one note , which quickened , and stopped . "[0-i] Now [we]862-they 'll go back , " said [Arabella]305-arabella , who had attended to the sounds . [Jude]180-jude assented . So long as [he]180-jude was near [her]305-arabella [he]180-jude minded little where [he]180-jude was . When [they]862-they arrived at [[her]305-arabella house]4390-her house [he]180-jude said lingeringly : "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't come in . Why are [you]863-you in such a hurry to go in to - night ? It is not near dark . " "[0-i] Wait a moment , " said [she]305-arabella . [She]305-arabella tried the handle of the door and found it locked . "[0-i] Ah - [they]864-they are gone to [church]865-church , " [she]305-arabella added . And searching behind the scraper [she]305-arabella found the key and unlocked the door . "[864-they] Now , [you]0-i 'll come in a moment ? " [she]305-arabella asked lightly . "[0-i] [We]866-we shall be all alone . " "[0-i] Certainly , " said [Jude]180-jude with alacrity , the case being unexpectedly altered . Indoors [they]862-they went . Did [he]180-jude want any tea ? No , it was too late : [he]180-jude would rather sit and talk to [her]305-arabella . [She]305-arabella took off [her]305-arabella jacket and hat , and [they]862-they sat down - naturally enough close together . "[0-i] Do n't touch [me]0-i , please , " [she]305-arabella said softly . "[0-i] [I]0-i am part egg - shell . Or perhaps [I]0-i had better put it in a safe place . " [She]305-arabella began unfastening the collar of [her]305-arabella gown . "[0-i] What is it ? " said [[her]305-arabella lover]4279-her lover . "[0-i] An egg - a cochin 's egg . [I]0-i am hatching a very rare sort . [I]0-i carry it about everywhere with [me]0-i , and it will get hatched in less than three weeks . " "[0-i] Where do [you]0-i carry it ? " "[0-i] Just here . " [She]305-arabella put [her]305-arabella hand into [her]305-arabella bosom and drew out the egg , which was wrapped in wool , outside it being a piece of pig 's bladder , in case of accidents . Having exhibited it to [him]4279-her lover [she]305-arabella put it back , "[0-i] Now mind [you]0-i do n't come near [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n't want to get it broke , and have to begin another . " "[0-i] Why do [you]0-i do such a strange thing ? " "[0-i] It 's an old custom . [I]0-i suppose it is natural for [a woman]4193-a woman to want to bring live things into [the world]706-the world . " "[4193-a woman] It is very awkward for [me]0-i just now , " [he]4279-her lover said , laughing . "[4193-a woman] It serves [you]0-i right . "[0-i] That 's very shabby of [you]0-i ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i should have catched [me]0-i a minute ago when [I]0-i had put the egg down ! There ! " [she]305-arabella said defiantly , "[0-i] [I]0-i am without it now ! " [She]305-arabella had quickly withdrawn the egg a second time ; but before [he]4279-her lover could quite reach [her]305-arabella [she]305-arabella had put it back as quickly , laughing with the excitement of [her]305-arabella strategy . Then there was a little struggle , [Jude]180-jude making a plunge for it and capturing it triumphantly . [Her]305-arabella face flushed ; and becoming suddenly conscious [he]4279-her lover flushed also . [They]4392-they looked at [each other]4188-each other , panting ; till [he]4279-her lover rose and said : "[0-i] One kiss , now [I]0-i can do it without damage to property ; and [I]0-i 'll go ! " But [she]305-arabella had jumped up too . "[0-i] [You]0-i must find [me]0-i first ! " [she]305-arabella cried . [[Her]305-arabella lover]4279-her lover followed [her]305-arabella as [she]305-arabella withdrew . It was now dark inside [the room]4227-the room , and the window being small [he]4279-her lover could not discover for a long time what had become of [her]305-arabella , till a laugh revealed [her]305-arabella to have rushed up [the stairs]4396-the stairs , whither [Jude]180-jude rushed at [her]305-arabella heels . [IX]231-ix It was some two months later in the year , and [the pair]4397-the pair had met constantly during the interval . [Arabella]305-arabella seemed dissatisfied ; [she]305-arabella was always imagining , and waiting , and wondering . One day [she]305-arabella met [the itinerant Vilbert]189-vilbert . [She]305-arabella , like all [the cottagers thereabout]4398-the cottagers thereabout , knew the quack well , and [she]305-arabella began telling [him]189-vilbert of [her]305-arabella experiences . [Arabella]305-arabella had been gloomy , but before [he]189-vilbert left [her]305-arabella [she]305-arabella had grown brighter . That evening [she]305-arabella kept an appointment with [Jude]180-jude , who seemed sad . "[0-i] [I]0-i am going away , " [he]180-jude said to [her]305-arabella . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i ought to go . [I]0-i think it will be better both for [you]869-you and for [me]0-i . [I]0-i wish some things had never begun ! [I]0-i was much to blame , [I]0-i know . But it is never too late to mend . " [Arabella]305-arabella began to cry . "[0-i] How do [you]0-i know it is not too late ? " [she]305-arabella said . "[0-i] That 's all very well to say ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought - [I]0-i thought , [deary]852-deary , perhaps [you]0-i would go away all the more for that , and leave [me]0-i to face it alone ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i knew better ! " That night [he]852-deary went out alone , and walked in the dark self - communing . [He]852-deary knew well , too well , in the secret centre of [his]852-deary brain , that [Arabella]305-arabella was not worth a great deal as [a specimen of womankind]4400-a specimen of womankind . What was as remarkable as the undertaking itself was the fact that [nobody]4069-nobody seemed at all surprised at what [they]4416-the two swore . [[Fawley]180-jude 's aunt]4418-fawley 's aunt being [a baker]4419-a baker [she]4418-fawley 's aunt made [him]180-jude a bride - cake , saying bitterly that it was the last thing [she]4418-fawley 's aunt could do for [him]180-jude , [poor silly fellow]4420-poor silly fellow ; and that it would have been far better if , instead of [his]180-jude living to trouble [her]4418-fawley 's aunt , [he]180-jude had gone underground years before with [[his]180-jude father]3903-his father and [mother]4422-mother . " The prospects of [the newly married couple]4424-the newly married couple were certainly not very brilliant even to the most sanguine mind . [He]180-jude , [[a stone - mason]4425-a stone - mason 's apprentice]4426-a stone - mason 's apprentice , nineteen years of age , was working for half wages till [he]180-jude should be out of [his]180-jude time . [[His]180-jude wife]4427-his wife was absolutely useless in [a town]809-a town - lodging , where [he]180-jude at first had considered it would be necessary for [them]4424-the newly married couple to live . But the urgent need of adding to income in ever so little a degree caused [him]180-jude to take [a lonely roadside cottage]4429-a lonely roadside cottage between [the Brown House]21-the brown house and [Marygreen]1-marygreen , that [he]180-jude might have the profits of [a vegetable garden]4430-a vegetable garden , and utilize [her]4427-his wife past experiences by letting [her]4427-his wife keep a pig . But it was not the sort of life [he]180-jude had bargained for , and it was a long way to walk to and from [Alfredston]20-alfredston every day . [Arabella]305-arabella , however , felt that all these make - shifts were temporary ; [she]305-arabella had gained [a husband]807-a husband ; that was the thing - a husband with a lot of earning power in [him]180-jude for buying [her]305-arabella frocks and hats when [he]180-jude should begin to get frightened a bit , and stick to [his]180-jude trade , and throw aside those stupid books for practical undertakings . " Nevertheless it was with a little uneasiness that [Arabella]305-arabella approached the time when in the natural course of things [she]305-arabella would have to reveal that the alarm [she]305-arabella had raised had been without foundation . [He]180-jude had worked hard the whole twelve hours , and had retired to rest before [[his]180-jude wife]4427-his wife . When [she]4427-his wife came into [the room]4227-the room [he]180-jude was between sleeping and waking , and was barely conscious of [her]4427-his wife undressing before the little looking - glass as [he]180-jude lay . One action of [hers]4427-his wife , however , brought [him]180-jude to full cognition . " [He]4457-he gave the answer simply , and lay down ; and there was silence between [them]912-our . When [Jude]180-jude awoke the next morning [he]180-jude seemed to see [the world]706-the world with a different eye . As to the point in question [he]180-jude was compelled to accept [her]795-dear word ; in the circumstances [he]180-jude could not have acted otherwise while ordinary notions prevailed . But how came [they]912-our to prevail ? There seemed to [him]180-jude , vaguely and dimly , something wrong in a social ritual which made necessary a cancelling of well - formed schemes involving years of thought and labour , of foregoing [a man]543-a man 's one opportunity of showing [himself]543-a man superior to the lower animals , and of contributing [his]543-a man units of work to the general progress of [[his]543-a man generation]4460-his generation , because of a momentary surprise by a new and transitory instinct which had nothing in it of the nature of vice , and could be only at the most called weakness . [He]180-jude was inclined to inquire what [he]180-jude had done , or [she]795-dear lost , for that matter , that [he]180-jude deserved to be caught in a gin which would cripple [him]180-jude , if not [her]795-dear also , for the rest of a lifetime ? There was perhaps something fortunate in the fact that the immediate reason of [his]180-jude marriage had proved to be non - existent . But the marriage remained . X The time arrived for killing the pig which [Jude]180-jude and [[his]180-jude wife]4427-his wife had fattened in [their]4462-their sty during the autumn months , and the butchering was timed to take place as soon as it was light in the morning , so that [Jude]180-jude might get to [Alfredston]20-alfredston without losing more than a quarter of a day . The night had seemed strangely silent . [Jude]180-jude looked out of the window long before dawn , and perceived that the ground was covered with snow - snow rather deep for the season , it seemed , a few flakes still falling . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid [the pig - killer]915-the pig - killer wo n't be able to come , " [he]180-jude said to [Arabella]305-arabella . "[0-i] Oh , [he]915-the pig - killer 'll come . [You]916-you must get up and make the water hot , if [you]916-you want [Challow]232-challow to scald [him]915-the pig - killer . Though [I]0-i like singeing best . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll get up , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] [I]0-i like the way of [[my]0-i own county]917-my own county . " [He]180-jude went [downstairs]4245-downstairs , lit the fire under the copper , and began feeding it with bean - stalks , all the time without a candle , the blaze flinging a cheerful shine into [the room]4227-the room ; though for [him]180-jude the sense of cheerfulness was lessened by thoughts on the reason of that blaze - to heat water to scald the bristles from the body of [an animal that as yet lived , and whose voice could be continually heard]4465-an animal that as yet lived , and whose voice could be continually heard from a corner of [the garden]521-the garden . At half - past six , the time of appointment with [the butcher]4467-the butcher , the water boiled , and [[Jude]180-jude 's wife]4468-jude 's wife came [downstairs]4245-downstairs . "[0-i] Is [Challow]232-challow come ? " [she]0-i asked . "[232-challow] No . " [They]918-we waited , and it grew lighter , with the dreary light of a snowy dawn . [She]0-i went out , gazed along [the road]629-the road , and returning said , "[232-challow] [He]232-challow 's not coming . Drunk last night , [I]0-i expect . The snow is not enough to hinder [him]232-challow , surely ! " "[232-challow] Then [we]918-we must put it off . It is only the water boiled for nothing . The snow may be deep in [the valley]919-the valley . " "[232-challow] Ca n't be put off . There 's no more victuals for the pig . [He]232-challow ate the last mixing o ' barleymeal yesterday morning . " "[232-challow] Yesterday morning ? What has [he]232-challow lived on since ? " "[232-challow] Nothing . " "[232-challow] What - [he]232-challow has been starving ? " "[232-challow] Yes . [We]918-we always do it the last day or two , to save bother with the innerds . What ignorance , not to know that ! " "[0-i] That accounts for [his]232-challow crying so . [Poor creature]920-poor creature ! " "[920-poor creature] Well - [you]921-you must do the sticking - there 's no help for it . [I]0-i 'll show [you]921-you how . Or [I]0-i 'll do it [myself]0-i - [I]0-i think [I]0-i could . Though as it is such a big pig [I]0-i had rather [Challow]232-challow had done it . However , [his]232-challow basket o ' knives and things have been already sent on here , and [we]918-we can use 'em . " "[921-you] Of course [you]921-you sha n't do it , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[921-you] [I]0-i 'll do it , since it must be done . " [He]180-jude went out to [the sty]4471-the sty , shovelled away the snow for the space of a couple of yards or more , and placed the stool in front , with the knives and ropes at hand . [A robin]4472-a robin peered down at the preparations from the nearest tree , and , not liking the sinister look of the scene , flew away , though hungry . By this time [Arabella]305-arabella had joined [[her]305-arabella husband]3921-her husband , and [Jude]180-jude , rope in hand , got into [the sty]4471-the sty , and noosed the affrighted animal , who , beginning with a squeak of surprise , rose to repeated cries of rage . [Arabella]305-arabella opened the sty - door , and together [they]918-we hoisted [the victim]4475-the victim on to the stool , legs upward , and while [Jude]180-jude held [him]4475-the victim [Arabella]305-arabella bound [him]4475-the victim down , looping the cord over [his]4475-the victim legs to keep [him]4475-the victim from struggling . The animal 's note changed its quality . It was not now rage , but the cry of despair ; long - drawn , slow and hopeless . "[0-i] Upon [my]0-i soul [I]0-i would sooner have gone without the pig than have had this to do ! " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] A creature [I]0-i have fed with [my]0-i own hands . " "[0-i] Do n't be such [a tender - hearted fool]922-a tender - hearted fool ! There 's the sticking - knife - the one with the point . Now whatever [you]0-i do , do n't stick un too deep . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll stick [him]923-he effectually , so as to make short work of it . That 's the chief thing . " "[0-i] [You]0-i must not ! " [she]0-i cried . "[0-i] The meat must be well bled , and to do that [he]923-he must die slow . [We]924-we shall lose a shilling a score if the meat is red and bloody ! Just touch the vein , that 's all . [I]0-i was brought up to it , and [I]0-i know . [Every good butcher]925-every good butcher keeps un bleeding long . [He]923-he ought to be eight or ten minutes dying , at least . " "[923-he] [He]923-he shall not be half a minute if [I]0-i can help it , however the meat may look , " said [Jude]180-jude determinedly . Scraping the bristles from the pig 's upturned throat , as [he]180-jude had seen [the butchers]4476-the butchers do , [he]180-jude slit the fat ; then plunged in the knife with all [his]180-jude might . "[0-i] ' Od damn it all ! " [she]0-i cried , "[0-i] that ever [I]0-i should say it ! [You]0-i 've over - stuck un ! And [I]0-i telling [you]0-i all the time - " "[0-i] Do be quiet , [Arabella]305-arabella , and have a little pity on [the creature]926-the creature ! " "[0-i] Hold up the pail to catch the blood , and do n't talk ! " However unworkmanlike the deed , it had been mercifully done . The blood flowed out in a torrent instead of in the trickling stream [she]0-i had desired . [The dying animal]4477-the dying animal 's cry assumed its third and final tone , the shriek of agony ; [his]4477-the dying animal glazing eyes riveting themselves on [Arabella]305-arabella with the eloquently keen reproach of a creature recognizing at last the treachery of [those who had seemed [[his]180-jude only friends]4479-his only friends]4478-those who had seemed his only friends . "[0-i] Make un stop that ! " said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[0-i] Such a noise will bring [somebody or other]927-somebody or other up here , and [I]0-i do n't want [people]658-people to know [we]929-we are doing it [ourselves]929-we . " Picking up the knife from the ground whereon [Jude]180-jude had flung it , [she]305-arabella slipped it into the gash , and slit the windpipe . [The pig]4357-the pig was instantly silent , [his]4357-the pig dying breath coming through the hole . "[658-people] That 's better , " [she]305-arabella said . "[658-people] It is a hateful business ! " said [he]180-jude . "[930-pigs] [Pigs]930-pigs must be killed . " [The animal]4481-the animal heaved in a final convulsion , and , despite the rope , kicked out with all [his]4357-the pig last strength . A tablespoonful of black clot came forth , the trickling of red blood having ceased for some seconds . "[930-pigs] That 's it ; now [he]931-you 'll go , " said [she]305-arabella . "[931-you] [Artful creatures]932-artful creatures - [they]932-artful creatures always keep back a drop like that as long as [they]932-artful creatures can ! " The last plunge had come so unexpectedly as to make [Jude]180-jude stagger , and in recovering [himself]180-jude [he]180-jude kicked over the vessel in which the blood had been caught . "[932-artful creatures] There ! " [she]305-arabella cried , thoroughly in a passion . "[932-artful creatures] Now [I]0-i ca n't make any blackpot . There 's a waste , all through [you]931-you ! " [Jude]180-jude put the pail upright , but only about a third of the whole steaming liquid was left in it , the main part being splashed over the snow , and forming a dismal , sordid , ugly spectacle - to [those who saw it as other than an ordinary obtaining of meat]4482-those who saw it as other than an ordinary obtaining of meat . The lips and nostrils of the animal turned livid , then white , and the muscles of [his]180-jude limbs relaxed . "[931-you] Thank [God]177-god ! " [Jude]180-jude said . "[931-you] [He]931-you 's dead . " "[931-you] What 's [God]177-god got to do with such a messy job as a pig - killing , [I]0-i should like to know ! " [she]305-arabella said scornfully . "[0-i] [Poor folks]933-poor folks must live . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know , " said [he]180-jude . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't scold [you]931-you . " Suddenly [they]4483-they became aware of a voice at hand . "[0-i] Well done , [young married volk]934-young married volk ! [I]0-i could n't have carried it out much better [myself]0-i , cuss [me]0-i if [I]0-i could ! " The voice , which was husky , came from [the garden]521-the garden - gate , and looking up from the scene of slaughter [they]4483-they saw the burly form of [Mr. Challow]232-challow leaning over the gate , critically surveying [their]4483-they performance . "[0-i] ' Tis well for ' [ee]935-ee to stand there and glane ! " said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[935-ee] Owing to [your]931-you being late the meat is blooded and half spoiled ! ' Twon't fetch so much by a shilling a score ! " [Challow]232-challow expressed [his]232-challow contrition . "[931-you] [You]931-you should have waited a bit " [he]232-challow said , shaking [his]232-challow head , "[931-you] and not have done this - in the delicate state , too , that [you]931-you be in at present , [ma'am]936-ma'am . ' Tis risking [yourself]931-you too much . " "[931-you] [You]931-you need n't be concerned about that , " said [Arabella]305-arabella , laughing . [Jude]180-jude too laughed , but there was a strong flavour of bitterness in [his]180-jude amusement . [Challow]232-challow made up for [his]232-challow neglect of the killing by zeal in the scalding and scraping . [Jude]180-jude felt dissatisfied with [himself]180-jude as [a man]543-a man at what [he]180-jude had done , though aware of [his]180-jude lack of common sense , and that the deed would have amounted to the same thing if carried out by [deputy]4486-deputy . The white snow , stained with the blood of [[his]180-jude fellow - mortal]4487-his fellow - mortal , wore an illogical look to [him]180-jude as [a lover of justice]4488-a lover of justice , not to say [a Christian]4489-a christian ; but [he]180-jude could not see how the matter was to be mended . No doubt [he]180-jude was , as [[his]180-jude wife]4427-his wife had called [him]180-jude , [a tender - hearted fool]922-a tender - hearted fool . [He]180-jude did not like [the road to [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4492-the road to alfredston now . [It]4492-the road to alfredston stared [him]180-jude cynically in the face . The wayside objects reminded [him]180-jude so much of [his]180-jude courtship of [[his]180-jude wife]4427-his wife that , to keep them out of [his]180-jude eyes , [he]180-jude read whenever [he]180-jude could as [he]180-jude walked to and from [his]180-jude work . Yet [he]180-jude sometimes felt that by caring for books [he]180-jude was not escaping common - place nor gaining rare ideas , [every working - man being of that taste]4494-every working - man being of that taste now . When passing near the spot by [the stream on which [he]180-jude had first made [her]4427-his wife acquaintance]4495-the stream on which he had first made her acquaintance [he]180-jude one day heard voices just as [he]180-jude had done at that earlier time . [One of the girls who had been [[Arabella]305-arabella 's companions]4336-arabella 's companions]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions was talking to [a friend in [a shed]4499-a shed]4498-a friend in a shed , [himself]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions being the subject of discourse , possibly because [they]4336-arabella 's companions had seen [him]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions in the distance . [They]4336-arabella 's companions were quite unaware that the shed - walls were so thin that [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions could hear [their]4336-arabella 's companions words as [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions passed . "[233-howsomever] [Howsomever]233-howsomever , ' twas [I]0-i put [her]937-she up to it ! ' Nothing venture nothing have , ' [I]0-i said . The suggestion was horridly unpleasant , and it rankled in [his]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions mind so much that instead of entering [[his]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions own cottage]4502-his own cottage when [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions reached [it]4502-his own cottage [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions flung [his]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions basket inside the garden - gate and passed on , determined to go and see [[his]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions old aunt]4503-his old aunt and get some supper [there]3887-there . [Arabella]305-arabella however , was busy melting down lard from fat of the deceased pig , for [she]305-arabella had been out on a jaunt all day , and so delayed [her]305-arabella work . Dreading lest what [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions had heard should lead [him]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions to say something regrettable to [her]305-arabella [he]4496-one of the girls who had been arabella 's companions spoke little . But [Arabella]305-arabella was very talkative , and said among other things that [she]305-arabella wanted some money . "[937-she] [An apprentice]939-an apprentice 's wages are not meant to be enough to keep [a wife]940-a wife on , as a rule , [[my]0-i dear]772-my dear . " "[937-she] Then [you]772-my dear should n't have had one . " "[937-she] Come , [Arabella]305-arabella ! That 's too bad , when [you]772-my dear know how it came about . It was a good job for [you]772-my dear that it was n't so ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't mean that , " [he]772-my dear said hastily . "[0-i] [I]0-i mean before that time .
