" Part Third AT [MELCHESTER]3-melchester "[0-i] For there was [no other girl]1496-no other girl , [O bridegroom]1497-o bridegroom , like [her]1498-her ! " - [SAPPHO H. T. Wharton]277-sappho h. t. wharton . [I]1499-you It was a new idea - the ecclesiastical and altruistic life as distinct from the intellectual and emulative life . [A man]543-a man could preach and do good to [his]543-a man fellow - creatures without taking double - firsts in [the schools of [Christminster]180-jude]5031-the schools of christminster , or having anything but ordinary knowledge . The old fancy which had led on to the culminating vision of [the bishopric]5032-the bishopric had not been an ethical or theological enthusiasm at all , but a mundane ambition masquerading in a surplice . [He]543-a man feared that [his]543-a man whole scheme had degenerated to , even though it might not have originated in , a social unrest which had no foundation in the nobler instincts ; which was purely an artificial product of civilization . There were thousands of [young men on the same self - seeking track]5033-young men on the same self - seeking track at the present moment . [The sensual hind who ate , drank , and lived carelessly with [[his]543-a man wife]4427-his wife through the days of [his]543-a man vanity was a more likable being than [he]543-a man . But to enter [the Church]4809-the church in such an unscholarly way that [he]543-a man could not in any probability rise to a higher grade through all [his]543-a man career than that of [the humble curate wearing [his]543-a man life out in [an obscure village]5038-an obscure village or [city slum]5039-city slum]5037-the humble curate wearing his life out in an obscure village or city slum]5034-the sensual hind who ate , drank , and lived carelessly with his wife through the days of his vanity was a more likable being than he . but to enter the church in such an unscholarly way that he could not in any probability rise to a higher grade through all his career than that of the humble curate wearing his life out in an obscure village or city slum - that might have a touch of goodness and greatness in it ; that might be true religion , and a purgatorial course worthy of being followed by [a remorseful man]5040-a remorseful man . The favourable light in which this new thought showed itself by contrast with [his]543-a man foregone intentions cheered [Jude]180-jude , as [he]543-a man sat there , shabby and lonely ; and it may be said to have given , during the next few days , the coup de grace to [his]543-a man intellectual career - a career which had extended over the greater part of a dozen years . [He]543-a man did nothing , however , for some long stagnant time to advance [his]543-a man new desire , occupying [himself]543-a man with little local jobs in putting up and lettering headstones about [the neighbouring villages]5041-the neighbouring villages , and submitting to be regarded as a social failure , a returned purchase , by [the half - dozen or so of farmers]5042-the half - dozen or so of farmers and [other country - people who condescended to nod to [him]543-a man]5043-other country - people who condescended to nod to him . The human interest of the new intention - and a human interest is indispensable to the most spiritual and self - sacrificing - was created by a letter from [Sue]174-sue , bearing a fresh postmark . [She]174-sue evidently wrote with anxiety , and told very little about [her]174-sue own doings , more than that [she]174-sue had passed some sort of examination for [a Queen]5044-a queen 's Scholarship , and was going to enter [a training college at [Melchester]3-melchester]5045-a training college at melchester to complete [herself]174-sue for the vocation [she]174-sue had chosen , partly by [his]543-a man influence . There was [a theological college at [Melchester]3-melchester]5046-a theological college at melchester ; [Melchester]3-melchester was [a quiet and soothing place]5047-a quiet and soothing place , almost entirely ecclesiastical in [its]3-melchester tone ; a spot where worldly learning and intellectual smartness had no establishment ; where the altruistic feeling that [he]543-a man did possess would perhaps be more highly estimated than a brilliancy which [he]543-a man did not . As it would be necessary that [he]543-a man should continue for a time to work at [his]543-a man trade while reading up Divinity , which [he]543-a man had neglected at [Christminster]180-jude for the ordinary classical grind , what better course for [him]543-a man than to get employment at [the further city]5048-the further city , and pursue this plan of reading ? That [his]543-a man excessive human interest in [the new place]5049-the new place was entirely of [Sue]174-sue 's making , while at the same time [Sue]174-sue was to be regarded even less than formerly as proper to create it , had an ethical contradictoriness to which [he]543-a man was not blind . But that much [he]543-a man conceded to human frailty , and hoped to learn to love [her]174-sue only as [a friend and kinswoman]5050-a friend and kinswoman . [He]543-a man considered that [he]543-a man might so mark out [his]543-a man coming years as to begin [his]543-a man ministry at the age of thirty - an age which much attracted [him]543-a man as being that of [his]543-a man exemplar when [he]543-a man first began to teach in [Galilee]44-galilee . This would allow [him]543-a man plenty of time for deliberate study , and for acquiring capital by [his]543-a man trade to help [his]543-a man aftercourse of keeping the necessary terms at [a theological college]5051-a theological college . Christmas had come and passed , and [Sue]174-sue had gone to [the Melchester Normal School]63-the melchester normal school . The time was just the worst in the year for [Jude]180-jude to get into new employment , and [he]543-a man had written suggesting to [her]174-sue that [he]543-a man should postpone [his]543-a man arrival for a month or so , till the days had lengthened . [She]174-sue had acquiesced so readily that [he]543-a man wished [he]543-a man had not proposed it - [she]174-sue evidently did not much care about [him]543-a man , though [she]174-sue had never once reproached [him]543-a man for [his]543-a man strange conduct in coming to [her]174-sue that night , and [his]543-a man silent disappearance . Neither had [she]174-sue ever said a word about [her]174-sue relations with [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson . Suddenly , however , quite a passionate letter arrived from [Sue]174-sue . [She]174-sue was quite lonely and miserable , [she]174-sue told [him]543-a man . [She]174-sue hated [the place [she]174-sue was in]5052-the place she was in ; it was worse than [[the ecclesiastical designer]5053-the ecclesiastical designer 's]5054-the ecclesiastical designer 's ; worse than anywhere . [She]174-sue felt utterly friendless ; could [he]543-a man come immediately ? - though when [he]543-a man did come [she]174-sue would only be able to see [him]543-a man at limited times , the rules of the establishment [she]174-sue found [herself]174-sue in being strict to a degree . It was [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson who had advised [her]174-sue to come [there]3887-there , and [she]174-sue wished [she]174-sue had never listened to [him]543-a man . [Phillotson]163-phillotson 's suit was not exactly prospering , evidently ; and [Jude]180-jude felt unreasonably glad . [He]543-a man packed up [his]543-a man things and went to [Melchester]3-melchester with a lighter heart than [he]543-a man had known for months . This being the turning over a new leaf [he]543-a man duly looked about for [a temperance hotel]5056-a temperance hotel , and found [a little establishment of that description in [the street]4748-the street leading from [the station]5059-the station]5057-a little establishment of that description in the street leading from the station . When [he]543-a man had had something to eat [he]543-a man walked out into the dull winter light over [the town bridge]5060-the town bridge , and turned the corner towards [the Close]64-the close . The day was foggy , and standing under the walls of the most graceful architectural pile in [England]65-england [he]543-a man paused and looked up . [The lofty building]5061-the lofty building was visible as far as the roofridge ; above , the dwindling spire rose more and more remotely , till [its]5061-the lofty building apex was quite lost in the mist drifting across [it]5061-the lofty building . The lamps now began to be lighted , and turning to the west front [he]543-a man walked round . [He]543-a man took it as a good omen that numerous blocks of stone were lying about , which signified that [the cathedral]4622-the cathedral was undergoing restoration or repair to a considerable extent . It seemed to [him]543-a man , full of the superstitions of [his]543-a man beliefs , that this was an exercise of forethought on the part of [a ruling Power]5063-a ruling power , that [he]543-a man might find plenty to do in the art [he]543-a man practised while waiting for a call to higher labours . Then a wave of warmth came over [him]543-a man as [he]543-a man thought how near [he]543-a man now stood to [the bright - eyed vivacious girl with the broad forehead and pile of dark hair above it]5064-the bright - eyed vivacious girl with the broad forehead and pile of dark hair above it ; [the girl with the kindling glance]5065-the girl with the kindling glance , daringly soft at times - something like that of [the girls [he]543-a man had seen in engravings from paintings of [the Spanish school]5067-the spanish school]5066-the girls he had seen in engravings from paintings of the spanish school . [She]5065-the girl with the kindling glance was [here]3898-here - actually in [this Close]5069-this close - in [one of [the houses confronting [this very west facade]5072-this very west facade]5071-the houses confronting this very west facade]5070-one of the houses confronting this very west facade . [He]543-a man went down [the broad gravel path]5073-the broad gravel path towards [the building]4677-the building . [It]4677-the building was [an ancient edifice of the fifteenth century]5075-an ancient edifice of the fifteenth century , once [a palace]5076-a palace , now [a training - school]5077-a training - school , with mullioned and transomed windows , and [a courtyard in front shut in from [the road]629-the road by a wall]5078-a courtyard in front shut in from the road by a wall . [Jude]180-jude opened the gate and went up to the door through which , on inquiring for [[his]543-a man cousin]3917-his cousin , [he]543-a man was gingerly admitted to [a waiting - room]5081-a waiting - room , and in a few minutes [she]5065-the girl with the kindling glance came . Though [she]5065-the girl with the kindling glance had been [here]3898-here such a short while , [she]5065-the girl with the kindling glance was not as [he]543-a man had seen [her]5065-the girl with the kindling glance last . All [her]5065-the girl with the kindling glance bounding manner was gone ; [her]5065-the girl with the kindling glance curves of motion had become subdued lines . The screens and subtleties of convention had likewise disappeared . Yet neither was [she]5065-the girl with the kindling glance quite [the woman who had written the letter that summoned [him]543-a man]5083-the woman who had written the letter that summoned him . That had plainly been dashed off in an impulse which second thoughts had somewhat regretted ; thoughts that were possibly of [his]543-a man recent self - disgrace . [Jude]180-jude was quite overcome with emotion . "[1499-you] [You]1499-you do n't - think [me]0-i [a demoralized wretch]1500-a demoralized wretch - for coming to [you]1499-you as [I]0-i was - and going so shamefully , [Sue]174-sue ? " "[174-sue] Oh , [I]0-i have tried not to ! [You]1499-you said enough to let [me]0-i know what had caused it . [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall never have any doubt of [your]1499-you worthiness , [[my]0-i poor [Jude]180-jude]1501-my poor jude ! And [I]0-i am glad [you]1499-you have come ! " [She]174-sue wore a murrey - coloured gown with a little lace collar . It was made quite plain , and hung about [her]174-sue slight figure with clinging gracefulness . [Her]174-sue hair , which formerly [she]174-sue had worn according to the custom of the day was now twisted up tightly , and [she]174-sue had altogether the air of [a woman clipped and pruned by severe discipline , an under - brightness shining through from the depths which that discipline had not yet been able to reach]5084-a woman clipped and pruned by severe discipline , an under - brightness shining through from the depths which that discipline had not yet been able to reach . [She]174-sue had come forward prettily , but [Jude]180-jude felt that [she]174-sue had hardly expected [him]180-jude to kiss [her]174-sue , as [he]180-jude was burning to do , under other colours than those of [cousinship]5085-cousinship . [He]180-jude could not perceive the least sign that [Sue]174-sue regarded [him]180-jude as [a lover]4803-a lover , or ever would do so , now that [she]174-sue knew the worst of [him]180-jude , even if [he]180-jude had the right to behave as [one]810-one ; and this helped on [his]180-jude growing resolve to tell [her]174-sue of [his]180-jude matrimonial entanglement , which [he]180-jude had put off doing from time to time in sheer dread of losing the bliss of [her]174-sue company . [Sue]174-sue came out into [the town]4154-the town with [him]180-jude , and [they]5089-they walked and talked with tongues centred only on the passing moments . [Jude]180-jude said [he]180-jude would like to buy [her]174-sue a little present of some sort , and then [she]174-sue confessed , with something of shame , that [she]174-sue was dreadfully hungry . [They]5089-they were kept on very short allowances in [the college]4625-the college , and a dinner , tea , and supper all in one was the present [she]174-sue most desired in [the world]706-the world . [Jude]180-jude thereupon took [her]174-sue to [an inn]1366-an inn and ordered whatever [the house]504-the house afforded , which was not much . [The place]3987-the place , however , gave [them]5089-they a delightful opportunity for a tete - a - tete , [nobody else]5095-nobody else being in [the room]4227-the room , and [they]5089-they talked freely . [She]174-sue told [him]180-jude about [the school]458-the school as it was at that date , and the rough living , and the mixed character of [[her]174-sue fellow - students]5098-her fellow - students , gathered together from all parts of [the diocese]5099-the diocese , and how [she]174-sue had to get up and work by gas - light in the early morning , with all the bitterness of [a young person to whom restraint was new]5100-a young person to whom restraint was new . To all this [he]180-jude listened ; but it was not what [he]180-jude wanted especially to know - [her]174-sue relations with [Phillotson]163-phillotson . That was what [she]174-sue did not tell . When [they]5089-they had sat and eaten , [Jude]180-jude impulsively placed [his]180-jude hand upon [hers]174-sue ; [she]174-sue looked up and smiled , and took [his]180-jude quite freely into [her]174-sue own little soft one , dividing [his]180-jude fingers and coolly examining them , as if they were the fingers of a glove [she]174-sue was purchasing . "[0-i] [Your]1502-you hands are rather rough , [Jude]180-jude , are n't they ? " [she]174-sue said . "[0-i] Yes . So would [yours]1502-you be if [they]1503-they held a mallet and chisel all day . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't dislike it , [you]1502-you know . [I]0-i think it is noble to see [a man]543-a man 's hands subdued to what [he]543-a man works in ... Well , [I]0-i 'm rather glad [I]0-i came to [this training - school]1505-this training - school , after all . See how independent [I]0-i shall be after the two years ' training ! [I]0-i shall pass pretty high , [I]0-i expect , and [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson will use [his]163-phillotson influence to get [me]0-i a big school . " [She]0-i had touched the subject at last . "[163-phillotson] [I]0-i had a suspicion , a fear , " said [Jude]180-jude , "[163-phillotson] that [he]163-phillotson - cared about [you]1502-you rather warmly , and perhaps wanted to marry [you]1502-you . " "[174-sue] Oh , [Sue]174-sue ! ... But of course it is right - [you]174-sue could n't have done better ! " [He]163-phillotson glanced at [her]174-sue and [their]1510-we eyes met , the reproach in [his]163-phillotson own belying [his]163-phillotson words . Then [he]163-phillotson drew [his]163-phillotson hand quite away from [hers]174-sue , and turned [his]163-phillotson face in estrangement from [her]174-sue to the window . [Sue]174-sue regarded [him]163-phillotson passively without moving . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew [you]1517-you would be angry ! " [she]174-sue said with an air of no emotion whatever . "[1517-you] Very well - [I]0-i am wrong , [I]0-i suppose ! [I]0-i ought not to have let [you]1517-you come to see [me]0-i ! [We]1518-we had better not meet again ; and [we]1518-we 'll only correspond at long intervals , on purely business matters ! " This was just the one thing [he]163-phillotson would not be able to bear , as [she]174-sue probably knew , and it brought [him]163-phillotson round at once . "[1518-we] Oh yes , [we]1518-we will , " [he]163-phillotson said quickly . "[1518-we] [Your]0-i being engaged can make no difference to [me]0-i whatever . What does it matter about what [one]810-one is going to do two years hence ! " [She]0-i was something of a riddle to [him]163-phillotson , and [he]163-phillotson let the subject drift away . "[0-i] That 's the centre of [the town]4154-the town life now . [The cathedral]4622-the cathedral has had its day ! " "[0-i] How modern [you]0-i are ! " "[0-i] So would [you]0-i be if [you]0-i had lived so much in the Middle Ages as [I]0-i have done these last few years ! [The cathedral]4622-the cathedral was a very good place four or five centuries ago ; but it is played out now ... [I]0-i am not modern , either . [I]0-i am more ancient than mediaevalism , if [you]0-i only knew . " [Jude]180-jude looked distressed . "[0-i] There - [I]0-i wo n't say any more of that ! " [she]0-i cried . "[0-i] Only [you]0-i do n't know how bad [I]0-i am , from [your]0-i point of view , or [you]0-i would n't think so much of [me]0-i , or care whether [I]0-i was engaged or not . Now there 's just time for [us]1526-us to walk round the Close , then [I]0-i must go in , or [I]0-i shall be locked out for the night . " [He]180-jude took [her]0-i to the gate and [they]1526-us parted . [Jude]180-jude had a conviction that [his]180-jude unhappy visit to [her]0-i on that sad night had precipitated this marriage engagement , and it did anything but add to [his]180-jude happiness . [Her]0-i reproach had taken that shape , then , and not the shape of words . However , next day [he]180-jude set about seeking employment , which it was not so easy to get as at [Christminster]180-jude , there being , as a rule , less stone - cutting in progress in [this quiet city]5101-this quiet city , and hands being mostly permanent . But [he]180-jude edged [himself]180-jude in by degrees . [His]180-jude first work was some carving at [the cemetery on [the hill]564-the hill]5102-the cemetery on the hill ; and ultimately [he]180-jude became engaged on the labour [he]180-jude most desired - the cathedral repairs , which were very extensive , the whole interior stonework having been overhauled , to be largely replaced by new . It might be a labour of years to get it all done , and [he]180-jude had confidence enough in [his]180-jude own skill with the mallet and chisel to feel that it would be a matter of choice with [himself]180-jude how long [he]180-jude would stay . [The lodgings [he]180-jude took near [the Close Gate]5105-the close gate]5104-the lodgings he took near the close gate would not have disgraced [a curate]5106-a curate , the rent representing a higher percentage on [his]180-jude wages than [mechanics of any sort]5107-mechanics of any sort usually care to pay . [[His]180-jude combined bed and sitting - room]5108-his combined bed and sitting - room was furnished with framed photographs of [the rectories]5109-the rectories and deaneries at which [[his]180-jude landlady]4617-his landlady had lived as [trusted servant]5111-trusted servant in [her]4617-his landlady time , and [the parlour downstairs]5112-the parlour downstairs bore a clock on the mantelpiece inscribed to the effect that it was presented to [the same serious - minded woman]5113-the same serious - minded woman by [[her]4617-his landlady fellow - servants]5114-her fellow - servants on the occasion of [her]4617-his landlady marriage . [Jude]180-jude added to the furniture of [[his]180-jude room]4314-his room by unpacking photographs of the ecclesiastical carvings and monuments that [he]180-jude had executed with [his]180-jude own hands ; and [he]180-jude was deemed a satisfactory acquisition as tenant of [the vacant apartment]5116-the vacant apartment . [He]180-jude found an ample supply of theological books in [the city book - shops]5117-the city book - shops , and with these [his]180-jude studies were recommenced in a different spirit and direction from [his]180-jude former course . [He]180-jude hired a harmonium , set it up in [[his]180-jude lodging]4560-his lodging , and practised chants thereon , single and double . II "[0-i] To - morrow is [our]1527-we grand day , [you]1528-you know . Where shall [we]1527-we go ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have leave from three till nine . " "[180-jude] [Wardour]68-wardour is [Gothic ruins]1531-gothic ruins - and [I]0-i hate Gothic ! " "[0-i] No . Quite otherwise . [We]1527-we 'll go . " [Their]1527-we conversation had run thus some few weeks later , and next morning [they]1527-we prepared to start . Every detail of the outing was a facet reflecting a sparkle to [Jude]180-jude , and [he]180-jude did not venture to meditate on the life of inconsistency [he]180-jude was leading . [His]180-jude [Sue]174-sue 's conduct was one lovely conundrum to [him]180-jude ; [he]180-jude could say no more . There duly came the charm of calling at [the college]4625-the college door for [her]174-sue ; [her]174-sue emergence in a nunlike simplicity of costume that was rather enforced than desired ; the traipsing along to [the station]5059-the station , [the porters]5122-the porters ' "[1527-we] B'your leave ! , " the screaming of [the trains]5123-the trains - everything formed the basis of a beautiful crystallization . [Nobody]4069-nobody stared at [Sue]174-sue , because [she]174-sue was so plainly dressed , which comforted [Jude]180-jude in the thought that only [himself]180-jude knew the charms those habiliments subdued . A matter of ten pounds spent in [a drapery - shop]5125-a drapery - shop , which had no connection with [her]174-sue real life or [[her]174-sue real self]5126-her real self , would have set all [Melchester]3-melchester staring . [The guard of [the train]5128-the train]5127-the guard of the train thought [they]5129-they were [lovers]798-lovers , and put [them]5129-they into [a compartment]5131-a compartment all by [themselves]5129-they . "[1527-we] That 's a good intention wasted ! " said [she]174-sue . [Jude]180-jude did not respond . [He]180-jude thought the remark unnecessarily cruel , and partly untrue . [They]5129-they reached [the park and castle]5132-the park and castle and wandered through [the picture - galleries]5133-the picture - galleries , [Jude]180-jude stopping by preference in front of the devotional pictures by [Del Sarto]281-del sarto , [Guido Reni]282-guido reni , Spagnoletto , [Sassoferrato]283-sassoferrato , [Carlo Dolci]284-carlo dolci , and [others]4093-others . [Sue]174-sue paused patiently beside [him]180-jude , and stole critical looks into [his]180-jude face as , regarding [the Virgins]5135-the virgins , [Holy Families]5136-holy families , and [Saints]1217-saints , it grew reverent and abstracted . When [she]174-sue had thoroughly estimated [him]180-jude at this , [she]174-sue would move on and wait for [him]180-jude before a Lely or [Reynolds]285-reynolds . It was evident that [[her]174-sue cousin]4824-her cousin deeply interested [her]174-sue , as [one]810-one might be interested in [a man puzzling out [his]180-jude way along a labyrinth from which one had [one]810-one 's self]5140-a man puzzling out his way along a labyrinth from which one had one 's self escaped . When [they]5142-they came out a long time still remained to [them]5142-they and [Jude]180-jude proposed that as soon as [they]5142-they had had something to eat [they]5142-they should walk across [the high country]5143-the high country to the north of [their]5142-they present position , and intercept the train of another railway leading back to [Melchester]3-melchester , at [a station about seven miles off]5144-a station about seven miles off . [Sue]174-sue , who was inclined for any adventure that would intensify the sense of [her]174-sue day 's freedom , readily agreed ; and away [they]5142-they went , leaving [the adjoining station]5145-the adjoining station behind [them]5142-they . [It]5146-it was indeed [open country]5147-open country , wide and high . [They]5142-they talked and bounded on , [Jude]180-jude cutting from a little covert a long walking - stick for [Sue]174-sue as tall as [herself]174-sue , with a great crook , which made [her]174-sue look like [a shepherdess]5148-a shepherdess . About half - way on [their]5142-they journey [they]5142-they crossed [a main road]5149-a main road running due east and west - [the old road from [London]7-london to [Land]69-land 's End]5150-the old road from london to land 's end . [They]5142-they paused , and looked up and down [it]5149-a main road for a moment , and remarked upon the desolation which had come over [this once lively thoroughfare]5151-this once lively thoroughfare , while the wind dipped to earth and scooped straws and hay - stems from the ground . [They]5142-they crossed [the road]629-the road and passed on , but during the next half - mile [Sue]174-sue seemed to grow tired , and [Jude]180-jude began to be distressed for [her]174-sue . [They]5142-they had walked a good distance altogether , and if [they]5142-they could not reach [the other station]5153-the other station it would be rather awkward . For a long time there was [no cottage]5154-no cottage visible on [the wide expanse of down and turnip - land]5155-the wide expanse of down and turnip - land ; but presently [they]5142-they came to a sheepfold , and next to [the shepherd]5156-the shepherd , pitching hurdles . [He]180-jude told [them]5142-they that [the only house near]5157-the only house near was [[his]180-jude mother]4570-his mother 's and [his]180-jude , pointing to a little dip ahead from which a faint blue smoke arose , and recommended [them]5142-they to go on and rest there . This [they]5142-they did , and entered [the house]504-the house , admitted by [an old woman without a single tooth]5160-an old woman without a single tooth , to whom [they]5142-they were as civil as [strangers]5161-strangers can be when [their]5142-they only chance of rest and shelter lies in the favour of [the householder]5162-the householder . "[1527-we] [A nice little cottage]1533-a nice little cottage , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[1527-we] Oh , [I]0-i do n't know about the niceness . [I]0-i shall have to thatch it soon , and where the thatch is to come from [I]0-i ca n't tell , for straw do get [that dear]1534-that dear , that ' twill soon be cheaper to cover [[your]1535-you house]1536-your house wi ' chainey plates than thatch . " [They]5142-they sat resting , and [the shepherd]5156-the shepherd came in . "[1537-ee] Do n't ' [ee]1537-ee mind [I]0-i , " [he]5156-the shepherd said with a deprecating wave of the hand ; "[1537-ee] bide here as long as [ye]1535-you will . But mid [you]1535-you be thinking o ' getting back to [Melchester]3-melchester to - night by [train]1538-train ? Because [you]1535-you 'll never do it in [this world]1539-this world , since [you]1535-you do n't know the lie of [the country]4234-the country . ' Tis hard lying , rather , but volk may do worse . " [He]5164-he turned to [Jude]180-jude and asked privately : "[1535-you] Be [you]1535-you [a married couple]1543-a married couple ? " "[1535-you] Hsh - no ! " said [Jude]180-jude . "[1535-you] Oh - [I]0-i meant nothing ba'dy - not [I]0-i ! "[1535-you] [I]0-i rather like this , " said [Sue]174-sue , while [[their]1545-they entertainers]5167-their entertainers were clearing away the dishes . "[0-i] Outside all laws except gravitation and germination . " "[0-i] [You]1535-you only think [you]1535-you like it ; [you]1535-you do n't : [you]1535-you are quite a product of civilization , " said [Jude]180-jude , a recollection of [her]4570-his mother engagement reviving [his]180-jude soreness a little . "[1535-you] Indeed [I]0-i am not , [Jude]180-jude . [I]0-i like reading and all that , but [I]0-i crave to get back to the life of [my]0-i infancy and its freedom . " "[0-i] Do [you]1535-you remember it so well ? [You]1535-you seem to [me]0-i to have nothing unconventional at all about [you]1535-you . " "[1535-you] Oh , have n't [I]0-i ! [You]1535-you do n't know what 's inside [me]0-i . " "[1535-you] What ? " "[286-the ishmaelite] [The Ishmaelite]286-the ishmaelite . " "[286-the ishmaelite] [An urban miss]1547-an urban miss is what [you]1535-you are . " [She]4570-his mother looked severe disagreement , and turned away . [The shepherd]5156-the shepherd aroused [them]5169-they the next morning , as [he]5156-the shepherd had said . It was bright and clear , and the four miles to [the train]5128-the train were accomplished pleasantly . When [they]5169-they had reached [Melchester]3-melchester , and walked to [the Close]64-the close , and the gables of [the old building in which [she]4570-his mother was again to be immured]5171-the old building in which she was again to be immured rose before [Sue]174-sue 's eyes , [she]4570-his mother looked a little scared . "[1547-an urban miss] [I]0-i expect [I]0-i shall catch it ! " [she]4570-his mother murmured . [They]5169-they rang the great bell and waited . "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i bought something for [you]1535-you , which [I]0-i had nearly forgotten , " [she]4570-his mother said quickly , searching [her]4570-his mother pocket . "[0-i] It is a new little photograph of [me]0-i . Would [you]1535-you like it ? " "[1535-you] WOULD [I]0-i ! " [He]1535-you took it gladly , and [the porter]5172-the porter came . There seemed to be an ominous glance on [his]1535-you face when [he]1535-you opened the gate . [She]4570-his mother passed in , looking back at [Jude]180-jude , and waving [her]4570-his mother hand . [III]174-sue [The seventy young women , of ages varying in the main from nineteen to one - and - twenty]5173-the seventy young women , of ages varying in the main from nineteen to one - and - twenty , though [several]1428-several were older , who at this date filled [the species of nunnery known as [the Training - School at [Melchester]3-melchester]70-the training - school at melchester]5175-the species of nunnery known as the training - school at melchester , formed a very mixed community , which included [the daughters of [mechanics]5177-mechanics]5176-the daughters of mechanics , [curates]5178-curates , [surgeons]5179-surgeons , [shopkeepers]5180-shopkeepers , [farmers]4018-farmers , [dairy - men]5182-dairy - men , [soldiers]1406-soldiers , [sailors]5184-sailors , and [villagers]5185-villagers . [They]5173-the seventy young women , of ages varying in the main from nineteen to one - and - twenty sat in [the large school - room of [the establishment]5187-the establishment]5186-the large school - room of the establishment on the evening previously described , and word was passed round that [Sue Bridehead]174-sue had not come in at closing - time . "[1548-her] [She]1548-her went out with [[her]1548-her young man]1549-her young man , " said [a second - year 's student , who knew about [young men]859-young men]5188-a second - year 's student , who knew about young men . "[1548-her] And [Miss Traceley]287-miss traceley saw [her]1548-her at [the station]5059-the station with [him]1549-her young man . " "[1548-her] [She]1548-her said [he]1549-her young man was [[her]1548-her cousin]4824-her cousin , " observed [a youthful new girl]5190-a youthful new girl . "[1548-her] That excuse has been made a little too often in [this school]1552-this school to be effectual in saving [our]1553-our souls , " said [the head girl of the year]5191-the head girl of the year , drily . The fact was that , only twelve months before , there had occurred a lamentable seduction of [one of the pupils who had made the same statement in order to gain meetings with [[her]1548-her lover]4279-her lover]5192-one of the pupils who had made the same statement in order to gain meetings with her lover . The affair had created a scandal , and the management had consequently been rough on [cousins]4662-cousins ever since . At nine o'clock the names were called , [Sue]174-sue 's being pronounced three times sonorously by [Miss Traceley]287-miss traceley without eliciting an answer . At a quarter past nine [the seventy]5195-the seventy stood up to sing the "[1548-her] Evening Hymn , " and then knelt down to prayers . After prayers [they]5195-the seventy went in to supper , and [every girl]5196-every girl 's thought was , Where is [Sue Bridehead]174-sue ? [Some of [the students]5198-the students , who had seen [Jude]180-jude from the window]5197-some of the students , who had seen jude from the window , felt that [they]5197-some of the students , who had seen jude from the window would not mind risking [her]174-sue punishment for the pleasure of being kissed by [such a kindly - faced young men]5199-such a kindly - faced young men . [Hardly one among [them]5197-some of the students , who had seen jude from the window]5200-hardly one among them believed in the cousinship . Half an hour later [they]5195-the seventy all lay in [[their]5195-the seventy cubicles]5201-their cubicles , [their]5195-the seventy tender feminine faces upturned to the flaring gas - jets which at intervals stretched down [the long dormitories]5202-the long dormitories , every face bearing the legend "[288-the weaker] [The Weaker]288-the weaker " upon it , as the penalty of the sex wherein [they]5195-the seventy were moulded , which by no possible exertion of [their]5195-the seventy willing hearts and abilities could be made strong while the inexorable laws of nature remain what [they]5195-the seventy are . [They]5195-the seventy formed a pretty , suggestive , pathetic sight , of whose pathos and beauty [they]5195-the seventy were [themselves]5195-the seventy unconscious , and would not discover till , amid the storms and strains of after - years , with [their]5195-the seventy injustice , loneliness , child - bearing , and bereavement , [their]5195-the seventy minds would revert to this experience as to something which had been allowed to slip past [them]5195-the seventy insufficiently regarded . [One of [the mistresses]5204-the mistresses]5203-one of the mistresses came in to turn out the lights , and before doing so gave a final glance at [[Sue]174-sue 's cot]5205-sue 's cot , which remained empty , and at [her]174-sue little dressing - table at the foot , which , like all the rest , was ornamented with various girlish trifles , framed photographs being not the least conspicuous among [them]5195-the seventy . [Sue]174-sue 's table had a moderate show , [two men in [their]5206-two men in their filigree and velvet frames standing together beside her looking - glass filigree and velvet frames standing together beside [her]174-sue looking - glass]5206-two men in their filigree and velvet frames standing together beside her looking - glass . " "[1557-the middle - aged man] One - [the middle - aged man]1557-the middle - aged man , " said [a student in the next bed]5208-a student in the next bed - "[1557-the middle - aged man] is [the schoolmaster [she]1555-she served under]1558-the schoolmaster she served under - [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson . " "[1455-the undergraduate] Quite . [He]4340-the other was [a young man with a black beard]1563-a young man with a black beard . " The lights were promptly extinguished , and till [they]5209-they fell asleep [the girls]1514-the girls indulged in conjectures about [Sue]174-sue , and wondered what games [she]174-sue had carried on in [London]7-london and at [Christminster]180-jude before [she]174-sue came [here]3898-here , some of [the more restless ones]5212-the more restless ones getting out of bed and looking from the mullioned windows at [the vast west front of [the cathedral]4622-the cathedral opposite]5213-the vast west front of the cathedral opposite , and the spire rising behind [it]4622-the cathedral . When [they]5209-they awoke the next morning [they]5209-they glanced into [[Sue]174-sue 's nook]5215-sue 's nook , to find [it]5215-sue 's nook still without [a tenant]5216-a tenant . After the early lessons by gas - light , in half - toilet , and when [they]5209-they had come up to dress for breakfast , the bell of the entrance gate was heard to ring loudly . [The mistress of [the dormitory]5218-the dormitory]5217-the mistress of the dormitory went away , and presently came back to say that [the principal]5219-the principal 's orders were that [nobody]4069-nobody was to speak to [Bridehead]174-sue without permission . When , accordingly , [Sue]174-sue came into [the dormitory]5218-the dormitory to hastily tidy [herself]174-sue , looking flushed and tired , [she]174-sue went to [[her]174-sue cubicle]5222-her cubicle in silence , [none of [them]5209-they]5223-none of them coming out to greet [her]174-sue or to make inquiry . When [they]5209-they had gone [downstairs]4245-downstairs [they]5209-they found that [she]174-sue did not follow [them]5209-they into [the dining - hall]5225-the dining - hall to breakfast , and [they]5209-they then learnt that [she]174-sue had been severely reprimanded , and ordered to [a solitary room]5226-a solitary room for a week , there to be confined , and take [her]174-sue meals , and do all [her]174-sue reading . At this [the seventy]5195-the seventy murmured , the sentence being , [they]5195-the seventy thought , too severe . A round robin was prepared and sent in to [the principal]5219-the principal , asking for a remission of [Sue]174-sue 's punishment . No notice was taken . Towards evening , when [the geography mistress]5229-the geography mistress began dictating [her]5229-the geography mistress subject , [the girls in the class]5230-the girls in the class sat with folded arms . "[1563-a young man with a black beard] [You]1564-you mean that [you]1564-you are not going to work ? " said [the mistress]5207-the mistress at last . "[1563-a young man with a black beard] [I]0-i may as well tell [you]1564-you that it has been ascertained that [the young man]4185-the young man [Bridehead]174-sue stayed out with was not [[her]174-sue cousin]4824-her cousin , for the very good reason that [she]174-sue has [no such relative]1567-no such relative . [We]1568-we have written to [Christminster]180-jude to ascertain . " "[1568-we] [We]1568-we are willing to take [her]174-sue word , " said [the head girl]5232-the head girl . "[1568-we] [This young man]1569-this young man was discharged from [his]1569-this young man work at [Christminster]180-jude for drunkenness and blasphemy in [public - houses]1570-public - houses , and [he]1569-this young man has come [here]3898-here to live , entirely to be near [her]174-sue . " However , [they]1568-we remained stolid and motionless , and [the mistress]5207-the mistress left [the room]4227-the room to inquire from [[her]5207-the mistress superiors]5235-her superiors what was to be done . Presently , towards dusk , [the pupils]5236-the pupils , as [they]5236-the pupils sat , heard exclamations from [[the first - year]5237-the first - year 's girls]5238-the first - year 's girls in [an adjoining classroom]5239-an adjoining classroom , and [one]810-one rushed in to say that [Sue Bridehead]174-sue had got out of the back window of [the room in which [she]174-sue had been confined]5241-the room in which she had been confined , escaped in the dark across [the lawn]5242-the lawn , and disappeared . How [she]174-sue had managed to get out of [the garden]521-the garden [nobody]4069-nobody could tell , as [it]521-the garden was bounded by [the river at the bottom]5245-the river at the bottom , and the side door was locked . [They]5236-the pupils went and looked at [the empty room]5246-the empty room , the casement between the middle mullions of which stood open . [The lawn]5242-the lawn was again searched with a lantern , every bush and shrub being examined , but [she]174-sue was nowhere hidden . Then [the porter of the front gate]5248-the porter of the front gate was interrogated , and on reflection [he]5248-the porter of the front gate said that [he]5248-the porter of the front gate remembered hearing a sort of splashing in [the stream]4177-the stream at the back , but [he]5248-the porter of the front gate had taken no notice , thinking some ducks had come down [the river]5250-the river from above . "[1572-she] [She]1572-she must have walked through [the river]5250-the river ! " said [a mistress]5251-a mistress . "[1572-she] Or drownded [herself]1572-she , " said [the porter]5172-the porter . The mind of [the matron]5253-the matron was horrified - not so much at the possible death of [Sue]174-sue as at the possible half - column detailing that event in all the newspapers , which , added to the scandal of the year before , would give [the college]4625-the college an unenviable notoriety for many months to come . More lanterns were procured , and [the river]5250-the river examined ; and then , at last , on the opposite shore , which was open to [the fields]5256-the fields , some little boot - tracks were discerned in the mud , which left no doubt that [the too excitable girl]5257-the too excitable girl had waded through a depth of water reaching nearly to [her]174-sue shoulders - for this was [the chief river of [the county]4369-the county]5258-the chief river of the county , and was mentioned in all the geography books with respect . As [Sue]174-sue had not brought disgrace upon [the school]458-the school by drowning [herself]174-sue , [the matron]5253-the matron began to speak superciliously of [her]174-sue , and to express gladness that [she]174-sue was gone . On the self - same evening [Jude]180-jude sat in [[his]180-jude lodgings]4578-his lodgings by [the Close Gate]71-the close gate . Often at this hour after dusk [he]180-jude would enter [the silent Close]5263-the silent close , and stand opposite [the house that contained [Sue]174-sue]5264-the house that contained sue , and watch the shadows of [the girls]1514-the girls ' heads passing to and fro upon the blinds , and wish [he]180-jude had nothing else to do but to sit reading and learning all day what many of [the thoughtless inmates]5266-the thoughtless inmates despised . But to - night , having finished tea and brushed [himself]180-jude up , [he]180-jude was deep in the perusal of the Twenty - ninth Volume of [[Pusey]280-pusey 's Library of [the Fathers]749-the fathers]72-pusey 's library of the fathers , a set of books which [he]180-jude had purchased of [a second - hand dealer]5268-a second - hand dealer at a price that seemed to [him]180-jude to be one of miraculous cheapness for that invaluable work . [He]180-jude fancied [he]180-jude heard something rattle lightly against [his]180-jude window ; then [he]180-jude heard it again . Certainly [somebody]4067-somebody had thrown gravel . [He]180-jude rose and gently lifted the sash . "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude ! " from below . "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue ! " "[174-sue] Yes - it is ! Can [I]0-i come up without being seen ? " "[0-i] Oh yes ! " "[0-i] Then do n't come down . Shut the window . " [Jude]180-jude waited , knowing that [she]174-sue could enter easily enough , the front door being opened merely by a knob which [anybody]4107-anybody could turn , as in [most old country towns]5271-most old country towns . [He]180-jude palpitated at the thought that [she]174-sue had fled to [him]180-jude in [her]174-sue trouble as [he]180-jude had fled to [her]174-sue in [his]180-jude . What counterparts [they]5272-they were ! [He]180-jude unlatched the door of [[his]180-jude room]4314-his room , heard a stealthy rustle on the dark stairs , and in a moment [she]174-sue appeared in the light of [his]180-jude lamp . [He]180-jude went up to seize [her]174-sue hand , and found [she]174-sue was clammy as [a marine deity]5274-a marine deity , and that [her]174-sue clothes clung to [her]174-sue like the robes upon the figures in the Parthenon frieze . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm so cold ! " [she]174-sue said through [her]174-sue chattering teeth . "[0-i] Can [I]0-i come by [your]0-i fire , [Jude]180-jude ? " [She]174-sue crossed to [his]180-jude little grate and very little fire , but as the water dripped from [her]174-sue as [she]174-sue moved , the idea of drying [herself]174-sue was absurd . "[180-jude] Whatever have [you]0-i done , [darling]841-darling ? " [he]180-jude asked , with alarm , the tender epithet slipping out unawares . "[0-i] Walked through [the largest river in [the county]4369-the county]1575-the largest river in the county - that 's what [I]0-i 've done ! [They]1577-they locked [me]0-i up for being out with [you]0-i ; and it seemed so unjust that [I]0-i could n't bear it , so [I]0-i got out of the window and escaped across [the stream]4177-the stream ! " [She]0-i had begun the explanation in [her]0-i usual slightly independent tones , but before [she]0-i had finished the thin pink lips trembled , and [she]0-i could hardly refrain from crying . "[0-i] [Dear Sue]289-sue ! " [he]5275-he said . "[0-i] [You]289-sue must take off all [your]289-sue things ! And let [me]0-i see - [you]289-sue must borrow some from [the landlady]1579-the landlady . [I]0-i 'll ask [her]1579-the landlady . " "[0-i] No , no ! Do n't let [her]1579-the landlady know , for [God]177-god 's sake ! [We]1580-we are so near [the school]458-the school that [they]1582-they 'll come after [me]0-i ! " "[1582-they] Then [you]289-sue must put on [mine]0-i . [You]289-sue do n't mind ? " "[289-sue] Oh no . " "[289-sue] [My]0-i Sunday suit , [you]289-sue know . It is close here . " In fact , everything was close and handy in [[Jude]180-jude 's single chamber]5276-jude 's single chamber , because there was not room for it to be otherwise . [He]180-jude opened a drawer , took out [his]180-jude best dark suit , and giving the garments a shake , said , "[289-sue] Now , how long shall [I]0-i give [you]289-sue ? " "[0-i] Ten minutes . " [Jude]180-jude left [the room]4227-the room and went into [the street]4748-the street , where [he]180-jude walked up and down . A clock struck half - past seven , and [he]180-jude returned . Sitting in [his]180-jude only arm - chair [he]180-jude saw a slim and fragile being masquerading as [himself]180-jude on a Sunday , so pathetic in [her]0-i defencelessness that [his]180-jude heart felt big with the sense of it . On two other chairs before the fire were [her]0-i wet garments . [She]0-i blushed as [he]180-jude sat down beside [her]0-i , but only for a moment . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose , [Jude]180-jude , it is odd that [you]180-jude should see [me]0-i like this and all [my]0-i things hanging there ? Yet what nonsense ! They are only [a woman]4193-a woman 's clothes - sexless cloth and linen ... [I]0-i wish [I]0-i did n't feel so ill and sick ! Will [you]180-jude dry [my]0-i clothes now ? Please do , [Jude]180-jude , and [I]0-i 'll get a lodging by and by . It is not late yet . " "[180-jude] No , [you]180-jude sha n't , if [you]180-jude are ill . [You]180-jude must stay [here]3898-here . Dear , dear [Sue]289-sue , what can [I]0-i get for [you]289-sue ? " "[289-sue] [I]0-i do n't know ! [I]0-i ca n't help shivering . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could get warm . " [Jude]180-jude put on [her]289-sue [his]180-jude great - coat in addition , and then ran out to [the nearest public - house]5279-the nearest public - house , whence [he]180-jude returned with a little bottle in [his]180-jude hand . "[0-i] Here 's six of best brandy , " [he]180-jude said . "[0-i] Now [you]289-sue drink it , [dear]795-dear ; all of it . " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't out of the bottle , can [I]0-i ? " [Jude]180-jude fetched the glass from the dressing - table , and administered the spirit in some water . [She]289-sue gasped a little , but gulped it down , and lay back in the armchair . [She]289-sue then began to relate circumstantially [her]289-sue experiences since [they]5280-they had parted ; but in the middle of [her]289-sue story [her]289-sue voice faltered , [her]289-sue head nodded , and [she]289-sue ceased . [She]289-sue was in a sound sleep . [Jude]180-jude , dying of anxiety lest [she]289-sue should have caught a chill which might permanently injure [her]289-sue , was glad to hear the regular breathing . [He]180-jude softly went nearer to [her]289-sue , and observed that a warm flush now rosed [her]289-sue hitherto blue cheeks , and felt that [her]289-sue hanging hand was no longer cold . Then [he]180-jude stood with [his]180-jude back to the fire regarding [her]289-sue , and saw in [her]289-sue almost a divinity . [IV Jude]188-jude 's reverie was interrupted by the creak of footsteps ascending the stairs . [He]180-jude whisked [Sue]289-sue 's clothing from the chair where it was drying , thrust it under the bed , and sat down to [his]180-jude book . [Somebody]4067-somebody knocked and opened the door immediately . It was [the landlady]1579-the landlady . "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i did n't know whether [you]0-i was in or not , [Mr. Fawley]180-jude . [I]0-i wanted to know if [you]0-i would require supper . [I]0-i see [you]0-i 've [a young gentleman]1586-a young gentleman - " "[1586-a young gentleman] Yes , [ma'am]936-ma'am . But [I]0-i think [I]0-i wo n't come down to - night . Will [you]0-i bring supper up on a tray , and [I]0-i 'll have a cup of tea as well . " It was [Jude]180-jude 's custom to go [downstairs]4245-downstairs to [the kitchen]5284-the kitchen , and eat [his]180-jude meals with [the family]3948-the family , to save trouble . [[His]180-jude landlady]4617-his landlady brought up the supper , however , on this occasion , and [he]180-jude took it from [her]4617-his landlady at the door . When [she]4617-his landlady had descended [he]180-jude set the teapot on the hob , and drew out [Sue]289-sue 's clothes anew ; but they were far from dry . A thick woollen gown , [he]180-jude found , held a deal of water . So [he]180-jude hung them up again , and enlarged [his]180-jude fire and mused as the steam from the garments went up the chimney . Suddenly [she]4617-his landlady said , "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude ! " "[180-jude] Yes . All right . How do [you]180-jude feel now ? " "[180-jude] Better . Quite well . Why , [I]0-i fell asleep , did n't [I]0-i ? What time is it ? Not late surely ? " "[0-i] It is past ten . " "[0-i] Is it really ? What SHALL [I]0-i do ! " [she]4617-his landlady said , starting up . "[0-i] Stay where [you]180-jude are . " "[0-i] Yes ; that 's what [I]0-i want to do . But [I]0-i do n't know what [they]1588-they would say ! And what will [you]180-jude do ? " "[180-jude] [I]0-i am going to sit here by the fire all night , and read . To - morrow is Sunday , and [I]0-i have n't to go out anywhere . Perhaps [you]180-jude will be saved a severe illness by resting there . Do n't be frightened . [I]0-i 'm all right . Look here , what [I]0-i have got for [you]180-jude . Some supper . " When [she]4617-his landlady had sat upright [she]4617-his landlady breathed plaintively and said , "[0-i] [I]0-i do feel rather weak still . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was well ; and [I]0-i ought not to be [here]3898-here , ought [I]0-i ? " But the supper fortified [her]4617-his landlady somewhat , and when [she]4617-his landlady had had some tea and had lain back again [she]4617-his landlady was bright and cheerful . The tea must have been green , or too long drawn , for [she]4617-his landlady seemed preternaturally wakeful afterwards , though [Jude]180-jude , who had not taken any , began to feel heavy ; till [her]4617-his landlady conversation fixed [his]180-jude attention . "[1590-you] [You]1590-you called [me]0-i [a creature of civilization]1591-a creature of civilization , or something , did n't [you]1590-you ? " [she]4617-his landlady said , breaking a silence . "[1590-you] It was very odd [you]1590-you should have done that . " "[1590-you] Why ? " "[1590-you] Well , because it is provokingly wrong . [I]0-i am [a sort of negation of it]1592-a sort of negation of it . " "[0-i] [You]1590-you are very philosophical . ' A negation ' is profound talking . " "[0-i] Is it ? Do [I]0-i strike [you]1590-you as being learned ? " [she]4617-his landlady asked , with a touch of raillery . "[0-i] No - not learned . Only [you]1590-you do n't talk quite like [a girl]1593-a girl - well , [a girl who has had no advantages]1594-a girl who has had no advantages . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have had advantages . [I]0-i do n't know Latin and Greek , though [I]0-i know the grammars of those tongues . But [I]0-i know most of the Greek and Latin classics through translations , and other books too . [I]0-i read [Lempriere]290-lempriere , [Catullus]291-catullus , Martial , [Juvenal]292-juvenal , [Lucian]293-lucian , [Beaumont]294-beaumont and [Fletcher]295-fletcher , Boccaccio , [Scarron]296-scarron , [De Brantome]297-de brantome , [Sterne]298-sterne , [De Foe]299-de foe , [Smollett]300-smollett , [Fielding]301-fielding , Shakespeare , the Bible , and other such ; and found that all interest in the unwholesome part of those books ended with its mystery . [VI Meanwhile]180-jude [a middle - aged man]5348-a middle - aged man was dreaming a dream of great beauty concerning [the writer of the above letter]5349-the writer of the above letter . [He]5348-a middle - aged man was [Richard Phillotson]258-phillotson , who had recently removed from [the mixed village school at [Lumsdon]46-lumsdon near [Christminster]180-jude]5350-the mixed village school at lumsdon near christminster , to undertake [a large boys ' school]5351-a large boys ' school in [[his]5348-a middle - aged man native town of [Shaston]4-shaston]5352-his native town of shaston , which stood on [a hill sixty miles to the south - west]5353-a hill sixty miles to the south - west as the crow flies . A glance at [the place]3987-the place and [its]3987-the place accessories was almost enough to reveal that [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's plans and dreams so long indulged in had been abandoned for some new dream with which neither [the Church]4809-the church nor literature had much in common . Essentially [an unpractical man]5357-an unpractical man , [he]409-the schoolmaster was now bent on making and saving money for a practical purpose - that of keeping [a wife]940-a wife , who , if [she]940-a wife chose , might conduct [one of [[the girls]1514-the girls ' schools adjoining [his]409-the schoolmaster own]5361-the girls ' schools adjoining his own]5359-one of the girls ' schools adjoining his own ; for which purpose [he]409-the schoolmaster had advised [her]940-a wife to go into training , since [she]940-a wife would not marry [him]409-the schoolmaster offhand . About the time that [Jude]180-jude was removing from [Marygreen]1-marygreen to [Melchester]3-melchester , and entering on adventures at [the latter place]5362-the latter place with [Sue]174-sue , [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster was settling down in [the new school - house at [Shaston]4-shaston]5364-the new school - house at shaston . All the furniture being fixed , the books shelved , and the nails driven , [he]409-the schoolmaster had begun to sit in [[his]409-the schoolmaster parlour]5365-his parlour during the dark winter nights and re - attempt some of [his]409-the schoolmaster old studies - one branch of which had included Roman - Britannic antiquities - an unremunerative labour for [a national school - master]5366-a national school - master but a subject , that , after [his]409-the schoolmaster abandonment of the university scheme , had interested [him]409-the schoolmaster as being a comparatively unworked mine ; practicable to [those who , like [himself]409-the schoolmaster]5367-those who , like himself , had lived in lonely spots where these remains were abundant , and were seen to compel inferences in startling contrast to accepted views on the civilization of that time . A resumption of this investigation was the outward and apparent hobby of [Phillotson]258-phillotson at present - [his]409-the schoolmaster ostensible reason for going alone into [fields where causeways]5368-fields where causeways , [dykes , and tumuli]5369-dykes , and tumuli abounded , or shutting [himself]409-the schoolmaster up in [[his]409-the schoolmaster house]5370-his house with a few urns , tiles , and mosaics [he]409-the schoolmaster had collected , instead of calling round upon [[his]409-the schoolmaster new neighbours]5371-his new neighbours , who for [their]5371-his new neighbours part had showed [themselves]5371-his new neighbours willing enough to be friendly with [him]409-the schoolmaster . But it was not the real , or the whole , reason , after all . Thus on a particular evening in the month , when it had grown quite late - to near midnight , indeed - and the light of [his]409-the schoolmaster lamp , shining from [his]409-the schoolmaster window at a salient angle of [the hill - top town over [infinite miles of valley westward]5373-infinite miles of valley westward]5372-the hill - top town over infinite miles of valley westward , announced as by words a place and [person given over to study]5374-person given over to study , [he]409-the schoolmaster was not exactly studying . [The interior of [the room]4227-the room]5375-the interior of the room - the books , the furniture , [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's loose coat , [his]409-the schoolmaster attitude at the table , even the flickering of the fire , bespoke the same dignified tale of undistracted research - more than creditable to [a man who had had no advantages beyond those of [his]409-the schoolmaster own making]5378-a man who had had no advantages beyond those of his own making . And yet the tale , true enough till latterly , was not true now . What [he]409-the schoolmaster was regarding was not history . They were historic notes , written in a bold womanly hand at [his]409-the schoolmaster dictation some months before , and it was the clerical rendering of word after word that absorbed [him]409-the schoolmaster . [He]409-the schoolmaster presently took from a drawer a carefully tied bundle of letters , few , very few , as correspondence counts nowadays . Each was in its envelope just as it had arrived , and the handwriting was of the same womanly character as the historic notes . [He]409-the schoolmaster unfolded them one by one and read them musingly . At first sight there seemed in these small documents to be absolutely nothing to muse over . They were straightforward , frank letters , signed "[0-i] Sue B - " ; just such ones as would be written during short absences , with no other thought than [their]5379-their speedy destruction , and chiefly concerning books in reading and other experiences of [a training school]5380-a training school , forgotten doubtless by [the writer]5381-the writer with the passing of the day of [their]5379-their inditing . In one of them - quite a recent note - [the young woman]4785-the young woman said that [she]4785-the young woman had received [his]409-the schoolmaster considerate letter , and that it was honourable and generous of [him]409-the schoolmaster to say [he]409-the schoolmaster would not come to see [her]4785-the young woman oftener than [she]4785-the young woman desired [the school]458-the school being such an awkward place for [callers]5384-callers , and because of [her]4785-the young woman strong wish that [her]4785-the young woman engagement to [him]409-the schoolmaster should not be known , which it would infallibly be if [he]409-the schoolmaster visited [her]4785-the young woman often . Over these phrases [the school - master]508-the school - master pored . What precise shade of satisfaction was to be gathered from [a woman]4193-a woman 's gratitude that [the man who loved [her]4193-a woman had not been often to see [her]4193-a woman]5387-the man who loved her had not been often to see her ? The problem occupied [him]409-the schoolmaster , distracted [him]409-the schoolmaster . [He]409-the schoolmaster opened another drawer , and found therein an envelope , from which [he]409-the schoolmaster drew a photograph of [Sue]174-sue as [a child]781-a child , long before [he]409-the schoolmaster had known [her]174-sue , standing under trellis - work with a little basket in [her]174-sue hand . There was another of [her]174-sue as [a young woman]5389-a young woman , [her]174-sue dark eyes and hair making a very distinct and attractive picture of [her]174-sue , which just disclosed , too , the thoughtfulness that lay behind [her]174-sue lighter moods . It was a duplicate of the one [she]174-sue had given [Jude]180-jude , and would have given to [any man]5390-any man . [Phillotson]258-phillotson brought it half - way to [his]409-the schoolmaster lips , but withdrew it in doubt at [her]174-sue perplexing phrases : ultimately kissing the dead pasteboard with all the passionateness , and more than all the devotion , of [a young man of eighteen]5391-a young man of eighteen . [The schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's was an unhealthy - looking , old - fashioned face , rendered more old - fashioned by [his]409-the schoolmaster style of shaving . A certain gentlemanliness had been imparted to it by nature , suggesting an inherent wish to do rightly by all . [His]409-the schoolmaster speech was a little slow , but [his]409-the schoolmaster tones were sincere enough to make [his]409-the schoolmaster hesitation no defect . [His]409-the schoolmaster greying hair was curly , and radiated from a point in the middle of [his]409-the schoolmaster crown . There were four lines across [his]409-the schoolmaster forehead , and [he]409-the schoolmaster only wore spectacles when reading at night . It was almost certainly a renunciation forced upon [him]409-the schoolmaster by [his]409-the schoolmaster academic purpose , rather than a distaste for [women]3879-women , which had hitherto kept [him]409-the schoolmaster from closing with one of the sex in matrimony . Such silent proceedings as those of this evening were repeated many and oft times when [he]409-the schoolmaster was not under the eye of [the boys]1513-the boys , whose quick and penetrating regard would frequently become almost intolerable to [the self - conscious master]5395-the self - conscious master in [his]409-the schoolmaster present anxious care for [Sue]174-sue , making [him]409-the schoolmaster , in the grey hours of morning , dread to meet anew the gimlet glances , lest [they]1513-the boys should read what the dream within [him]409-the schoolmaster was . [He]409-the schoolmaster had honourably acquiesced in [Sue]174-sue 's announced wish that [he]409-the schoolmaster was not often to visit [her]174-sue at [the training school]5396-the training school ; but at length , [his]409-the schoolmaster patience being sorely tried , [he]409-the schoolmaster set out one Saturday afternoon to pay [her]174-sue an unexpected call . There the news of [her]174-sue departure - expulsion as it might almost have been considered - was flashed upon [him]409-the schoolmaster without warning or mitigation as [he]409-the schoolmaster stood at the door expecting in a few minutes to behold [her]174-sue face ; and when [he]409-the schoolmaster turned away [he]409-the schoolmaster could hardly see [the road before [him]409-the schoolmaster]5397-the road before him . [Sue]174-sue had , in fact , never written a line to [[her]174-sue suitor]5398-her suitor on the subject , although it was fourteen days old . A short reflection told [him]409-the schoolmaster that this proved nothing , a natural delicacy being as ample a reason for silence as any degree of blameworthiness . [They]5399-they had informed [him]409-the schoolmaster at [the school where [she]174-sue was living]5400-the school where she was living , and having no immediate anxiety about [her]174-sue comfort [his]409-the schoolmaster thoughts took the direction of a burning indignation against [the training school committee]5401-the training school committee . In [his]409-the schoolmaster bewilderment [Phillotson]258-phillotson entered [the adjacent cathedral]5402-the adjacent cathedral , just now in a direly dismantled state by reason of the repairs . [He]409-the schoolmaster sat down on a block of freestone , regardless of the dusty imprint it made on [his]409-the schoolmaster breeches ; and [his]409-the schoolmaster listless eyes following the movements of [the workmen]636-the workmen [he]409-the schoolmaster presently became aware that [the reputed culprit]5404-the reputed culprit , [[Sue]174-sue 's lover]5405-sue 's lover [Jude]180-jude , was one amongst [them]636-the workmen . [Jude]180-jude had never spoken to [[his]180-jude former hero]5406-his former hero since the meeting by [the model of [Jerusalem]50-jerusalem]5407-the model of jerusalem . Having inadvertently witnessed [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's tentative courtship of [Sue]174-sue in [the lane]493-the lane there had grown up in [the younger man]5409-the younger man 's mind a curious dislike to think of [the elder]5410-the elder , to meet [him]409-the schoolmaster , to communicate in any way with [him]409-the schoolmaster ; and since [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's success in obtaining at least [her]174-sue promise had become known to [Jude]180-jude , [he]180-jude had frankly recognized that [he]180-jude did not wish to see or hear of [[his]180-jude senior]5411-his senior any more , learn anything of [his]180-jude pursuits , or even imagine again what excellencies might appertain to [his]180-jude character . On this very day of [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's visit [Jude]180-jude was expecting [Sue]174-sue , as [she]174-sue had promised ; and when therefore [he]180-jude saw [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster in [the nave of [the building]4677-the building]5414-the nave of the building , saw , moreover , that [he]409-the schoolmaster was coming to speak to [him]409-the schoolmaster , [he]180-jude felt no little embarrassment ; which [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's own embarrassment prevented [his]180-jude observing . [Jude]180-jude joined [him]180-jude , and [they]5416-they both withdrew from [the other workmen]5417-the other workmen to the spot where [Phillotson]258-phillotson had been sitting . [Jude]180-jude offered [him]180-jude a piece of sackcloth for a cushion , and told [him]180-jude it was dangerous to sit on the bare block . "[0-i] Yes ; yes , " said [Phillotson]258-phillotson abstractedly , as [he]180-jude reseated [himself]180-jude , [his]180-jude eyes resting on the ground as if [he]180-jude were trying to remember where [he]180-jude was . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't keep [you]0-i long . It was merely that [I]0-i have heard that [you]0-i have seen [[my]0-i little friend]1724-my little friend [Sue]174-sue recently . "[0-i] About [her]174-sue escaping from [the training school]5396-the training school , and [her]174-sue coming to [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] Well " - [Jude]180-jude for a moment felt an unprincipled and fiendish wish to annihilate [[his]180-jude rival]5341-his rival at all cost . By the exercise of that treachery which love for [the same woman]5419-the same woman renders possible to [men the most honourable in every other relation of life]5420-men the most honourable in every other relation of life , [he]180-jude could send off [Phillotson]258-phillotson in agony and defeat by saying that the scandal was true , and that [Sue]174-sue had irretrievably committed [herself]174-sue with [him]180-jude . But [his]180-jude action did not respond for a moment to [his]180-jude animal instinct ; and what [he]180-jude said was , "[0-i] [I]0-i am glad of [your]0-i kindness in coming to talk plainly to [me]0-i about it . [You]0-i know what [they]1726-they say ? - that [I]0-i ought to marry [her]1727-her . " "[1726-they] What ! " "[1726-they] And [I]0-i wish with all [my]0-i soul [I]0-i could ! " [Phillotson]258-phillotson trembled , and [his]180-jude naturally pale face acquired a corpselike sharpness in its lines . "[0-i] [I]0-i had no idea that it was of this nature ! God forbid ! " "[0-i] No , no ! " said [Jude]180-jude aghast . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i understood ? " What [he]180-jude had really meant was simply that [he]180-jude loved [her]1727-her . "[0-i] But - since this painful matter has been opened up - what really happened ? " asked [Phillotson]258-phillotson , with the firmness of [a man who felt that a sharp smart now was better than a long agony of suspense hereafter]5421-a man who felt that a sharp smart now was better than a long agony of suspense hereafter . "[0-i] Cases arise , and this is one , when even ungenerous questions must be put to make false assumptions impossible , and to kill scandal . " [Jude]180-jude explained readily ; giving the whole series of adventures , including the night at [the shepherd 's]5422-the shepherd 's , [her]1727-her wet arrival at [[his]180-jude lodging]4560-his lodging , [her]1727-her indisposition from [her]1727-her immersion , [their]5424-their vigil of discussion , and [his]180-jude seeing [her]1727-her off next morning . " "[0-i] It is , " said [Jude]180-jude solemnly . "[0-i] Absolutely . So help [me]0-i [God]177-god ! " [The schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster rose . This visit took place about eleven o'clock in the morning ; but no [Sue]174-sue appeared .
