[VII]305-arabella Tidings from [Sue]174-sue a day or two after passed across [Jude]180-jude like a withering blast . Before reading the letter [he]180-jude was led to suspect that its contents were of a somewhat serious kind by catching sight of the signature - which was in [her]1761-my great - aunt full name , never used in [her]1761-my great - aunt correspondence with [him]180-jude since [her]1761-my great - aunt first note : [[MY]3941-my father DEAR]772-my dear [JUDE]180-jude , - [I]3941-my father have something to tell [you]180-jude which perhaps [you]180-jude will not be surprised to hear , though certainly it may strike [you]180-jude as being accelerated as [the railway companies]5454-the railway companies say of [[their]5454-the railway companies trains]5455-their trains . [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson and [I]3941-my father are to be married quite soon - in three or four weeks . [We]5456-we had intended , as [you]180-jude know , to wait till [I]3941-my father had gone through [my]3941-my father course of training and obtained [my]3941-my father certificate , so as to assist [him]180-jude , if necessary , in the teaching . But [he]180-jude generously says [he]180-jude does not see any object in waiting , now [I]3941-my father am not at [the training school]5396-the training school . It is so good of [him]180-jude , because the awkwardness of [my]3941-my father situation has really come about by [my]3941-my father fault in getting expelled . Wish [me]3941-my father joy . Remember [I]3941-my father say [you]180-jude are to , and [you]180-jude must n't refuse ! - [[Your]180-jude affectionate cousin]5458-your affectionate cousin , [SUSANNA FLORENCE MARY BRIDEHEAD]174-sue . [Jude]180-jude staggered under the news ; could eat no breakfast ; and kept on drinking tea because [his]180-jude mouth was so dry . Then presently [he]180-jude went back to [his]180-jude work and laughed the usual bitter laugh of [a man so confronted . Everything]5459-a man so confronted . everything seemed turning to satire . And yet , what could [the poor girl]5460-the poor girl do ? [he]180-jude asked [himself]180-jude : and felt worse than shedding tears . "[3941-my father] O [Susanna Florence Mary]174-sue ! " [he]180-jude said as [he]180-jude worked . "[174-sue] [You]174-sue do n't know what marriage means ! " Could it be possible that [his]180-jude announcement of [his]180-jude own marriage had pricked [her]5460-the poor girl on to this , just as [his]180-jude visit to [her]5460-the poor girl when in liquor may have pricked [her]5460-the poor girl on to [her]5460-the poor girl engagement ? To be sure , there seemed to exist these other and sufficient reasons , practical and social , for [her]5460-the poor girl decision ; but [Sue]174-sue was not [a very practical or calculating person]5461-a very practical or calculating person ; and [he]180-jude was compelled to think that a pique at having [his]180-jude secret sprung upon [her]5460-the poor girl had moved [her]5460-the poor girl to give way to [Phillotson]163-phillotson 's probable representations , that the best course to prove how unfounded were the suspicions of [the school authorities]5462-the school authorities would be to marry [him]180-jude off - hand , as in fulfilment of an ordinary engagement . [Sue]174-sue had , in fact , been placed in an awkward corner . [Poor Sue]174-sue ! [He]180-jude determined to play [the Spartan]5463-the spartan ; to make the best of it , and support [her]174-sue ; but [he]180-jude could not write the requested good wishes for a day or two . Meanwhile there came another note from [[his]180-jude impatient little dear]5464-his impatient little dear : [Jude]180-jude , will [you]180-jude give [me]174-sue away ? [I]174-sue have nobody else who could do it so conveniently as [you]180-jude , being [the only married relation [I]174-sue have here on the spot , even if [[my]174-sue father]3941-my father were friendly enough to be willing , which [he]3941-my father is n't]5465-the only married relation i have here on the spot , even if my father were friendly enough to be willing , which he is n't . [I]174-sue hope [you]180-jude wo n't think it a trouble ? [I]174-sue have been looking at the marriage service in the prayer - book , and it seems to [me]174-sue very humiliating that a giver - away should be required at all . According to the ceremony as there printed , [[my]174-sue bridegroom]5467-my bridegroom chooses [me]174-sue of [his]5467-my bridegroom own will and pleasure ; but [I]174-sue do n't choose [him]5467-my bridegroom . [Somebody]4067-somebody GIVES [me]174-sue to [him]5467-my bridegroom , like a [she]5469-she - ass or [she]5469-she - goat , or any other domestic animal . Bless [your]180-jude exalted views of [woman]4206-woman , [O churchman]5471-o churchman ! But [I]174-sue forget : [I]174-sue am no longer privileged to tease [you]180-jude . - Ever , [SUSANNA FLORENCE MARY BRIDEHEAD]174-sue . [Jude]180-jude screwed [himself]180-jude up to heroic key ; and replied : [MY]174-sue DEAR SUE , - Of course [I]174-sue wish [you]180-jude joy ! And also of course [I]174-sue will give [you]180-jude away . What [I]174-sue suggest is that , as [you]180-jude have [no house of [your]180-jude own]5472-no house of your own , [you]180-jude do not marry from [[your]180-jude school friend]5473-your school friend 's , but from [mine]174-sue . It would be more proper , [I]174-sue think , since [I]174-sue am , as [you]180-jude say , [the person nearest related to [you]180-jude in]5474-the person nearest related to you in [this part of [the world]706-the world]5475-this part of the world . [I]174-sue do n't see why [you]180-jude sign [your]180-jude letter in such a new and terribly formal way ? Surely [you]180-jude care a bit about [me]174-sue still ! - Ever [your]180-jude affectionate , [JUDE]180-jude . What had jarred on [him]180-jude even more than the signature was a little sting [he]180-jude had been silent on - the phrase "[174-sue] married relation " - What [an idiot]5477-an idiot it made [him]180-jude seem as [[her]174-sue lover]4279-her lover ! If [Sue]174-sue had written that in satire , [he]180-jude could hardly forgive [her]174-sue ; if in suffering - ah , that was another thing ! [His]180-jude offer of [his]180-jude lodging must have commended itself to [Phillotson]163-phillotson at any rate , for [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster sent [him]180-jude a line of warm thanks , accepting the convenience . [Sue]174-sue also thanked [him]180-jude . [Jude]180-jude immediately moved into [more commodious quarters]5480-more commodious quarters , as much to escape the espionage of [the suspicious landlady]5481-the suspicious landlady who had been one cause of [Sue]174-sue 's unpleasant experience as for the sake of room . Then [Sue]174-sue wrote to tell [him]180-jude the day fixed for the wedding ; and [Jude]180-jude decided , after inquiry , that [she]174-sue should come into residence on the following Saturday , which would allow of a ten days ' stay in [the city]414-the city prior to the ceremony , sufficiently representing a nominal residence of fifteen . [She]174-sue arrived by [the ten o'clock train]5483-the ten o'clock train on the day aforesaid , [Jude]180-jude not going to meet [her]174-sue at [the station]5059-the station , by [her]174-sue special request , that [he]180-jude should not lose a morning 's work and pay , [she]174-sue said if this were [her]174-sue true reason . But so well by this time did [he]180-jude know [Sue]174-sue that the remembrance of [their]5485-their mutual sensitiveness at emotional crises might , [he]180-jude thought , have weighed with [her]174-sue in this . When [he]180-jude came [home]3897-home to dinner [she]174-sue had taken possession of [[her]174-sue apartment]5487-her apartment . [She]174-sue lived in [the same house]5488-the same house with [him]180-jude , but on a different floor , and [they]5485-their saw [each other]4188-each other little , an occasional supper being the only meal [they]5485-their took together , when [Sue]174-sue 's manner was something like that of [a scared child]5490-a scared child . What [she]174-sue felt [he]180-jude did not know ; [their]5485-their conversation was mechanical , though [she]174-sue did not look pale or ill . [Phillotson]163-phillotson came frequently , but mostly when [Jude]180-jude was absent . On the morning of the wedding , when [Jude]180-jude had given [himself]180-jude a holiday , [Sue]174-sue and [[her]174-sue cousin]4824-her cousin had breakfast together for the first and last time during this curious interval ; in [[his]180-jude room]4314-his room - [the parlour - which [he]180-jude had hired for the period of [Sue]174-sue 's residence]5493-the parlour - which he had hired for the period of sue 's residence . Seeing , as [women]3879-women do , how helpless [he]180-jude was in making [the place]3987-the place comfortable , [she]174-sue bustled about . "[174-sue] What 's the matter , [Jude]180-jude ? " [she]174-sue said suddenly . [He]180-jude was leaning with [his]180-jude elbows on the table and [his]180-jude chin on [his]180-jude hands , looking into a futurity which seemed to be sketched out on the tablecloth . "[180-jude] Oh - nothing ! " "[180-jude] [You]180-jude are ' [father]3907-father ' , [you]180-jude know . That 's what [they]1767-they call [the man who gives [you]180-jude away]1768-the man who gives you away . " [Jude]180-jude could have said "[1768-the man who gives you away] [Phillotson]163-phillotson 's age entitles [him]180-jude to be called that ! " But [he]180-jude would not annoy [her]174-sue by such a cheap retort . [She]174-sue talked incessantly , as if [she]174-sue dreaded [his]180-jude indulgence in reflection , and before the meal was over both [he]180-jude and [she]174-sue wished [they]5496-they had not put such confidence in [their]5496-they new view of things , and had taken breakfast apart . What oppressed [Jude]180-jude was the thought that , having done a wrong thing of this sort [himself]180-jude , [he]180-jude was aiding and abetting [the woman [he]180-jude loved]5497-the woman he loved in doing a like wrong thing , instead of imploring and warning [her]174-sue against it . It was on [his]180-jude tongue to say , "[1769-you] [You]1769-you have quite made up [your]1769-you mind ? " After breakfast [they]5496-they went out on an errand together moved by a mutual thought that it was the last opportunity [they]5496-they would have of indulging in unceremonious companionship . By the irony of fate , and the curious trick in [Sue]174-sue 's nature of tempting [Providence]306-providence at critical times , [she]174-sue took [his]180-jude arm as [they]5496-they walked through [the muddy street]5498-the muddy street - a thing [she]174-sue had never done before in [her]174-sue life - and on turning the corner [they]5496-they found [themselves]5496-they close to [a grey perpendicular church]5499-a grey perpendicular church with a low - pitched roof - [the church of [St. Thomas]78-st. thomas]5500-the church of st. thomas . "[1769-you] That 's [the church]4809-the church , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[1769-you] Where [I]0-i am going to be married ? " "[1769-you] Yes . " "[1769-you] Indeed ! " [she]174-sue exclaimed with curiosity . "[1769-you] How [I]0-i should like to go in and see what [the spot]654-the spot is like where [I]0-i am so soon to kneel and do it . " Again [he]180-jude said to [himself]180-jude , "[0-i] [She]0-i does not realize what marriage means ! " [He]180-jude passively acquiesced in [her]174-sue wish to go in , and [they]5496-they entered by the western door . [The only person inside [the gloomy building]5502-the gloomy building]5501-the only person inside the gloomy building was [a charwoman cleaning]5503-a charwoman cleaning . [Sue]174-sue still held [Jude]180-jude 's arm , almost as if [she]174-sue loved [him]180-jude . Cruelly sweet , indeed , [she]174-sue had been to [him]180-jude that morning ; but [his]180-jude thoughts of a penance in store for [her]174-sue were tempered by an ache : ... [I]0-i can find no way How a blow should fall , such as falls on [men]716-men , Nor prove too much for [your]716-men womanhood ! [They]5496-they strolled undemonstratively up [the nave]5505-the nave towards the altar railing , which [they]5496-they stood against in silence , turning then and walking down [the nave]5505-the nave again , [her]174-sue hand still on [his]180-jude arm , precisely like [a couple just married]5507-a couple just married . The too suggestive incident , entirely of [her]174-sue making , nearly broke down [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] [I]0-i like to do things like this , " [she]174-sue said in the delicate voice of an epicure in emotions , which left no doubt that [she]174-sue spoke the truth . "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i do ! " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] They are interesting , because they have probably never been done before . [I]0-i shall walk down [the church]4809-the church like this with [[my]0-i husband]1773-my husband in about two hours , sha n't [I]0-i ! " "[0-i] No doubt [you]0-i will ! " "[0-i] Was it like this when [you]0-i were married ? " "[177-god] [Good God]177-god , [Sue]174-sue - do n't be so awfully merciless ! ... There , [dear one]1774-dear one , [I]0-i did n't mean it ! " "[0-i] Ah - [you]0-i are vexed ! " [she]0-i said regretfully , as [she]0-i blinked away an access of eye moisture . "[0-i] And [I]0-i promised never to vex [you]0-i ! ... [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought not to have asked [you]0-i to bring [me]0-i in [here]3898-here . Oh , [I]0-i ought n't ! [I]0-i see it now . [My]0-i curiosity to hunt up a new sensation always leads [me]0-i into these scrapes . Forgive [me]0-i ! ... [You]0-i will , wo n't [you]0-i , [Jude]180-jude ? " The appeal was so remorseful that [Jude]180-jude 's eyes were even wetter than [hers]0-i as [he]180-jude pressed [her]0-i hand for Yes . "[0-i] Now [we]1776-they 'll hurry away , and [I]0-i wo n't do it any more ! " [she]0-i continued humbly ; and [they]1776-they came out of [the building]4677-the building , [Sue]174-sue intending to go on to [the station]5059-the station to meet [Phillotson]163-phillotson . But [the first person [they]1776-they encountered on entering [the main street]705-the main street]5510-the first person they encountered on entering the main street was [the schoolmaster [himself]5512-the schoolmaster himself , whose train had arrived sooner than sue expected , whose train had arrived sooner than [Sue]174-sue expected]5512-the schoolmaster himself , whose train had arrived sooner than sue expected . There was nothing really to demur to in [her]0-i leaning on [Jude]180-jude 's arm ; but [she]0-i withdrew [her]0-i hand , and [Jude]180-jude thought that [Phillotson]163-phillotson had looked surprised . "[0-i] [We]1776-they have been doing such a funny thing ! " said [she]0-i , smiling candidly . "[1776-they] [We]1776-they 've been to [the church]4809-the church , rehearsing as it were . Have n't [we]1776-they , [Jude]180-jude ? " "[180-jude] How ? " said [Phillotson]163-phillotson curiously . [Jude]180-jude inwardly deplored what [he]180-jude thought to be unnecessary frankness ; but [she]0-i had gone too far not to explain all , which [she]0-i accordingly did , telling [him]163-phillotson how [they]1776-they had marched up to the altar . Seeing how puzzled [Phillotson]163-phillotson seemed , [Jude]180-jude said as cheerfully as [he]180-jude could , "[0-i] [I]0-i am going to buy [her]1778-her another little present . Will [you]1779-you both come to [the shop]4554-the shop with [me]0-i ? " "[1779-you] No , " said [Sue]174-sue , "[1779-you] [I]0-i 'll go on to [the house]504-the house with [him]180-jude " ; and requesting [[her]0-i lover]4279-her lover not to be a long time [she]0-i departed with [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster . [Jude]180-jude soon joined [them]1776-they at [[his]163-phillotson rooms]5515-his rooms , and shortly after [they]1776-they prepared for the ceremony . [Phillotson]163-phillotson 's hair was brushed to a painful extent , and [his]163-phillotson shirt collar appeared stiffer than it had been for the previous twenty years . Beyond this [he]163-phillotson looked dignified and thoughtful , and altogether [a man of whom it was not unsafe to predict that [he]163-phillotson would make [a kind and considerate husband]5517-a kind and considerate husband]5516-a man of whom it was not unsafe to predict that he would make a kind and considerate husband . That [he]163-phillotson adored [Sue]174-sue was obvious ; and [she]174-sue could almost be seen to feel that [she]174-sue was undeserving [his]163-phillotson adoration . Although the distance was so short [he]163-phillotson had hired a fly from [the Red Lion]79-the red lion , and [six or seven women]5518-six or seven women and [children]4054-children had gathered by the door when [they]1776-they came out . [The schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster and [Sue]174-sue were unknown , though [Jude]180-jude was getting to be recognized as [a citizen]5521-a citizen ; and [the couple]5522-the couple were judged to be [some relations of [his]163-phillotson]5523-some relations of his from a distance , nobody supposing [Sue]174-sue to have been [a recent pupil at [the training school]5396-the training school]5524-a recent pupil at the training school . In [the carriage]5526-the carriage [Jude]180-jude took from [his]180-jude pocket [his]180-jude extra little wedding - present , which turned out to be two or three yards of white tulle , which [he]180-jude threw over [her]174-sue bonnet and all , as a veil . "[0-i] It looks so odd over a bonnet , " [she]174-sue said . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll take the bonnet off . " "[0-i] Oh no - let it stay , " said [Phillotson]163-phillotson . And [she]174-sue obeyed . When [they]5522-the couple had passed up [the church]4809-the church and were standing in [their]5522-the couple places [Jude]180-jude found that the antecedent visit had certainly taken off the edge of this performance , but by the time [they]5522-the couple were half - way on with the service [he]180-jude wished from [his]180-jude heart that [he]180-jude had not undertaken the business of giving [her]174-sue away . How could [Sue]174-sue have had the temerity to ask [him]180-jude to do it - a cruelty possibly to [herself]174-sue as well as to [him]180-jude ? [Women]3879-women were different from [men]716-men in such matters . Was it that [they]3879-women were , instead of more sensitive , as reputed , more callous , and less romantic ; or were [they]3879-women more heroic ? Or was [Sue]174-sue simply so perverse that [she]174-sue wilfully gave [herself]174-sue and [him]180-jude pain for the odd and mournful luxury of practising long - suffering in [[her]174-sue own person]5530-her own person , and of being touched with tender pity for [him]180-jude at having made [him]180-jude practise it ? [He]180-jude could perceive that [her]174-sue face was nervously set , and when [they]3879-women reached the trying ordeal of [Jude]180-jude giving [her]174-sue to [Phillotson]163-phillotson [she]174-sue could hardly command [herself]174-sue ; rather , however , as it seemed , from [her]174-sue knowledge of what [[her]174-sue cousin]4824-her cousin must feel , whom [she]174-sue need not have had there at all , than from self - consideration . Possibly [she]174-sue would go on inflicting such pains again and again , and grieving for [the sufferer]5532-the sufferer again and again , in all [her]174-sue colossal inconsistency . [Phillotson]163-phillotson seemed not to notice , to be surrounded by a mist which prevented [his]180-jude seeing the emotions of [others]4093-others . As soon as [they]3879-women had signed [their]3879-women names and come away , and the suspense was over , [Jude]180-jude felt relieved . The meal at [[his]180-jude lodging]4560-his lodging was a very simple affair , and at two o'clock [they]3879-women went off . In crossing [the pavement]4653-the pavement to the fly [she]174-sue looked back ; and there was a frightened light in [her]174-sue eyes . Could it be that [Sue]174-sue had acted with such unusual foolishness as to plunge into [she]174-sue knew not what for the sake of asserting [her]174-sue independence of [him]180-jude , of retaliating on [him]180-jude for [his]180-jude secrecy ? Perhaps [Sue]174-sue was thus venturesome with [men]716-men because [she]174-sue was childishly ignorant of that side of [their]716-men natures which wore out [women]3879-women 's hearts and lives . When [her]174-sue foot was on the carriage - step [she]174-sue turned round , saying that [she]174-sue had forgotten something . [Jude]180-jude and [the landlady]1579-the landlady offered to get it . "[0-i] No , " [she]174-sue said , running back . "[0-i] It is [my]0-i handkerchief . [I]0-i know where [I]0-i left it . " [Jude]180-jude followed [her]174-sue back . [She]174-sue had found it , and came holding it in [her]174-sue hand . [She]174-sue looked into [his]180-jude eyes with [her]174-sue own tearful ones , and [her]174-sue lips suddenly parted as if [she]174-sue were going to avow something . But [she]174-sue went on ; and whatever [she]174-sue had meant to say remained unspoken . [VIII Jude]180-jude wondered if [she]174-sue had really left [her]174-sue handkerchief behind ; or whether it were that [she]174-sue had miserably wished to tell [him]180-jude of a love that at the last moment [she]174-sue could not bring [herself]174-sue to express . [He]180-jude could not stay in [[his]180-jude silent lodging]5539-his silent lodging when [they]5540-they were gone , and fearing that [he]180-jude might be tempted to drown [his]180-jude misery in alcohol [he]180-jude went [upstairs]4313-upstairs , changed [his]180-jude dark clothes for [his]180-jude white , [his]180-jude thin boots for [his]180-jude thick , and proceeded to [his]180-jude customary work for the afternoon . But in [the cathedral]4622-the cathedral [he]180-jude seemed to hear a voice behind [him]180-jude , and to be possessed with an idea that [she]174-sue would come back . [She]174-sue could not possibly go [home]3897-home with [Phillotson]163-phillotson , [he]180-jude fancied . The feeling grew and stirred . The moment that the clock struck the last of [his]180-jude working hours [he]180-jude threw down [his]180-jude tools and rushed homeward . "[0-i] Has [anybody]4107-anybody been for [me]0-i ? " [he]180-jude asked . [Nobody]4069-nobody had been [there]3887-there . As [he]180-jude could claim [the downstairs sitting - room]5546-the downstairs sitting - room till twelve o'clock that night [he]180-jude sat in [it]5546-the downstairs sitting - room all the evening ; and even when the clock had struck eleven , and [the family]3948-the family had retired , [he]180-jude could not shake off the feeling that [she]174-sue would come back and sleep in [the little room adjoining [his]180-jude own]5548-the little room adjoining his own in which [she]174-sue had slept so many previous days . [Her]174-sue actions were always unpredictable : why should [she]174-sue not come ? Gladly would [he]180-jude have compounded for the denial of [her]174-sue as [a sweetheart]1715-a sweetheart and [wife]4501-wife by having [her]174-sue live thus as [a fellow - lodger]5551-a fellow - lodger and [friend]5444-friend , even on the most distant terms . [His]180-jude supper still remained spread , and going to the front door , and softly setting it open , [he]180-jude returned to [the room]4227-the room and sat as [watchers]5554-watchers sit on Old - Midsummer eves , expecting the phantom of the Beloved . But [she]174-sue did not come . Having indulged in this wild hope [he]180-jude went [upstairs]4313-upstairs , and looked out of the window , and pictured [her]174-sue through the evening journey to [London]7-london , whither [she]174-sue and [Phillotson]163-phillotson had gone for [their]5556-their holiday ; [their]5556-their rattling along through the damp night to [[their]5556-their hotel]5557-their hotel , under the same sky of ribbed cloud as that [he]180-jude beheld , through which the moon showed its position rather than its shape , and one or two of the larger stars made themselves visible as faint nebulae only . It was a new beginning of [Sue]174-sue 's history . [He]180-jude projected [his]180-jude mind into the future , and saw [her]174-sue with [children]4054-children more or less in [her]174-sue own likeness around [her]174-sue . But the consolation of regarding [them]4054-children as a continuation of [her]174-sue identity was denied to [him]180-jude , as to [all such dreamers]5559-all such dreamers , by the wilfulness of Nature in not allowing issue from [one parent]5560-one parent alone . Every desired renewal of an existence is debased by being half alloy . "[4107-anybody] If at the estrangement or death of [[my]0-i lost love]1783-my lost love , [I]0-i could go and see [[her]1783-my lost love child]1784-her child - [hers]1783-my lost love solely - there would be comfort in it ! " said [Jude]180-jude . And then [he]180-jude again uneasily saw , as [he]180-jude had latterly seen with more and more frequency , the scorn of Nature for [man]575-man 's finer emotions , and [her]174-sue lack of interest in [his]180-jude aspirations . The oppressive strength of [his]180-jude affection for [Sue]174-sue showed itself on the morrow and following days yet more clearly . [He]180-jude could no longer endure the light of the [Melchester]3-melchester lamps ; the sunshine was as drab paint , and the blue sky as zinc . Then [he]180-jude received news that [[his]180-jude old aunt]4503-his old aunt was dangerously ill at [Marygreen]1-marygreen , which intelligence almost coincided with a letter from [[his]180-jude former employer]5563-his former employer at [Christminster]180-jude , who offered [him]180-jude permanent work of [a good class]5564-a good class if [he]180-jude would come back . The letters were almost a relief to [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude started to visit [Aunt Drusilla]308-aunt drusilla , and resolved to go onward to [Christminster]180-jude to see what worth there might be in [the builder]5565-the builder 's offer . [Jude]180-jude found [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt even worse than the communication from [the Widow Edlin]309-the widow edlin had led [him]180-jude to expect . There was every possibility of [her]555-his aunt lingering on for weeks or months , though little likelihood . [He]180-jude wrote to [Sue]174-sue informing [her]174-sue of the state of [[her]174-sue aunt]5567-her aunt , and suggesting that [she]174-sue might like to see [[her]174-sue aged relative]5568-her aged relative alive . [He]180-jude would meet [her]174-sue at [Alfredston Road]80-alfredston road , the following evening , Monday , on [his]180-jude way back from [Christminster]180-jude , if [she]174-sue could come by [the up - train]5569-the up - train which crossed [[his]180-jude down - train at [that station]5571-that station]5570-his down - train at that station . Next morning , according , [he]180-jude went on to [Christminster]180-jude , intending to return to [Alfredston]20-alfredston soon enough to keep the suggested appointment with [Sue]174-sue . [The city of learning]5572-the city of learning wore an estranged look , and [he]180-jude had lost all feeling for [its]5572-the city of learning associations . Yet as the sun made vivid lights and shades of the mullioned architecture of [the facades]5573-the facades , and drew patterns of the crinkled battlements on the young turf of [the quadrangles]1033-the quadrangles , [Jude]180-jude thought [he]180-jude had never seen [the place]3987-the place look more beautiful . [He]180-jude came to [the street in which [he]180-jude had first beheld [Sue]174-sue]5576-the street in which he had first beheld sue . The chair [she]174-sue had occupied when , leaning over [her]174-sue ecclesiastical scrolls , a hog - hair brush in [her]174-sue hand , [her]174-sue girlish figure had arrested the gaze of [his]180-jude inquiring eyes , stood precisely in [its]5572-the city of learning former spot , empty . [The bar]1461-the bar had been gutted and newly arranged throughout , mahogany fixtures having taken the place of the old painted ones , while at the back of the standing - space there were stuffed sofa - benches . [The room]4227-the room was divided into compartments in the approved manner , between which were screens of ground glass in mahogany framing , to prevent topers in [one compartment]5603-one compartment being put to the blush by the recognitions of [those in the next]5604-those in the next . [Jude]180-jude watched [her]0-i disappear in the direction of [the hotel]5660-the hotel , and entered [the railway station]1522-the railway station close by . Finding that it wanted three - quarters of an hour of the time at which [he]180-jude could get [a train]5662-a train back to [Alfredston]20-alfredston , [he]180-jude strolled mechanically into [the city]414-the city as far as to the Fourways , where [he]180-jude stood as [he]180-jude had so often stood before , and surveyed [Chief Street]84-chief street stretching ahead , with [its]84-chief street college after college , in picturesqueness unrivalled except by such Continental vistas as [the Street of Palaces in [Genoa]85-genoa]5664-the street of palaces in genoa ; the lines of [the buildings]1016-the buildings being as distinct in the morning air as in an architectural drawing . But [Jude]180-jude was far from seeing or criticizing these things ; they were hidden by an indescribable consciousness of [Arabella]305-arabella 's midnight contiguity , a sense of degradation at [his]180-jude revived experiences with [her]305-arabella , of [her]305-arabella appearance as [she]305-arabella lay asleep at dawn , which set upon [his]180-jude motionless face a look as of [one accurst]5666-one accurst . [She]174-sue bent down and said softly : "[0-i] No , [dear]795-dear - [you]0-i are not to come yet . [I]0-i do n't think [you]0-i are in a good mood . " "[0-i] Very well , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] Good - bye ! " "[0-i] Good - bye ! " [She]174-sue waved [her]174-sue hand and was gone . "[0-i] [She]0-i 's right ! [I]0-i wo n't go ! " [he]180-jude murmured . [He]180-jude passed the evening and following days in mortifying by every possible means [his]180-jude wish to see [her]174-sue , nearly starving [himself]180-jude in attempts to extinguish by fasting [his]180-jude passionate tendency to love [her]174-sue . [He]180-jude read sermons on discipline , and hunted up passages in Church history that treated of [the Ascetics of the second century]5712-the ascetics of the second century . Before [he]180-jude had returned from [Marygreen]1-marygreen to [Melchester]3-melchester there arrived a letter from [Arabella]305-arabella . The sight of it revived a stronger feeling of self - condemnation for [his]180-jude brief return to [her]305-arabella society than for [his]180-jude attachment to [Sue]174-sue . The letter , [he]180-jude perceived , bore a [London]7-london postmark instead of the Christminster one . [Arabella]305-arabella informed [him]180-jude that a few days after [their]5713-their parting in the morning at [Christminster]180-jude , [she]305-arabella had been surprised by an affectionate letter from [[her]305-arabella Australian husband]5714-her australian husband , formerly manager of [the hotel in [Sydney]83-sydney]5715-the hotel in sydney . [He]180-jude had come to [England]65-england on purpose to find [her]305-arabella ; and had taken [a free , fully - licensed public , in [Lambeth]87-lambeth , where [he]180-jude wished [her]305-arabella to join [him]180-jude in conducting the business , which was likely to be a very thriving one]5716-a free , fully - licensed public , in lambeth , where he wished her to join him in conducting the business , which was likely to be a very thriving one , [the house]504-the house being situated in [an excellent , densely populated , gin - drinking neighbourhood]5718-an excellent , densely populated , gin - drinking neighbourhood , and already doing a trade of L200 a month , which could be easily doubled . As [he]180-jude had said that [he]180-jude loved [her]305-arabella very much still , and implored [her]305-arabella to tell [him]180-jude where [she]305-arabella was , and as [they]5719-they had only parted in a slight tiff , and as [her]305-arabella engagement in [Christminster]180-jude was only temporary , [she]305-arabella had just gone to join [him]180-jude as [he]180-jude urged . [She]305-arabella could not help feeling that [she]305-arabella belonged to [him]180-jude more than to [Jude]180-jude , since [she]305-arabella had properly married [him]180-jude , and had lived with [him]180-jude much longer than with [[her]305-arabella first husband]5720-her first husband . In thus wishing [Jude]180-jude good - bye [she]305-arabella bore [him]180-jude no ill - will , and trusted [he]180-jude would not turn upon [her]305-arabella , [a weak woman]5721-a weak woman , and inform against [her]305-arabella , and bring [her]305-arabella to ruin now that [she]305-arabella had a chance of improving [her]305-arabella circumstances and leading a genteel life . [X Jude]316-jude returned to [Melchester]3-melchester , which had the questionable recommendation of being only a dozen and a half miles from [[his]180-jude Sue 's now permanent residence]5722-his sue 's now permanent residence . At first [he]180-jude felt that this nearness was a distinct reason for not going southward at all ; but [Christminster]180-jude was too sad a place to bear , while the proximity of [Shaston]4-shaston to [Melchester]3-melchester might afford [him]180-jude the glory of worsting [the Enemy]5723-the enemy in a close engagement , such as was deliberately sought by [the priests and [virgins of the early Church , who , disdaining an ignominious flight from temptation]5725-virgins of the early church , who , disdaining an ignominious flight from temptation]5724-the priests and virgins of the early church , who , disdaining an ignominious flight from temptation , became [even chamber - partners with impunity]5726-even chamber - partners with impunity . [Jude]316-jude did not pause to remember that , in the laconic words of [the historian]5727-the historian , "[0-i] insulted Nature sometimes vindicated [her]1900-her rights " in such circumstances . [He]316-jude now returned with feverish desperation to [his]316-jude study for the priesthood - in the recognition that the single - mindedness of [his]316-jude aims , and [his]316-jude fidelity to the cause , had been more than questionable of late . [His]316-jude passion for [Sue]174-sue troubled [his]316-jude soul ; yet [his]316-jude lawful abandonment to [the society of [Arabella]305-arabella]5728-the society of arabella for twelve hours seemed instinctively a worse thing - even though [she]305-arabella had not told [him]316-jude of [[her]305-arabella Sydney husband]5729-her sydney husband till afterwards . [He]316-jude had , [he]316-jude verily believed , overcome all tendency to fly to liquor - which , indeed , [he]316-jude had never done from taste , but merely as an escape from intolerable misery of mind . Yet [he]316-jude perceived with despondency that , taken all round , [he]316-jude was [a man of too many passions]5730-a man of too many passions to make [a good clergyman]5731-a good clergyman ; the utmost [he]316-jude could hope for was that in a life of constant internal warfare between flesh and spirit [the former]5732-the former might not always be victorious . As a hobby , auxiliary to [his]316-jude readings in Divinity , [he]316-jude developed [his]316-jude slight skill in church - music and thorough - bass , till [he]316-jude could join in part - singing from notation with some accuracy . A mile or two from [Melchester]3-melchester there was [a restored village church]5733-a restored village church , to which [Jude]316-jude had originally gone to fix the new columns and capitals . By this means [he]316-jude had become acquainted with [the organist]5734-the organist , and the ultimate result was that [he]316-jude joined [the choir]4681-the choir as a bass voice . [He]316-jude walked out to [this parish]5736-this parish twice every Sunday , and sometimes in the week . One evening about Easter [the choir]4681-the choir met for practice , and a new hymn which [Jude]316-jude had heard of as being by [a Wessex composer]5738-a wessex composer was to be tried and prepared for the following week . It turned out to be a strangely emotional composition . As [they]4681-the choir all sang it over and over again its harmonies grew upon [Jude]316-jude , and moved [him]316-jude exceedingly . When [they]4681-the choir had finished [he]316-jude went round to [the organist]5734-the organist to make inquiries . The score was in manuscript , the name of [the composer]5740-the composer being at the head , together with the title of the hymn : "[1903-a professional musician at kennetbridge] The Foot of the Cross . " "[1903-a professional musician at kennetbridge] Yes , " said [the organist]5734-the organist . "[1901-he] [He]1901-he is [a local man]1902-a local man . [He]1901-he is [a professional musician at [Kennetbridge]89-kennetbridge]1903-a professional musician at kennetbridge - between here and [Christminster]180-jude . [The vicar]1262-the vicar knows [him]1901-he . [He]1901-he was brought up and educated in [Christminster]180-jude traditions , which accounts for the quality of the piece . [I]0-i think [he]1901-he plays in [the large church there]1905-the large church there , and has [a surpliced choir]1906-a surpliced choir . [He]1901-he comes to [Melchester]3-melchester sometimes , and once tried to get the cathedral organ when the post was vacant . The hymn is getting about everywhere this Easter . " As [he]316-jude walked humming the air on [his]316-jude way [home]3897-home , [Jude]316-jude fell to musing on [its composer]5743-its composer , and the reasons why [he]316-jude composed it . What [a man of sympathies]5744-a man of sympathies [he]316-jude must be ! Perplexed and harassed as [he]316-jude [himself]316-jude was about [Sue]174-sue and [Arabella]305-arabella , and troubled as was [his]316-jude conscience by the complication of [his]316-jude position , how [he]316-jude would like to know [that man]1681-that man ! "[1907-he] [[He]1907-he of [all men]1883-all men]1908-he of all men would understand [my]0-i difficulties , " said [the impulsive Jude]316-jude . If there were [any person in [the world]706-the world]5746-any person in the world to choose as [a confidant]5748-a confidant , [this composer]5749-this composer would be the one , for [he]5749-this composer must have suffered , and throbbed , and yearned . In brief , ill as [he]5749-this composer could afford the time and money for the journey , [Fawley]180-jude resolved , like [the child that [he]5749-this composer was]5750-the child that he was , to go to [Kennetbridge]89-kennetbridge the very next Sunday . [He]5749-this composer duly started , early in the morning , for it was only by a series of crooked railways that [he]5749-this composer could get to [the town]4154-the town . About mid - day [he]5749-this composer reached [it]89-kennetbridge , and crossing [the bridge]4202-the bridge into [the quaint old borough]5753-the quaint old borough [he]5749-this composer inquired for [the house of [the composer]5740-the composer]5754-the house of the composer . [They]5756-they told [him]5749-this composer [it]5754-the house of the composer was [a red brick building some little way further on]5757-a red brick building some little way further on . Also that [the gentleman]1310-the gentleman [himself]1310-the gentleman had just passed along [the street]4748-the street not five minutes before . "[1907-he] Which way ? " asked [Jude]180-jude with alacrity . "[1907-he] Straight along homeward from [church]865-church . " [Jude]180-jude hastened on , and soon had the pleasure of observing [a man in a black coat and a black slouched felt hat no considerable distance ahead]5760-a man in a black coat and a black slouched felt hat no considerable distance ahead . Stretching out [his]180-jude legs yet more widely [he]180-jude stalked after . "[1907-he] [A hungry soul in pursuit of a full soul]1911-a hungry soul in pursuit of a full soul ! " [he]180-jude said . "[0-i] [I]0-i must speak to [that man]1681-that man ! " [He]180-jude could not , however , overtake [the musician]5761-the musician before [he]180-jude had entered [[his]180-jude own house]5762-his own house , and then arose the question if this were an expedient time to call . Whether or not [he]180-jude decided to do so there and then , now that [he]180-jude had got [here]3898-here , the distance [home]3897-home being too great for [him]180-jude to wait till late in the afternoon . [This man of soul]5765-this man of soul would understand scant ceremony , and might be quite a perfect adviser in a case in which an earthly and illegitimate passion had cunningly obtained entrance into [his]180-jude heart through the opening afforded for religion . [Jude]180-jude accordingly rang the bell , and was admitted . [The musician]5761-the musician came to [him]180-jude in a moment , and being respectably dressed , good - looking , and frank in manner , [Jude]180-jude obtained a favourable reception . [He]180-jude was nevertheless conscious that there would be a certain awkwardness in explaining [his]180-jude errand . "[1681-that man] [I]0-i have been singing in [the choir of [a little church near [Melchester]3-melchester]1914-a little church near melchester]1913-the choir of a little church near melchester , " [he]180-jude said . "[0-i] And [we]1915-we have this week practised ' The Foot of the Cross , ' which [I]0-i understand , [sir]3888-sir , that [you]3888-sir composed ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did - a year or so ago . " "[0-i] [I]0-i - like it . [I]0-i think it supremely beautiful ! " "[0-i] Ah well - [other people]757-other people have said so too . Yes , there 's money in it , if [I]0-i could only see about getting it published . [I]0-i have other compositions to go with it , too ; [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could bring them out ; for [I]0-i have n't made a five - pound note out of any of them yet . [These publishing people]1918-these publishing people - [they]1918-these publishing people want the copyright of [an obscure composer]1919-an obscure composer 's work , such as [mine]0-i is , for almost less than [I]0-i should have to pay [a person]1920-a person for making a fair manuscript copy of the score . The one [you]1921-you speak of [I]0-i have lent to [various friends]1922-various friends about here and [Melchester]3-melchester , and so it has got to be sung a little . But music is a poor staff to lean on - [I]0-i am giving it up entirely . [You]1921-you must go into trade if [you]1921-you want to make money nowadays . The wine business is what [I]0-i am thinking of . This is [my]0-i forthcoming list - it is not issued yet - but [you]1921-you can take one . " [He]1919-an obscure composer handed [Jude]180-jude an advertisement list of several pages in booklet shape , ornamentally margined with a red line , in which were set forth the various clarets , champagnes , ports , sherries , and other wines with which [he]1919-an obscure composer purposed to initiate [his]1919-an obscure composer new venture . It took [Jude]180-jude more than by surprise that [the man with the soul]5767-the man with the soul was thus and thus ; and [he]180-jude felt that [he]180-jude could not open up [his]180-jude confidences . [They]5768-they talked a little longer , but constrainedly , for when [the musician]5761-the musician found that [Jude]180-jude was [a poor man]5770-a poor man [his]180-jude manner changed from what it had been while [Jude]180-jude 's appearance and address deceived [him]180-jude as to [his]180-jude position and pursuits . [Jude]180-jude stammered out something about [his]180-jude feelings in wishing to congratulate [the author]5771-the author on such an exalted composition , and took an embarrassed leave . All the way [home]3897-home by [the slow Sunday train]5773-the slow sunday train , sitting in [the fireless waiting - rooms]5774-the fireless waiting - rooms on this cold spring day , [he]180-jude was depressed enough at [his]180-jude simplicity in taking such a journey . But no sooner did [he]180-jude reach [[his]180-jude Melchester lodging]5775-his melchester lodging than [he]180-jude found awaiting [him]180-jude a letter which had arrived that morning a few minutes after [he]180-jude had left [the house]504-the house . It was a contrite little note from [Sue]174-sue , in which [she]174-sue said , with sweet humility , that [she]174-sue felt [she]174-sue had been horrid in telling [him]180-jude [he]180-jude was not to come to see [her]174-sue , that [she]174-sue despised [herself]174-sue for having been so conventional ; and that [he]180-jude was to be sure to come by [the eleven - forty - five train]5777-the eleven - forty - five train that very Sunday , and have dinner with [them]5778-them at half - past one . [Jude]180-jude almost tore [his]180-jude hair at having missed this letter till it was too late to act upon its contents ; but [he]180-jude had chastened [himself]180-jude considerably of late , and at last [his]180-jude chimerical expedition to [Kennetbridge]89-kennetbridge really did seem to have been another special intervention of [Providence]306-providence to keep [him]180-jude away from temptation . But a growing impatience of faith , which [he]180-jude had noticed in [himself]180-jude more than once of late , made [him]180-jude pass over in ridicule the idea that [God]177-god sent [people]658-people on fools ' errands . [He]180-jude longed to see [her]174-sue ; [he]180-jude was angry at having missed [her]174-sue : and [he]180-jude wrote instantly , telling [her]174-sue what had happened , and saying [he]180-jude had not enough patience to wait till the following Sunday , but would come any day in the week that [she]174-sue liked to name . Since [he]180-jude wrote a little over - ardently , [Sue]174-sue , as [her]174-sue manner was , delayed [her]174-sue reply till Thursday before Good Friday , when [she]174-sue said [he]180-jude might come that afternoon if [he]180-jude wished , this being the earliest day on which [she]174-sue could welcome [him]180-jude , for [she]174-sue was now assistant - teacher in [[[her]174-sue husband]3921-her husband 's school]5781-her husband 's school . [Jude]180-jude therefore got leave from [the cathedral works]5347-the cathedral works at the trifling expense of a stoppage of pay , and went . Part Fourth AT [SHASTON]4-shaston "[1921-you] Whoso prefers either Matrimony or other Ordinance before the Good of [Man and the plain Exigence of Charity]1923-man and the plain exigence of charity , let [him]1924-he profess [Papist]1925-papist , or Protestant , or what [he]1924-he will , [he]1924-he is no better than [a Pharisee]1926-a pharisee . " - [J. MILTON]317-j. milton . [I]1927-the martyr [Shaston]4-shaston , [the ancient British Palladour]5783-the ancient british palladour , From whose foundation first such strange reports arise , as [Drayton]319-drayton sang [it]4-shaston , was , and is , in [itself]4-shaston [the city]414-the city of a dream . Vague imaginings of [[its]4-shaston castle]5785-its castle , [[its]4-shaston three mints]5786-its three mints , [[its]4-shaston magnificent apsidal abbey]5787-its magnificent apsidal abbey , [the chief glory of [South Wessex]5789-south wessex]5788-the chief glory of south wessex , [[its]4-shaston twelve churches]5790-its twelve churches , [its]4-shaston shrines , [chantries]5791-chantries , [hospitals]5792-hospitals , [[its]4-shaston gabled freestone mansions]5793-its gabled freestone mansions - all now ruthlessly swept away - throw [the visitor]5794-the visitor , even against [his]5794-the visitor will , into a pensive melancholy , which the stimulating atmosphere and limitless landscape around [him]5794-the visitor can scarcely dispel . [The spot]654-the spot was [the burial - place of [a king]5797-a king and [a queen]5044-a queen , of [abbots]5799-abbots and [abbesses]5800-abbesses]5796-the burial - place of a king and a queen , of abbots and abbesses , [saints]1217-saints and [bishops]731-bishops , [knights]5803-knights and [squires]5804-squires . The bones of [King Edward]320-king edward "[1927-the martyr] [the Martyr]1927-the martyr , " carefully removed hither for holy preservation , brought [Shaston]4-shaston a renown which made [it]4-shaston the resort of pilgrims from [every part of [Europe]90-europe]5805-every part of europe , and enabled [it]4-shaston to maintain a reputation extending far beyond [English shores]5806-english shores . To this fair creation of the great Middle - Age the Dissolution was , as [historians]5807-historians tell [us]5808-us , the death - knell . With the destruction of [the enormous abbey]5809-the enormous abbey [the whole place]5810-the whole place collapsed in a general ruin : [the Martyr]1927-the martyr 's bones met with the fate of the sacred pile that held them , and not a stone is now left to tell where they lie . The natural picturesqueness and singularity of [the town]4154-the town still remain ; but strange to say these qualities , which were noted by many writers in ages when scenic beauty is said to have been unappreciated , are passed over in this , and one of the queerest and quaintest spots in [England]65-england stands virtually unvisited to - day . [It]4-shaston has a unique position on the summit of [a steep and imposing scarp , rising on the north , south , and west sides of [the borough]5814-the borough]5813-a steep and imposing scarp , rising on the north , south , and west sides of the borough out of [the deep alluvial Vale of Blackmoor]91-the deep alluvial vale of blackmoor , the view from [the Castle Green]92-the castle green over [three counties of verdant pasture - South]5815-three counties of verdant pasture - south , [Mid]93-mid , and [Nether Wessex]94-nether wessex - being as sudden a surprise to [the unexpectant traveller]5816-the unexpectant traveller 's eyes as the medicinal air is to [his]5816-the unexpectant traveller lungs . Impossible to [a railway]5817-a railway , [it]4-shaston can best be reached on foot , next best by [light vehicles]5818-light vehicles ; and [it]4-shaston is hardly accessible to these but by [a sort of isthmus on the north - east]5819-a sort of isthmus on the north - east , that connects [it]4-shaston with [the high chalk table - land on that side]5820-the high chalk table - land on that side . Such is , and such was , [the now world - forgotten [Shaston]4-shaston or [Palladour]95-palladour]5821-the now world - forgotten shaston or palladour . [Its]4-shaston situation rendered water the great want of [the town]4154-the town ; and within living memory , horses , donkeys and [men]716-men may have been seen toiling up the winding ways to the top of the height , laden with tubs and barrels filled from [the wells beneath [the mountain]5825-the mountain]5824-the wells beneath the mountain , and [hawkers]5826-hawkers retailing [their]5826-hawkers contents at the price of a halfpenny a bucketful . This difficulty in the water supply , together with two other odd facts , namely , that [the chief graveyard]5827-the chief graveyard slopes up as steeply as a roof behind [the church]4809-the church , and that in former times [the town]4154-the town passed through a curious period of corruption , conventual and domestic , gave rise to the saying that [Shaston]4-shaston was remarkable for three consolations to [man]575-man , such as [the world]706-the world afforded not elsewhere . It was a place where [the churchyard]500-the churchyard lay nearer heaven than [the church steeple]5833-the church steeple , where beer was more plentiful than water , and where there were more [wanton women]5834-wanton women than [honest wives]5835-honest wives and [maids]5836-maids . It is also said that after the Middle Ages [the inhabitants]5330-the inhabitants were too poor to pay [[their]5330-the inhabitants priests]5838-their priests , and hence were compelled to pull down [[their]5330-the inhabitants churches]5839-their churches , and refrain altogether from the public worship of [God]177-god ; a necessity which [they]5330-the inhabitants bemoaned over [their]5330-the inhabitants cups in the settles of [[their]5330-the inhabitants inns]5840-their inns on Sunday afternoons . In those days [the Shastonians]321-the shastonians were apparently not without a sense of humour . There was another peculiarity - this a modern one - which [Shaston]4-shaston appeared to owe to [its]4-shaston site . [It]4-shaston was [the resting - place and headquarters of [the proprietors of wandering vans]5842-the proprietors of wandering vans , shows , [shooting - galleries]5843-shooting - galleries , and other itinerant concerns , whose business lay largely at [fairs and markets]5844-fairs and markets]5841-the resting - place and headquarters of the proprietors of wandering vans , shows , shooting - galleries , and other itinerant concerns , whose business lay largely at fairs and markets . As strange wild birds are seen assembled on [some lofty promontory]5845-some lofty promontory , meditatively pausing for longer flights , or to return by the course [they]5846-they followed thither , so here , in [this cliff - town]5847-this cliff - town , stood in stultified silence the yellow and green caravans bearing names not local , as if surprised by a change in the landscape so violent as to hinder [their]5846-they further progress ; and here [they]5846-they usually remained all the winter till [they]5846-they turned to seek again [their]5846-they old tracks in the following spring . It was to [this breezy and whimsical spot]5848-this breezy and whimsical spot that [Jude]180-jude ascended from [the nearest station]5849-the nearest station for the first time in [his]180-jude life about four o'clock one afternoon , and entering on [the summit of [the peak]5851-the peak]5850-the summit of the peak after a toilsome climb , passed [the first houses of [the aerial town]5853-the aerial town]5852-the first houses of the aerial town ; and drew towards [the school - house]4810-the school - house . The hour was too early ; [the pupils]5236-the pupils were still in [school]5856-school , humming small , like a swarm of gnats ; and [he]180-jude withdrew a few steps along [Abbey Walk]96-abbey walk , whence [he]180-jude regarded the spot which fate had made [the home of all [he]180-jude loved best in [the world]706-the world]5857-the home of all he loved best in the world . In front of [the schools]5859-the schools , which were extensive and stone - built , grew two enormous beeches with smooth mouse - coloured trunks , as such trees will only grow on [chalk uplands]5860-chalk uplands . Within the mullioned and transomed windows [he]180-jude could see the black , brown , and flaxen crowns of [the scholars]4900-the scholars over the sills , and to pass the time away [he]180-jude walked down to [the level terrace where [the abbey gardens]5863-the abbey gardens once had spread , [his]180-jude heart throbbing in spite of [him]180-jude]5862-the level terrace where the abbey gardens once had spread , his heart throbbing in spite of him . Unwilling to enter till [the children]4875-the children were dismissed [he]180-jude remained [here]3898-here till young voices could be heard in the open air , and [girls in white pinafores over red and blue frocks]5866-girls in white pinafores over red and blue frocks appeared dancing along the paths which [the abbess]5867-the abbess , [prioress]5868-prioress , [subprioress]5869-subprioress , and [fifty nuns]5870-fifty nuns had demurely paced three centuries earlier . Retracing [his]180-jude steps [he]180-jude found that [he]180-jude had waited too long , and that [Sue]174-sue had gone out into [the town]4154-the town at the heels of [the last scholar]5872-the last scholar , [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson having been absent all the afternoon at [a [teachers]4901-teachers ' meeting at [Shottsford]97-shottsford]5873-a teachers ' meeting at shottsford . [Jude]180-jude went into [the empty schoolroom]5875-the empty schoolroom and sat down , [the girl who was sweeping the floor having informed [him]180-jude that [Mrs. Phillotson]258-phillotson]5876-the girl who was sweeping the floor having informed him that mrs. phillotson would be back again in a few minutes . A piano stood near - actually the old piano that [Phillotson]163-phillotson had possessed at [Marygreen]1-marygreen - and though the dark afternoon almost prevented [him]180-jude seeing the notes [Jude]180-jude touched them in [his]180-jude humble way , and could not help modulating into the hymn which had so affected [him]180-jude in the previous week . [A figure]5877-a figure moved behind [him]180-jude , and thinking it was still [the girl with the broom]5878-the girl with the broom [Jude]180-jude took no notice , till [the person]5879-the person came close and laid [her]5879-the person fingers lightly upon [his]180-jude bass hand . The imposed hand was a little one [he]180-jude seemed to know , and [he]180-jude turned . "[1927-the martyr] Do n't stop , " said [Sue]174-sue . "[0-i] [I]0-i like it . [Jude]180-jude grasped it - just as [he]180-jude had done before [her]174-sue marriage . [Those earnest men [he]180-jude read of]5910-those earnest men he read of , [the saints , whom [Sue]174-sue , with gentle irreverence , called [[his]180-jude demi - gods]5912-his demi - gods]5911-the saints , whom sue , with gentle irreverence , called his demi - gods , would have shunned such encounters if [they]5911-the saints , whom sue , with gentle irreverence , called his demi - gods doubted [their]5911-the saints , whom sue , with gentle irreverence , called his demi - gods own strength . II However , if [God]177-god disposed not , [woman]4206-woman did . The next morning but [one]810-one brought [him]180-jude this note from [her]5901-her : Do n't come next week . Think no more than [you]180-jude can help of [SUSANNA FLORENCE MARY]174-sue . The disappointment was keen . It was absolutely necessary to communicate with [Sue]174-sue , though two or three days earlier [they]5925-the layers - out had agreed to mutual severance . [He]180-jude wrote in the briefest terms : [Aunt Drusilla]308-aunt drusilla is dead , having been taken almost suddenly . The funeral is on Friday afternoon . [He]180-jude remained in and about [Marygreen]1-marygreen through the intervening days , went out on Friday morning to see that the grave was finished , and wondered if [Sue]174-sue would come . [She]174-sue had not written , and that seemed to signify rather that [she]174-sue would come than that [she]174-sue would not . Having timed [her]174-sue by [her]174-sue only possible train , [he]180-jude locked the door about mid - day , and crossed [the hollow field]5927-the hollow field to [the verge of [the upland]523-the upland]5928-the verge of the upland by [the Brown House]790-the brown house , where [he]180-jude stood and looked over [the vast prospect northwards]5931-the vast prospect northwards , and over [the nearer landscape in which [Alfredston]20-alfredston stood]5932-the nearer landscape in which alfredston stood . Two miles behind [it]790-the brown house a jet of white steam was travelling from the left to the right of the picture . There was a long time to wait , even now , till [he]180-jude would know if [she]174-sue had arrived . [He]180-jude did wait , however , and at last [a small hired vehicle]5933-a small hired vehicle pulled up at [the bottom of [the hill]564-the hill]4321-the bottom of the hill , and [a person]1920-a person alighted , the conveyance going back , while [the passenger]5937-the passenger began ascending [the hill]564-the hill . [He]180-jude knew [her]174-sue ; and [she]174-sue looked so slender to - day that it seemed as if [she]174-sue might be crushed in the intensity of a too passionate embrace - such as it was not for [him]180-jude to give . Two - thirds of the way up [her]174-sue head suddenly took a solicitous poise , and [he]180-jude knew that [she]174-sue had at that moment recognized [him]180-jude . [Her]174-sue face soon began a pensive smile , which lasted till , having descended a little way , [he]180-jude met [her]174-sue . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " [she]174-sue began with nervous quickness , "[0-i] that it would be so sad to let [you]1977-you attend the funeral alone ! And so - at the last moment - [I]0-i came . " "[0-i] [Dear faithful Sue]174-sue ! " murmured [Jude]180-jude . With the elusiveness of [her]174-sue curious double nature , however , [Sue]174-sue did not stand still for any further greeting , though it wanted some time to the burial . A pathos so unusually compounded as that which attached to this hour was unlikely to repeat itself for years , if ever , and [Jude]180-jude would have paused , and meditated , and conversed . But [Sue]174-sue either saw it not at all , or , seeing it more than [he]180-jude , would not allow [herself]174-sue to feel it . The sad and simple ceremony was soon over , [their]5939-their progress to [the church]4809-the church being almost at a trot , [the bustling undertaker]5941-the bustling undertaker having a more important funeral an hour later , three miles off . [Drusilla]308-aunt drusilla was put into [the new ground]5942-the new ground , quite away from [[her]308-aunt drusilla ancestors]5943-her ancestors . "[174-sue] [She]1978-she was opposed to marriage , from first to last , [you]1979-you say ? " murmured [Sue]174-sue . "[1978-she] Yes . "[1978-she] [We]1981-we are rather [a sad family]1983-a sad family , do n't [you]1979-you think , [Jude]180-jude ? " "[1978-she] [She]1978-she said [we]1981-we made bad [husbands]960-husbands and [wives]961-wives . Certainly [we]1981-we make unhappy ones . At all events , [I]0-i do , for one ! " [Sue]174-sue was silent . "[0-i] Is it wrong , [Jude]180-jude , " [she]174-sue said with a tentative tremor , "[0-i] for [a husband]807-a husband or [wife]4501-wife to tell [a third person]1988-a third person that [they]1988-a third person are unhappy in [their]1988-a third person marriage ? If a marriage ceremony is a religious thing , it is possibly wrong ; but if it is only a sordid contract , based on material convenience in householding , rating , and taxing , and the inheritance of land and money by [children]4054-children , making it necessary that [the male parent]1990-the male parent should be known - which it seems to be - why surely [a person]1920-a person may say , even proclaim upon the housetops , that it hurts and grieves [him]1992-him or [her]1993-her ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have said so , anyhow , to [you]180-jude . " Presently [she]0-i went on : "[0-i] Are there [many couples]1994-many couples , do [you]180-jude think , where [one]810-one dislikes [the other]4340-the other for no definite fault ? " "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i suppose . If either cares for [another person]1997-another person , for instance . " "[0-i] But even apart from that ? Would n't [the woman]4031-the woman , for example , be very bad - natured if [she]4031-the woman did n't like to live with [[her]4031-the woman husband]3921-her husband ; merely " - [her]0-i voice undulated , and [he]180-jude guessed things - "[4031-the woman] merely because [she]4031-the woman had a personal feeling against it - a physical objection - a fastidiousness , or whatever it may be called - although [she]4031-the woman might respect and be grateful to [him]3921-her husband ? [I]0-i am merely putting a case . Ought [she]4031-the woman to try to overcome [her]4031-the woman pruderies ? " [Jude]180-jude threw a troubled look at [her]0-i . [He]180-jude said , looking away : "[4031-the woman] It would be just one of those cases in which [my]0-i experiences go contrary to [my]0-i dogmas . Speaking as [an order - loving man]2000-an order - loving man - which [I]0-i hope [I]0-i am , though [I]0-i fear [I]0-i am not - [I]0-i should say , yes . Speaking from experience and unbiased nature , [I]0-i should say , no .... [Sue]174-sue , [I]0-i believe [you]174-sue are not happy ! " "[174-sue] Of course [I]0-i am ! " [she]174-sue contradicted . "[174-sue] How can [a woman]4193-a woman be unhappy who has only been married eight weeks to [a man [she]4193-a woman chose freely]2002-a man she chose freely ? " "[4193-a woman] ' Chose freely ! "[174-sue] And it is said that what [a woman]4193-a woman shrinks from - in the early days of [her]4193-a woman marriage - [she]4193-a woman shakes down to with comfortable indifference in half a dozen years . But that is much like saying that the amputation of a limb is no affliction , since [a person]1920-a person gets comfortably accustomed to the use of a wooden leg or arm in the course of time ! " [Jude]180-jude could hardly speak , but [he]180-jude said , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought there was something wrong , [Sue]174-sue ! Oh , [I]0-i thought there was ! " "[0-i] But it is not as [you]174-sue think ! - there is nothing wrong except [my]0-i own wickedness , [I]0-i suppose [you]174-sue 'd call it - a repugnance on [my]0-i part , for a reason [I]0-i can not disclose , and what would not be admitted as one by [the world]706-the world in general ! ... What tortures [me]0-i so much is the necessity of being responsive to [this man]4146-this man whenever [he]4146-this man wishes , good as [he]4146-this man is morally ! - the dreadful contract to feel in a particular way in a matter whose essence is its voluntariness ! ... [I]0-i wish [he]4146-this man would beat [me]0-i , or be faithless to [me]0-i , or do some open thing that [I]0-i could talk about as a justification for feeling as [I]0-i do ! But [he]4146-this man does nothing , except that [he]4146-this man has grown a little cold since [he]4146-this man has found out how [I]0-i feel . That 's why [he]4146-this man did n't come to the funeral ... Oh , [I]0-i am very miserable - [I]0-i do n't know what to do ! ... " Instead of replying [she]0-i rose quickly , and saying [she]0-i was going to walk to [[her]0-i aunt]5567-her aunt 's grave in [the churchyard]500-the churchyard to recover [herself]0-i , went out of [the house]504-the house . Twenty minutes later [he]180-jude saw [her]0-i cross [the village green]5951-the village green towards [[Mrs. Edlin]313-mrs. edlin 's]5952-mrs. edlin 's , and soon [she]313-mrs. edlin sent [a little girl]593-a little girl to fetch [her]313-mrs. edlin bag , and tell [him]180-jude [she]313-mrs. edlin was too tired to see [him]180-jude again that night . In [the lonely room of [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt 's house]5954-the lonely room of his aunt 's house , [Jude]180-jude sat watching [the cottage of [the Widow Edlin]309-the widow edlin]5956-the cottage of the widow edlin as it disappeared behind the night shade . [He]180-jude knew that [Sue]174-sue was sitting within [its]5956-the cottage of the widow edlin walls equally lonely and disheartened ; and again questioned [his]180-jude devotional motto that all was for the best . [He]180-jude retired to rest early , but [his]180-jude sleep was fitful from the sense that [Sue]174-sue was so near at hand . At some time near two o'clock , when [he]180-jude was beginning to sleep more soundly , [he]180-jude was aroused by a shrill squeak that had been familiar enough to [him]180-jude when [he]180-jude lived regularly at [Marygreen]1-marygreen . It was the cry of a rabbit caught in a gin . As was [the little creature]5957-the little creature 's habit , it did not soon repeat [its]5957-the little creature cry ; and probably would not do so more than once or twice ; but would remain bearing its torture till the morrow when [the trapper]5958-the trapper would come and knock it on the head . [[He]180-jude who in [his]180-jude childhood had saved the lives of [the earthworms]5960-the earthworms]5959-he who in his childhood had saved the lives of the earthworms now began to picture the agonies of the rabbit from [its]5957-the little creature lacerated leg . If it were a "[180-jude] bad catch " by the hind - leg , the animal would tug during the ensuing six hours till the iron teeth of the trap had stripped the leg - bone of [its]5957-the little creature flesh , when , should a weak - springed instrument enable [it]5957-the little creature to escape , [it]5957-the little creature would die in [the fields]5256-the fields from the mortification of the limb . If it were a "[180-jude] good catch , " namely , by the fore - leg , the bone would be broken and the limb nearly torn in two in attempts at an impossible escape . Almost half an hour passed , and the rabbit repeated [its]5957-the little creature cry . [Jude]180-jude could rest no longer till [he]180-jude had put [it]5957-the little creature out of [its]5957-the little creature pain , so dressing [himself]180-jude quickly [he]180-jude descended , and by the light of the moon went across [the green]464-the green in the direction of [the sound]5963-the sound . [He]180-jude reached the hedge bordering [[the widow]5702-the widow 's garden]5965-the widow 's garden , when [he]180-jude stood still . The faint click of the trap as dragged about by the writhing animal guided [him]180-jude now , and reaching the spot [he]180-jude struck the rabbit on the back of the neck with the side of [his]180-jude palm , and it stretched itself out dead . [He]180-jude was turning away when [he]180-jude saw [a woman]4193-a woman looking out of the open casement at a window on [the ground floor of [the adjacent cottage]5968-the adjacent cottage]5967-the ground floor of the adjacent cottage . "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude ! " said a voice timidly - [Sue]174-sue 's voice . "[180-jude] It is [you]180-jude - is it not ? " "[180-jude] Yes , [dear]795-dear ! " "[180-jude] [I]0-i have n't been able to sleep at all , and then [I]0-i heard the rabbit , and could n't help thinking of what it suffered , till [I]0-i felt [I]0-i must come down and kill it ! "[795-dear] That may have BEEN [my]0-i view ; but [my]0-i doctrines and [I]0-i begin to part company . " "[0-i] [I]0-i knew it - [I]0-i knew it ! And that 's why [I]0-i vowed [I]0-i would n't disturb [your]795-dear belief .
