" [Jude]180-jude seized [her]795-dear hand and kissed it . "[2041-a stronger one left] There is [a stronger one left]2041-a stronger one left ! " [he]180-jude said . "[2041-a stronger one left] [I]0-i 'll never care about [my]0-i doctrines or [my]0-i religion any more ! Let [them]2042-them go ! Let [me]0-i help [you]795-dear , even if [I]0-i do love [you]795-dear , and even if [you]795-dear ... " "[795-dear] Do n't say it ! - [I]0-i know what [you]795-dear mean ; but [I]0-i ca n't admit so much as that . There ! Guess what [you]795-dear like , but do n't press [me]0-i to answer questions ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]795-dear were happy , whatever [I]0-i may be ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i CAN'T be ! So [few]2043-few could enter into [my]0-i feeling - [they]2043-few would say ' twas [my]0-i fanciful fastidiousness , or something of that sort , and condemn [me]0-i ... It is none of the natural tragedies of love that 's love 's usual tragedy in civilized life , but a tragedy artificially manufactured for [people who in a natural state]2044-people who in a natural state would find relief in parting ! ... It would have been wrong , perhaps , for [me]0-i to tell [my]0-i distress to [you]795-dear , if [I]0-i had been able to tell it to [anybody else]695-anybody else . But [I]0-i have [nobody]4069-nobody . And [I]0-i MUST tell [somebody]4067-somebody ! [Jude]180-jude , before [I]0-i married [him]180-jude [I]0-i had never thought out fully what marriage meant , even though [I]0-i knew . It was idiotic of [me]0-i - there is no excuse . [I]0-i was old enough , and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was very experienced . So [I]0-i rushed on , when [I]0-i had got into [that training school]2048-that training school scrape , with all the cock - sureness of the fool that [I]0-i was ! ... [I]0-i am certain [one]810-one ought to be allowed to undo what [one]810-one had done so ignorantly ! [I]0-i daresay it happens to [lots of women]2051-lots of women , only [they]2051-lots of women submit , and [I]0-i kick ... When [people of a later age]2052-people of a later age look back upon the barbarous customs and superstitions of the times that [we]2053-we have the unhappiness to live in , what WILL [they]2052-people of a later age say ! " "[2052-people of a later age] [You]0-i are very bitter , [darling Sue]174-sue ! How [I]0-i wish - [I]0-i wish - " "[0-i] [You]0-i must go in now ! " In a moment of impulse [she]174-sue bent over the sill , and laid [her]174-sue face upon [his]5969-he hair , weeping , and then imprinting a scarcely perceptible little kiss upon the top of [his]5969-he head , withdrawing quickly , so that [he]5969-he could not put [his]5969-he arms round [her]174-sue , as otherwise [he]5969-he unquestionably would have done . [She]174-sue shut the casement , and [he]5969-he returned to [[his]5969-he cottage]4297-his cottage . III [Sue]174-sue 's distressful confession recurred to [Jude]180-jude 's mind all the night as being a sorrow indeed . The morning after , when it was time for [her]174-sue to go , [the neighbours]5971-the neighbours saw [[her]174-sue companion]5972-her companion and [herself]174-sue disappearing on foot down [the hill path which led into [the lonely road]5974-the lonely road to [Alfredston]20-alfredston]5973-the hill path which led into the lonely road to alfredston . An hour passed before [he]5969-he returned along [the same route]5975-the same route , and in [his]5969-he face there was a look of exaltation not unmixed with recklessness . An incident had occurred . [They]5976-they had stood parting in [the silent highway]5977-the silent highway , and [their]5976-they tense and passionate moods had led to bewildered inquiries of [each other]4188-each other on how far [their]5976-they intimacy ought to go ; till [they]5976-they had almost quarrelled , and [she]174-sue said tearfully that it was hardly proper of [him]5969-he as [a parson]4309-a parson in embryo to think of such a thing as kissing [her]174-sue even in farewell as [he]5969-he now wished to do . Then [she]174-sue had conceded that the fact of the kiss would be nothing : all would depend upon the spirit of it . If given in the spirit of [a cousin]5980-a cousin and [a friend]4804-a friend [she]174-sue saw no objection : if in the spirit of [a lover]4803-a lover [she]174-sue could not permit it . "[0-i] Will [you]2054-you swear that it will not be in that spirit ? " [she]174-sue had said . No : [he]5969-he would not . And then [they]5976-they had turned from [each other]4188-each other in estrangement , and gone [their]5976-they several ways , till at a distance of twenty or thirty yards [both]5984-both had looked round simultaneously . That look behind was fatal to [the reserve hitherto more or less maintained]5985-the reserve hitherto more or less maintained . [They]5976-they had quickly run back , and met , and embracing most unpremeditatedly , kissed close and long . When [they]5976-they parted for good it was with flushed cheeks on [her]174-sue side , and a beating heart on [his]5969-he . The kiss was a turning - point in [Jude]180-jude 's career . Back again in [the cottage]501-the cottage , and left to reflection , [he]5969-he saw one thing : that though [his]5969-he kiss of [that aerial being]5987-that aerial being had seemed the purest moment of [his]5969-he faultful life , as long as [he]5969-he nourished this unlicensed tenderness it was glaringly inconsistent for [him]5969-he to pursue the idea of becoming [the soldier]5988-the soldier and servant of a religion in which sexual love was regarded as at its best a frailty , and at its worst damnation . What [Sue]174-sue had said in warmth was really the cold truth . When to defend [his]5969-he affection tooth and nail , to persist with headlong force in impassioned attentions to [her]174-sue , was all [he]5969-he thought of , [he]5969-he was condemned ipso facto as [a professor of the accepted school of morals]5989-a professor of the accepted school of morals . [He]5969-he was as unfit , obviously , by nature , as [he]5969-he had been by social position , to fill the part of [a propounder of accredited dogma]5990-a propounder of accredited dogma . Strange that [his]5969-he first aspiration - towards academical proficiency - had been checked by [a woman]4193-a woman , and that [his]5969-he second aspiration - towards apostleship - had also been checked by [a woman]4193-a woman . "[2054-you] Is it , " [he]5969-he said , "[2054-you] that [the women]4764-the women are to blame ; or is it the artificial system of things , under which the normal sex - impulses are turned into devilish domestic gins and springs to noose and hold back [those who want to progress]2056-those who want to progress ? " It had been [his]5969-he standing desire to become [a prophet]5993-a prophet , however humble , to [his]5969-he struggling fellow - creatures , without any thought of personal gain . Yet with [a wife]940-a wife living away from [him]5969-he with [another husband]5995-another husband , and [himself]5969-he in love erratically , [the loved one]5996-the loved one 's revolt against [her]5996-the loved one state being possibly on [his]5969-he account , [he]5969-he had sunk to be barely respectable according to regulation views . It was not for [him]5969-he to consider further : [he]5969-he had only to confront the obvious , which was that [he]5969-he had made [himself]5969-he quite [an impostor]4955-an impostor as [a law - abiding religious teacher]5998-a law - abiding religious teacher . At dusk that evening [he]5969-he went into [the garden]521-the garden and dug a shallow hole , to which [he]5969-he brought out all the theological and ethical works that [he]5969-he possessed , and had stored [here]3898-here . [He]5969-he knew that , in [this country]4946-this country of [true believers]6002-true believers , most of [them]6002-true believers were not saleable at a much higher price than waste - paper value , and preferred to get rid of [them]6002-true believers in [his]5969-he own way , even if [he]5969-he should sacrifice a little money to the sentiment of thus destroying them . Lighting some loose pamphlets to begin with , [he]5969-he cut the volumes into pieces as well as [he]5969-he could , and with a three - pronged fork shook them over the flames . They kindled , and lighted up the back of [the house]504-the house , the pigsty , and [his]5969-he own face , till they were more or less consumed . Though [he]5969-he was almost a stranger here now , [passing cottagers]6004-passing cottagers talked to [him]5969-he over the garden hedge . "[2054-you] Burning up [[your]2057-your awld aunt]2058-your awld aunt 's rubbidge , [I]0-i suppose ? Ay ; a lot gets heaped up in nooks and corners when [you]2057-your 've lived eighty years in [one house]2059-one house . " It was nearly one o'clock in the morning before the leaves , covers , and binding of [Jeremy Taylor]328-jeremy taylor , [Butler]279-butler , [Doddridge]329-doddridge , [Paley]278-paley , [Pusey]280-pusey , [Newman]259-newman and [the rest]6005-the rest had gone to ashes , but the night was quiet , and as [he]5969-he turned and turned the paper shreds with the fork , the sense of being no longer [a hypocrite to [himself]5969-he]6006-a hypocrite to himself afforded [his]5969-he mind a relief which gave [him]5969-he calm . [He]5969-he might go on believing as before , but [he]5969-he professed nothing , and no longer owned and exhibited engines of faith which , as [[their]6007-their proprietor]6008-their proprietor , [he]5969-he might naturally be supposed to exercise on [himself]5969-he first of all . In [his]5969-he passion for [Sue]174-sue [he]5969-he could not stand as [an ordinary sinner]6009-an ordinary sinner , and not as [a whited sepulchre]6010-a whited sepulchre . [Meanwhile Sue]174-sue , after parting from [him]5969-he earlier in the day , had gone along to [the station]5059-the station , with tears in [her]174-sue eyes for having run back and let [him]5969-he kiss [her]174-sue . [Jude]180-jude ought not to have pretended that [he]5969-he was not [a lover]4803-a lover , and made [her]174-sue give way to an impulse to act unconventionally , if not wrongly . [She]174-sue was inclined to call it the latter ; for [Sue]174-sue 's logic was extraordinarily compounded , and seemed to maintain that before a thing was done it might be right to do , but that being done it became wrong ; or , in other words , that things which were right in theory were wrong in practice . "[0-i] [I]0-i have been too weak , [I]0-i think ! " [she]0-i jerked out as [she]0-i pranced on , shaking down tear - drops now and then . "[0-i] It was burning , like [a lover]4803-a lover 's - oh , it was ! And [I]0-i wo n't write to [him]2061-him any more , or at least for a long time , to impress [him]2061-him with [my]0-i dignity ! And [I]0-i hope it will hurt [him]2061-him very much - expecting a letter to - morrow morning , and the next , and the next , and no letter coming . [He]2061-him 'll suffer then with suspense - wo n't [he]2061-him , that 's all ! - and [I]0-i am very glad of it ! " - Tears of pity for [Jude]180-jude 's approaching sufferings at [her]0-i hands mingled with those which had surged up in pity for [herself]0-i . Then [the slim little wife of [a husband whose person was disagreeable to [her]0-i]6014-a husband whose person was disagreeable to her , [the ethereal , fine - nerved , sensitive girl , quite unfitted by temperament and instinct to fulfil the conditions of the matrimonial relation]6015-the ethereal , fine - nerved , sensitive girl , quite unfitted by temperament and instinct to fulfil the conditions of the matrimonial relation with [Phillotson]163-phillotson , possibly with scarce [any man]5390-any man , walked fitfully along , and panted , and brought weariness into [her]0-i eyes by gazing and worrying hopelessly]6013-the slim little wife of a husband whose person was disagreeable to her , the ethereal , fine - nerved , sensitive girl , quite unfitted by temperament and instinct to fulfil the conditions of the matrimonial relation with phillotson , possibly with scarce any man , walked fitfully along , and panted , and brought weariness into her eyes by gazing and worrying hopelessly . [Phillotson]163-phillotson met [her]0-i at [the arrival station]6017-the arrival station , and , seeing that [she]0-i was troubled , thought it must be owing to the depressing effect of [[her]0-i aunt]5567-her aunt 's death and funeral . [He]163-phillotson began telling [her]0-i of [his]163-phillotson day 's doings , and how [[his]163-phillotson friend]1009-his friend [Gillingham]331-gillingham , [a neighbouring schoolmaster whom [he]163-phillotson had not seen for years]6020-a neighbouring schoolmaster whom he had not seen for years , had called upon [him]163-phillotson . " [They]6024-they lapsed into silence . Had this been a case in [the court of [an omniscient judge]6026-an omniscient judge]6025-the court of an omniscient judge , [he]163-phillotson might have entered on [his]163-phillotson notes the curious fact that [Sue]174-sue had placed [the minor]6027-the minor for the major indiscretion , and had not said a word about the kiss . After tea that evening [Phillotson]163-phillotson sat balancing [the school registers]6028-the school registers . [She]174-sue remained in an unusually silent , tense , and restless condition , and at last , saying [she]174-sue was tired , went to bed early . When [Phillotson]163-phillotson arrived [upstairs]4313-upstairs , weary with the drudgery of the attendance - numbers , it was a quarter to twelve o'clock . Entering [[their]6024-they chamber]4450-their chamber , which by day commanded a view of some thirty or forty miles over [the Vale of Blackmoor]91-the deep alluvial vale of blackmoor , and even into [Outer Wessex]101-outer wessex , [he]163-phillotson went to the window , and , pressing [his]163-phillotson face against the pane , gazed with hard - breathing fixity into the mysterious darkness which now covered the far - reaching scene . [He]163-phillotson was musing , "[0-i] [I]0-i think , " [he]163-phillotson said at last , without turning [his]163-phillotson head , "[0-i] that [I]0-i must get [the committee]2062-the committee to change the school - stationer . All the copybooks are sent wrong this time . " There was no reply . Thinking [Sue]174-sue was dozing [he]163-phillotson went on : "[2062-the committee] And there must be a rearrangement of that ventilator in [the class - room]2063-the class - room . The wind blows down upon [my]0-i head unmercifully and gives [me]0-i the ear - ache . " As the silence seemed more absolute than ordinarily [he]163-phillotson turned round . The heavy , gloomy oak wainscot , which extended over the walls [upstairs]4313-upstairs and down in [the dilapidated "[2064-you] Old - Grove Place]6032-the dilapidated " old - grove place , " and the massive chimney - piece reaching to the ceiling , stood in odd contrast to the new and shining brass bedstead , and the new suite of birch furniture that [he]163-phillotson had bought for [her]174-sue , the two styles seeming to nod to each other across three centuries upon the shaking floor . "[2064-you] Soo ! " [he]163-phillotson said this being the way in which [he]163-phillotson pronounced [her]174-sue name . [She]174-sue was not in the bed , though [she]174-sue had apparently been there - the clothes on [her]174-sue side being flung back . " "[2064-you] Yes ! " came back to [him]163-phillotson in [her]174-sue voice , from the distant [kitchen quarter]6036-kitchen quarter . "[2064-you] What are [you]2064-you doing down there at midnight - tiring [yourself]2064-you out for nothing ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not sleepy ; [I]0-i am reading ; and there is a larger fire here . " [He]163-phillotson went to bed . Some time in the night [he]163-phillotson awoke . [She]174-sue was not [there]3887-there , even now . Under the staircase was [a large clothes - closet]6039-a large clothes - closet , without a window ; they seemed to come from [it]3887-there . The door was shut , but there was no lock or other fastening . [Phillotson]163-phillotson , alarmed , went towards [it]3887-there , wondering if [she]174-sue had suddenly become deranged . " The ringing of the school bell saved [Phillotson]258-phillotson from the necessity of replying at present to what apparently did not strike [him]180-jude as being such a convincing argumentum ad verecundiam as [she]258-phillotson , in [her]258-phillotson loss of courage at the last moment , meant it to appear . [She]258-phillotson was beginning to be so puzzling and unstateable that [he]180-jude was ready to throw in with [her]258-phillotson other little peculiarities the extremest request which [a wife]940-a wife could make . [They]2098-our proceeded to [the schools]5859-the schools that morning as usual , [Sue]174-sue entering [the class - room]2063-the class - room , where [he]180-jude could see the back of [her]174-sue head through the glass partition whenever [he]180-jude turned [his]180-jude eyes that way . As [he]180-jude went on giving and hearing lessons [his]180-jude forehead and eyebrows twitched from concentrated agitation of thought , till at length [he]180-jude tore a scrap from a sheet of scribbling paper and wrote : [Your]174-sue request prevents [my]258-phillotson attending to work at all . [I]258-phillotson do n't know what [I]258-phillotson am doing ! Was it seriously made ? [He]180-jude folded the piece of paper very small , and gave it to [a little boy]4938-a little boy to take to [Sue]174-sue . [The child]3918-the child toddled off into [the class - room]2063-the class - room . [Phillotson]258-phillotson saw [[his]180-jude wife]4427-his wife turn and take the note , and the bend of [her]174-sue pretty head as [she]174-sue read it , [her]174-sue lips slightly crisped , to prevent undue expression under fire of so many young eyes . [He]180-jude could not see [her]174-sue hands , but [she]174-sue changed [her]174-sue position , and soon [the child]3918-the child returned , bringing nothing in reply . In a few minutes , however , one of [Sue]174-sue 's class appeared , with a little note similar to [his]180-jude own . These words only were pencilled therein : [I]258-phillotson am sincerely sorry to say that it was seriously made . [Phillotson]258-phillotson looked more disturbed than before , and the meeting - place of [his]180-jude brows twitched again . In ten minutes [he]180-jude called up [the child [he]180-jude had just sent to [her]174-sue]6059-the child he had just sent to her , and dispatched another missive : [God]177-god knows [I]258-phillotson do n't want to thwart [you]6059-the child he had just sent to her in any reasonable way . [My]258-phillotson whole thought is to make [you]6059-the child he had just sent to her comfortable and happy . But [I]258-phillotson can not agree to such a preposterous notion as [your]6059-the child he had just sent to her going to live with [[your]6059-the child he had just sent to her lover]6060-your lover . [You]6059-the child he had just sent to her would lose [everybody]411-everybody 's respect and regard ; and so should [I]258-phillotson ! After an interval a similar part was enacted in [the class - room]2063-the class - room , and an answer came : [I]258-phillotson know [you]6059-the child he had just sent to her mean [my]258-phillotson good . But [I]258-phillotson do n't want to be respectable ! To produce "[258-phillotson] Human development in its richest diversity " to quote [your]6059-the child he had just sent to her Humboldt is to [my]177-god mind far above respectability . No doubt [my]177-god tastes are low - in [your]6059-the child he had just sent to her view - hopelessly low ! If [you]6059-the child he had just sent to her won t let [me]177-god go to [him]6063-him , will [you]6059-the child he had just sent to her grant [me]177-god this one request - allow [me]177-god to live in [[your]6059-the child he had just sent to her house]1536-your house in a separate way ? To this [he]177-god returned no answer . [She]258-phillotson wrote again : [I]177-god know what [you]177-god think . But can not [you]177-god have pity on [me]177-god ? [I]177-god beg [you]177-god to ; [I]177-god implore [you]177-god to be merciful ! [I]177-god would not ask if [I]177-god were not almost compelled by what [I]177-god ca n't bear ! [No poor woman]6065-no poor woman has ever wished more than [I]177-god that [Eve]334-eve had not fallen , so that as [the primitive Christians]6066-the primitive christians believed some harmless mode of vegetation might have peopled [Paradise]102-paradise . But [I]177-god wo n't trifle ! Be kind to [me]177-god - even though [I]177-god have not been kind to [you]177-god ! [I]177-god will go away , go abroad , anywhere , and never trouble [you]177-god . Nearly an hour passed , and then [he]177-god returned an answer : [I]177-god do not wish to pain [you]177-god . How well [you]177-god KNOW [I]177-god do n't ! Give [me]177-god a little time . [I]177-god am disposed to agree to [your]177-god last request . One line from [her]6067-her : Thank [you]177-god from [my]177-god heart , [Richard]258-phillotson . [I]177-god do not deserve [your]177-god kindness . All day [Phillotson]258-phillotson bent a dazed regard upon [her]6067-her through the glazed partition ; and [he]177-god felt as lonely as when [he]177-god had not known [her]6067-her . But [he]177-god was as good as [his]177-god word , and consented to [her]6067-her living apart in [the house]504-the house . At first , when [they]6069-they met at meals , [she]6067-her had seemed more composed under the new arrangement ; but the irksomeness of [their]6069-they position worked on [her]6067-her temperament , and the fibres of [her]6067-her nature seemed strained like harp - strings . [She]6067-her talked vaguely and indiscriminately to prevent [his]177-god talking pertinently . [IV Phillotson]335-phillotson was sitting up late , as was often [his]177-god custom , trying to get together the materials for [his]177-god long - neglected hobby of Roman antiquities . For the first time since reviving the subject [he]177-god felt a return of [his]177-god old interest in it . [He]177-god forgot time and place , and when [he]177-god remembered [himself]177-god and ascended to rest it was nearly two o'clock . [His]177-god preoccupation was such that , though [he]177-god now slept on the other side of [the house]504-the house , [he]177-god mechanically went to [the room that [he]177-god and [[his]177-god wife]4427-his wife had occupied when [he]177-god first became [a tenant of [Old - Grove Place]98-old - grove place]6073-a tenant of old - grove place]6071-the room that he and his wife had occupied when he first became a tenant of old - grove place [, which since [his]177-god differences with [Sue]174-sue had been [hers]174-sue exclusively]6074-, which since his differences with sue had been hers exclusively . [He]177-god entered , and unconsciously began to undress . There was a cry from the bed , and a quick movement . Before [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster had realized where [he]177-god was [he]177-god perceived [Sue]174-sue starting up half - awake , staring wildly , and springing out upon the floor on the side away from [him]177-god , which was towards the window . This was somewhat hidden by the canopy of the bedstead , and in a moment [he]177-god heard [her]174-sue flinging up the sash . Before [he]177-god had thought that [she]174-sue meant to do more than get air [she]174-sue had mounted upon the sill and leapt out . [She]174-sue disappeared in the darkness , and [he]177-god heard [her]174-sue fall below . [Phillotson]335-phillotson , horrified , ran [downstairs]4245-downstairs , striking [himself]335-phillotson sharply against the newel in [his]335-phillotson haste . Opening the heavy door [he]335-phillotson ascended the two or three steps to the level of the ground , and there on the gravel before [him]335-phillotson lay a white heap . [Phillotson]335-phillotson seized it in [his]335-phillotson arms , and bringing [Sue]174-sue into [the hall]6077-the hall seated [her]174-sue on a chair , where [he]335-phillotson gazed at [her]174-sue by the flapping light of the candle which [he]335-phillotson had set down in the draught on the bottom stair . [She]174-sue had certainly not broken [her]174-sue neck . [She]174-sue looked at [him]335-phillotson with eyes that seemed not to take [him]335-phillotson in ; and though not particularly large in general they appeared so now . [She]174-sue pressed [her]174-sue side and rubbed [her]174-sue arm , as if conscious of pain ; then stood up , averting [her]174-sue face , in evident distress at [his]335-phillotson gaze . "[177-god] Thank [God]177-god - [you]2099-you are not killed ! Though it 's not for want of trying - not much hurt [I]0-i hope ? " [Her]174-sue fall , in fact , had not been a serious one , probably owing to the lowness of [the old rooms]6078-the old rooms and to the high level of the ground without . Beyond a scraped elbow and a blow in the side [she]174-sue had apparently incurred little harm . "[0-i] [I]0-i was asleep , [I]0-i think ! " [she]174-sue began , [her]174-sue pale face still turned away from [him]335-phillotson . "[0-i] And something frightened [me]0-i - a terrible dream - [I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw [you]2099-you - " The actual circumstances seemed to come back to [her]174-sue , and [she]174-sue was silent . [Her]174-sue cloak was hanging at the back of the door , and [the wretched Phillotson]335-phillotson flung it round [her]174-sue . "[0-i] Shall [I]0-i help [you]2099-you [upstairs]4313-upstairs ? " [he]335-phillotson asked drearily ; for the significance of all this sickened [him]335-phillotson of [himself]335-phillotson and of everything . "[0-i] No thank [you]2099-you , [Richard]258-phillotson . [I]0-i am very little hurt . [I]0-i can walk . " "[0-i] [You]2099-you ought to lock [your]2099-you door , " [he]335-phillotson mechanically said , as if lecturing in [school]5856-school . "[2099-you] Then [no one]2101-no one could intrude even by accident . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have tried - it wo n't lock . All the doors are out of order . " The aspect of things was not improved by [her]174-sue admission . [She]174-sue ascended the staircase slowly , the waving light of the candle shining on [her]174-sue . [Phillotson]258-phillotson did not approach [her]174-sue , or attempt to ascend [himself]258-phillotson till [he]335-phillotson heard [her]174-sue enter [[her]174-sue room]6080-her room . Then [he]335-phillotson fastened up the front door , and returning , sat down on the lower stairs , holding the newel with one hand , and bowing [his]335-phillotson face into the other . Thus [he]335-phillotson remained for a long long time - a pitiable object enough to [one who had seen [him]335-phillotson]6081-one who had seen him ; till , raising [his]335-phillotson head and sighing a sigh which seemed to say that the business of [his]335-phillotson life must be carried on , whether [he]335-phillotson had [a wife]940-a wife or no , [he]335-phillotson took the candle and went [upstairs]4313-upstairs to [[his]335-phillotson lonely room]6084-his lonely room on the other side of [the landing]5023-the landing . No further incident touching the matter between [them]6086-them occurred till the following evening , when , immediately school was over , [Phillotson]258-phillotson walked out of [Shaston]4-shaston , saying [he]335-phillotson required no tea , and not informing [Sue]174-sue where [he]335-phillotson was going . [He]335-phillotson descended from [the town]4154-the town level by [a steep road]6088-a steep road in a north - westerly direction , and continued to move downwards till the soil changed from its white dryness to a tough brown clay . [He]335-phillotson was now on [the low alluvial beds Where [Duncliffe]103-duncliffe]6089-the low alluvial beds where duncliffe is [the traveller]6090-the traveller 's mark , And cloty [Stour]104-stour 's a - rolling dark . More than once [he]335-phillotson looked back in the increasing obscurity of evening . Against the sky was [Shaston]4-shaston , dimly visible On the grey - topp'd height Of [Paladore]105-paladore , as pale day wore Away ... [William Barnes]336-willis . The new - lit lights from [its]4-shaston windows burnt with a steady shine as if watching [him]335-phillotson , one of which windows was [his]335-phillotson own . Above it [he]335-phillotson could just discern [the pinnacled tower of [Trinity Church]99-trinity church]6091-the pinnacled tower of trinity church . The air down here , tempered by the thick damp bed of tenacious clay , was not as it had been above , but soft and relaxing , so that when [he]335-phillotson had walked a mile or two [he]335-phillotson was obliged to wipe [his]335-phillotson face with [his]335-phillotson handkerchief . "[0-i] Stick to [her]2160-her ! How permanently it was imprinted upon [his]331-gillingham vision ; that look of [her]2160-her as [she]2160-her glided into [the parlour]6123-the parlour to tea ; [a slim flexible figure]6124-a slim flexible figure ; a face , strained from its roundness , and marked by the pallors of restless days and nights , suggesting tragic possibilities quite at variance with [her]2160-her times of buoyancy ; a trying of this morsel and that , and an inability to eat either . [I]0-i may hold the opinion that , in a proper state of society , [the father of [a woman]4193-a woman 's child]2217-the father of a woman 's child will be as much a private matter of [hers]4193-a woman as [the cut of [her]4193-a woman underlinen]2219-the cut of her underlinen , on whom [nobody]4069-nobody will have any right to question [her]4193-a woman . If there had been a rope - ladder , and [he]2217-the father of a woman 's child had run after [us]2221-we with pistols , it would have seemed different , and [I]0-i may have acted otherwise . [VI]180-jude In returning to [[his]841-darling native town of [Shaston]4-shaston]5352-his native town of shaston as [schoolmaster Phillotson]6175-schoolmaster phillotson had won the interest and awakened the memories of [the inhabitants]5330-the inhabitants , who , though [they]5330-the inhabitants did not honour [him]841-darling for [his]841-darling miscellaneous aquirements as [he]841-darling would have been honoured elsewhere , retained for [him]841-darling a sincere regard . When , shortly after [his]841-darling arrival , [he]841-darling brought [home]3897-home [a pretty wife]6178-a pretty wife - awkwardly pretty for [him]841-darling , if [he]841-darling did not take care , [they]5330-the inhabitants said - [they]5330-the inhabitants were glad to have [her]6178-a pretty wife settle among [them]5330-the inhabitants . For some time after [her]6178-a pretty wife flight from [that home [Sue]174-sue 's absence]6179-that home sue 's absence did not excite comment . [Her]6178-a pretty wife place as monitor in [the school]458-the school was taken by [another young woman]6181-another young woman within a few days of [her]6178-a pretty wife vacating [it]458-the school , which substitution also passed without remark , [Sue]174-sue 's services having been of a provisional nature only . When , however , a month had passed , and [Phillotson]258-phillotson casually admitted to [an acquaintance]6182-an acquaintance that [he]841-darling did not know where [[his]841-darling wife]4427-his wife was staying , curiosity began to be aroused ; till , jumping to conclusions , [people]658-people ventured to affirm that [Sue]174-sue had played [him]841-darling false and run away from [him]841-darling . [The schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's growing languor and listlessness over [his]841-darling work gave countenance to the idea . Though [Phillotson]258-phillotson had held [his]841-darling tongue as long as [he]841-darling could , except to [[his]841-darling friend]1009-his friend [Gillingham]331-gillingham , [his]841-darling honesty and directness would not allow [him]841-darling to do so when misapprehensions as to [Sue]174-sue 's conduct spread abroad . On a Monday morning [the chairman of the school committee]6187-the chairman of the school committee called , and after attending to the business of [the school]458-the school drew [Phillotson]258-phillotson aside out of earshot of [the children]4875-the children . "[2297-sweet] [You]2298-you 'll excuse [my]0-i asking , [Phillotson]258-phillotson , since [everybody]411-everybody is talking of it : is this true as to [your]258-phillotson domestic affairs - that [[your]258-phillotson wife]967-your wife 's going away was on no visit , but a secret elopement with [a lover]4803-a lover ? If so , [I]0-i condole with [you]258-phillotson . " "[0-i] Do n't , " said [Phillotson]258-phillotson . "[0-i] There was no secret about it . " "[967-your wife] [She]967-your wife has gone to visit [friends]1427-friends ? " "[967-your wife] No . " "[967-your wife] Then what has happened ? " "[967-your wife] [She]967-your wife has gone away under circumstances that usually call for condolence with [the husband]2303-the husband . But [I]0-i gave [my]0-i consent . " [The chairman]6190-the chairman looked as if [he]6190-the chairman had not apprehended the remark . "[0-i] What [I]0-i say is quite true , " [Phillotson]258-phillotson continued testily . "[0-i] [She]967-your wife asked leave to go away with [[her]967-your wife lover]4279-her lover , and [I]0-i let [her]967-your wife . Why should n't [I]0-i ? [A woman of full age]2305-a woman of full age , it was a question of [her]967-your wife own conscience - not for [me]0-i . [I]0-i was not [[her]967-your wife gaoler]2306-her gaoler . [I]0-i ca n't explain any further . [I]0-i do n't wish to be questioned . " [The children]4875-the children observed that much seriousness marked the faces of [the two men]6192-the two men , and went [home]3897-home and told [[their]4875-the children parents]6194-their parents that something new had happened about [Mrs. Phillotson]258-phillotson . Then [[Phillotson]258-phillotson 's little maidservant , who was [a schoolgirl just out of [her]967-your wife standards]6196-a schoolgirl just out of her standards]6195-phillotson 's little maidservant , who was a schoolgirl just out of her standards , said that [Mr. Phillotson]163-phillotson had helped in [[his]163-phillotson wife]4427-his wife 's packing , had offered [her]4427-his wife what money [she]4427-his wife required , and had written a friendly letter to [[her]4427-his wife young man]1549-her young man , telling [him]1549-her young man to take care of [her]4427-his wife . [The chairman of committee]6199-the chairman of committee thought the matter over , and talked to [the other managers of [the school]458-the school]6200-the other managers of the school , till a request came to [Phillotson]163-phillotson to meet [them]6200-the other managers of the school privately . The meeting lasted a long time , and at the end [the school - master]508-the school - master came [home]3897-home , looking as usual pale and worn . [Gillingham]331-gillingham was sitting in [[his]331-gillingham house]5370-his house awaiting [him]163-phillotson . "[2307-you] Well ; it is as [you]2307-you said , " observed [Phillotson]163-phillotson , flinging [himself]0-i down wearily in a chair . "[2307-you] [They]2308-they have requested [me]0-i to send in [my]0-i resignation on account of [my]0-i scandalous conduct in giving [[my]0-i tortured wife]2309-my tortured wife [her]2309-my tortured wife liberty - or , as [they]2308-they call it , condoning [her]2309-my tortured wife adultery . But [I]0-i sha n't resign ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i would . " "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't . It is no business of theirs . It does n't affect [me]0-i in [my]0-i public capacity at all . [They]2308-they may expel [me]0-i if [they]2308-they like . " "[2308-they] If [you]0-i make a fuss it will get into the papers , and [you]0-i 'll never get appointed to [another school]2310-another school . [You]0-i see , [they]2308-they have to consider what [you]0-i did as done by [a teacher of youth]2311-a teacher of youth - and its effects as such upon the morals of [the town]4154-the town ; and , to ordinary opinion , [your]0-i position is indefensible . [You]0-i must let [me]0-i say that . " To this good advice , however , [Phillotson]163-phillotson would not listen . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't care , " [he]163-phillotson said . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't go unless [I]0-i am turned out . And for this reason ; that by resigning [I]0-i acknowledge [I]0-i have acted wrongly by [her]2313-her ; when [I]0-i am more and more convinced every day that in the sight of Heaven and by all natural , straightforward humanity , [I]0-i have acted rightly . " [Gillingham]331-gillingham saw that [[his]331-gillingham rather headstrong friend]6205-his rather headstrong friend would not be able to maintain such a position as this ; but [he]331-gillingham said nothing further , and in due time - indeed , in a quarter of an hour - the formal letter of dismissal arrived , [the managers]420-the managers having remained behind to write it after [Phillotson]163-phillotson 's withdrawal . [The latter]444-the latter replied that [he]331-gillingham should not accept dismissal ; and called a public meeting , which [he]331-gillingham attended , although [he]331-gillingham looked so weak and ill that [[his]331-gillingham friend]1009-his friend implored [him]331-gillingham to stay at [home]3897-home . When [he]331-gillingham stood up to give [his]331-gillingham reasons for contesting the decision of [the managers]420-the managers [he]331-gillingham advanced [them]420-the managers firmly , as [he]331-gillingham had done to [[his]331-gillingham friend]1009-his friend , and contended , moreover , that the matter was a domestic theory which did not concern [them]420-the managers . This [they]420-the managers over - ruled , insisting that the private eccentricities of [a teacher]4859-a teacher came quite within [their]420-the managers sphere of control , as it touched the morals of those [he]331-gillingham taught . [Phillotson]163-phillotson replied that [he]163-phillotson did not see how an act of natural charity could injure morals . [All the respectable inhabitants]6213-all the respectable inhabitants and [well - to - do fellow - natives of [the town]4154-the town]6214-well - to - do fellow - natives of the town were against [Phillotson]163-phillotson to [a man]543-a man . But , somewhat to [his]163-phillotson surprise , [some dozen or more champions]6217-some dozen or more champions rose up in [his]163-phillotson defence as from the ground . It has been stated that [Shaston]4-shaston was the anchorage of [a curious and interesting group of [itinerants]6219-itinerants , who frequented the numerous fairs and markets held up and down [Wessex]10-wessex during the summer and autumn months]6218-a curious and interesting group of itinerants , who frequented the numerous fairs and markets held up and down wessex during the summer and autumn months . Although [Phillotson]163-phillotson had never spoken to [one of [these gentlemen]6221-these gentlemen]6220-one of these gentlemen [they]420-the managers now nobly led the forlorn hope in [his]163-phillotson defence . The body included [two cheap Jacks]6222-two cheap jacks , [a shooting - gallery proprietor]6223-a shooting - gallery proprietor and [the ladies who loaded the guns]6224-the ladies who loaded the guns , [a pair of boxing - masters]6225-a pair of boxing - masters , [a steam - roundabout manager]6226-a steam - roundabout manager , [two travelling broom - makers]6227-two travelling broom - makers , who called [themselves]6227-two travelling broom - makers [widows]6228-widows , [a gingerbread - stall keeper]6229-a gingerbread - stall keeper , [a swing - boat owner]6230-a swing - boat owner , and [a "[0-i] test - [your]2314-your - strength " man]6231-a " test - your - strength " man . When [Phillotson]163-phillotson saw the blood running down [the rector]423-the rector 's face [he]163-phillotson deplored almost in groans the untoward and degrading circumstances , regretted that [he]163-phillotson had not resigned when called upon , and went [home]3897-home so ill that next morning [he]163-phillotson could not leave [his]163-phillotson bed . The farcical yet melancholy event was the beginning of a serious illness for [him]163-phillotson ; and [he]163-phillotson lay in [his]163-phillotson lonely bed in the pathetic state of mind of [a middle - aged man who perceives at length that [his]163-phillotson life , intellectual and domestic , is tending to failure and gloom]6241-a middle - aged man who perceives at length that his life , intellectual and domestic , is tending to failure and gloom . [Gillingham]331-gillingham came to see [him]163-phillotson in the evenings , and on one occasion mentioned [Sue]174-sue 's name . "[2315-she] [She]2315-she does n't care anything about [me]0-i ! " said [Phillotson]163-phillotson . "[2315-she] Why should [she]2315-she ? " "[2315-she] [She]2315-she does n't know [you]0-i are ill . " "[2315-she] So much the better for [both of [us]2316-both of us]2316-both of us . " "[2315-she] Where are [[her]2315-she lover]4279-her lover and [she]2315-she living ? " "[2315-she] At [Melchester]3-melchester - [I]0-i suppose ; at least [he]4279-her lover was living [there]3887-there some time ago . " When [Gillingham]331-gillingham reached [home]3897-home [he]331-gillingham sat and reflected , and at last wrote an anonymous line to [Sue]174-sue , on the bare chance of its reaching [her]174-sue , the letter being enclosed in an envelope addressed to [Jude]180-jude at [the diocesan capital]6243-the diocesan capital . Arriving at [that place]6244-that place it was forwarded to [Marygreen]1-marygreen in [North Wessex]23-north wessex , and thence to [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham by [the only person who knew [his]331-gillingham present address]6245-the only person who knew his present address - [the widow who had nursed [[his]331-gillingham aunt]555-his aunt]6246-the widow who had nursed his aunt . Three days later , in the evening , when the sun was going down in splendour over [the lowlands of [Blackmoor]115-blackmoor]6248-the lowlands of blackmoor , and making the Shaston windows like tongues of fire to the eyes of [the rustics in [that vale]6250-that vale]6249-the rustics in that vale , [the sick man]6251-the sick man fancied that [he]6251-the sick man heard [somebody]4067-somebody come to [the house]504-the house , and a few minutes after there was a tap at the bedroom door . [Phillotson]163-phillotson did not speak ; the door was hesitatingly opened , and there entered - [Sue]174-sue . [She]174-sue was in light spring clothing , and [her]174-sue advent seemed ghostly - like the flitting in of a moth . [He]2320-you turned [his]2320-you eyes upon [her]174-sue , and flushed ; but appeared to check [his]2320-you primary impulse to speak . "[4279-her lover] [I]0-i have no business [here]3898-here , " [she]0-i said , bending [her]0-i frightened face to [him]2320-you . "[0-i] But [I]0-i heard [you]2320-you were ill - very ill ; and - and as [I]0-i know that [you]2320-you recognize other feelings between [man]575-man and [woman]4206-woman than physical love , [I]0-i have come . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not very ill , [[my]0-i dear friend]2323-my dear friend . Only unwell . " "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't know that ; and [I]0-i am afraid that only a severe illness would have justified [my]0-i coming ! " "[0-i] Yes ... yes . And [I]0-i almost wish [you]2320-you had not come ! It is a little too soon - that 's all [I]0-i mean . Still , let [us]2324-they make the best of it . [You]2320-you have n't heard about [the school]458-the school , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[2320-you] No - what about it ? " "[2320-you] Only that [I]0-i am going away from [here]3898-here to [another place]2327-another place . [The managers]420-the managers and [I]0-i do n't agree , and [we]2324-they are going to part - that 's all . " [Sue]174-sue did not for a moment , either now or later , suspect what troubles had resulted to [him]2320-you from letting [her]174-sue go ; it never once seemed to cross [her]174-sue mind , and [she]174-sue had received no news whatever from [Shaston]4-shaston . [They]2324-they talked on slight and ephemeral subjects , and when [his]2320-you tea was brought up [he]2320-you told [the amazed little servant]6254-the amazed little servant that a cup was to be set for [Sue]174-sue . [That young person]6255-that young person was much more interested in [their]2324-they history than [they]2324-they supposed , and as [she]6255-that young person descended [the stairs]4396-the stairs [she]6255-that young person lifted [her]6255-that young person eyes and hands in grotesque amazement . While [they]2324-they sipped [Sue]174-sue went to the window and thoughtfully said , "[420-the managers] It is such a beautiful sunset , [Richard]258-phillotson . " "[258-phillotson] They are mostly beautiful from here , owing to the rays crossing the mist of [the vale]2329-the vale . But [I]0-i lose them all , as they do n't shine into [this gloomy corner where [I]0-i lie]2330-this gloomy corner where i lie . "[0-i] There - [you]258-phillotson can see the great red sun now ! " [she]174-sue said . "[258-phillotson] And [I]0-i am sure it will cheer [you]258-phillotson - [I]0-i do so hope it will ! " [She]174-sue spoke with a childlike , repentant kindness , as if [she]174-sue could not do too much for [him]6257-him . [Phillotson]258-phillotson smiled sadly . "[0-i] [You]0-i are [an odd creature]2331-an odd creature ! " [he]6257-him murmured as the sun glowed in [his]6257-him eyes . [Richard]258-phillotson , [I]0-i am so very glad [you]258-phillotson are better . [You]258-phillotson do n't hate [me]0-i , do [you]258-phillotson ? " It grew dusk quickly in [the gloomy room]6258-the gloomy room during [their]6259-their intermittent chat , and when candles were brought and it was time to leave [she]174-sue put [her]174-sue hand in [his]6260-he or rather allowed it to flit through [his]6260-he ; for [she]174-sue was significantly light in touch . [She]174-sue had nearly closed the door when [he]6260-he said , "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue ! " [He]6260-he had noticed that , in turning away from [him]6260-he , tears were on [her]174-sue face and a quiver in [her]174-sue lip . It was bad policy to recall [her]174-sue - [he]6260-he knew it while [he]6260-he pursued it . But [he]6260-he could not help it . [She]174-sue came back . "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue , " [he]6260-he murmured , "[174-sue] do [you]174-sue wish to make it up , and stay ? [I]0-i 'll forgive [you]174-sue and condone everything ! " "[0-i] Oh [you]0-i ca n't , [you]0-i ca n't ! " [she]174-sue said hastily . "[0-i] [You]0-i ca n't condone it now ! " "[0-i] [HE]2337-he is [[your]174-sue husband]1785-your husband now , in effect , [you]174-sue mean , of course ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i may assume it . " There had arisen in [Sue]174-sue 's face that incipient fright which showed itself whenever [he]180-jude changed from [friend]5444-friend to [husband]2264-husband , and which made [her]174-sue adopt any line of defence against marital feeling in [him]180-jude . "[0-i] [I]0-i MUST go now . [I]0-i 'll come again - may [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't ask [you]174-sue to go , even now . [I]0-i ask [you]174-sue to stay . " "[2343-his] [She]2343-his 's [his]2343-his - [his]2343-his from lips to heel ! " said [Phillotson]258-phillotson ; but so faintly that in closing the door [she]174-sue did not hear it . The dread of a reactionary change in [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster 's sentiments , coupled , perhaps , with a faint shamefacedness at letting even [him]409-the schoolmaster know what a slipshod lack of thoroughness , from [a man]543-a man 's point of view , characterized [her]174-sue transferred allegiance , prevented [her]174-sue telling [him]409-the schoolmaster of [her]174-sue , thus far , incomplete relations with [Jude]180-jude ; and [Phillotson]258-phillotson lay writhing like [a man in hell]6265-a man in hell as [he]409-the schoolmaster pictured the prettily dressed , maddening compound of sympathy and averseness who bore [his]409-the schoolmaster name , returning impatiently to [the home of [[her]174-sue lover]4279-her lover]6266-the home of her lover . [Gillingham]331-gillingham was so interested in [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's affairs , and so seriously concerned about [him]409-the schoolmaster , that [he]331-gillingham walked up [the hill]564-the hill - side to [Shaston]4-shaston two or three times a week , although , there and back , it was a journey of nine miles , which had to be performed between tea and supper , after a hard day 's work in [school]5856-school . When [he]331-gillingham called on the next occasion after [Sue]174-sue 's visit [[his]331-gillingham friend]1009-his friend was [downstairs]4245-downstairs , and [Gillingham]331-gillingham noticed that [his]331-gillingham restless mood had been supplanted by a more fixed and composed one . "[2343-his] [She]2344-she 's been here since [you]2345-you called last , " said [Phillotson]258-phillotson . "[2344-she] Not [Mrs. Phillotson]258-phillotson ? " "[258-phillotson] Yes . " "[258-phillotson] Ah ! [You]2345-you have made it up ? " "[2345-you] No ... [She]2344-she just came , patted [my]0-i pillow with [her]2344-she little white hand , played [the thoughtful nurse]2346-the thoughtful nurse for half an hour , and went away . " "[2344-she] Well - [I]0-i 'm hanged ! [A little hussy]2347-a little hussy ! " "[2347-a little hussy] What do [you]2345-you say ? " "[2345-you] Oh - nothing ! " "[2345-you] What do [you]2345-you mean ? " "[2345-you] [I]0-i mean , what [a tantalizing , capricious little woman]2348-a tantalizing , capricious little woman ! If [she]2344-she were not [[your]2345-you wife]967-your wife - " "[2344-she] [She]2344-she is not ; [she]2344-she 's [another man]661-another man 's except in name and law . And [I]0-i have been thinking - it was suggested to [me]0-i by a conversation [I]0-i had with [her]2344-she - that , in kindness to [her]2344-she , [I]0-i ought to dissolve the legal tie altogether ; which , singularly enough , [I]0-i think [I]0-i can do , now [she]2344-she has been back , and refused [my]0-i request to stay after [I]0-i said [I]0-i had forgiven [her]2344-she . [I]0-i believe that fact would afford [me]0-i opportunity of doing it , though [I]0-i did not see it at the moment . What 's the use of keeping [her]2344-she chained on to [me]0-i if [she]2344-she does n't belong to [me]0-i ? [I]0-i know - [I]0-i feel absolutely certain - that [she]2344-she would welcome [my]0-i taking such a step as the greatest charity to [her]2344-she . For though as [a fellow]2351-a fellow - creature [she]2344-she sympathizes with , and pities [me]0-i , and even weeps for [me]0-i , as [a husband]807-a husband [she]2344-she can not endure [me]0-i - [she]2344-she loathes [me]0-i - there 's no use in mincing words - [she]2344-she loathes [me]0-i , and [my]0-i only manly , and dignified , and merciful course is to complete what [I]0-i have begun ... And for worldly reasons , too , it will be better for [her]2344-she to be independent . [I]0-i have hopelessly ruined [my]0-i prospects because of [my]0-i decision as to what was best for [us]2353-us , though [she]2344-she does not know it ; [I]0-i see only dire poverty ahead from [my]0-i feet to the grave ; for [I]0-i can be accepted as [teacher]470-teacher no more . [I]0-i shall probably have enough to do to make both ends meet during the remainder of [my]0-i life , now [my]0-i occupation 's gone ; and [I]0-i shall be better able to bear it alone . [I]0-i may as well tell [you]2355-you that what has suggested [my]0-i letting [her]2344-she go is some news [she]2344-she brought [me]0-i - the news that [Fawley]180-jude is doing the same . " "[180-jude] Oh - [he]180-jude had [a spouse]2356-a spouse , too ? [A queer couple]2357-a queer couple , [these lovers]796-these lovers ! " "[180-jude] Well - [I]0-i do n't want [your]2355-you opinion on that . What [I]0-i was going to say is that [my]0-i liberating [her]2344-she can do [her]2344-she no possible harm , and will open up a chance of happiness for [her]2344-she which [she]2344-she has never dreamt of hitherto . For then [they]2359-they 'll be able to marry , as [they]2359-they ought to have done at first . " [Gillingham]331-gillingham did not hurry to reply . "[0-i] [I]0-i may disagree with [your]2355-you motive , " [he]331-gillingham said gently , for [he]331-gillingham respected views [he]331-gillingham could not share . "[0-i] But [I]0-i think [you]2355-you are right in [your]2355-you determination - if [you]2355-you can carry it out . [I]0-i doubt , however , if [you]2355-you can . " Part Fifth AT [ALDBRICKHAM]5-aldbrickham AND ELSEWHERE "[2360-thy] [Thy]2360-thy aerial part , and all the fiery parts which are mingled in [thee]2360-thy , though by nature [they]2361-they have an upward tendency , still in obedience to the disposition of the universe [they]2361-they are over - powered here in the compound mass the body . " - M. ANTONINUS Long . [I]2361-they How [Gillingham]331-gillingham 's doubts were disposed of will most quickly appear by passing over the series of dreary months and incidents that followed the events of the last chapter , and coming on to a Sunday in the February of the year following . [Sue]174-sue and [Jude]180-jude were living in [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham , in precisely the same relations that [they]6272-they had established between [themselves]6272-they when [she]174-sue left [Shaston]4-shaston to join [him]331-gillingham the year before . The proceedings in [the law - courts]6273-the law - courts had reached [their]6272-they consciousness , but as a distant sound and an occasional missive which [they]6272-they hardly understood . [They]6272-they had met , as usual , to breakfast together in [the little house]6274-the little house with [Jude]180-jude 's name on it , that [he]180-jude had taken at fifteen pounds a year , with three - pounds - ten extra for rates and taxes , and furnished with [[his]180-jude aunt]555-his aunt 's ancient and lumbering goods , which had cost [him]180-jude about [their]6272-they full value to bring all the way from [Marygreen]1-marygreen . [Sue]174-sue kept [house]6276-house , and managed everything . As [he]180-jude entered [the room]4227-the room this morning [Sue]174-sue held up a letter [she]174-sue had just received . "[2361-they] Well ; and what is it about ? " [he]180-jude said after kissing [her]174-sue . "[2361-they] That the decree nisi in the case of [Phillotson]258-phillotson versus [Phillotson and Fawley]347-phillotson and fawley , pronounced six months ago , has just been made absolute . " "[2361-they] Ah , " said [Jude]180-jude , as [he]180-jude sat down . The same concluding incident in [Jude]180-jude 's suit against [Arabella]305-arabella had occurred about a month or two earlier . Both cases had been too insignificant to be reported in the papers , further than by name in a long list of other undefended cases . "[2361-they] Now then , [Sue]174-sue , at any rate , [you]174-sue can do what [you]174-sue like ! " [He]180-jude looked at [[his]180-jude sweetheart]4320-his sweetheart curiously . "[174-sue] Are [we]2362-we - [you]174-sue and [I]0-i - just as free now as if [we]2362-we had never married at all ? " "[174-sue] Just as free - except , [I]0-i believe , that [a clergyman]2363-a clergyman may object personally to remarry [you]174-sue , and hand the job on to [somebody else]1754-somebody else . " "[2363-a clergyman] But [I]0-i wonder - do [you]0-i think it is really so with [us]2362-we ? [I]0-i know it is generally . But [I]0-i have an uncomfortable feeling that [my]0-i freedom has been obtained under false pretences ! " "[0-i] How ? " "[0-i] Well - if the truth about [us]2362-we had been known , the decree would n't have been pronounced . It is only , is it , because [we]2362-we have made no defence , and have led [them]2365-their into a false supposition ? Therefore is [my]0-i freedom lawful , however proper it may be ? " "[174-sue] Well - why did [you]174-sue let it be under false pretences ? [You]174-sue have only [yourself]174-sue to blame , " [he]180-jude said mischievously . "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude - do n't ! [You]180-jude ought not to be touchy about that still . [You]180-jude must take [me]0-i as [I]0-i am . " "[180-jude] Very well , [darling]841-darling : so [I]0-i will . Perhaps [you]0-i were right . As to [your]0-i question , [we]2362-we were not obliged to prove anything . That was [their]2365-their business . Anyhow [we]2362-we are living together . " "[2365-their] Yes . Though not in [their]2365-their sense . " "[2365-their] One thing is certain , that however the decree may be brought about , a marriage is dissolved when it is dissolved . There is this advantage in being [poor obscure people like [us]2362-we]2367-poor obscure people like us - that these things are done for [us]2362-we in a rough and ready fashion . It was the same with [me]0-i and [Arabella]305-arabella . [I]0-i was afraid [her]305-arabella criminal second marriage would have been discovered , and [she]305-arabella punished ; but [nobody]4069-nobody took any interest in [her]305-arabella - [nobody]4069-nobody inquired , [nobody]4069-nobody suspected it . If [we]2362-we 'd been patented nobilities [we]2362-we should have had infinite trouble , and days and weeks would have been spent in investigations . " By degrees [Sue]174-sue acquired [[her]174-sue lover]4279-her lover 's cheerfulness at the sense of freedom , and proposed that [they]2362-we should take a walk in [the fields]5256-the fields , even if [they]2362-we had to put up with a cold dinner on account of it . [Jude]180-jude agreed , and [Sue]174-sue went up - stairs and prepared to start , putting on a joyful coloured gown in observance of [her]174-sue liberty ; seeing which [Jude]180-jude put on a lighter tie . "[4069-nobody] Now [we]2362-we 'll strut arm and arm , " [he]180-jude said , "[4069-nobody] like [any other engaged couple]2371-any other engaged couple . [We]2362-we 've a legal right to . " [They]2362-we rambled out of [the town]4154-the town , and along a path over [the low - lying lands that bordered [it]4154-the town]6282-the low - lying lands that bordered it , though these were frosty now , and [the extensive seed - fields]6283-the extensive seed - fields were bare of colour and produce . [The pair]4397-the pair , however , were so absorbed in [their]4397-the pair own situation that [their]4397-the pair surroundings were little in [their]4397-the pair consciousness . "[2362-we] Well , [[my]0-i dearest]2372-my dearest , the result of all this is that [we]2362-we can marry after a decent interval . " "[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i suppose [we]2362-we can , " said [Sue]174-sue , without enthusiasm . "[0-i] And are n't [we]2362-we going to ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't like to say no , dear [Jude]180-jude ; but [I]0-i feel just the same about it now as [I]0-i have done all along . [I]0-i have just the same dread lest an iron contract should extinguish [your]180-jude tenderness for [me]0-i , and [mine]0-i for [you]180-jude , as it did between [[our]2362-we unfortunate parents]2373-our unfortunate parents . " "[180-jude] Still , what can [we]2362-we do ? [I]0-i do love [you]180-jude , as [you]180-jude know , [Sue]174-sue . " "[174-sue] [I]0-i know it abundantly . But [I]0-i think [I]0-i would much rather go on living always as [lovers]798-lovers , as [we]2362-we are living now , and only meeting by day . It is so much sweeter - for [the woman]4031-the woman at least , and when [she]4031-the woman is sure of [the man]607-the man . And henceforward [we]2362-we need n't be so particular as [we]2362-we have been about appearances . " "[2362-we] [Our]2362-we experiences of matrimony with [others]4093-others have not been encouraging , [I]0-i own , " said [he]180-jude with some gloom ; "[0-i] either owing to [our]2362-we own dissatisfied , unpractical natures , or by [our]2362-we misfortune . But [we]2362-we two - " "[2378-two dissatisfied ones] Should be [two dissatisfied ones]2378-two dissatisfied ones linked together , which would be twice as bad as before ... [I]0-i think [I]0-i should begin to be afraid of [you]2379-you , [Jude]180-jude , the moment [you]2379-you had contracted to cherish [me]0-i under a Government stamp , and [I]0-i was licensed to be loved on [the premises]4536-the premises by [you]2379-you - Ugh , how horrible and sordid ! Although , as [you]2379-you are , free , [I]0-i trust [you]2379-you more than [any other man in [the world]706-the world]2381-any other man in the world . " "[0-i] No , no - do n't say [I]0-i should change ! " [he]543-a man expostulated ; yet there was misgiving in [his]543-a man own voice also . "[0-i] Apart from [ourselves]2362-we , and [our]2362-we unhappy peculiarities , it is foreign to [a man]543-a man 's nature to go on loving [a person]1920-a person when [he]543-a man is told that [he]543-a man must and shall be [[that person]2385-that person 's lover]2386-that person 's lover . There would be a much likelier chance of [his]543-a man doing it if [he]543-a man were told not to love . If the marriage ceremony consisted in an oath and signed contract between [the parties]2387-the parties to cease loving from that day forward , in consideration of personal possession being given , and to avoid each other 's society as much as possible in public , there would be [more loving couples]2388-more loving couples than there are now . Fancy the secret meetings between [the perjuring husband]2389-the perjuring husband and [wife]4501-wife , the denials of having seen [each other]4188-each other , the clambering in at bedroom windows , and the hiding in [closets]2392-closets ! There 'd be little cooling then . " "[174-sue] Yes ; but admitting this , or something like it , to be true , [you]2393-you are not the only one in [the world]706-the world to see it , [dear little Sue]174-sue . [People]658-people go on marrying because [they]658-people ca n't resist natural forces , although many of [them]658-people may know perfectly well that [they]658-people are possibly buying a month 's pleasure with a life 's discomfort . No doubt [[my]0-i father]3941-my father and [mother]4422-mother , and [[your]2393-you father]907-your father and [mother]4422-mother , saw it , if [they]2387-the parties at all resembled [us]2400-us in habits of observation . But then [they]2387-the parties went and married just the same , because [they]2387-the parties had ordinary passions . But [you]2393-you , [Sue]174-sue , are such a phantasmal , bodiless creature , one who - if [you]2393-you 'll allow [me]0-i to say it - has so little animal passion in [you]2393-you , that [you]2393-you can act upon reason in the matter , when [we]2400-us poor unfortunate wretches of grosser substance ca n't . " "[2393-you] Well , " [she]0-i sighed , "[2393-you] [you]2393-you 've owned that it would probably end in misery for [us]2400-us . And [I]0-i am not so exceptional [a woman]4193-a woman as [you]2393-you think . [Fewer women]2402-fewer women like marriage than [you]2393-you suppose , only [they]2402-fewer women enter into it for the dignity it is assumed to confer , and the social advantages it gains [them]2402-fewer women sometimes - a dignity and an advantage that [I]0-i am quite willing to do without . " [Jude]180-jude fell back upon [his]180-jude old complaint - that , intimate as [they]6285-they were , [he]180-jude had never once had from [her]2393-you an honest , candid declaration that [she]2393-you loved or could love [him]180-jude . "[0-i] [I]0-i really fear sometimes that [you]2393-you can not , " [he]180-jude said , with a dubiousness approaching anger . "[0-i] And [you]2393-you are so reticent . [I]0-i know that [women]3879-women are taught by [other women]2404-other women that [they]3879-women must never admit the full truth to [a man]543-a man . But the highest form of affection is based on full sincerity on both sides . Not being [men]716-men , [these women]2407-these women do n't know that in looking back on those [he]543-a man has had tender relations with , [a man]543-a man 's heart returns closest to [her]3879-women who was the soul of truth in [her]3879-women conduct . [The better class of [man]575-man]2409-the better class of man , even if caught by airy affectations of dodging and parrying , is not retained by [them]2407-these women . [A Nemesis]2411-a nemesis attends [the woman who plays the game of elusiveness too often , in the utter contempt for [her]3879-women that , sooner or later , [[her]3879-women old admirers]2413-her old admirers feel]2412-the woman who plays the game of elusiveness too often , in the utter contempt for her that , sooner or later , her old admirers feel ; under which [they]2413-her old admirers allow [her]3879-women to go unlamented to [her]3879-women grave . " [Sue]174-sue , who was regarding the distance , had acquired a guilty look ; and [she]174-sue suddenly replied in a tragic voice : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i like [you]2414-you to - day so well as [I]0-i did , [Jude]180-jude ! " "[180-jude] Do n't [you]2414-you ? Why ? " "[180-jude] Oh , well - [you]2414-you are not nice - too sermony . Though [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i am so bad and worthless that [I]0-i deserve the utmost rigour of lecturing ! " "[2414-you] No , [you]2414-you are not bad . [You]2414-you are [a dear]2415-a dear . But as slippery as an eel when [I]0-i want to get a confession from [you]2414-you . " "[0-i] Oh yes [I]0-i am bad , and obstinate , and all sorts ! It is no use [your]2414-you pretending [I]0-i am not ! [People who are good]2416-people who are good do n't want scolding as [I]0-i do ... But now that [I]0-i have [nobody]4069-nobody but [you]2414-you , and [nobody]4069-nobody to defend [me]0-i , it is very hard that [I]0-i must n't have [my]0-i own way in deciding how [I]0-i 'll live with [you]2414-you , and whether [I]0-i 'll be married or no ! " "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue , [[my]0-i own comrade]2419-my own comrade and [sweetheart]2420-sweetheart , [I]0-i do n't want to force [you]174-sue either to marry or to do the other thing - of course [I]0-i do n't ! It is too wicked of [you]174-sue to be so pettish ! Now [we]2421-we wo n't say any more about it , and go on just the same as [we]2421-we have done ; and during the rest of [our]2421-we walk [we]2421-we 'll talk of [the meadows]2422-the meadows only , and the floods , and the prospect of [the farmers]2423-the farmers this coming year . " After this the subject of marriage was not mentioned by [them]2421-we for several days , though living as [they]2421-we were with only a landing between [them]2421-we it was constantly in [their]2421-we minds . [Sue]174-sue was assisting [Jude]180-jude very materially now : [he]180-jude had latterly occupied [himself]180-jude on [his]180-jude own account in working and lettering headstones , which [he]180-jude kept in a little yard at the back of [[his]180-jude little house]6286-his little house , where in the intervals of domestic duties [she]174-sue marked out the letters full size for [him]180-jude , and blacked them in after [he]180-jude had cut them . It was a lower class of handicraft than were [his]180-jude former performances as [a cathedral mason]6287-a cathedral mason , and [[his]180-jude only patrons]6288-his only patrons were [the poor people who lived in [[his]180-jude own neighbourhood]6290-his own neighbourhood]6289-the poor people who lived in his own neighbourhood , and knew what [a cheap man]6291-a cheap man this "[180-jude] [Jude Fawley]180-jude : [Monumental Mason]2424-monumental mason " as [he]180-jude called [himself]180-jude on [his]180-jude front door was to employ for the simple memorials [they]6289-the poor people who lived in his own neighbourhood required for [their]6289-the poor people who lived in his own neighbourhood dead . But [he]180-jude seemed more independent than before , and it was the only arrangement under which [Sue]174-sue , who particularly wished to be no burden on [him]180-jude , could render any assistance . II It was an evening at the end of the month , and [Jude]180-jude had just returned [home]3897-home from hearing a lecture on ancient history in [the public hall]6293-the public hall not far off . When [he]180-jude entered , [Sue]174-sue , who had been keeping [indoors]4935-indoors during [his]180-jude absence , laid out supper for [him]180-jude . Contrary to custom [she]0-i did not speak . [Jude]180-jude had taken up some illustrated paper , which [he]180-jude perused till , raising [his]180-jude eyes , [he]180-jude saw that [her]0-i face was troubled . "[2424-monumental mason] Are [you]2425-you depressed , [Sue]174-sue ? " [he]180-jude said . [She]0-i paused a moment . "[174-sue] [I]0-i have a message for [you]2426-you , " [she]0-i answered . "[0-i] [Somebody]4067-somebody has called ? " "[4193-a woman] Yes . [A woman]4193-a woman . " [Sue]174-sue 's voice quavered as [she]174-sue spoke , and [she]174-sue suddenly sat down from [her]174-sue preparations , laid [her]174-sue hands in [her]174-sue lap , and looked into the fire . "[4193-a woman] [I]0-i do n't know whether [I]0-i did right or not ! " [she]0-i continued . "[0-i] [I]0-i said [you]2426-you were not at [home]3897-home , and when [she]4193-a woman said [she]4193-a woman would wait , [I]0-i said [I]0-i thought [you]2426-you might not be able to see [her]4193-a woman . " "[0-i] Why did [you]2426-you say that , [dear]795-dear ? [I]0-i suppose [she]4193-a woman wanted a headstone . Was [she]4193-a woman in mourning ? " "[4193-a woman] No . [She]4193-a woman was n't in mourning , and [she]4193-a woman did n't want a headstone ; and [I]0-i thought [you]2426-you could n't see [her]4193-a woman . " [Sue]174-sue looked critically and imploringly at [him]2426-you . "[2426-you] But who was [she]4193-a woman ? Did n't [she]4193-a woman say ? " "[4193-a woman] No . [She]4193-a woman would n't give [her]4193-a woman name . But [I]0-i know who [she]4193-a woman was - [I]0-i think [I]0-i do ! It was [Arabella]305-arabella ! " "[305-arabella] Heaven save [us]2431-us ! What should [Arabella]305-arabella come for ? What made [you]2426-you think it was [she]305-arabella ? " "[305-arabella] Oh , [I]0-i can hardly tell . But [I]0-i know it was ! [I]0-i feel perfectly certain it was - by the light in [her]4193-a woman eyes as [she]4193-a woman looked at [me]0-i . [She]4193-a woman was [a fleshy , coarse woman]2432-a fleshy , coarse woman . " "[4193-a woman] Well - [I]0-i should not have called [Arabella]305-arabella coarse exactly , except in speech , though [she]305-arabella may be getting so by this time under the duties of [the public house]2433-the public house . [She]305-arabella was rather handsome when [I]0-i knew [her]305-arabella . " "[305-arabella] Handsome ! But yes ! - so [she]305-arabella is ! " "[305-arabella] [I]0-i think [I]0-i heard a quiver in [your]2426-you little mouth . Well , waiving that , as [she]305-arabella is nothing to [me]0-i , and virtuously married to [another man]661-another man , why should [she]305-arabella come troubling [us]2435-us ? " "[305-arabella] Are [you]2426-you sure [she]305-arabella 's married ? Have [you]2426-you definite news of it ? " "[2426-you] No - not definite news . But that was why [she]305-arabella asked [me]0-i to release [her]305-arabella . [She]305-arabella and [the man]607-the man both wanted to lead a proper life , as [I]0-i understood . " "[305-arabella] Oh [Jude]180-jude - it was , it WAS [Arabella]305-arabella ! " cried [Sue]174-sue , covering [her]174-sue eyes with [her]174-sue hand . "[305-arabella] And [I]0-i am so miserable ! It seems such an ill omen , whatever [she]305-arabella may have come for . [You]180-jude could not possibly see [her]305-arabella , could [you]180-jude ? " "[180-jude] [I]0-i do n't really think [I]0-i could . It would be so very painful to talk to [her]305-arabella now - for [her]305-arabella as much as for [me]0-i . However , [she]305-arabella 's gone . Did [she]305-arabella say [she]305-arabella would come again ? " "[305-arabella] No . But [she]305-arabella went away very reluctantly . " [Sue]174-sue , whom the least thing upset , could not eat any supper , and when [Jude]180-jude had finished [his]180-jude [he]180-jude prepared to go to bed . [He]180-jude had no sooner raked out the fire , fastened the doors , and got to the top of the stairs than there came a knock . [Sue]174-sue instantly emerged from [[her]174-sue room]6080-her room , which [she]174-sue had but just entered . "[305-arabella] There [she]305-arabella is again ! " [Sue]174-sue whispered in appalled accents . "[305-arabella] How do [you]0-i know ? " "[305-arabella] [She]305-arabella knocked like that last time . " [They]6296-they listened , and the knocking came again . [No servant]6297-no servant was kept in [the house]504-the house , and if the summons were to be responded to [one of [them]6296-they]1300-one of them would have to do it in person . "[305-arabella] [I]0-i 'll open a window , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[0-i] [Whoever it is]2437-whoever it is can not be expected to be let in at this time . " [He]180-jude accordingly went into [[his]180-jude bedroom]4217-his bedroom and lifted the sash . [The lonely street of]6301-the lonely street of [early retiring workpeople]6302-early retiring workpeople was empty from end to end save of one figure - that of [a woman walking up and down by the lamp a few yards off]6303-a woman walking up and down by the lamp a few yards off . "[2437-whoever it is] Who 's there ? " [he]180-jude asked . "[2437-whoever it is] Is that [Mr. Fawley]180-jude ? " came up from [the woman]4031-the woman , in a voice which was unmistakably [Arabella]305-arabella 's . [Jude]180-jude replied that it was . "[305-arabella] Is it [she]305-arabella ? " asked [Sue]174-sue from the door , with lips apart . "[305-arabella] Yes , [dear]795-dear , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[305-arabella] What do [you]795-dear want , [Arabella]305-arabella ? " [he]180-jude inquired . "[795-dear] [I]0-i beg [your]2439-you pardon , [Jude]180-jude , for disturbing [you]2439-you , " said [Arabella]305-arabella humbly . "[180-jude] But [I]0-i called earlier - [I]0-i wanted particularly to see [you]2439-you to - night , if [I]0-i could . [I]0-i am in trouble , and have [nobody]4069-nobody to help [me]0-i ! " "[2439-you] In trouble , are [you]2439-you ? " "[2439-you] Yes . " There was a silence . An inconvenient sympathy seemed to be rising in [Jude]180-jude 's breast at the appeal . "[2439-you] But are n't [you]795-dear married ? " [he]180-jude said . [Arabella]305-arabella hesitated . "[180-jude] No , [Jude]180-jude , [I]0-i am not , " [she]0-i returned . "[2441-he] [He]2441-he would n't , after all . And [I]0-i am in great difficulty . [I]0-i hope to get another situation as [barmaid]881-barmaid soon . But it takes time , and [I]0-i really am in great distress because of a sudden responsibility that 's been sprung upon [me]0-i from [Australia]32-australia ; or [I]0-i would n't trouble [you]180-jude - believe [me]0-i [I]0-i would n't . [I]0-i want to tell [you]180-jude about it . " [Sue]174-sue remained at gaze , in painful tension , hearing every word , but speaking none . "[0-i] [You]795-dear are not really in want of money , [Arabella]305-arabella ? " [he]180-jude asked , in a distinctly softened tone . "[305-arabella] [I]0-i have enough to pay for the night 's lodging [I]0-i have obtained , but barely enough to take [me]0-i back again . " "[305-arabella] Where are [you]0-i living ? " "[0-i] In [London]7-london still . " [She]0-i was about to give the address , but [she]0-i said , "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [somebody]4067-somebody may hear , so [I]0-i do n't like to call out particulars of [myself]0-i so loud . If [you]180-jude could come down and walk a little way with [me]0-i towards [the Prince Inn]116-the prince inn , where [I]0-i am staying to - night , [I]0-i would explain all . [You]180-jude may as well , for old time 's sake ! " "[180-jude] Poor thing ! [I]0-i must do [her]2444-her the kindness of hearing what 's the matter , [I]0-i suppose , " said [Jude]180-jude in much perplexity . "[0-i] As [she]2444-her 's going back to - morrow it ca n't make much difference . " "[0-i] But [you]0-i can go and see [her]2444-her to - morrow , [Jude]180-jude ! Do n't go now , [Jude]180-jude ! " came in plaintive accents from the doorway . "[180-jude] Oh , it is only to entrap [you]180-jude , [I]0-i know it is , as [she]2444-her did before ! Do n't go , [dear]795-dear ! [She]2444-her is such [a low - passioned woman]2446-a low - passioned woman - [I]0-i can see it in [her]2444-her shape , and hear it in [her]2444-her voice ! " But [I]180-jude shall go , "[180-jude] said [Jude]180-jude . " Do n't attempt to detain [me]180-jude , [Sue]174-sue . "[180-jude] There was that in [his]180-jude manner which [she]2447-she knew it would be futile to oppose . [She]2447-she listened . [She]2447-she knew exactly how far it was to [the inn that [Arabella]305-arabella had named]2453-the inn that arabella had named as [[her]305-arabella lodging]2454-her lodging . It would occupy about seven minutes to get [there]3887-there at an ordinary walking pace ; seven to come back again .
