"[305-arabella] III When [Sue]174-sue reached [home]3897-home [Jude]180-jude was awaiting [her]174-sue at the door to take the initial step towards [their]2481-their marriage . [She]174-sue clasped [his]180-jude arm , and [they]2481-their went along silently together , as [true comrades oft - times]2482-true comrades oft - times do . [He]180-jude saw that [she]174-sue was preoccupied , and forbore to question [her]174-sue . " Oh [Jude]180-jude - [I]174-sue 've been talking to [her]174-sue , "[174-sue] [she]174-sue said at last . " [I]174-sue wish [I]174-sue had n't ! And yet it is best to be reminded of things . "[174-sue] " [I]180-jude hope [she]174-sue was civil . "[180-jude] " Yes . [I]174-sue - [I]174-sue ca n't help liking [her]174-sue - just a little bit ! [She]174-sue 's not an ungenerous nature ; and [I]174-sue am so glad [her]174-sue difficulties have all suddenly ended . "[174-sue] [She]174-sue explained how [Arabella]305-arabella had been summoned back , and would be enabled to retrieve [her]305-arabella position . " [I]174-sue was referring to [our]6372-our old question . What [Arabella]305-arabella has been saying to [me]174-sue has made [me]174-sue feel more than ever how hopelessly vulgar an institution legal marriage is - a sort of trap to catch [a man]543-a man - [I]174-sue ca n't bear to think of it . [I]174-sue wish [I]174-sue had n't promised to let [you]174-sue put up the banns this morning ! "[174-sue] " Oh , do n't mind [me]180-jude . Any time will do for [me]180-jude . [I]180-jude thought [you]174-sue might like to get it over quickly , now . "[180-jude] " Indeed , [I]174-sue do n't feel any more anxious now than [I]174-sue did before . Perhaps with [any other man]6374-any other man [I]174-sue might be a little anxious ; but among the very few virtues possessed by [[your]174-sue family]6375-your family and [mine]174-sue , [dear]795-dear , [I]174-sue think [I]174-sue may set staunchness . So [I]174-sue am not a bit frightened about losing [you]174-sue , now [I]174-sue really am [yours]174-sue and [you]174-sue really are [mine]174-sue . In fact , [I]174-sue am easier in [my]174-sue mind than [I]174-sue was , for [my]174-sue conscience is clear about [Richard]258-phillotson , who now has a right to [his]6377-his freedom . [I]174-sue felt [we]6378-we were deceiving [him]6377-his before . "[174-sue] " [Sue]174-sue , [you]174-sue seem when [you]174-sue are like this to be [one of [the women of some grand old civilization , whom [I]2483-we used to read about in [my]2483-we bygone , wasted , classical days]6380-the women of some grand old civilization , whom i used to read about in my bygone , wasted , classical days , rather than [a denizen of [a mere Christian country]6382-a mere christian country]6381-a denizen of a mere christian country]6379-one of the women of some grand old civilization , whom i used to read about in my bygone , wasted , classical days , rather than a denizen of a mere christian country . "[2483-we] [They]2483-we had now reached [the house of [the parish clerk]2485-the parish clerk]2484-the house of the parish clerk . [Sue]174-sue stood back , while [[her]174-sue lover]4279-her lover went up to the door . [His]4279-her lover hand was raised to knock when [she]174-sue said : " [Jude]180-jude ! "[174-sue] [He]4279-her lover looked round . " Wait a minute , would [you]4279-her lover mind ? "[4279-her lover] [He]4279-her lover came back to [her]174-sue . " Just let [us]2483-we think , "[174-sue] [she]174-sue said timidly . " [I]174-sue had such a horrid dream one night ! ... And [Arabella]305-arabella - "[174-sue] " What did [Arabella]305-arabella say to [you]174-sue ? "[4279-her lover] [he]4279-her lover asked . " Oh , [she]305-arabella said that when [people]658-people were tied up [you]174-sue could get the law of [a man]543-a man better if [he]543-a man beat [you]174-sue - and how when [couples]6386-couples quarrelled ... [Jude]180-jude , do [you]180-jude think that when [you]180-jude must have [me]4279-her lover with [you]180-jude by law , [we]2483-we shall be so happy as [we]2483-we are now ? [The men]647-the men and women of [[our]2483-we family]3916-our family are very generous when everything depends upon [their]647-the men goodwill , but [they]647-the men always kick against compulsion . Do n't [you]180-jude dread the attitude that insensibly arises out of legal obligation ? Do n't [you]180-jude think it is destructive to a passion whose essence is its gratuitousness ? "[4279-her lover] " Upon [my]2487-my word , love , [you]180-jude are beginning to frighten [me]2487-my , too , with all this foreboding ! Well , let 's go back and think it over . "[2487-my] [Her]2487-my face brightened . " Yes - so [we]2483-we will ! "[2487-my] said [she]2487-my . And [they]2488-they turned from [the clerk]2489-the clerk 's door , [Sue]174-sue taking [his]2489-the clerk arm and murmuring as [they]2488-they walked on homeward : Can [you]2489-the clerk keep the bee from ranging , Or the ring - dove 's neck from changing ? No ! Nor fetter'd love ... [They]2488-they thought it over , or postponed thinking . Certainly [they]2488-they postponed action , and seemed to live on in [a dreamy paradise]2490-a dreamy paradise . At the end of a fortnight or three weeks matters remained unadvanced , and no banns were announced to the ears of [any Aldbrickham congregation]2491-any aldbrickham congregation . Whilst [they]2488-they were postponing and postponing thus a letter and a newspaper arrived before breakfast one morning from [Arabella]305-arabella . Seeing the handwriting [Jude]180-jude went up to [[Sue]174-sue 's room]2492-sue 's room and told [her]174-sue , and as soon as [she]174-sue was dressed [she]174-sue hastened down . [Sue]174-sue opened the newspaper ; [Jude]180-jude the letter . After glancing at the paper [she]174-sue held across the first page to [him]2489-the clerk with [her]174-sue finger on a paragraph ; but [he]2489-the clerk was so absorbed in [his]2489-the clerk letter that [he]2489-the clerk did not turn awhile . " Look ! "[174-sue] said [she]174-sue . [He]2489-the clerk looked and read . The paper was one that circulated in [South London]119-south london only , and the marked advertisement was simply the announcement of a marriage at [St. John 's Church]120-st. john 's church , [Waterloo Road]121-waterloo road , under the names , " [CARTLETT - DONN]355-cartlett "[180-jude] ; the united pair being [Arabella]305-arabella and [the inn - keeper]2493-the inn - keeper . " Well , it is satisfactory , "[174-sue] said [Sue]174-sue complacently . " Though , after this , it seems rather low to do likewise , and [I]174-sue am glad . However , [she]305-arabella is provided for now in a way , [I]174-sue suppose , whatever [her]305-arabella faults , poor thing . It is nicer that [we]6389-we are able to think that , than to be uneasy about [her]305-arabella . [I]174-sue ought , too , to write to [Richard]258-phillotson and ask [him]180-jude how [he]180-jude is getting on , perhaps ? "[174-sue] But [Jude]180-jude 's attention was still absorbed . [Having]311-having merely glanced at the announcement [he]180-jude said in a disturbed voice : " Listen to this letter . What shall [I]180-jude say or do ? "[180-jude] THE THREE HORNS , [LAMBETH]87-lambeth . DEAR [JUDE]180-jude [I]0-i wo n't be so distant as to call [you]180-jude [Mr. Fawley]180-jude , - [I]0-i send to - day a newspaper , from which useful document [you]180-jude will learn that [I]0-i was married over again to [Cartlett]355-cartlett last Tuesday . So that business is settled right and tight at last . But what [I]0-i write about more particular is that private affair [I]0-i wanted to speak to [you]180-jude on when [I]0-i came down to [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham . [I]0-i could n't very well tell it to [[your]180-jude lady friend]2494-your lady friend , and should much have liked to let [you]180-jude know it by word of mouth , as [I]0-i could have explained better than by letter . The fact is , [Jude]180-jude , that , though [I]0-i have never informed [you]180-jude before , there was [a boy born of [our]2496-our marriage]2495-a boy born of our marriage , eight months after [I]0-i left [you]180-jude , when [I]0-i was at [Sydney]83-sydney , living with [[my]0-i father]3941-my father and [mother]4422-mother . All that is easily provable . As [I]0-i had separated from [you]180-jude before [I]0-i thought such a thing was going to happen , and [I]0-i was over [there]3887-there , and [our]2496-our quarrel had been sharp , [I]0-i did not think it convenient to write about the birth . [I]0-i was then looking out for a good situation , so [[my]0-i parents]2500-my parents took [the child]3918-the child , and [he]3918-the child has been with [them]2500-my parents ever since . That was why [I]0-i did not mention it when [I]0-i met [you]180-jude in [Christminster]180-jude , nor at the law proceedings . [He]3918-the child is now of an intelligent age , of course , and [[my]0-i mother]964-my mother and [father]3907-father have lately written to say that , as [they]2500-my parents have rather a hard struggle over there , and [I]0-i am settled comfortably [here]3898-here , [they]2500-my parents do n't see why [they]2500-my parents should be encumbered with [the child]3918-the child any longer , [[his]3918-the child parents]2506-his parents being alive . [I]0-i would have [him]3918-the child with [me]0-i here in a moment , but [he]3918-the child is not old enough to be of any use in [the bar]1461-the bar nor will be for years and years , and naturally [Cartlett]355-cartlett might think [him]3918-the child in the way . [They]2500-my parents have , however , packed [him]3918-the child off to [me]0-i in charge of [some friends who happened to be coming [home]3897-home]2508-some friends who happened to be coming home , and [I]0-i must ask [you]2510-you to take [him]3918-the child when [he]3918-the child arrives , for [I]0-i do n't know what to do with [him]3918-the child . [He]3918-the child is lawfully [yours]2510-you , that [I]0-i solemnly swear . If [anybody]4107-anybody says [he]3918-the child is n't , call [them]4107-anybody brimstone liars , for [my]0-i sake . Whatever [I]0-i may have done before or afterwards , [I]0-i was honest to [you]2510-you from the time [we]2512-we were married till [I]0-i went away , and [I]0-i remain , [yours]2510-you , c. , [ARABELLA CARTLETT]356-arabella . [Sue]174-sue 's look was one of dismay . " What will [you]180-jude do , [dear]795-dear ? "[174-sue] [she]174-sue asked faintly . [Jude]180-jude did not reply , and [Sue]174-sue watched [him]180-jude anxiously , with heavy breaths . " It hits [me]180-jude hard ! "[180-jude] said [he]180-jude in an under - voice . " It MAY be true ! [I]180-jude ca n't make it out . Certainly , if [his]180-jude birth was exactly when [she]174-sue says , [he]180-jude 's [mine]174-sue . "[180-jude] " [The poor child]6393-the poor child seems to be wanted by [nobody]4069-nobody ! "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue replied , and [her]174-sue eyes filled . [I]180-jude would take [him]180-jude and bring [him]180-jude up . The beggarly question of parentage - what is it , after all ? What does it matter , when [you]6395-you come to think of it , whether [a child]781-a child is [yours]6395-you by blood or not ? [All the little ones of]6397-all the little ones of [our]6398-our time are collectively [the children of [[us]6398-our adults]6400-us adults of the time , and entitled to [our]6398-our general care]6399-the children of us adults of the time , and entitled to our general care . In [the down - train that was timed to reach [Aldbrickham station]5-aldbrickham]2517-the down - train that was timed to reach aldbrickham station about ten o'clock the next evening , [a small , pale child]2518-a small , pale child 's face could be seen in the gloom of [a third - class carriage]2519-a third - class carriage . [He]2518-a small , pale child had large , frightened eyes , and wore a white woollen cravat , over which a key was suspended round [his]2518-a small , pale child neck by a piece of common string : the key attracting attention by its occasional shine in the lamplight . In the band of [his]2518-a small , pale child hat [his]2518-a small , pale child half - ticket was stuck . [His]2518-a small , pale child eyes remained mostly fixed on the back of the seat opposite , and never turned to the window even when [a station]2520-a station was reached and called . On the other seat were [two or three passengers]2521-two or three passengers , [one of [them]2521-two or three passengers [a working woman who held a basket on [her]2523-a working woman who held a basket on her lap , in which was a tabby kitten lap , in which was a tabby kitten]2523-a working woman who held a basket on her lap , in which was a tabby kitten . At these [the fellow - passengers]2525-the fellow - passengers laughed , except [the solitary boy bearing the key and ticket]2526-the solitary boy bearing the key and ticket , who , regarding the kitten with [his]2518-a small , pale child saucer eyes , seemed mutely to say : " All laughing comes from misapprehension . Rightly looked at there is no laughable thing under the sun . "[2518-a small , pale child] Occasionally at a stoppage [the guard]2527-the guard would look into [the compartment]6156-the compartment and say to [the boy]437-the boy , " All right , [[my]2527-the guard man]719-my man . [Your]437-the boy box is safe in [the van]6420-the van . "[2527-the guard] [The boy]437-the boy would say , " Yes , "[437-the boy] without animation , would try to smile , and fail . [He]437-the boy was Age masquerading as [Juvenility]357-juvenility , and doing it so badly that [his]437-the boy real self showed through crevices . A ground - swell from ancient years of night seemed now and then to lift [the child]3918-the child in this [his]437-the boy morning - life , when [his]437-the boy face took a back view over some great Atlantic of Time , and appeared not to care about what [it]2532-it saw . When [the other travellers]2533-the other travellers closed [their]2533-the other travellers eyes , which [they]2533-the other travellers did one by one - even the kitten curling itself up in the basket , weary of its too circumscribed play - [the boy]437-the boy remained just as before . [He]437-the boy then seemed to be doubly awake , like [an enslaved and dwarfed divinity]2535-an enslaved and dwarfed divinity , sitting passive and regarding [[his]437-the boy companions]2536-his companions as if [he]437-the boy saw [their]2536-his companions whole rounded lives rather than [their]2536-his companions immediate figures . This was [[Arabella]356-arabella 's boy]2537-arabella 's boy . With [her]356-arabella usual carelessness [she]356-arabella had postponed writing to [Jude]180-jude about [him]180-jude till the eve of [his]180-jude landing , when [she]356-arabella could absolutely postpone no longer , though [she]356-arabella had known for weeks of [his]180-jude approaching arrival , and had , as [she]356-arabella truly said , visited [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham mainly to reveal [the boy]437-the boy 's existence and [his]180-jude near home - coming to [Jude]180-jude . This very day on which [she]356-arabella had received [[her]356-arabella former husband]2539-her former husband 's answer at some time in the afternoon , [the child]3918-the child reached the [London Docks]123-london docks , and [the family in whose charge [he]3918-the child had come]2541-the family in whose charge he had come , having put [him]3918-the child into [a cab]2542-a cab for [Lambeth]87-lambeth and directed [the cabman]2543-the cabman to [[[his]3918-the child mother]4570-his mother 's house]2545-his mother 's house , bade [him]3918-the child good - bye , and went [their]2546-their way . On [his]3918-the child arrival at [the Three Horns]2547-the three horns , [Arabella]356-arabella had looked [him]3918-the child over with an expression that was as good as saying , " [You]3918-the child are very much what [I]356-arabella expected [you]3918-the child to be , "[356-arabella] had given [him]3918-the child a good meal , a little money , and , late as it was getting , dispatched [him]3918-the child to [Jude]164-jude by [the next train]2548-the next train , wishing [[her]356-arabella husband]3921-her husband [Cartlett]356-arabella , who was out , not to see [him]3918-the child . [The train]5128-the train reached [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham , and [the boy]437-the boy was deposited on [the lonely platform beside [his]437-the boy box]2552-the lonely platform beside his box . [The collector]2553-the collector took [his]437-the boy ticket and , with a meditative sense of the unfitness of things , asked [him]437-the boy where [he]437-the boy was going by [himself]437-the boy at that time of night . " Going to [Spring Street]117-spring street , "[2554-the little one] said [the little one]2554-the little one impassively . " Why , that 's a long way from here ; a'most out in [the country]4234-the country ; and [the folks]6422-the folks will be gone to bed . "[2554-the little one] " [I]2553-the collector 've got to go [there]3887-there . "[2553-the collector] " [You]2553-the collector must have a fly for [your]2553-the collector box . "[2554-the little one] Saying nothing further [the boy]437-the boy came out into [the street]4748-the street , looking round to see that [nobody]4069-nobody followed or observed [him]437-the boy . When [he]437-the boy had walked some little distance [he]437-the boy asked for [the street of [his]437-the boy destination]2558-the street of his destination . [He]437-the boy was told to go straight on quite into [the outskirts of [the place]3987-the place]2559-the outskirts of the place . [The child]3918-the child fell into a steady mechanical creep which had in it an impersonal quality - the movement of the wave , or of the breeze , or of the cloud . [He]3918-the child followed [his]3918-the child directions literally , without an inquiring gaze at anything . It could have been seen that [the boy]437-the boy 's ideas of life were different from those of [the local boys]2563-the local boys . [Children]4054-children begin with detail , and learn up to [the general]2565-the general ; [they]4054-children begin with the contiguous , and gradually comprehend the universal . [The boy]437-the boy seemed to have begun with the generals of life , and never to have concerned [himself]437-the boy with the particulars . To [him]437-the boy [the houses]2567-the houses , [the willows]2568-the willows , [the obscure fields beyond]2569-the obscure fields beyond , were apparently regarded not as [brick residences]2570-brick residences , pollards , [meadows]2571-meadows ; but as human dwellings in the abstract , vegetation , and [the wide dark world]2572-the wide dark world . [He]437-the boy found the way to [the little lane]2573-the little lane , and knocked at the door of [[Jude]180-jude 's house]2574-jude 's house . [Jude]180-jude had just retired to bed , and [Sue]174-sue was about to enter [[her]174-sue chamber]2575-her chamber adjoining when [she]174-sue heard the knock and came down . " Is this where [Father]228-father lives ? "[3918-the child] asked [the child]3918-the child . " Who ? "[174-sue] " [Mr. Fawley]180-jude , that 's [his]180-jude name . "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue ran up to [[Jude]180-jude 's room]2577-jude 's room and told [him]180-jude , and [he]180-jude hurried down as soon as [he]180-jude could , though to [her]174-sue impatience [he]180-jude seemed long . " What - is it [he]180-jude - so soon ? "[174-sue] [she]174-sue asked as [Jude]180-jude came . [She]174-sue scrutinized [the child]3918-the child 's features , and suddenly went away into [the little sitting - room adjoining]2579-the little sitting - room adjoining . [He]180-jude found [her]174-sue in the dark , bending over an arm - chair . "[2582-she] Then a yearning look came over [the child]3918-the child and [he]3918-the child began to cry . [Sue]174-sue thereupon could not refrain from instantly doing likewise , being a harp which the least wind of emotion from another 's heart could make to vibrate as readily as a radical stir in [her]174-sue own . " [You]3918-the child may call [me]174-sue [Mother]4422-mother , if [you]3918-the child wish to , [[my]174-sue poor dear]6437-my poor dear ! " Yet the advent of [the child]3918-the child disturbed [him]180-jude . " During the interval before the issuing of the certificate [Sue]174-sue , in [her]174-sue housekeeping errands , sometimes walked past [the office]4781-the office , and furtively glancing in saw affixed to the wall the notice of the purposed clinch to [their]6458-their union . [She]174-sue could not bear its aspect . Coming after [her]174-sue previous experience of matrimony , all the romance of [their]6458-their attachment seemed to be starved away by placing [her]174-sue present case in the same category . [She]174-sue was usually leading [little Father]6459-little father Time by the hand , and fancied that [people]658-people thought [him]6459-little father hers , and regarded the intended ceremony as the patching up of an old error . Meanwhile [Jude]180-jude decided to link [his]180-jude present with [his]180-jude past in some slight degree by inviting to the wedding [the only person remaining on [earth]6462-earth who was associated with [his]180-jude early life at [Marygreen]1-marygreen]6461-the only person remaining on earth who was associated with his early life at marygreen - [the aged widow [Mrs. Edlin]313-mrs. edlin , who had been [[his]180-jude great - aunt]505-his great - aunt 's friend and nurse in [her]505-his great - aunt last illness]6463-the aged widow mrs. edlin , who had been his great - aunt 's friend and nurse in her last illness . [He]180-jude hardly expected that [she]174-sue would come ; but [she]174-sue did , bringing singular presents , in the form of apples , jam , brass snuffers , an ancient pewter dish , a warming - pan , and an enormous bag of goose feathers towards a bed . [She]174-sue was allotted [the spare room in [Jude]180-jude 's house]6465-the spare room in jude 's house , whither [she]174-sue retired early , and where [they]6466-they could hear [her]174-sue through the ceiling below , honestly saying [the Lord]895-the lord 's Prayer in a loud voice , as the Rubric directed . As , however , [she]174-sue could not sleep , and discovered that [Sue]174-sue and [Jude]180-jude were still sitting up - it being in fact only ten o'clock - [she]174-sue dressed [herself]174-sue again and came down , and [they]6466-they all sat by the fire till a late hour - Father Time included ; though , as [he]180-jude never spoke , [they]6466-they were hardly conscious of [him]180-jude . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i bain't set against marrying as [[your]2616-your great - aunt]2617-your great - aunt was , " said [the widow]5702-the widow . "[0-i] And [I]0-i hope ' twill be a jocund wedding for [ye]2616-your in all respects this time . " On the steps of [the office]4781-the office there were the muddy foot - marks of [people who had entered]6479-people who had entered , and in the entry were damp umbrellas Within [the office]4781-the office [several persons]6481-several persons were gathered , and [[our]2651-we couple]6482-our couple perceived that a marriage between [a soldier]6483-a soldier and [a young woman]5389-a young woman was just in progress . [The room]4227-the room was [a dreary place to two of [their]6482-our couple temperament]6487-a dreary place to two of their temperament , though to [[its]4227-the room usual frequenters]6488-its usual frequenters it doubtless seemed ordinary enough . Law - books in musty calf covered one wall , and elsewhere were post - office directories , and other books of reference . Papers in packets tied with red tape were pigeon - holed around , and some iron safes filled a recess , while the bare wood floor was , like the door - step , stained by [previous visitors]6489-previous visitors . [The soldier]5988-the soldier was sullen and reluctant : [the bride]6491-the bride sad and timid ; [she]6491-the bride was soon , obviously , to become [a mother]6443-a mother , and [she]6491-the bride had a black eye . "[0-i] Now , [darling]841-darling , what shall [we]2663-we do ? [We]2663-we are making a mess of it , it strikes [me]0-i . Still , ANYTHING that pleases [you]841-darling will please [me]0-i . " "[180-jude] But [Jude]180-jude , [dearest]6404-dearest , [I]0-i am worrying [you]841-darling ! [You]841-darling wanted it to be [there]3887-there , did n't [you]841-darling ? " "[841-darling] Well , to tell the truth , when [I]0-i got inside [I]0-i felt as if [I]0-i did n't care much about it . And then [I]0-i thought of what [you]841-darling had said this morning as to whether [we]2663-we ought . " [They]2663-we walked on vaguely , till [she]2676-that flabby woman paused , and [her]2676-that flabby woman little voice began anew : "[841-darling] It seems so weak , too , to vacillate like this ! And yet how much better than to act rashly a second time ... How terrible that scene was to [me]0-i ! The expression in [that flabby woman]2676-that flabby woman 's face , leading [her]2676-that flabby woman on to give [herself]2676-that flabby woman to that gaol - bird , not for a few hours , as [she]2676-that flabby woman would , but for a lifetime , as [she]2676-that flabby woman must . And [the other poor soul]2677-the other poor soul - to escape a nominal shame which was owing to the weakness of [her]2676-that flabby woman character , degrading [herself]2676-that flabby woman to the real shame of bondage to [a tyrant who scorned [her]2676-that flabby woman]2678-a tyrant who scorned her - [a man whom to avoid for ever]2679-a man whom to avoid for ever was [her]2676-that flabby woman only chance of salvation ... This is [[our]2663-we parish church]2680-our parish church , is n't it ? This is where it would have to be , if [we]2663-we did it in the usual way ? A service or something seems to be going on . [There]3887-there is in Upper [Wessex]10-wessex [an old town of nine or ten thousand souls]6539-an old town of nine or ten thousand souls ; [the town]4154-the town may be called [Stoke - Barehills]129-stoke - barehills . [The great western highway]6546-the great western highway from [London]7-london passes through [it]4154-the town , near a point where [the road]629-the road branches into two , merely to unite again some twenty miles further westward . Out of this bifurcation and reunion there used to arise among [wheeled travellers]6548-wheeled travellers , before railway days , endless questions of choice between the respective ways . But the question is now as dead as [the scot - and - lot freeholder]6549-the scot - and - lot freeholder , [the road waggoner]6550-the road waggoner , and [the mail coachman who disputed it]6551-the mail coachman who disputed it ; and probably not [a single inhabitant of [Stoke - Barehills]129-stoke - barehills]6552-a single inhabitant of stoke - barehills is now even aware that the two roads which part in [[his]129-stoke - barehills town]6553-his town ever meet again ; for [nobody]4069-nobody now drives up and down [the great western highway dally]6555-the great western highway dally . "[0-i] A love - philtre , such as was used by [the ancients]2783-the ancients with great effect . [I]0-i found it out by study of [their]2783-the ancients writings , and have never known it to fail . " "[0-i] What is it made of ? " asked [Arabella]356-arabella curiously . "[0-i] Well - a distillation of the juices of doves ' hearts - otherwise pigeons ' - is one of the ingredients . It took nearly a hundred hearts to produce that small bottle full . " "[0-i] How do [you]0-i get pigeons enough ? " "[0-i] To tell a secret , [I]0-i get a piece of rock - salt , of which pigeons are inordinately fond , and place it in a dovecot on [[my]0-i roof]2784-my roof . In a few hours the birds come to it from all points of the compass - east , west , north , and south - and thus [I]0-i secure as many as [I]0-i require . [You]2782-you use the liquid by contriving that [the desired man]2785-the desired man shall take about ten drops of it in [his]2785-the desired man drink . " [She]0-i produced five shillings , the price asked , and slipped the phial in [her]0-i capacious bosom . [She]0-i adored roses , and what [Arabella]356-arabella had witnessed was [Sue]174-sue detaining [Jude]180-jude almost against [his]180-jude will while [she]0-i learnt the names of this variety and that , and put [her]0-i face within an inch of [their]2798-the dears blooms to smell them . "[0-i] [The policeman]4108-the policeman will be down on [us]2801-we , and [I]0-i shall say it was [[my]0-i husband]1773-my husband 's fault ! " VI The unnoticed lives that [the pair]4397-the pair had hitherto led began , from the day of the suspended wedding onwards , to be observed and discussed by [other persons than [Arabella]356-arabella]6668-other persons than arabella . [The society of [Spring Street]117-spring street and [the neighbourhood]495-the neighbourhood]6669-the society of spring street and the neighbourhood generally did not understand , and probably could not have been made to understand , [Sue]174-sue and [Jude]180-jude 's private minds , emotions , positions , and fears . The curious facts of [a child]781-a child coming to [them]4397-the pair unexpectedly , who called [Jude]180-jude "[3907-father] [Father]3907-father , " and [Sue]174-sue "[4422-mother] [Mother]4422-mother , " and a hitch in a marriage ceremony intended for quietness to be performed at [[a registrar]6672-a registrar 's office]6673-a registrar 's office , together with rumours of the undefended cases in [the law - courts]6273-the law - courts , bore only one translation to plain minds . Little Time - for though [he]781-a child was formally turned into "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude , " the apt nickname stuck to [him]781-a child - would come [home]3897-home from [school]5856-school in the evening , and repeat inquiries and remarks that had been made to [him]781-a child by [the other boys]6677-the other boys ; and cause [Sue]174-sue , and [Jude]180-jude when [he]781-a child heard [them]4397-the pair , a great deal of pain and sadness . The result was that shortly after the attempt at [[the registrar]6678-the registrar 's [the pair]4397-the pair]6679-the registrar 's the pair went off - to [London]7-london it was believed - for several days , hiring [somebody]4067-somebody to look to [the boy]437-the boy . When [they]4397-the pair came back [they]4397-the pair let it be understood indirectly , and with total indifference and weariness of mien , that [they]4397-the pair were legally married at last . [Sue]174-sue , who had previously been called [Mrs. Bridehead]365-mrs. bridehead now openly adopted the name of [Mrs. Fawley]180-jude . [Her]174-sue dull , cowed , and listless manner for days seemed to substantiate all this . But the mistake as it was called of [their]4397-the pair going away so secretly to do the business , kept up much of the mystery of [their]4397-the pair lives ; and [they]4397-the pair found that [they]4397-the pair made not such advances with [[their]4397-the pair neighbours]6683-their neighbours as [they]4397-the pair had expected to do thereby . A living mystery was not much less interesting than a dead scandal . [[The baker]6684-the baker 's lad]6685-the baker 's lad and [[the grocer]6686-the grocer 's boy , who at first had used to lift [their]6687-the grocer 's boy , who at first had used to lift their hats gallantly to sue when they came to execute their errands hats gallantly to [Sue]174-sue when [they]6687-the grocer 's boy , who at first had used to lift their hats gallantly to sue when they came to execute their errands came to execute [their]6687-the grocer 's boy , who at first had used to lift their hats gallantly to sue when they came to execute their errands errands]6687-the grocer 's boy , who at first had used to lift their hats gallantly to sue when they came to execute their errands , in these days no longer took the trouble to render [her]174-sue that homage , and [[the neighbouring artizans]6688-the neighbouring artizans ' wives]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives looked straight along [the pavement]4653-the pavement when [they]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives encountered [her]174-sue . [Nobody]4069-nobody molested [them]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives , it is true ; but an oppressive atmosphere began to encircle [their]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives souls , particularly after [their]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives excursion to the show , as if that visit had brought some evil influence to bear on [them]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives . And [their]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives temperaments were precisely of a kind to suffer from this atmosphere , and to be indisposed to lighten it by vigorous and open statements . [Their]6689-the neighbouring artizans ' wives apparent attempt at reparation had come too late to be effective . The headstone and epitaph orders fell off : and two or three months later , when autumn came , [Jude]180-jude perceived that [he]180-jude would have to return to journey - work again , a course all the more unfortunate just now , in that [he]180-jude had not as yet cleared off the debt [he]180-jude had unavoidably incurred in the payment of the law - costs of the previous year . One evening [he]180-jude sat down to share the common meal with [Sue]174-sue and [the child]3918-the child as usual . "[0-i] [I]0-i am thinking , " [he]180-jude said to [her]174-sue , "[0-i] that [I]0-i 'll hold on here no longer . The life suits [us]2812-we , certainly ; but if [we]2812-we could get away to a place where [we]2812-we are unknown , [we]2812-we should be lighter hearted , and have a better chance . And so [I]0-i am afraid [we]2812-we must break it up here , however awkward for [you]2813-you , [poor dear]1482-poor dear ! " [Sue]174-sue was always much affected at a picture of [herself]174-sue as an object of pity , and [she]174-sue saddened . "[0-i] Well - [I]0-i am not sorry , " said [she]0-i presently . "[0-i] [I]0-i am much depressed by the way [they]2815-they look at [me]0-i here . And [you]0-i have been keeping on [this house]2006-this house and furniture entirely for [me]0-i and [the boy]437-the boy ! [You]0-i do n't want it [yourself]0-i , and the expense is unnecessary . But whatever [we]2812-we do , wherever [we]2812-we go , [you]0-i wo n't take [him]437-the boy away from [me]0-i , [[Jude]180-jude dear]2818-jude dear ? [I]0-i could not let [him]437-the boy go now ! The cloud upon [his]437-the boy young mind makes [him]437-the boy so pathetic to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i do hope to lift it some day ! And [he]437-the boy loves [me]0-i so . [You]0-i wo n't take [him]437-the boy away from [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Certainly [I]0-i wo n't , [dear little girl]2666-dear little girl ! [We]2812-we 'll get nice lodgings , wherever [we]2812-we go . [I]0-i shall be moving about probably - getting a job [here]3898-here and a job there . " "[0-i] [I]0-i shall do something too , of course , till - till - Well , now [I]0-i ca n't be useful in the lettering it behoves [me]0-i to turn [my]0-i hand to something else . " "[174-sue] Do n't hurry about getting employment , " [he]437-the boy said regretfully . "[174-sue] [I]0-i do n't want [you]2666-dear little girl to do that . [I]0-i wish [you]2666-dear little girl would n't , [Sue]174-sue . [The boy]437-the boy and [yourself]2666-dear little girl are enough for [you]2666-dear little girl to attend to . " There was a knock at the door , and [Jude]180-jude answered it . [Sue]174-sue could hear the conversation : "[437-the boy] Is [Mr. Fawley]270-mr. fawley at [home]3897-home ? ... [Biles]366-biles and [Willis the building contractors]2823-willis the building contractors sent [me]0-i to know if [you]2666-dear little girl 'll undertake the relettering of the ten commandments in [a little church [they]2823-willis the building contractors 've been restoring]2824-a little church they 've been restoring lately in [the country near [here]3898-here]2825-the country near here . " [Jude]180-jude reflected , and said [he]180-jude could undertake it . "[2823-willis the building contractors] It is not a very artistic job , " continued [the messenger]6693-the messenger . "[2827-the clergyman] [The clergyman]2827-the clergyman is [a very old - fashioned chap]2828-a very old - fashioned chap , and [he]2827-the clergyman has refused to let anything more be done to [the church]4809-the church than cleaning and repairing . " "[2827-the clergyman] [Excellent old man]2830-excellent old man ! " said [Sue]174-sue to [herself]174-sue , who was sentimentally opposed to the horrors of over - restoration . "[2830-excellent old man] The Ten Commandments are fixed to the east end , " [the messenger]6693-the messenger went on , "[2823-willis the building contractors] and [they]2823-willis the building contractors want doing up with the rest of the wall there , since [he]2827-the clergyman wo n't have them carted off as old materials belonging to [the contractor]2831-the contractor in the usual way of the trade . " A bargain as to terms was struck , and [Jude]180-jude came [indoors]4935-indoors . "[2827-the clergyman] [There]3887-there , [you]2833-you see , " [he]180-jude said cheerfully . "[2827-the clergyman] One more job yet , at any rate , and [you]2833-you can help in it - at least [you]2833-you can try . [We]2834-we shall have all [the church]4809-the church to [ourselves]2834-we , as the rest of the work is finished . " Next day [Jude]180-jude went out to [the church]4809-the church , which was only two miles off . [He]180-jude found that what [[the contractor]2831-the contractor 's clerk]6698-the contractor 's clerk had said was true . The tables of the Jewish law towered sternly over the utensils of Christian grace , as the chief ornament of [the chancel]6699-the chancel end , in the fine dry style of the last century . And as [their]2823-willis the building contractors framework was constructed of ornamental plaster they could not be taken down for repair . A portion , crumbled by damp , required renewal ; and when this had been done , and the whole cleansed , [he]180-jude began to renew the lettering . On the second morning [Sue]174-sue came to see what assistance [she]174-sue could render , and also because [they]2823-willis the building contractors liked to be together . The silence and emptiness of [the building]4677-the building gave [her]174-sue confidence , and , standing on a safe low platform erected by [Jude]180-jude , which [she]174-sue was nevertheless timid at mounting , [she]174-sue began painting in the letters of the first Table while [he]180-jude set about mending a portion of the second . [She]174-sue was quite pleased at [her]174-sue powers ; [she]174-sue had acquired them in the days [she]174-sue painted illumined texts for [the church - fitting shop at [Christminster]180-jude]6701-the church - fitting shop at christminster . [Nobody]4069-nobody seemed likely to disturb [them]2823-willis the building contractors ; and the pleasant twitter of birds , and rustle of October leafage , came in through an open window , and mingled with [their]2823-willis the building contractors talk . [They]2823-willis the building contractors were not , however , to be left thus snug and peaceful for long . About half - past twelve there came footsteps on the gravel without . [The old vicar]6703-the old vicar and [[his]6703-the old vicar churchwarden]6704-his churchwarden entered , and , coming up to see what was being done , seemed surprised to discover that [a young woman]5389-a young woman was assisting . [They]2823-willis the building contractors passed on into [an aisle]6706-an aisle , at which time the door again opened , and [another figure]6707-another figure entered - [a small one , that of little Time]6708-a small one , that of little time , who was crying . [Sue]174-sue had told [him]6703-the old vicar where [he]6703-the old vicar might find [her]5389-a young woman between school - hours , if [he]6703-the old vicar wished . [She]0-i came down from [her]0-i perch , and said , "[2838-they] What 's the matter , [[my]0-i dear]772-my dear ? " "[2838-they] [I]0-i could n't stay to eat [my]0-i dinner in [school]5856-school , because [they]2838-they said - " [He]6703-the old vicar described how [some boys]6709-some boys had taunted [him]6703-the old vicar about [[his]6703-the old vicar nominal mother]6710-his nominal mother , and [Sue]174-sue , grieved , expressed [her]174-sue indignation to [Jude]180-jude aloft . [The child]3918-the child went into [the churchyard]500-the churchyard , and [Sue]174-sue returned to [her]174-sue work . Meanwhile the door had opened again , and there shuffled in with a businesslike air [the white - aproned woman who cleaned [the church]4809-the church]6713-the white - aproned woman who cleaned the church . [Sue]174-sue recognized [her]6713-the white - aproned woman who cleaned the church as one who had friends in [Spring Street]117-spring street , whom [she]174-sue visited . [The church - cleaner]6715-the church - cleaner looked at [Sue]174-sue , gaped , and lifted [her]6715-the church - cleaner hands ; [she]6715-the church - cleaner had evidently recognized [[Jude]180-jude 's companion]6716-jude 's companion as [the latter]444-the latter had recognized [her]174-sue . Next came [two ladies]6718-two ladies , and after talking to [the charwoman]6719-the charwoman [they]6718-two ladies also moved forward , and as [Sue]174-sue stood reaching upward , watched [her]174-sue hand tracing the letters , and critically regarded [[her]174-sue person]6720-her person in relief against the white wall , till [she]174-sue grew so nervous that [she]174-sue trembled visibly . [They]6718-two ladies went back to where [the others]762-the others were standing , talking in undertones : and [one]810-one said - [Sue]174-sue could not hear which - "[2838-they] [She]2839-she 's [[his]2840-his wife]4427-his wife , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[1125-some] [Some]1125-some say Yes : some say No , " was the reply from [the charwoman]6719-the charwoman . "[1125-some] Not ? Then [she]2839-she ought to be , or [somebody]4067-somebody 's - that 's very clear ! " "[2844-they] [They]2844-they 've only been married a very few weeks , whether or no . " "[2844-they] A strange pair to be painting the Two Tables ! [I]0-i wonder [Biles]366-biles and [Willis]336-willis could think of such a thing as hiring those ! " [The churchwarden]6724-the churchwarden supposed that [Biles]366-biles and [Willis]336-willis knew of nothing wrong , and then the other , who had been talking to [the old woman]1006-the old woman , explained what [she]1006-the old woman meant by calling [them]2844-they [strange people]6726-strange people . The probable drift of the subdued conversation which followed was made plain by [the churchwarden]6724-the churchwarden breaking into an anecdote , in a voice that [everybody in the church]6728-everybody in the church could hear , though obviously suggested by the present situation : "[336-willis] Well , now , it is a curious thing , but [[my]0-i grandfather]2631-my grandfather told [me]0-i a strange tale of a most immoral case that happened at the painting of the Commandments in [a church out by [Gaymead]134-gaymead]2846-a church out by gaymead - which is quite within a walk of this one . In them days Commandments were mostly done in gilt letters on a black ground , and that 's how they were out where [I]0-i say , before [the owld church]2847-the owld church was rebuilded . It must have been somewhere about a hundred years ago that [them Commandments]2848-them commandments wanted doing up just as [ours]2849-ours do here , and [they]2848-them commandments had to get [[men]716-men from [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham]2851-men from aldbrickham to do 'em . Now [they]2848-them commandments wished to get the job finished by a particular Sunday , so [the men]647-the men had to work late Saturday night , against [their]647-the men will , for overtime was not paid then as ' tis now . There was no true religion in [the country]4234-the country at that date , neither among [pa'sons]689-pa'sons , [clerks]2855-clerks , nor [people]658-people , and to keep [the men]647-the men up to [their]647-the men work [the vicar]1262-the vicar had to let ['em]647-the men have plenty of drink during the afternoon . As evening drawed on [they]2848-them commandments sent for some more [themselves]2848-them commandments ; rum , by all account . It got later and later , and [they]2848-them commandments got more and more fuddled , till at last [they]2848-them commandments went a - putting [their]2848-them commandments rum - bottle and rummers upon the communion table , and drawed up a trestle or two , and sate round comfortable and poured out again right hearty bumpers . No sooner had [they]2848-them commandments tossed off [their]2848-them commandments glasses than , so the story goes [they]2848-them commandments fell down senseless , one and all . How long [they]2848-them commandments bode so [they]2848-them commandments did n't know , but when [they]2848-them commandments came to [themselves]2848-them commandments there was a terrible thunder - storm a - raging , and [they]2848-them commandments seemed to see in the gloom [a dark figure with very thin legs and a curious voot]2859-a dark figure with very thin legs and a curious voot , a - standing on the ladder , and finishing [their]2848-them commandments work . When it got daylight [they]2848-them commandments could see that the work was really finished , and could n't at all mind finishing it [themselves]2848-them commandments . [They]2848-them commandments went [home]3897-home , and the next thing [they]2848-them commandments heard was that a great scandal had been caused in [the church]4809-the church that Sunday morning , for when [the people]5006-the people came and service began , [all]6610-all saw that the Ten Commandments [wez]2864-wez painted with the ' nots ' left out . [Decent people]2865-decent people would n't attend service [there]3887-there for a long time , and [the Bishop]4173-the bishop had to be sent for to reconsecrate [the church]4809-the church . That 's the tradition as [I]0-i used to hear it as [a child]781-a child . [You]2870-you must take it for what it is wo'th , but this case to - day has reminded [me]0-i o't , as [I]0-i say . " [The visitors]6729-the visitors gave one more glance , as if to see whether [Jude]180-jude and [Sue]174-sue had left the "[0-i] nots " out likewise , and then severally left [the church]4809-the church , even [the old woman]1006-the old woman at last . [Sue]174-sue and [Jude]180-jude , who had not stopped working , sent back [the child]3918-the child to [school]5856-school , and remained without speaking ; till , looking at [her]3918-the child narrowly , [he]180-jude found [she]3918-the child had been crying silently . "[1965-comrade] Never mind , [comrade]1965-comrade ! " [he]180-jude said . "[1965-comrade] [I]0-i know what it is ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't BEAR that [they]2872-they , and [everybody]411-everybody , should think [people]658-people wicked because [they]658-people may have chosen to live [their]658-people own way ! It is really these opinions that make [the best intentioned people]2875-the best intentioned people reckless , and actually become immoral ! " "[180-jude] Never be cast down ! It was only a funny story . " "[2876-we] Ah , but [we]2876-we suggested it ! [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i have done [you]0-i mischief , [Jude]180-jude , instead of helping [you]0-i by coming ! " To have suggested such a story was certainly not very exhilarating , in a serious view of [their]2876-we position . However , in a few minutes [Sue]174-sue seemed to see that [their]2876-we position this morning had a ludicrous side , and wiping [her]174-sue eyes [she]174-sue laughed . "[180-jude] It is droll , after all , " [she]174-sue said , "[180-jude] that [we]2876-we two , of all people , with [our]2876-we queer history , should happen to be here painting the Ten Commandments ! [You]0-i a reprobate , and [I]0-i - in [my]0-i condition ... O dear ! " ... " [They]2876-we sat down to lunch - which [they]2876-we had brought with [them]2876-we not to hinder time - and having eaten it were about to set to work anew when [a man]543-a man entered [the church]4809-the church , and [Jude]180-jude recognized in [him]543-a man the contractor Willis . [He]543-a man beckoned to [Jude]180-jude , and spoke to [him]180-jude apart . "[0-i] Here - [I]0-i 've just had a complaint about this , " [he]543-a man said , with rather breathless awkwardness . " [Jude]180-jude was too independent to make any fuss ; and [the contractor]2831-the contractor paid [him]180-jude , and left . [Jude]180-jude picked up [his]180-jude tools , and [Sue]174-sue cleansed [her]174-sue brush . Then [their]2881-we eyes met . " [Jude]180-jude returned . "[4107-anybody] Well , it ca n't be helped , [dear]795-dear ; and of course [I]0-i would n't wish to injure [Willis]336-willis 's trade - connection by staying . " [They]2881-we sat down passively for a few minutes , proceeded out of [the church]4809-the church , and overtaking [the boy]437-the boy pursued [their]2881-we thoughtful way to [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham . [Fawley]180-jude had still a pretty zeal in the cause of education , and , as was natural with [his]180-jude experiences , [he]180-jude was active in furthering "[0-i] equality of opportunity " by any humble means open to [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude had joined [an Artizans ' Mutual Improvement Society established in [the town]4154-the town]6739-an artizans ' mutual improvement society established in the town about the time of [his]180-jude arrival [there]3887-there ; [[its]6739-an artizans ' mutual improvement society established in the town members]6742-its members being [young men of all creeds and denominations]6743-young men of all creeds and denominations , including [Churchmen]6744-churchmen , [Congregationalists]6745-congregationalists , [Baptists]6746-baptists , [Unitarians]6747-unitarians , [Positivists]6748-positivists , and [others]4093-others - [agnostics]6750-agnostics had scarcely been heard of at this time - [their]6750-agnostics one common wish to enlarge [their]6750-agnostics minds forming a sufficiently close bond of union . The subscription was small , and [the room]4227-the room homely ; and [Jude]180-jude 's activity , uncustomary acquirements , and above all , singular intuition on what to read and how to set about it - begotten of [his]180-jude years of struggle against malignant stars - had led to [his]180-jude being placed on the committee . A few evenings after [his]180-jude dismissal from [the church repairs]6752-the church repairs , and before [he]180-jude had obtained any more work to do , [he]180-jude went to attend a meeting of [the aforesaid committee]6753-the aforesaid committee . It was late when [he]180-jude arrived : [all the others]6754-all the others had come , and as [he]180-jude entered [they]6754-all the others looked dubiously at [him]180-jude , and hardly uttered a word of greeting . [He]180-jude guessed that something bearing on [himself]180-jude had been either discussed or mooted . Some ordinary business was transacted , and it was disclosed that the number of subscriptions had shown a sudden falling off for that quarter . [One member]6755-one member - [a really well - meaning and upright man]6756-a really well - meaning and upright man - began speaking in enigmas about certain possible causes : that it behoved [them]6754-all the others to look well into [their]6754-all the others constitution ; for if [the committee]2062-the committee were not respected , and had not at least , in [their]6754-all the others differences , a common standard of CONDUCT , [they]6754-all the others would bring [the institution]6758-the institution to the ground . Nothing further was said in [Jude]180-jude 's presence , but [he]180-jude knew what this meant ; and turning to the table wrote a note resigning [[his]180-jude office]6759-his office there and then . Thus [the supersensitive couple]6760-the supersensitive couple were more and more impelled to go away . And then bills were sent in , and the question arose , what could [Jude]180-jude do with [[his]180-jude great - aunt]505-his great - aunt 's heavy old furniture , if [he]180-jude left [the town]4154-the town to travel [he]180-jude knew not whither ? This , and the necessity of ready money , compelled [him]180-jude to decide on an auction , much as [he]180-jude would have preferred to keep the venerable goods . The day of the sale came on ; and [Sue]174-sue for the last time cooked [her]174-sue own , [the child]3918-the child 's , and [Jude]180-jude 's breakfast in [the little house [he]180-jude had furnished]6764-the little house he had furnished . It chanced to be a wet day ; moreover [Sue]174-sue was unwell , and not wishing to desert [her]174-sue poor [Jude]180-jude in such gloomy circumstances , for [he]180-jude was compelled to stay awhile , [she]174-sue acted on the suggestion of [[the auctioneer]1466-the auctioneer 's man]6766-the auctioneer 's man , and ensconced [herself]174-sue in [an upper room]6767-an upper room , which could be emptied of its effects , and so kept closed to [the bidders]6768-the bidders . Here [Jude]180-jude discovered [her]174-sue ; and with [the child]3918-the child , and [their]3918-the child few trunks , baskets , and bundles , and two chairs and a table that were not in the sale , [the two]4416-the two sat in meditative talk . Footsteps began stamping up and down [the bare stairs]6771-the bare stairs , [the comers]6772-the comers inspecting the goods , some of which were of so quaint and ancient a make as to acquire an adventitious value as art . [Their]3918-the child door was tried once or twice , and to guard [themselves]3918-the child against intrusion [Jude]180-jude wrote "[0-i] Private " on a scrap of paper , and stuck it upon the panel . [They]3918-the child soon found that , instead of the furniture , [their]3918-the child own personal histories and past conduct began to be discussed to an unexpected and intolerable extent by [the intending bidders]6773-the intending bidders . It was not till now that [they]3918-the child really discovered what a fools ' paradise of supposed unrecognition [they]3918-the child had been living in of late . [Sue]174-sue silently took [[her]174-sue companion]5972-her companion 's hand , and with eyes on [each other]4188-each other [they]3918-the child heard these passing remarks - the quaint and mysterious personality of [Father Time]228-father being a subject which formed a large ingredient in the hints and innuendoes . At length the auction began in [the room below]6776-the room below , whence [they]3918-the child could hear each familiar article knocked down , the highly prized ones cheaply , the unconsidered at an unexpected price . "[0-i] [People]658-people do n't understand [us]2885-we , " [he]5972-her companion sighed heavily . "[0-i] [I]0-i am glad [we]2885-we have decided to go . " "[0-i] The question is , where to ? " "[0-i] It ought to be to [London]7-london . There [one]810-one can live as [one]810-one chooses . " "[0-i] No - not [London]7-london , [dear]795-dear ! [I]0-i know it well . [We]2885-we should be unhappy [there]3887-there . " "[2885-we] Why ? " "[2885-we] Ca n't [you]0-i think ? " "[2885-we] Because [Arabella]356-arabella is there ? " "[356-arabella] That 's the chief reason . " "[356-arabella] But in [the country]4234-the country [I]0-i shall always be uneasy lest there should be some more of [our]2885-we late experience . And [I]0-i do n't care to lessen it by explaining , for one thing , all about [the boy]437-the boy 's history . To cut [him]437-the boy off from [his]437-the boy past [I]0-i have determined to keep silence . [I]0-i am sickened of ecclesiastical work now ; and [I]0-i should n't like to accept it , if offered [me]0-i ! " "[795-dear] [You]795-dear ought to have learnt classic . Gothic is barbaric art , after all . [Pugin]367-pugin was wrong , and [Wren]368-wren was right . Remember [the interior of [Christminster Cathedral]135-christminster cathedral]2892-the interior of christminster cathedral - almost the first place in which [we]2885-we looked in [each other]4188-each other 's faces . Under the picturesqueness of those Norman details one can see the grotesque childishness of [uncouth people trying to imitate the vanished Roman forms , remembered by dim tradition only]2894-uncouth people trying to imitate the vanished roman forms , remembered by dim tradition only . " "[795-dear] Yes - [you]795-dear have half - converted [me]0-i to that view by what [you]795-dear have said before . But [one]810-one can work , and despise what [one]810-one does . [I]0-i must do something , if not church - gothic . " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [we]2885-we could both follow an occupation in which personal circumstances do n't count , " [she]0-i said , smiling up wistfully . "[0-i] [I]0-i am as disqualified for teaching as [you]795-dear are for ecclesiastical art . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not skilled in those ... [I]0-i ought to take to bread - baking . [I]0-i grew up in the baking business with [aunt]2902-aunt , [you]795-dear know . " "[4419-a baker] Unless [he]4419-a baker keeps a cake and gingerbread stall at markets and fairs , where [people]658-people are gloriously indifferent to everything except the quality of the goods . " One by one the articles went , and the afternoon passed away . [Jude]180-jude and [the other two]4332-the other two were getting tired and hungry , but after the conversation [they]2908-their had heard [they]2908-their were shy of going out while [the purchasers]6779-the purchasers were in [their]2908-their line of retreat . However , the later lots drew on , and it became necessary to emerge into the rain soon , to take on [Sue]174-sue 's things to [[their]2908-their temporary lodging]6780-their temporary lodging . "[4419-a baker] Now [the next lot]2909-the next lot : two pairs of pigeons , all alive and plump - a nice pie for [somebody for next Sunday]2910-somebody for next sunday 's dinner ! " The impending sale of these birds had been the most trying suspense of the whole afternoon . [They]2908-their were [Sue]174-sue 's pets , and when it was found that they could not possibly be kept , more sadness was caused than by parting from all the furniture . [Sue]174-sue tried to think away [her]174-sue tears as [she]174-sue heard the trifling sum that [[her]174-sue dears]6781-her dears were deemed to be worth advanced by small stages to the price at which [they]6781-her dears were finally knocked down . [The purchaser]6782-the purchaser was [a neighbouring poulterer]6783-a neighbouring poulterer , and [they]6781-her dears were unquestionably doomed to die before the next market day . Noting [her]174-sue dissembled distress [Jude]180-jude kissed [her]174-sue , and said it was time to go and see if [the lodgings]6784-the lodgings were ready . [He]180-jude would go on with [the boy]437-the boy , and fetch [her]174-sue soon . When [she]174-sue was left alone [she]174-sue waited patiently , but [Jude]180-jude did not come back . At last [she]174-sue started , [the coast]6786-the coast being clear , and on passing [[the poulterer]6787-the poulterer 's shop]6788-the poulterer 's shop , not far off , [she]174-sue saw [her]174-sue pigeons in a hamper by the door . An emotion at sight of [them]6781-her dears , assisted by the growing dusk of evening , caused [her]174-sue to act on impulse , and first looking around [her]174-sue quickly , [she]174-sue pulled out the peg which fastened down the cover , and went on . The cover was lifted from within , and the pigeons flew away with a clatter that brought [the chagrined poulterer]6789-the chagrined poulterer cursing and swearing to the door . [Sue]174-sue reached [the lodging trembling]6790-the lodging trembling , and found [Jude]180-jude and [the boy]437-the boy making it comfortable for [her]174-sue . "[4419-a baker] Do [the buyers]2911-the buyers pay before [they]2911-the buyers bring away the things ? " [she]174-sue asked breathlessly . "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i think . Why ? " "[0-i] Because , then , [I]0-i 've done such a wicked thing ! " And [she]174-sue explained , in bitter contrition . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall have to pay [the poulterer]6787-the poulterer for [them]2911-the buyers , if [he]6787-the poulterer does n't catch [them]2911-the buyers , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[6787-the poulterer] But never mind . Do n't fret about it , [dear]795-dear . " "[795-dear] It was so foolish of [me]0-i ! Oh why should [Nature]179-nature 's law be mutual butchery ! " "[229-mother] Is it so , [Mother]229-mother ? " asked [the boy]437-the boy intently . "[229-mother] Yes ! " said [Sue]174-sue vehemently . "[229-mother] Well , [they]2911-the buyers must take [their]2911-the buyers chance , now , poor things , " said [Jude]180-jude . "[2911-the buyers] As soon as the sale - account is wound up , and [our]2914-we bills paid , [we]2914-we go . " "[2911-the buyers] Where do [we]2914-we go to ? " asked [Time]228-father , in suspense . "[2911-the buyers] [We]2914-we must sail under sealed orders , that [nobody]4069-nobody may trace [us]2914-we ... [We]2914-we must n't go to [Alfredston]20-alfredston , or to [Melchester]3-melchester , or to [Shaston]4-shaston , or to [Christminster]180-jude . Apart from those [we]2914-we may go anywhere . " "[3907-father] Why must n't [we]2914-we go there , [Father]3907-father ? " "[3907-father] Because of a cloud that has gathered over [us]2914-we ; though ' [we]2914-we have wronged [no man]6310-no man , corrupted [no man]6310-no man , defrauded [no man]6310-no man ! ' Though perhaps [we]2914-we have ' done that which was right in [our]2914-we own eyes . ' " [VII]305-arabella From that week [Jude Fawley]180-jude and [Sue]174-sue walked no more in [the town of Aldbrickham]6793-the town of aldbrickham . Whither [they]2914-we had gone [nobody]4069-nobody knew , chiefly because [nobody]4069-nobody cared to know . [Any one sufficiently curious to trace the steps of such an obscure pair]6796-any one sufficiently curious to trace the steps of such an obscure pair might have discovered without great trouble that [they]2914-we had taken advantage of [his]180-jude adaptive craftsmanship to enter on a shifting , almost nomadic , life , which was not without its pleasantness for a time . Wherever [Jude]180-jude heard of free - stone work to be done , thither [he]180-jude went , choosing by preference places remote from [[his]180-jude old haunts]6797-his old haunts and [[Sue]174-sue 's]6798-sue 's . [He]180-jude laboured at a job , long or briefly , till it was finished ; and then moved on . Two whole years and a half passed thus . Sometimes [he]180-jude might have been found shaping the mullions of [a country mansion]6799-a country mansion , sometimes setting the parapet of [a town - hall]6800-a town - hall , sometimes ashlaring [an hotel at [Sandbourne]73-sandbourne]6801-an hotel at sandbourne , sometimes [a museum at [Casterbridge]136-casterbridge]6802-a museum at casterbridge , sometimes as far down as [Exonbury]137-exonbury , sometimes at [Stoke - Barehills]129-stoke - barehills . Later still [he]180-jude was at [Kennetbridge]89-kennetbridge , [a thriving town not more than a dozen miles south of Marygreen]6803-a thriving town not more than a dozen miles south of marygreen , this being [his]180-jude nearest approach to [[the village]410-the village where [he]180-jude was known]6805-the village where he was known ; for [he]180-jude had a sensitive dread of being questioned as to [his]180-jude life and fortunes by [those who had been acquainted with [him]180-jude during [his]180-jude ardent young manhood of study and promise , and [his]180-jude brief and unhappy married life at that time]6806-those who had been acquainted with him during his ardent young manhood of study and promise , and his brief and unhappy married life at that time . At some of [these places]6807-these places [he]180-jude would be detained for months , at others only a few weeks . [His]180-jude curious and sudden antipathy to ecclesiastical work , both episcopal and noncomformist , which had risen in [him]180-jude when suffering under a smarting sense of misconception , remained with [him]180-jude in cold blood , less from any fear of renewed censure than from an ultra - conscientiousness which would not allow [him]180-jude to seek a living out of [those who would disapprove of [his]180-jude ways]6808-those who would disapprove of his ways ; also , too , from a sense of inconsistency between [his]180-jude former dogmas and [his]180-jude present practice , hardly a shred of the beliefs with which [he]180-jude had first gone up to [Christminster]180-jude now remaining with [him]180-jude . [He]180-jude was mentally approaching the position which [Sue]174-sue had occupied when [he]180-jude first met [her]174-sue . On a Saturday evening in May , nearly three years after [Arabella]305-arabella 's recognition of [Sue]174-sue and [himself]180-jude at the agricultural show , some of those who there encountered [each other]4188-each other met again . It was the spring fair at [Kennetbridge]89-kennetbridge , and , though this ancient trade - meeting had much dwindled from [its]89-kennetbridge dimensions of former times , [the long straight street]6810-the long straight street of [the borough]5814-the borough presented a lively scene about midday . " [Arabella]356-arabella did calm [herself]356-arabella down by degrees ; and [they]2997-they crossed the ridge - way . To - day , in the open space stretching between [this building]6918-this building and [the nearest college]6919-the nearest college , stood [a crowd of expectant people]6920-a crowd of expectant people . "[3083-we] Here is [the place]3987-the place - [they]3086-they are just going to pass ! " cried [Jude]180-jude in sudden excitement . And pushing [his]180-jude way to the front [he]180-jude took up a position close to the barrier , still hugging [the youngest child]6925-the youngest child in [his]180-jude arms , while [Sue]174-sue and [the others]762-the others kept immediately behind [him]180-jude . [The crowd]1411-the crowd filled in at [their]6920-a crowd of expectant people back , and fell to talking , joking , and laughing as [carriage after carriage]6928-carriage after carriage drew up at the lower door of [the college]4625-the college , and [solemn stately figures in blood - red robes]6930-solemn stately figures in blood - red robes began to alight . The sky had grown overcast and livid , and thunder rumbled now and then . [Father Time]228-father shuddered . "[3083-we] It do seem like the Judgment Day ! " [he]180-jude whispered . "[3083-we] [They]3086-they are only [learned doctors]3087-learned doctors , " said [Sue]174-sue . While [they]6920-a crowd of expectant people waited big drops of rain fell on [their]6920-a crowd of expectant people heads and shoulders , and the delay grew tedious . [Sue]174-sue again wished not to stay . "[3086-they] [They]3086-they wo n't be long now , " said [Jude]180-jude , without turning [his]180-jude head . But the procession did not come forth , and [somebody in the crowd]6931-somebody in the crowd , to pass the time , looked at the facade of [the nearest college]6919-the nearest college , and said [he]6931-somebody in the crowd wondered what was meant by the Latin inscription in [its]6919-the nearest college midst . [Jude]180-jude , who stood near the inquirer , explained it , and finding that [the people all round [him]180-jude]6933-the people all round him were listening with interest , went on to describe the carving of the frieze which [he]180-jude had studied years before , and to criticize some details of masonry in [other college fronts about [the city]414-the city]6934-other college fronts about the city . [The idle crowd]6936-the idle crowd , including [the two policemen at the doors]6937-the two policemen at the doors , stared like [the Lycaonians]374-the lycaonians at [Paul]343-paul , for [Jude]180-jude was apt to get too enthusiastic over any subject in hand , and [they]6936-the idle crowd seemed to wonder how [the stranger]6938-the stranger should know more about [the buildings of [[their]6936-the idle crowd town]6940-their town]6939-the buildings of their town than [they]6936-the idle crowd [themselves]6936-the idle crowd did ; till [one of [them]6936-the idle crowd]1300-one of them said : "[3086-they] Why , [I]0-i know [that man]1681-that man ; [he]1681-that man used to work [here]3898-here years ago - [Jude Fawley]180-jude , that 's [his]1681-that man name ! " "[376-fortune] Do n't answer [them]3097-them any more ! " entreated [Sue]174-sue . "[376-fortune] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i like [Christminster]180-jude ! " murmured [little Time]228-father mournfully , as [he]228-father stood submerged and invisible in [the crowd]1411-the crowd . But finding [himself]0-i the centre of curiosity , quizzing , and comment , [Jude]180-jude was not inclined to shrink from open declarations of what [he]180-jude had no great reason to be ashamed of ; and in a little while was stimulated to say in a loud voice to [the listening throng]6641-the listening throng generally : "[376-fortune] It is a difficult question , [[my]0-i friends]944-my friends , for [any young man]3099-any young man - that question [I]0-i had to grapple with , and which [thousands]3100-thousands are weighing at the present moment in these uprising times - whether to follow uncritically the track [he]3099-any young man finds [himself]3099-any young man in , without considering [his]3099-any young man aptness for it , or to consider what [his]3099-any young man aptness or bent may be , and re - shape [his]3099-any young man course accordingly . [I]0-i tried to do the latter , and [I]0-i failed . But [I]0-i do n't admit that [my]0-i failure proved [my]0-i view to be a wrong one , or that [my]0-i success would have made it a right one ; though that 's how [we]3101-we appraise such attempts nowadays - [I]0-i mean , not by [their]3102-their essential soundness , but by their accidental outcomes . If [I]0-i had ended by becoming like one of [these gentlemen in red and black that [we]3101-we saw dropping in here by now]3103-these gentlemen in red and black that we saw dropping in here by now , [everybody]411-everybody would have said : ' See how wise [that young man]3105-that young man was , to follow the bent of [his]3105-that young man nature ! ' But having ended no better than [I]0-i began [they]3106-they say : ' See what [a fool that fellow]3107-a fool that fellow was in following a freak of [his]3105-that young man fancy ! ' " However it was [my]3108-i poverty and not [my]3108-i will that consented to be beaten . It takes two or three generations to do what [I]3108-i tried to do in one ; and [my]3108-i impulses - affections - vices perhaps [they]3106-they should be called - were too strong not to hamper [a man without advantages]6952-a man without advantages ; who should be as cold - blooded as a fish and as selfish as a pig to have a really good chance of being one of [his]3105-that young man country 's worthies . [You]6953-you may ridicule [me]3108-i - [I]3108-i am quite willing that [you]6953-you should - [I]3108-i am [a fit subject]6954-a fit subject , no doubt . Finding that the rain had ceased [she]174-sue proposed to [the boy]437-the boy that , after putting [the little ones]3198-the little ones to bed , [they]3199-they should go out and search about for another place , and bespeak it for the morrow , so as not to be so hard - driven then as [they]3199-they had been that day . Therefore , instead of unpacking [her]174-sue boxes , which had just been sent on from [the station]5059-the station by [Jude]180-jude , [they]3199-they sallied out into [the damp though not unpleasant streets]3201-the damp though not unpleasant streets , [Sue]174-sue resolving not to disturb [[her]174-sue husband]3921-her husband with the news of [her]174-sue notice to quit while [he]2264-husband was perhaps worried in obtaining a lodging for [himself]2264-husband . In the company of [the boy]437-the boy [she]174-sue wandered into [this street]6311-this street and into that ; but though [she]174-sue tried [a dozen different houses]3205-a dozen different houses [she]174-sue fared far worse alone than [she]174-sue had fared in [Jude]180-jude 's company , and could get [nobody]4069-nobody to promise [her]174-sue a room for the following day . [Every householder]3207-every householder looked askance at [such a woman]6995-such a woman and [child inquiring for accommodation in the gloom]3209-child inquiring for accommodation in the gloom . " [I]437-the boy ought not to be born , ought [I]437-the boy ? "[437-the boy] said [the boy]437-the boy with misgiving . Thoroughly tired at last [Sue]174-sue returned to [the place where [she]174-sue was not welcome , but where at least [she]174-sue had temporary shelter]3211-the place where she was not welcome , but where at least she had temporary shelter . In [her]174-sue absence [Jude]180-jude had left [[his]180-jude address]3212-his address ; but knowing how weak [he]180-jude still was [she]174-sue adhered to [her]174-sue determination not to disturb [him]180-jude till the next day . [II Sue]174-sue sat looking at the bare floor of [the room]4227-the room , [the house]504-the house being little more than [an old intramural cottage]3215-an old intramural cottage , and then [she]174-sue regarded the scene outside the uncurtained window . At some distance opposite , the outer walls of [Sarcophagus College]144-sarcophagus college - silent , black , and windowless - threw [their]3216-their four centuries of gloom , bigotry , and decay into [the little room]3217-the little room [she]174-sue occupied , shutting out the moonlight by night and the sun by day . The outlines of [Rubric College]145-rubric college also were discernible beyond the other , and [the tower of a third farther off still]3218-the tower of a third farther off still . [She]174-sue thought of the strange operation of [a simple - minded man]3219-a simple - minded man 's ruling passion , that it should have led [Jude]180-jude , who loved [her]174-sue and [the children]4875-the children so tenderly , to place [them]3221-them [here]3898-here in this depressing purlieu , because [he]180-jude was still haunted by [his]180-jude dream . Even now [he]180-jude did not distinctly hear the freezing negative that those scholared walls had echoed to [his]180-jude desire . The failure to find [another lodging]3223-another lodging , and the lack of room in [this house]2006-this house for [[his]180-jude father]3903-his father , had made a deep impression on [the boy]437-the boy - a brooding undemonstrative horror seemed to have seized [him]437-the boy . The silence was broken by [his]180-jude saying : " [Mother]4422-mother , WHAT shall [we]7008-we do to - morrow ! "[180-jude] " [I]174-sue do n't know ! "[174-sue] said [Sue]174-sue despondently . " [I]174-sue am afraid this will trouble [[your]437-the boy father]907-your father . "[174-sue] " [I]180-jude wish [Father]228-father was quite well , and there had been room for [him]228-father ! "[180-jude] " [Father]228-father went away to give [us]7008-we [children]4054-children room , did n't [he]228-father ? "[180-jude] " Partly . "[180-jude] [Sue]174-sue did not reply . [She]174-sue was doubtfully pondering how to treat [this too reflective child]3227-this too reflective child . "[3234-her] The following morning [she]3234-her awoke at a little past six , and decided to get up and run across before breakfast to [the inn which [Jude]180-jude had informed [her]3234-her to be [his]437-the boy quarters]3236-the inn which jude had informed her to be his quarters , to tell [him]437-the boy what had happened before [he]437-the boy went out . [She]3234-her arose softly , to avoid disturbing [the children]4875-the children , who , as [she]3234-her knew , must be fatigued by [their]4875-the children exertions of yesterday . [She]3234-her found [Jude]180-jude at breakfast in [the obscure tavern]3238-the obscure tavern [he]437-the boy had chosen as a counterpoise to the expense of [[her]3234-her lodging]2454-her lodging : and [she]3234-her explained to [him]437-the boy [her]3234-her homelessness . [He]437-the boy had been so anxious about [her]3234-her all night , [he]437-the boy said . Somehow , now it was morning , the request to leave [the lodgings]6784-the lodgings did not seem such a depressing incident as it had seemed the night before , nor did even [her]3234-her failure to find another place affect [her]3234-her so deeply as at first . [Jude]180-jude agreed with [her]3234-her that it would not be worth while to insist upon [her]3234-her right to stay a week , but to take immediate steps for removal .
