"[180-jude] [She]3241-she joined [Jude]180-jude in a hasty meal , and in a quarter of an hour [they]3242-they started together , resolving to clear out from [[Sue]174-sue 's too respectable lodging]3243-sue 's too respectable lodging immediately . On reaching [the place]3987-the place and going [upstairs]4313-upstairs [she]3241-she found that all was quiet in [[the children]4875-the children 's room]3247-the children 's room , and called to [the landlady]1579-the landlady in timorous tones to please bring up the tea - kettle and something for [their]4875-the children breakfast . This was perfunctorily done , and producing a couple of eggs which [she]3241-she had brought with [her]3241-she [she]3241-she put them into the boiling kettle , and summoned [Jude]180-jude to watch [them]4875-the children for [the youngsters]3249-the youngsters , while [she]3241-she went to call [them]3249-the youngsters , it being now about half - past eight o'clock . [Jude]180-jude stood bending over the kettle , with [his]180-jude watch in [his]180-jude hand , timing the eggs , so that [his]180-jude back was turned to the little inner chamber where [the children]4875-the children lay . A shriek from [Sue]174-sue suddenly caused [him]180-jude to start round . [He]180-jude saw that the door of [the room]4227-the room , or rather [closet]3252-closet - which had seemed to go heavily upon [its]3252-closet hinges as [she]3241-she pushed [it]3252-closet back - was open , and that [Sue]174-sue had sunk to the floor just within [it]3252-closet . Hastening forward to pick [her]174-sue up [he]180-jude turned [his]180-jude eyes to the little bed spread on the boards ; [no children]3253-no children were there . [He]180-jude looked in bewilderment round [the room]4227-the room . At the back of the door were fixed two hooks for hanging garments , and from these the forms of [the two youngest children]3255-the two youngest children were suspended , by a piece of box - cord round each of [their]3255-the two youngest children necks , while from a nail a few yards off the body of [little Jude]180-jude was hanging in a similar manner . An overturned chair was near [the elder boy]3256-the elder boy , and [his]3256-the elder boy glazed eyes were slanted into [the room]4227-the room ; but those of [the girl]4201-the girl and [the baby boy]3259-the baby boy were closed . Half - paralyzed by the strange and consummate horror of the scene [he]180-jude let [Sue]174-sue lie , cut the cords with [his]180-jude pocket - knife and threw [the three children]3260-the three children on the bed ; but the feel of [their]3260-the three children bodies in the momentary handling seemed to say that [they]3260-the three children were dead . [He]180-jude caught up [Sue]174-sue , who was in fainting fits , and put [her]174-sue on the bed in [the other room]3261-the other room , after which [he]180-jude breathlessly summoned [the landlady]1579-the landlady and ran out for [a doctor]3263-a doctor . When [he]180-jude got back [Sue]174-sue had come to [herself]174-sue , and [the two helpless women]3264-the two helpless women , bending over [the children]4875-the children in wild efforts to restore [them]4875-the children , and the triplet of little corpses , formed a sight which overthrew [his]180-jude self - command . [The nearest surgeon]3266-the nearest surgeon came in , but , as [Jude]180-jude had inferred , [his]3266-the nearest surgeon presence was superfluous . [The children]4875-the children were past saving , for though [their]4875-the children bodies were still barely cold it was conjectured that [they]4875-the children had been hanging more than an hour . The probability held by [the parents]3268-the parents later on , when [they]3268-the parents were able to reason on the case , was that [the elder boy]3256-the elder boy , on waking , looked into [the outer room]3270-the outer room for [Sue]174-sue , and , finding [her]174-sue absent , was thrown into a fit of aggravated despondency that the events and information of the evening before had induced in [his]180-jude morbid temperament . Moreover a piece of paper was found upon the floor , on which was written , in [the boy]437-the boy 's hand , with the bit of lead pencil that [he]180-jude carried : Done because [we]3272-we are [too menny]3273-too menny . At sight of this [Sue]174-sue 's nerves utterly gave way , an awful conviction that [her]174-sue discourse with [the boy]437-the boy had been the main cause of the tragedy , throwing [her]174-sue into a convulsive agony which knew no abatement . [They]3268-the parents carried [her]174-sue away against [her]174-sue wish to [a room on [the lower floor]3276-the lower floor]3275-a room on the lower floor ; and there [she]174-sue lay , [her]174-sue slight figure shaken with [her]174-sue gasps , and [her]174-sue eyes staring at the ceiling , [the woman of [the house]504-the house]3277-the woman of the house vainly trying to soothe [her]174-sue . [They]3268-the parents could hear from [this chamber]3279-this chamber [the people moving about above]3280-the people moving about above , and [she]174-sue implored to be allowed to go back , and was only kept from doing so by the assurance that , if there were any hope , [her]174-sue presence might do harm , and the reminder that it was necessary to take care of [herself]174-sue lest [she]174-sue should endanger a coming life . [Her]174-sue inquiries were incessant , and at last [Jude]180-jude came down and told [her]174-sue there was no hope . As soon as [she]174-sue could speak [she]174-sue informed [him]180-jude what [she]174-sue had said to [the boy]437-the boy , and how [she]174-sue thought [herself]174-sue the cause of this . " No , "[180-jude] said [Jude]180-jude . " It was in [his]180-jude nature to do it . [The doctor]7044-the doctor says there are [such boys]7045-such boys springing up amongst [us]7046-us - [boys of a sort unknown in the last generation]7047-boys of a sort unknown in the last generation - the outcome of new views of life . [They]7045-such boys seem to see all its terrors before [they]7045-such boys are old enough to have staying power to resist [them]7045-such boys . [He]180-jude says it is the beginning of the coming universal wish not to live . [He]180-jude 's [an advanced man]7048-an advanced man , [the doctor]7044-the doctor : but [he]180-jude can give no consolation to - "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude had kept back [his]180-jude own grief on account of [her]174-sue ; but [he]180-jude now broke down ; and this stimulated [Sue]174-sue to efforts of sympathy which in some degree distracted [her]174-sue from [her]174-sue poignant self - reproach . When [everybody]411-everybody was gone , [she]174-sue was allowed to see [the children]4875-the children . [The boy]437-the boy 's face expressed the whole tale of [their]4875-the children situation . On that little shape had converged all the inauspiciousness and shadow which had darkened the first union of [Jude]180-jude , and all the accidents , mistakes , fears , errors of the last . "[174-sue] " [Your]174-sue plan might have been a good one for the majority of cases ; only in [our]7067-we peculiar case it chanced to work badly perhaps . "[174-sue] " And [I]180-jude was just making [[my]180-jude baby]7068-my baby darling a new frock ; and now [I]180-jude shall never see [him]180-jude in it , and never talk to [him]180-jude any more ! ... [My]180-jude eyes are so swollen that [I]180-jude can scarcely see ; and yet little more than a year ago [I]180-jude called [myself]180-jude happy ! [We]7067-we went about loving [each other]4188-each other too much - indulging [ourselves]7067-we to utter selfishness with [each other]4188-each other ! [We]7067-we said - do [you]174-sue remember ? - that [we]7067-we would make a virtue of joy . What dreadful things [I]180-jude said ! And now [Fate]379-fate has given [us]7067-we this stab in the back for being such fools as to take [Nature]179-nature at [her]179-nature word ! "[180-jude] [She]3296-she sank into a quiet contemplation , till [she]3296-she said , " It is best , perhaps , that [they]7071-they should be gone . - Yes - [I]3296-she see it is ! Better that [they]7071-they should be plucked fresh than stay to wither away miserably ! "[3296-she] " Yes , "[180-jude] replied [Jude]180-jude . " [Some]1125-some say that [the elders]7073-the elders should rejoice when [[their]7073-the elders children]3132-their children die in infancy . "[3296-she] " But [they]7073-the elders do n't know ! ... Oh [[my]174-sue babies]7052-my babies , [[my]174-sue babies]7052-my babies , could [you]7052-my babies be alive now ! [You]7052-my babies may say [the boy]437-the boy wished to be out of life , or [he]437-the boy would n't have done it . It was not unreasonable for [him]437-the boy to die : it was part of [his]437-the boy incurably sad nature , [poor little fellow]7078-poor little fellow ! But then [the others]762-the others - [[my]174-sue OWN children]7080-my own children and [yours]7052-my babies ! "[174-sue] Again [Sue]174-sue looked at the hanging little frock and at the socks and shoes ; and [her]174-sue figure quivered like a string . " [I]174-sue am [a pitiable creature]7081-a pitiable creature , "[174-sue] [she]174-sue said , " good neither for [earth]6462-earth nor [heaven]7083-heaven any more ! [I]174-sue am driven out of [my]174-sue mind by things ! What ought to be done ? "[174-sue] [She]174-sue stared at [Jude]180-jude , and tightly held [his]180-jude hand . " Nothing can be done , "[180-jude] [he]180-jude replied . " Things are as [they]7084-they are , and will be brought to [their]7084-they destined issue . "[174-sue] [She]174-sue paused . " Yes ! Who said that ? "[174-sue] [she]174-sue asked heavily . " It comes in the chorus of [the Agamemnon]380-the agamemnon . It has been in [my]174-sue mind continually since this happened . "[174-sue] " [[My]3297-the jury poor]7085-my poor [Jude]180-jude - how [you]180-jude 've missed everything ! - [you]180-jude more than [I]3297-the jury , for [I]3297-the jury did get [you]180-jude ! To think [you]180-jude should know that by [your]180-jude unassisted reading , and yet be in poverty and despair ! "[3297-the jury] After such momentary diversions [her]174-sue grief would return in a wave . [The jury]3297-the jury duly came and viewed the bodies , the inquest was held ; and next arrived the melancholy morning of the funeral . Accounts in the newspapers had brought to the spot [curious idlers , who stood apparently counting the window - panes and the stones of the walls]3298-curious idlers , who stood apparently counting the window - panes and the stones of the walls . Doubt of the real relations of [the couple]5522-the couple added zest to [their]5522-the couple curiosity . [Sue]174-sue had declared that [she]174-sue would follow [the two little ones]3300-the two little ones to the grave , but at the last moment [she]174-sue gave way , and the coffins were quietly carried out of [the house]504-the house while [she]174-sue was lying down . [Jude]180-jude got into [the vehicle]3302-the vehicle , and it drove away , much to the relief of [the landlord]1464-the landlord , who now had only [Sue]174-sue and [her]174-sue luggage remaining on [his]1464-the landlord hands , which [he]1464-the landlord hoped to be also clear of later on in the day , and so to have freed [[his]1464-the landlord house]5370-his house from the exasperating notoriety [it]5370-his house had acquired during the week through [[his]1464-the landlord wife]4427-his wife 's unlucky admission of [these strangers]3306-these strangers . In the afternoon [he]180-jude privately consulted with [the owner of [the house]504-the house]3307-the owner of the house , and [they]3307-the owner of the house agreed that if any objection to it arose from the tragedy which had occurred [there]3887-there [they]3307-the owner of the house would try to get [its]504-the house number changed . When [Jude]180-jude had seen the two little boxes - one containing [little Jude]180-jude , and the other the two smallest - deposited in [the earth]6470-the earth [he]180-jude hastened back to [Sue]174-sue , who was still in [[her]174-sue room]6080-her room , and [he]180-jude therefore did not disturb [her]174-sue just then . Feeling anxious , however , [he]180-jude went again about four o'clock . [The woman]4031-the woman thought [she]4031-the woman was still lying down , but returned to [him]180-jude to say that [she]4031-the woman was not in [[her]4031-the woman bedroom]3313-her bedroom after all . [Her]4031-the woman hat and jacket , too , were missing : [she]4031-the woman had gone out . [Jude]180-jude hurried off to [the public house where [he]180-jude was sleeping]3314-the public house where he was sleeping . [She]4031-the woman had not been [there]3887-there . Then bethinking [himself]180-jude of possibilities [he]180-jude went along [the road]629-the road to [the cemetery]3317-the cemetery , which [he]180-jude entered , and crossed to where the interments had recently taken place . [The idlers who had followed to the spot by reason of the tragedy]3318-the idlers who had followed to the spot by reason of the tragedy were all gone now . [A man with a shovel in [his]3319-a man with a shovel in his hands hands]3319-a man with a shovel in his hands was attempting to earth in [the common grave of [the three children]3260-the three children]3320-the common grave of the three children , but [his]3319-a man with a shovel in his hands arm was held back by [an expostulating woman who stood in the half - filled hole]3322-an expostulating woman who stood in the half - filled hole . It was [Sue]174-sue , whose coloured clothing , which [she]174-sue had never thought of changing for the mourning [he]3319-a man with a shovel in his hands had bought , suggested to the eye a deeper grief than the conventional garb of bereavement could express . " [He]180-jude 's filling them in , and [he]180-jude sha n't till [I]174-sue 've seen [my]174-sue little ones again ! "[174-sue] [she]174-sue cried wildly when [she]174-sue saw [Jude]180-jude . " [I]174-sue want to see [them]3260-the three children once more . Oh [Jude]180-jude - please [Jude]180-jude - [I]174-sue want to see [them]3260-the three children ! [I]174-sue did n't know [you]180-jude would let [them]3260-the three children be taken away while [I]174-sue was asleep ! [You]180-jude said perhaps [I]174-sue should see [them]3260-the three children once more before [they]3260-the three children were screwed down ; and then [you]180-jude did n't , but took them away ! Oh [Jude]180-jude , [you]180-jude are cruel to [me]174-sue too ! "[174-sue] " [She]174-sue 's been wanting [me]3323-the man with the spade to dig out [the grave]5944-the grave again , and let [her]174-sue get to the coffins , "[3323-the man with the spade] said [the man with the spade]3323-the man with the spade . " [She]174-sue ought to be took [home]3897-home , by the look o ' [her]174-sue . [She]174-sue is hardly responsible , [poor thing]7088-poor thing , seemingly . Do [ye]936-ma'am go [home]3897-home with [[your]936-ma'am husband]1785-your husband , and take it quiet , and thank [God]177-god that there 'll be another soon to swage [yer]936-ma'am grief . "[3323-the man with the spade] But [Sue]174-sue kept asking piteously : " Ca n't [I]174-sue see [them]7092-them once more - just once ! Ca n't [I]174-sue ? Only just one little minute , [Jude]180-jude ? It would not take long ! And [I]174-sue should be so glad , [Jude]180-jude ! [I]174-sue will be so good , and not disobey [you]180-jude ever any more , [Jude]180-jude , if [you]180-jude will let [me]174-sue ? [I]174-sue would go [home]3897-home quietly afterwards , and not want to see [them]7092-them any more ! Ca n't [I]174-sue ? Why ca n't [I]174-sue ? "[174-sue] Thus [she]174-sue went on . [Jude]180-jude was thrown into such acute sorrow that [he]180-jude almost felt [he]180-jude would try to get [the man]607-the man to accede . But it could do no good , and might make [her]174-sue still worse ; and [he]180-jude saw that it was imperative to get [her]174-sue [home]3897-home at once . So [he]180-jude coaxed [her]174-sue , and whispered tenderly , and put [his]180-jude arm round [her]174-sue to support [her]174-sue ; till [she]174-sue helplessly gave in , and was induced to leave [the cemetery]3317-the cemetery . [He]180-jude wished to obtain a fly to take [her]174-sue back in , but economy being so imperative [she]174-sue deprecated [his]180-jude doing so , and [they]3327-we walked along slowly , [Jude]180-jude in black crape , [she]174-sue in brown and red clothing . [They]3327-we were to have gone to [a new lodging]3328-a new lodging that afternoon , but [Jude]180-jude saw that it was not practicable , and in course of time [they]3327-we entered [the now hated house]3329-the now hated house . [Sue]174-sue was at once got to bed , and [the doctor]7044-the doctor sent for . [Jude]180-jude waited all the evening [downstairs]4245-downstairs . At a very late hour the intelligence was brought to [him]180-jude that [a child had been prematurely born]3332-a child had been prematurely born , and that it , like the others , was a corpse . [III Sue]174-sue was convalescent , though [she]174-sue had hoped for death , and [Jude]180-jude had again obtained work at [his]180-jude old trade . [They]3327-we were in [other lodgings]3333-other lodgings now , in [the direction of [Beersheba]34-beersheba]3334-the direction of beersheba , and not far from [the Church of Ceremonies - Saint Silas]146-the church of ceremonies - saint silas . [They]3327-we would sit silent , more bodeful of the direct antagonism of things than of [their]3327-we insensate and stolid obstructiveness . Vague and quaint imaginings had haunted [Sue]174-sue in the days when [her]174-sue intellect scintillated like a star , that [the world]706-the world resembled a stanza or melody composed in a dream ; it was wonderfully excellent to the half - aroused intelligence , but hopelessly absurd at the full waking ; that the first cause worked automatically like a somnambulist , and not reflectively like [a sage]3336-a sage ; that at the framing of the terrestrial conditions there seemed never to have been contemplated such a development of emotional perceptiveness among [the creatures subject to those conditions as that reached by thinking and educated humanity]3337-the creatures subject to those conditions as that reached by thinking and educated humanity . But affliction makes opposing forces loom anthropomorphous ; and those ideas were now exchanged for a sense of [Jude]180-jude and [herself]180-jude fleeing from [a persecutor]3338-a persecutor . " [We]3327-we must conform ! "[174-sue] [she]174-sue said mournfully . " All the ancient wrath of [the Power above [us]3327-we]7094-the power above us has been vented upon [us]3327-we , [[His]180-jude poor creatures]7095-his poor creatures , and [we]3327-we must submit . There is no choice . [We]3327-we must . It is no use fighting against [God]177-god ! "[174-sue] " It is only against [man]575-man and senseless circumstance , "[180-jude] said [Jude]180-jude . " True ! "[174-sue] [she]174-sue murmured . " What have [I]174-sue been thinking of ! [I]174-sue am getting as superstitious as [a savage]7097-a savage ! ... But whoever or whatever [[our]3327-we foe]7098-our foe may be , [I]174-sue am cowed into submission . [I]174-sue have no more fighting strength left ; no more enterprise . [I]174-sue am beaten , beaten ! ... ' [We]3327-we are made a spectacle unto [the world]706-the world , and to [angels]7054-angels , and to [men]716-men ! ' [I]174-sue am always saying that now . "[174-sue] " [I]174-sue feel the same ! "[174-sue] " What shall [we]3327-we do ? [You]174-sue are in work now ; but remember , it may only be because [our]3327-we history and relations are not absolutely known ... Possibly , if [they]7102-they knew [our]3327-we marriage had not been formalized [they]7102-they would turn [you]174-sue out of [your]174-sue job as [they]7102-they did at [Aldbrickham]5-aldbrickham ! "[174-sue] " [I]174-sue hardly know . Perhaps [they]7102-they would hardly do that . However , [I]174-sue think that [we]3327-we ought to make it legal now - as soon as [you]174-sue are able to go out . "[174-sue] " [You]174-sue think [we]3327-we ought ? "[174-sue] " Certainly . "[174-sue] And [Jude]180-jude fell into thought . " [I]180-jude have seemed to [myself]180-jude lately , "[180-jude] [he]180-jude said , " to belong to [that vast band of [men shunned by the virtuous]7104-men shunned by the virtuous]7103-that vast band of men shunned by the virtuous - [the men called [seducers]7106-seducers]7105-the men called seducers . It amazes [me]180-jude when [I]180-jude think of it ! [I]180-jude have not been conscious of it , or of any wrongdoing towards [you]174-sue , whom [I]180-jude love more than [myself]180-jude . Yet [I]180-jude am [one of [those men]7108-those men]7107-one of those men ! [I]180-jude wonder if [any other of [them]7108-those men]7109-any other of them are the same purblind , simple creatures as [I]180-jude ? ... Yes , [Sue]174-sue - that 's what [I]180-jude am . [I]180-jude seduced [you]174-sue ... [You]174-sue were a distinct type - [a refined creature , intended by Nature to be left intact]7110-a refined creature , intended by nature to be left intact . But [I]180-jude could n't leave [you]174-sue alone ! "[180-jude] " No , no , [Jude]180-jude ! "[3339-i] [she]3339-i said quickly . " Do n't reproach [yourself]180-jude with being what [you]180-jude are not . If [anybody]4107-anybody is to blame it is [I.]180-jude "[3339-i] " [I]180-jude supported [you]174-sue in [your]174-sue resolve to leave [Phillotson]258-phillotson ; and without [me]180-jude perhaps [you]174-sue would n't have urged [him]180-jude to let [you]174-sue go . "[180-jude] " [I]3339-i should have , just the same . As to [ourselves]3341-our , the fact of [our]3341-our not having entered into a legal contract is the saving feature in [our]3341-our union . [We]3341-our have thereby avoided insulting , as it were , the solemnity of [our]3341-our first marriages . "[3339-i] " Solemnity ? "[3339-i] [Jude]180-jude looked at [her]3339-i with some surprise , and grew conscious that [she]3339-i was not [the Sue of [their]3341-our earlier time]3340-the sue of their earlier time . " Yes , "[3339-i] [she]3339-i said , with a little quiver in [her]3339-i words , " [I]3339-i have had dreadful fears , a dreadful sense of [my]3339-i own insolence of action . "[3339-i] " Good God , [dearest]6404-dearest ! - why ? "[3339-i] " Oh [I]3339-i ca n't explain ! Only the thought comes to [me]3339-i . "[3339-i] " It is [your]3339-i weakness - a sick fancy , without reason or meaning ! Do n't let it trouble [you]3339-i . "[3339-i] [Sue]174-sue sighed uneasily . As a set - off against such discussions as these there had come an improvement in [their]3341-our pecuniary position , which earlier in [their]3341-our experience would have made [them]3341-our cheerful . [Jude]180-jude had quite unexpectedly found good employment at [his]180-jude old trade almost directly [he]180-jude arrived , the summer weather suiting [his]180-jude fragile constitution ; and outwardly [his]180-jude days went on with that monotonous uniformity which is in itself so grateful after vicissitude . [People]658-people seemed to have forgotten that [he]180-jude had ever shown any awkward aberrancies : and [he]180-jude daily mounted to the parapets and copings of [colleges]6990-colleges [he]180-jude could never enter , and renewed the crumbling freestones of mullioned windows [he]180-jude would never look from , as if [he]180-jude had known no wish to do otherwise . There was this change in [him]180-jude ; that [he]180-jude did not often go to any service at [the churches]4760-the churches now . One thing troubled [him]180-jude more than any other ; that [Sue]174-sue and [himself]180-jude had mentally travelled in opposite directions since the tragedy : events which had enlarged [his]180-jude own views of life , laws , customs , and dogmas , had not operated in the same manner on [Sue]174-sue 's . [She]174-sue was no longer the same as in the independent days , when [her]174-sue intellect played like lambent lightning over conventions and formalities which [he]180-jude at that time respected , though [he]180-jude did not now . On a particular Sunday evening [he]180-jude came in rather late . [She]174-sue was not at [home]3897-home , but [she]174-sue soon returned , when [he]180-jude found [her]174-sue silent and meditative . " What are [you]174-sue thinking of , [little woman]7114-little woman ? "[180-jude] [he]180-jude asked curiously . " Oh [I]180-jude ca n't tell clearly ! [I]180-jude have thought that [we]7115-we have been selfish , careless , even impious , in [our]7115-we courses , [you]174-sue and [I.]180-jude [Our]7115-we life has been a vain attempt at self - delight . But self - abnegation is the higher road . [We]7115-we should mortify the flesh - the terrible flesh - the curse of [Adam]381-adam ! "[180-jude] " [Sue]174-sue ! "[180-jude] [he]180-jude murmured . " What has come over [you]174-sue ? "[180-jude] " [We]7115-we ought to be continually sacrificing [ourselves]7115-we on the altar of duty ! But [I]180-jude have always striven to do what has pleased [me]180-jude . [I]180-jude well deserved the scourging [I]180-jude have got ! [I]180-jude wish something would take the evil right out of [me]180-jude , and all [my]180-jude monstrous errors , and all [my]180-jude sinful ways ! "[180-jude] " [Sue]174-sue - [my]180-jude own too suffering dear ! - there 's [no evil woman]7116-no evil woman in [you]174-sue . [Your]174-sue natural instincts are perfectly healthy ; not quite so impassioned , perhaps , as [I]180-jude could wish ; but good , and dear , and pure . And as [I]180-jude have often said , [you]174-sue are absolutely [the most ethereal , least sensual woman [I]180-jude ever knew]7117-the most ethereal , least sensual woman i ever knew to exist without inhuman sexlessness . Why do [you]174-sue talk in such a changed way ? [We]7115-we have not been selfish , except when [no one]2101-no one could profit by [our]7115-we being otherwise . [You]174-sue used to say that human nature was noble and long - suffering , not vile and corrupt , and at last [I]180-jude thought [you]174-sue spoke truly . And now [you]174-sue seem to take such a much lower view ! "[180-jude] " [I]180-jude want a humble heart ; and a chastened mind ; and [I]180-jude have never had them yet ! "[180-jude] " [You]174-sue have been fearless , both as [a thinker]7119-a thinker and as [a feeler]2156-a feeler , and [you]174-sue deserved more admiration than [I]180-jude gave . [I]180-jude was too full of narrow dogmas at that time to see it . "[180-jude] " Do n't say that , [Jude]180-jude ! [I]180-jude can not humiliate [myself]180-jude too much . [I]180-jude should like to prick [myself]180-jude all over with pins and bleed out the badness that 's in [me]180-jude ! "[180-jude] " Hush ! "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude went vaguely in the direction of [the church]4809-the church , which [he]180-jude had never once approached since [he]180-jude lived out that way years before , when [his]180-jude young opinions were more mystical than they were now . [The spot]654-the spot was deserted , but the door was certainly unfastened ; [he]180-jude lifted the latch without noise , and pushing to the door behind [him]180-jude , stood absolutely still inside . The prevalent silence seemed to contain a faint sound , explicable as a breathing , or a sobbing , which came from the other end of [the building]4677-the building . The floor - cloth deadened [his]180-jude footsteps as [he]180-jude moved in that direction through the obscurity , which was broken only by the faintest reflected night - light from without . High overhead , above [the chancel steps]3371-the chancel steps , [Jude]180-jude could discern a huge , solidly constructed Latin cross - as large , probably , as the original [it]3372-it was designed to commemorate . It seemed to be suspended in the air by invisible wires ; it was set with large jewels , which faintly glimmered in some weak ray caught from outside , as the cross swayed to and fro in a silent and scarcely perceptible motion . Underneath , upon the floor , lay what appeared to be a heap of black clothes , and from this was repeated the sobbing that [he]180-jude had heard before . It was [his]180-jude [Sue]174-sue 's form , prostrate on the paving . " [Sue]174-sue ! "[180-jude] [he]180-jude whispered . "[3384-i] " [O Sue]174-sue ! "[3385-you] said [he]3385-you with a sudden sense of [his]3385-you own danger . " Do not do an immoral thing for moral reasons ! Do n't abandon [me]174-sue to [them]7233-my two arch - enemies , [Sue]174-sue , to save [your]174-sue own soul only ! [They]7233-my two arch - enemies have been kept entirely at a distance since [you]174-sue became [[my]174-sue guardian - angel]7235-my guardian - angel ! Since [I]174-sue have had [you]174-sue [I]174-sue have been able to go into any temptations of the sort , without risk . Is n't [my]174-sue safety worth a little sacrifice of dogmatic principle ? [I]174-sue am in terror lest , if [you]174-sue leave [me]174-sue , it will be with [me]174-sue another case of the pig that was washed turning back to [his]7236-his wallowing in the mire ! "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue burst out weeping . " Oh , but [you]180-jude must not , [Jude]180-jude ! [You]180-jude wo n't ! [I]174-sue 'll pray for [you]180-jude night and day ! "[174-sue] " Well - never mind ; do n't grieve , "[180-jude] said [Jude]180-jude generously . " [I]180-jude did suffer , [God]177-god knows , about [you]174-sue at that time ; and now [I]180-jude suffer again . But perhaps not so much as [you]174-sue . [The woman]4031-the woman mostly gets the worst of it in the long run ! "[180-jude] " [She]4031-the woman does . "[174-sue] " Unless [she]4031-the woman is absolutely worthless and contemptible . And this one is not that , anyhow ! "[174-sue] [Sue]174-sue drew a nervous breath or two . " [She]4031-the woman is - [I]174-sue fear ! ... Now [Jude]180-jude - good - night , - please ! "[174-sue] " [I]174-sue must n't stay ? - Not just once more ? As it has been so many times - O [Sue]174-sue , [[my]174-sue wife]1861-my wife , why not ! "[174-sue] " No - no - not wife ! ... [I]3386-i owe that to [you]180-jude , [darling]841-darling , in penance for how [I]3386-i overruled it at the first time . [[My]3386-i God]7240-my god , how selfish [I]3386-i was ! "[3386-i] [He]3386-i went to the bed , removed one of the pair of pillows thereon , and flung it to the floor . [Sue]174-sue looked at [him]3386-i , and bending over the bed - rail wept silently . " [You]180-jude do n't see that it is a matter of conscience with [me]174-sue , and not of dislike to [you]3386-i ! "[174-sue] [she]174-sue brokenly murmured . " Dislike to [you]3386-i ! "[331-gillingham] At the end of the week , when [Gillingham]331-gillingham had gone back to [[his]331-gillingham school near [Shaston]4-shaston]3398-his school near shaston , [Phillotson]258-phillotson , as was [his]331-gillingham custom , went to [[Alfredston]20-alfredston market]972-alfredston market ; ruminating again on [Arabella]356-arabella 's intelligence as [he]331-gillingham walked down [the long hill which [he]331-gillingham had known before [Jude]180-jude knew it]3400-the long hill which he had known before jude knew it , though [his]331-gillingham history had not beaten so intensely upon its incline . " [Arabella]356-arabella smiled grimly as [she]356-arabella resumed [her]356-arabella way , and practised dimple - making all along [the road]629-the road from where the pollard willows begin to [the old almshouses in [the first street of [the town]4154-the town]7259-the first street of the town]7258-the old almshouses in the first street of the town . Meanwhile [Phillotson]258-phillotson ascended to [Marygreen]1-marygreen , and for the first time during a lengthened period [he]3907-father lived with a forward eye . On crossing under the large trees of [the green]464-the green to [the humble schoolhouse to which [he]3907-father had been reduced]7262-the humble schoolhouse to which he had been reduced [he]3907-father stood a moment , and pictured [Sue]174-sue coming out of the door to meet [him]3907-father . [No man]6310-no man had ever suffered more inconvenience from [his]3907-father own charity , [Christian]185-christian or [heathen]7264-heathen , than [Phillotson]258-phillotson had done in letting [Sue]174-sue go . [He]3907-father had been knocked about from pillar to post at the hands of the virtuous almost beyond endurance ; [he]3907-father had been nearly starved , and was now dependent entirely upon the very small stipend from [the school of [this village]7266-this village]7265-the school of this village where [the parson]4761-the parson had got ill - spoken of for befriending [him]3907-father . [He]3907-father had often thought of [Arabella]356-arabella 's remarks that [he]3907-father should have been more severe with [Sue]174-sue , that [her]356-arabella recalcitrant spirit would soon have been broken . Yet such was [his]3907-father obstinate and illogical disregard of opinion , and of the principles in which [he]3907-father had been trained , that [his]3907-father convictions on the rightness of [his]3907-father course with [[his]3907-father wife]4427-his wife had not been disturbed . Principles which could be subverted by feeling in one direction were liable to the same catastrophe in another . The instincts which had allowed [him]3907-father to give [Sue]174-sue [her]174-sue liberty now enabled [him]3907-father to regard [her]174-sue as none the worse for [her]174-sue life with [Jude]180-jude . [He]3907-father wished for [her]174-sue still , in [his]3907-father curious way , if [he]3907-father did not love [her]174-sue , and , apart from policy , soon felt that [he]3907-father would be gratified to have [her]174-sue again as [his]3907-father , always provided that [she]174-sue came willingly . But artifice was necessary , [he]3907-father had found , for stemming the cold and inhumane blast of [the world]706-the world 's contempt . And here were the materials ready made . By getting [Sue]174-sue back and remarrying [her]174-sue on the respectable plea of having entertained erroneous views of [her]174-sue , and gained [his]3907-father divorce wrongfully , [he]3907-father might acquire some comfort , resume [his]3907-father old courses , perhaps return to [the Shaston school]7270-the shaston school , if not even to [the Church]4809-the church as [a licentiate]4830-a licentiate . [He]3907-father thought [he]3907-father would write to [Gillingham]331-gillingham to inquire [his]3907-father views , and what [he]3907-father thought of [his]3907-father , [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's , sending a letter to [her]174-sue . [Gillingham]331-gillingham replied , naturally , that now [she]174-sue was gone it were best to let [her]174-sue be , and considered that if [she]174-sue were [[anybody]4107-anybody 's wife]7274-anybody 's wife [she]174-sue was [the wife of [the man to whom [she]174-sue had borne [three children and owed such tragical adventures]7277-three children and owed such tragical adventures]7276-the man to whom she had borne three children and owed such tragical adventures]7275-the wife of the man to whom she had borne three children and owed such tragical adventures . Probably , as [his]3907-father attachment to [her]174-sue seemed unusually strong , [the singular pair]7278-the singular pair would make [their]7278-the singular pair union legal in course of time , and all would be well , and decent , and in order . "[3427-they] But [they]3427-they wo n't - [Sue]174-sue wo n't ! " exclaimed [Phillotson]258-phillotson to [himself]258-phillotson . "[331-gillingham] [Gillingham]331-gillingham is so matter of fact . [She]174-sue 's affected by [Christminster]180-jude sentiment and teaching . [I]0-i can see [her]174-sue views on the indissolubility of marriage well enough , and [I]0-i know where [she]174-sue got them . They are not mine ; but [I]0-i shall make use of them to further [mine]0-i . " [He]3429-he wrote a brief reply to [Gillingham]331-gillingham . "[0-i] [I]0-i know [I]0-i am entirely wrong , but [I]0-i do n't agree with [you]331-gillingham . As to [her]174-sue having lived with and had [three children]3428-three children by [him]3429-he , [my]0-i feeling is though [I]0-i can advance no logical or moral defence of it , on the old lines that it has done little more than finish [her]174-sue education . [I]0-i shall write to [her]174-sue , and learn whether what [that woman]4919-that woman said is true or no . " As [he]3429-he had made up [his]3429-he mind to do this before [he]3429-he had written to [[his]3429-he friend]1009-his friend , there had not been much reason for writing to [the latter]444-the latter at all . However , it was [Phillotson]258-phillotson 's way to act thus . [He]3429-he accordingly addressed a carefully considered epistle to [Sue]174-sue , and , knowing [her]174-sue emotional temperament , threw a Rhadamanthine strictness into the lines here and there , carefully hiding [his]3429-he heterodox feelings , not to frighten [her]174-sue . [He]3429-he stated that , it having come to [his]3429-he knowledge that [her]174-sue views had considerably changed , [he]3429-he felt compelled to say that [his]3429-he own , too , were largely modified by events subsequent to [their]7281-their parting . [He]3429-he would not conceal from [her]174-sue that passionate love had little to do with [his]3429-he communication . It arose from a wish to make [their]7281-their lives , if not a success , at least no such disastrous failure as [they]7281-their threatened to become , through [his]3429-he acting on what [he]3429-he had considered at the time a principle of justice , charity , and reason . To indulge [one]810-one 's instinctive and uncontrolled sense of justice and right , was not , [he]3429-he had found , permitted with impunity in an old civilization like [ours]7283-ours . It was necessary to act under an acquired and cultivated sense of the same , if [you]7284-you wished to enjoy an average share of comfort and honour ; and to let crude loving kindness take care of itself . [He]3429-he suggested that [she]174-sue should come to [him]3429-he there at [Marygreen]1-marygreen . On second thoughts [he]3429-he took out the last paragraph but one ; and having rewritten the letter [he]3429-he dispatched it immediately , and in some excitement awaited the issue . A few days after [a figure]5877-a figure moved through the white fog which enveloped [the Beersheba suburb of [Christminster]180-jude]7286-the beersheba suburb of christminster , towards [the quarter in which [Jude Fawley]180-jude had taken up [his]180-jude lodging since [his]180-jude division from [Sue]174-sue]7287-the quarter in which jude fawley had taken up his lodging since his division from sue . A timid knock sounded upon the door of [[his]180-jude abode]7288-his abode . It was evening - so [he]180-jude was at [home]3897-home ; and by a species of divination [he]180-jude jumped up and rushed to the door [himself]180-jude . "[3431-you] Will [you]3431-you come out with [me]0-i ? [I]0-i would rather not come in . [I]0-i want to - to talk with [you]3431-you - and to go with [you]3431-you to [the cemetery]3317-the cemetery . " It had been in the trembling accents of [Sue]174-sue that these words came . [Jude]180-jude put on [his]180-jude hat . "[0-i] It is dreary for [you]3431-you to be out , " [he]180-jude said . "[0-i] But if [you]3431-you prefer not to come in , [I]0-i do n't mind . " "[0-i] Yes - [I]0-i do . [I]0-i shall not keep [you]3431-you long . " [Jude]180-jude was too much affected to go on talking at first ; [she]3431-you , too , was now such a mere cluster of nerves that all initiatory power seemed to have left [her]3431-you , and [they]7290-they proceeded through the fog like Acherontic shades for a long while , without sound or gesture . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to tell [you]0-i , " [she]0-i presently said , [her]0-i voice now quick , now slow , ' so that [you]0-i may not hear of it by chance . [I]0-i am going back to [Richard]258-phillotson . [He]3433-you has - so magnanimously - agreed to forgive all . "[0-i] " Going back ? How can [you]0-i go - "[3433-you] " [He]3433-you is going to marry [me]3433-you again . That is for form 's sake , and to satisfy [the world]706-the world , which does not see things as they are . But of course [I]3433-you AM [[his]3433-you wife]4427-his wife already . Nothing has changed that . "[3433-you] [He]3433-you turned upon [her]0-i with an anguish that was well - nigh fierce . " But [you]0-i are [[MY]3433-you wife]1861-my wife ! Yes , [you]0-i are . [You]0-i know it . [I]3433-you have always regretted that feint of [ours]7294-we in going away and pretending to come back legally married , to save appearances . [I]3433-you loved [you]0-i , and [you]0-i loved [me]3433-you ; and [we]7294-we closed with [each other]4188-each other ; and that made the marriage . [We]7294-we still love - [you]0-i as well as [I]3433-you - KNOW it , [Sue]174-sue ! Therefore [our]7294-we marriage is not cancelled . "[3433-you] " Yes ; [I]3434-i know how [you]3433-you see it , "[3434-i] [she]3434-i answered with despairing self - suppression . " But [I]3434-i am going to marry [him]3433-you again , as it would be called by [you]3433-you . Strictly speaking [you]3433-you , too - do n't mind [my]3434-i saying it , [Jude]180-jude ! - [you]3433-you should take back - [Arabella]305-arabella . "[3434-i] " [I]3433-you should ? [Good God]177-god - what next ! But how if [you]3433-you and [I]3433-you had married legally , as [we]7294-we were on the point of doing ? "[3433-you] " [I]3435-i should have felt just the same - that [ours]7294-we was not a marriage . And [I]3435-i would go back to [Richard]258-phillotson without repeating the sacrament , if [he]3433-you asked [me]3435-i . But ' [the world]706-the world and its ways have a certain worth ' [I]3435-i suppose : therefore [I]3435-i concede a repetition of the ceremony ... Do n't crush all the life out of [me]3435-i by satire and argument , [I]3435-i implore [you]3433-you ! [I]3435-i was strongest once , [I]3435-i know , and perhaps [I]3435-i treated [you]3433-you cruelly . But [Jude]180-jude , return good for evil ! [I]3435-i am the weaker now . Do n't retaliate upon [me]3435-i , but be kind . Oh be kind to [me]3435-i - [a poor wicked woman who is trying to mend]7297-a poor wicked woman who is trying to mend ! "[3435-i] [He]3435-i shook [his]3435-i head hopelessly , [his]3435-i eyes wet . The blow of [her]3436-her bereavement seemed to have destroyed [her]3436-her reasoning faculty . The once keen vision was dimmed . " All wrong , all wrong ! "[3435-i] [he]3435-i said huskily . " Error - perversity ! It drives [me]3435-i out of [my]3435-i senses . Do [you]3433-you care for [him]3435-i ? Do [you]3433-you love [him]3435-i ? [You]3433-you know [you]3433-you do n't ! It will be [a fanatic prostitution - God]7298-a fanatic prostitution - god forgive [me]3435-i , yes - that 's what it will be ! "[3435-i] " [I]180-jude do n't love [him]3435-i - [I]180-jude must , must , own it , in deepest remorse ! But [I]180-jude shall try to learn to love [him]3435-i by obeying [him]3435-i . "[180-jude] [Jude]180-jude argued , urged , implored ; but [her]3436-her conviction was proof against all . It seemed to be the one thing on earth on which [she]3436-her was firm , and that [her]3436-her firmness in this had left [her]3436-her tottering in every other impulse and wish [she]3436-her possessed . " [I]3436-her have been considerate enough to let [you]180-jude know the whole truth , and to tell it [you]180-jude [myself]3436-her , "[3436-her] [she]3436-her said in cut tones ; " that [you]180-jude might not consider [yourself]180-jude slighted by hearing of it at second hand . [I]3436-her have even owned the extreme fact that [I]3436-her do not love [him]3435-i . [I]3436-her did not think [you]180-jude would be so rough with [me]3436-her for doing so ! [I]3436-her was going to ask [you]180-jude ... "[3436-her] " To give [you]180-jude away ? "[3438-i] " No . To send - [my]3438-i boxes to [me]3438-i - if [you]180-jude would . But [I]3438-i suppose [you]180-jude wo n't . "[3438-i] " Why , of course [I]3438-i will . What - is n't [he]3435-i coming to fetch [you]180-jude - to marry [you]180-jude from here ? [He]3435-i wo n't condescend to do that ? "[3438-i] " No - [I]3437-i wo n't let [him]3435-i . [I]3437-i go to [him]3435-i voluntarily , just as [I]3437-i went away from [him]3435-i . [We]7299-we are to be married at [[his]3435-i little church at [Marygreen]1-marygreen]7300-his little church at marygreen . "[3437-i] [She]3437-i was so sadly sweet in what [he]3438-i called [her]3437-i wrong - headedness that [Jude]180-jude could not help being moved to tears more than once for pity of [her]3437-i . " [I]180-jude never knew [such a woman]6995-such a woman for doing impulsive penances , as [you]180-jude , [Sue]174-sue ! No sooner does [one]810-one expect [you]180-jude to go straight on , as [the one rational proceeding]7303-the one rational proceeding , than [you]180-jude double round the corner ! "[180-jude] " Ah , well ; let that go ! ... [Jude]180-jude , [I]3439-me must say good - bye ! But [I]3439-me wanted [you]180-jude to go to [the cemetery]3317-the cemetery with [me]3439-me . "[3439-me] [They]3439-me turned in the direction of [the place]3987-the place , and the gate was opened to [them]3439-me on application . " [It]3887-there is here - [I]174-sue should like to part , "[174-sue] said [she]174-sue . " So be it ! "[174-sue] " Do n't think [me]3439-me hard because [I]3439-me have acted on conviction . [Your]180-jude generous devotion to [me]3439-me is unparalleled , [Jude]180-jude ! [Your]180-jude worldly failure , if [you]180-jude have failed , is to [your]180-jude credit rather than to [your]180-jude blame . ' "[3439-me] " In that chapter [we]7310-we are at one , [ever beloved darling]7311-ever beloved darling , and on it [we]7310-we 'll part [friends]1427-friends . "[174-sue] " Good - bye , [[my]3439-me mistaken wife]7314-my mistaken wife . Good - bye ! "[3439-me] V The next afternoon the familiar Christminster fog still hung over all things . [Sue]174-sue 's slim shape was only just discernible going towards [the station]5059-the station . [Jude]180-jude had no heart to go to [his]180-jude work that day . Neither could [he]180-jude go anywhere in the direction by which [she]174-sue would be likely to pass . [He]180-jude went in an opposite one , to [a dreary , strange , flat scene]3443-a dreary , strange , flat scene , where boughs dripped , and coughs and consumption lurked , and where [he]180-jude had never been before . " [Sue]174-sue 's gone from [me]180-jude - gone ! "[180-jude] [he]180-jude murmured miserably . [She]174-sue in the meantime had left by [the train]5128-the train , and reached [Alfredston Road]80-alfredston road , where [she]174-sue entered [the steam - tram]3445-the steam - tram and was conveyed into [the town]4154-the town . [She]174-sue wished , [she]174-sue said , to come to [him]180-jude voluntarily , to [[his]180-jude very house]3447-his very house and hearthstone . It was Friday evening , which had been chosen because [the schoolmaster]409-the schoolmaster was disengaged at four o'clock that day till the Monday morning following . [The little car [she]174-sue hired at [the Bear]149-the bear to drive [her]174-sue]3449-the little car she hired at the bear to drive her to [Marygreen]1-marygreen set [her]174-sue down at [the end of [the lane]493-the lane]3450-the end of the lane , half a mile from [the village]410-the village , by [her]174-sue desire , and preceded [her]174-sue to [the schoolhouse]419-the schoolhouse with such portion of [her]174-sue luggage as [she]174-sue had brought . [I]163-phillotson do n't know what the times be coming to ! Matrimony have growed to be that serious in these days that [one]810-one really do feel afeard to move in it at all . In [my]163-phillotson time [we]7361-we took it more careless ; and [I]163-phillotson do n't know that [we]7361-we was any the worse for it ! When [I]163-phillotson and [[my]163-phillotson poor man]2712-my poor man were jined in it [we]7361-we kept up the junketing all the week , and drunk [the parish]581-the parish dry , and had to borrow half a crown to begin housekeeping ! "[163-phillotson] When [Mrs. Edlin]313-mrs. edlin had gone back to [[her]313-mrs. edlin cottage]3490-her cottage [Phillotson]163-phillotson spoke moodily . " [I]163-phillotson do n't know whether [I]163-phillotson ought to do it - at any rate quite so rapidly . "[163-phillotson] " Why ? "[258-phillotson] " If [she]2712-my poor man is really compelling [herself]2712-my poor man to this against [her]2712-my poor man instincts - merely from this new sense of duty or religion - [I]258-phillotson ought perhaps to let [her]2712-my poor man wait a bit . "[258-phillotson] " Now [you]258-phillotson 've got so far [you]258-phillotson ought not to back out of it . That 's [my]163-phillotson opinion . "[163-phillotson] " [I]258-phillotson ca n't very well put it off now ; that 's true . But [I]258-phillotson had a qualm when [she]2712-my poor man gave that little cry at sight of the licence . "[258-phillotson] " Now , never [you]258-phillotson have qualms , [old boy]7365-old boy . [I]258-phillotson mean to give [her]2712-my poor man away to - morrow morning , and [you]258-phillotson mean to take [her]2712-my poor man . "[258-phillotson] [Phillotson]163-phillotson nodded , and seeing how staunch [[his]163-phillotson friend]1009-his friend was , became more frank . [The bride]6491-the bride was waiting , ready ; bonnet and all on . [He]180-jude was drinking nothing stronger than ale just then . [He]180-jude did not observe [her]3557-she , and [she]3557-she entered and sat beside [him]180-jude . [Jude]180-jude looked up , and said without surprise : " [You]3557-she 've come to have something , [Arabella]356-arabella ? ... [I]180-jude 'm trying to forget [her]3557-she : that 's all ! But [I]180-jude ca n't ; and [I]180-jude am going [home]3897-home . "[180-jude] [She]3557-she saw that [he]180-jude was a little way on in liquor , but only a little as yet . " [I]356-arabella 've come entirely to look for [you]180-jude , [dear boy]7417-dear boy . [You]180-jude are not well . Now [you]180-jude must have something better than that . "[356-arabella] [Arabella]356-arabella held up [her]356-arabella finger to [the barmaid]1456-the barmaid . " [You]180-jude shall have a liqueur - that 's better fit for [a man of education than beer]7418-a man of education than beer . [You]180-jude shall have maraschino , or curacao dry or sweet , or cherry brandy . [I]356-arabella 'll treat [you]180-jude , [poor chap]2943-poor chap ! "[356-arabella] " [I]356-arabella do n't care which ! Say cherry brandy ... [Sue]174-sue has served [me]356-arabella badly , very badly . [I]356-arabella did n't expect it of [Sue]174-sue ! [I]356-arabella stuck to [her]174-sue , and [she]174-sue ought to have stuck to [me]356-arabella . [I]356-arabella 'd have sold [my]356-arabella soul for [her]174-sue sake , but [she]174-sue would n't risk [hers]174-sue a jot for [me]356-arabella . To save [her]174-sue own soul [she]174-sue lets [mine]356-arabella go damn ! ... But it is n't [her]174-sue fault , [poor little girl]7420-poor little girl - [I]356-arabella am sure it is n't ! "[356-arabella] How [Arabella]356-arabella had obtained money did not appear , but [she]356-arabella ordered a liqueur each , and paid for [them]3562-them . When [they]3563-they had drunk these [Arabella]356-arabella suggested another ; and [Jude]180-jude had the pleasure of being , as it were , personally conducted through the varieties of spirituous delectation by one who knew [the landmarks]3564-the landmarks well . [Arabella]356-arabella kept very considerably in [the rear of [Jude]180-jude]3565-the rear of jude ; but though [she]356-arabella only sipped where [he]180-jude drank , [she]356-arabella took as much as [she]356-arabella could safely take without losing [her]356-arabella head - which was not a little , as the crimson upon [her]356-arabella countenance showed . [Her]356-arabella tone towards [him]180-jude to - night was uniformly soothing and cajoling ; and whenever [he]180-jude said " [I]356-arabella do n't care what happens to [me]356-arabella , "[356-arabella] a thing [he]180-jude did continually , [she]356-arabella replied , " But [I]356-arabella do very much ! "[356-arabella] The closing hour came , and [they]3566-they were compelled to turn out ; whereupon [Arabella]356-arabella put [her]356-arabella arm round [his]180-jude waist , and guided [his]180-jude unsteady footsteps . When [they]3566-they were in [the streets]680-the streets [she]356-arabella said : " [I]356-arabella do n't know what [[our]3566-they landlord]7421-our landlord will say to [my]356-arabella bringing [you]180-jude [home]3897-home in [this state]7423-this state . "[356-arabella] " Anything - anywhere , "[180-jude] replied [Jude]180-jude . " What the devil does it matter to [me]180-jude ? " This - is th ' Martyrs ' - burning - place , "[180-jude] [he]180-jude stammered as [they]3568-they dragged across [a broad street]3571-a broad street . " [I]180-jude remember - in [old Fuller 's Holy State]150-old fuller 's holy state - and [I]180-jude am reminded of it - by [our]3568-they passing by here - [old Fuller]386-old fuller in [[his]386-old fuller Holy State]7427-his holy state says , that at the burning of [Ridley]387-ridley , [Doctor Smith]388-doctor smith - preached sermon , and took as [his]386-old fuller text ' Though [I]180-jude give [my]180-jude body to be burned , and have not charity , it profiteth [me]180-jude nothing . Finding that [[her]305-arabella shorn [Samson]225-samson]3584-her shorn samson was asleep [she]305-arabella entered to the bedside and stood regarding [him]225-samson . " Now , "[305-arabella] said [Arabella]305-arabella to [[her]305-arabella father]4197-her father [downstairs]4245-downstairs , " [we]7467-we must keep plenty of good liquor going in [the house]504-the house these next few days . "[305-arabella] Three days later , when [Jude]180-jude had recovered somewhat from the fearful throbbing of [his]180-jude eyes and brain , but was still considerably confused in [his]180-jude mind by what had been supplied to [him]180-jude by [Arabella]305-arabella during the interval - to keep [him]180-jude , jolly , as [she]305-arabella expressed it - the quiet convivial gathering , suggested by [her]305-arabella , to wind [Jude]180-jude up to the striking point , took place . [Donn]390-donn had only just opened [[his]390-donn miserable little pork and sausage shop]3600-his miserable little pork and sausage shop , which had as yet scarce [any customers]3601-any customers ; nevertheless that party advertised it well , and [the Donns]237-the donns acquired a real notoriety among [a certain class in [Christminster]180-jude who knew not [the colleges]727-the colleges , nor [their]3602-a certain class in christminster who knew not the colleges , nor their works , nor their ways works , nor [their]3602-a certain class in christminster who knew not the colleges , nor their works , nor their ways ways]3602-a certain class in christminster who knew not the colleges , nor their works , nor their ways . [Jude]180-jude was asked if [he]180-jude could suggest [any guest]3604-any guest in addition to those named by [Arabella]305-arabella and [[her]305-arabella father]4197-her father , and in a saturnine humour of perfect recklessness mentioned [Uncle Joe]256-uncle joe , and [Stagg]375-stagg , and [the decayed auctioneer]3606-the decayed auctioneer , and others whom [he]180-jude remembered as having been frequenters of [the well - known tavern]3607-the well - known tavern during [his]180-jude bout therein years before . [Arabella]305-arabella took [him]180-jude at [his]180-jude word so far as [the men]647-the men went , but drew the line at [the ladies]1451-the ladies . [Another man [they]647-the men knew]3610-another man they knew , [Tinker Taylor]273-tinker taylor , though [he]273-tinker taylor lived in [the same street]3611-the same street , was not invited ; but as [he]273-tinker taylor went homeward from a late job on the evening of the party , [he]273-tinker taylor had occasion to call at [the shop]4554-the shop for [trotters]3613-trotters . There were none in , but [he]273-tinker taylor was promised some the next morning . While making [his]273-tinker taylor inquiry [Taylor]273-tinker taylor glanced into [the back room]3614-the back room , and saw [the guests]3615-the guests sitting round , card - playing , and drinking , and otherwise enjoying [themselves]3615-the guests at [Donn]390-donn 's expense . [He]273-tinker taylor went [home]3897-home to bed , and on [his]273-tinker taylor way out next morning wondered how the party went off . [He]273-tinker taylor thought it hardly worth while to call at [the shop]4554-the shop for [his]273-tinker taylor provisions at that hour , [Donn]390-donn and [[his]390-donn daughter]3618-his daughter being probably not up , if [they]3615-the guests caroused late the night before . However , [he]273-tinker taylor found in passing that the door was open , and [he]273-tinker taylor could hear voices within , though the shutters of [the meat - stall]3619-the meat - stall were not down . [He]273-tinker taylor went and tapped at the sitting - room door , and opened it . " Well - to be sure ! "[273-tinker taylor] [he]273-tinker taylor said , astonished . [Hosts]3620-hosts and [guests]3621-guests were sitting card - playing , smoking , and talking , precisely as [he]273-tinker taylor had left [them]3615-the guests eleven hours earlier ; the gas was burning and the curtains drawn , though it had been broad daylight for two hours out of doors . " Yes ! "[305-arabella] cried [Arabella]305-arabella , laughing . " Here [we]7475-we are , just the same . [We]7475-we ought to be ashamed of [ourselves]7475-we , ought n't [we]7475-we ! But it is a sort of housewarming , [you]7476-you see ; and [[our]7475-we friends]7477-our friends are in no hurry . Come in , [Mr. Taylor]391-mr. taylor , and sit down . "[305-arabella] [The tinker]3622-the tinker , or rather [reduced ironmonger]3623-reduced ironmonger , was nothing loath , and entered and took a seat . " [I]273-tinker taylor shall lose a quarter , but never mind , "[273-tinker taylor] [he]273-tinker taylor said . "[305-arabella] [He]273-tinker taylor now perceived that [she]305-arabella was sitting beside [Jude]180-jude , [her]305-arabella arm being round [his]180-jude waist . " Well , [we]7478-we 've been waiting for certain legal hours to arrive , to tell the truth , "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella continued bashfully , and making [her]305-arabella spirituous crimson look as much like [a maiden]3626-a maiden blush as possible . " [Jude]180-jude and [I]305-arabella have decided to make up matters between [us]7478-we by tying the knot again , as [we]7478-we find [we]7478-we ca n't do without [one another]976-one another after all . So , as a bright notion , [we]7478-we agreed to sit on till it was late enough , and go and do it off - hand . "[305-arabella] [Jude]180-jude seemed to pay no great heed to what [she]305-arabella was announcing , or indeed to anything whatever . "[305-arabella] " But [the parson]4761-the parson do n't know ? "[305-arabella] " Yes , [I]4197-her father told [him]4761-the parson last night that [we]7478-we might come between eight and nine , as there were reasons of decency for doing it as early and quiet as possible ; on account of it being [our]7478-we second marriage , which might make [people]658-people curious to look on if [they]658-people knew . [He]4761-the parson highly approved . "[4197-her father] " Oh very well : [I]4197-her father 'm ready , "[4197-her father] said [[her]305-arabella father]4197-her father , getting up and shaking [himself]4197-her father . " Now , [old darling]7482-old darling , "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella said to [Jude]180-jude . " Come along , as [you]180-jude promised . "[305-arabella] " When did [I]180-jude promise anything ? "[180-jude] asked [he]180-jude , whom [she]305-arabella had made so tipsy by [her]305-arabella special knowledge of that line of business as almost to have made [him]180-jude sober again - or to seem so to [those who did not know [him]180-jude]3630-those who did not know him . " Why ! "[305-arabella] said [Arabella]305-arabella , affecting dismay . " [You]180-jude 've promised to marry [me]305-arabella several times as [we]7483-we 've sat here to - night . [The landlord of [the lodging]3135-the lodging , who had heard that [they]3654-they were [a queer couple]2357-a queer couple]3655-the landlord of the lodging , who had heard that they were a queer couple , had doubted if [they]3654-they were married at all , especially as [he]3655-the landlord of the lodging , who had heard that they were a queer couple had seen [Arabella]305-arabella kiss [Jude]180-jude one evening when [she]305-arabella had taken a little cordial ; and [he]3655-the landlord of the lodging , who had heard that they were a queer couple was about to give [them]3654-they notice to quit , till by chance overhearing [her]305-arabella one night haranguing [Jude]180-jude in rattling terms , and ultimately flinging a shoe at [his]180-jude head , [he]3655-the landlord of the lodging , who had heard that they were a queer couple recognized the note of genuine wedlock ; and concluding that [they]3654-they must be respectable , said no more . [Jude]180-jude did not get any better , and one day [he]180-jude requested [Arabella]305-arabella , with considerable hesitation , to execute a commission for [him]180-jude . [I]305-arabella have n't posted it yet . "[305-arabella] The next day [Jude]180-jude wondered if [she]305-arabella really did post it , but would not ask [her]305-arabella ; and foolish Hope , that lives on a drop and a crumb , made [him]180-jude restless with expectation . [He]180-jude knew the times of the possible trains , and listened on each occasion for sounds of [her]305-arabella . [She]305-arabella did not come ; but [Jude]180-jude would not address [Arabella]305-arabella again thereon . [He]180-jude hoped and expected all the next day ; but no [Sue]174-sue appeared ; neither was there any note of reply . Then [Jude]180-jude decided in the privacy of [his]180-jude mind that [Arabella]305-arabella had never posted [hers]305-arabella , although [she]305-arabella had written it . There was something in [her]305-arabella manner which told it . [His]180-jude physical weakness was such that [he]180-jude shed tears at the disappointment when [she]305-arabella was not there to see . [His]180-jude suspicions were , in fact , well founded . [Arabella]305-arabella , like [some other nurses]3659-some other nurses , thought that [your]3660-your duty towards [[your]3660-your invalid]3661-your invalid was to pacify [him]3661-your invalid by any means short of really acting upon [his]3661-your invalid fancies . [He]180-jude never said another word to [her]305-arabella about [his]180-jude wish or [his]180-jude conjecture . A silent , undiscerned resolve grew up in [him]180-jude , which gave [him]180-jude , if not strength , stability and calm . One midday when , after an absence of two hours , [she]305-arabella came into [the room]4227-the room , [she]305-arabella beheld the chair empty . Down [she]305-arabella flopped on the bed , and sitting , meditated . " Now where the devil is [[my]305-arabella man]719-my man gone to ! "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella said . A driving rain from [the north - east]3986-the north - east had been falling with more or less intermission all the morning , and looking from the window at the dripping spouts it seemed impossible to believe that [any sick man]3664-any sick man would have ventured out to almost certain death . Yet a conviction possessed [Arabella]305-arabella that [he]180-jude had gone out , and it became a certainty when [she]305-arabella had searched [the house]504-the house . " If [he]180-jude 's such [a fool]3943-a fool , let [him]180-jude be ! "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella said . " [I]305-arabella can do no more . "[305-arabella] [Jude]180-jude was at that moment in [a railway train]6151-a railway train that was drawing near to [Alfredston]20-alfredston , oddly swathed , pale as a monumental figure in alabaster , and much stared at by [other passengers]3667-other passengers . An hour later [his]180-jude thin form , in the long great - coat and blanket [he]180-jude had come with , but without an umbrella , could have been seen walking along [the five - mile road]3668-the five - mile road to [Marygreen]1-marygreen . On [his]180-jude face showed the determined purpose that alone sustained [him]180-jude , but to which has weakness afforded a sorry foundation . By the up - hill walk [he]180-jude was quite blown , but [he]180-jude pressed on ; and at half - past three o'clock stood by [the familiar well at [Marygreen]1-marygreen]3669-the familiar well at marygreen . The rain was keeping [everybody]411-everybody indoors ; [Jude]180-jude crossed [the green]464-the green to [the church]4809-the church without observation , and found [the building]4677-the building open . Here [he]180-jude stood , looking forth at [the school]458-the school , whence [he]180-jude could hear the usual sing - song tones of the little voices that had not learnt [Creation]395-creation 's groan . [He]180-jude waited till [a small boy]3675-a small boy came from [the school]458-the school - one evidently allowed out before hours for some reason or other . [Jude]180-jude held up [his]180-jude hand , and [the child]3918-the child came . " Please call at [the schoolhouse]419-the schoolhouse and ask [Mrs. Phillotson]258-phillotson if [she]258-phillotson will be kind enough to come to [the church]4809-the church for a few minutes . "[3918-the child] [The child]3918-the child departed , and [Jude]180-jude heard [him]3918-the child knock at the door of [the dwelling]4871-the dwelling . [He]180-jude [himself]180-jude went further into [the church]4809-the church . Everything was new , except a few pieces of carving preserved from the wrecked old fabric , now fixed against the new walls . [He]180-jude stood by these : they seemed akin to [the perished people of [that place]6244-that place who were [[his]180-jude ancestors]3683-his ancestors and [Sue]174-sue 's . A light footstep , which might have been accounted no more than an added drip to the rainfall]3681-the perished people of that place who were his ancestors and sue 's . a light footstep , which might have been accounted no more than an added drip to the rainfall , sounded in [the porch]3684-the porch , and [he]180-jude looked round . " Oh - [I]180-jude did n't think it was [you]180-jude ! [I]180-jude did n't - Oh , [Jude]180-jude ! "[180-jude] A hysterical catch in [her]174-sue breath ended in a succession of them . [He]180-jude advanced , but [she]174-sue quickly recovered and went back . " Do n't go - do n't go ! "[180-jude] [he]180-jude implored . " This is [my]180-jude last time ! [I]180-jude thought it would be less intrusive than to enter [[your]174-sue house]1536-your house . And [I]180-jude shall never come again . Do n't then be unmerciful . [Sue]174-sue , [Sue]174-sue ! [We]7544-we are acting by the letter ; and ' the letter killeth ' ! "[180-jude] " [I]174-sue 'll stay - [I]174-sue wo n't be unkind ! "[174-sue] [she]174-sue said , [her]174-sue mouth quivering and [her]174-sue tears flowing as [she]174-sue allowed [him]180-jude to come closer . " But why did [you]180-jude come , and do this wrong thing , after doing such a right thing as [you]180-jude have done ? "[174-sue] " What right thing ? "[180-jude] " [Marrying Arabella]305-arabella again . It was in the Alfredston paper . [She]174-sue has never been other than [yours]180-jude , [Jude]180-jude - in a proper sense . And therefore [you]180-jude did so well - Oh so well ! - in recognizing it - and taking [her]174-sue to [you]180-jude again . "[180-jude] " [God]385-god above - and is that all [I]180-jude 've come to hear ? If there is anything more degrading , immoral , unnatural , than another in [my]180-jude life , it is this meretricious contract with [Arabella]305-arabella which has been called doing the right thing ! And [you]180-jude too - [you]180-jude call [yourself]180-jude [[Phillotson]258-phillotson 's wife]7545-phillotson 's wife ! [[HIS]180-jude wife]4427-his wife ! [You]180-jude are [mine]180-jude . "[180-jude] " Do n't make [me]180-jude rush away from [you]180-jude - [I]180-jude ca n't bear much ! But on this point [I]180-jude am decided . "[180-jude] " [I]180-jude can not understand how [you]180-jude did it - how [you]180-jude think it - [I]180-jude can not ! "[180-jude] " Never mind that . [He]180-jude is [a kind husband]7547-a kind husband to [me]180-jude - And [I]180-jude - [I]180-jude 've wrestled and struggled , and fasted , and prayed . [I]180-jude have nearly brought [my]180-jude body into complete subjection . And [you]180-jude must n't - will [you]180-jude - wake - "[180-jude] " Oh [[you]180-jude darling little fool]7548-you darling little fool ; where is [your]180-jude reason ? [You]180-jude seem to have suffered the loss of [your]180-jude faculties ! [I]180-jude would argue with [you]180-jude if [I]180-jude did n't know that [a woman in [your]180-jude state of feeling]7549-a woman in your state of feeling is quite beyond all appeals to [her]7549-a woman in your state of feeling brains . Or is it that [you]180-jude are humbugging [yourself]180-jude , as [so many women]2077-so many women do about these things ; and do n't actually believe what [you]180-jude pretend to , and only are indulging in the luxury of the emotion raised by an affected belief ? "[180-jude] " Luxury ! How can [you]180-jude be so cruel ! "[180-jude] " [[You]180-jude dear]7551-you dear , sad , soft , most melancholy wreck of [a promising human intellect]7552-a promising human intellect that it has ever been [my]180-jude lot to behold ! Where is [your]180-jude scorn of convention gone ? [I]180-jude WOULD have died game ! "[180-jude] " [You]180-jude crush , almost insult [me]3685-i , [Jude]180-jude ! Go away from [me]3685-i ! "[3685-i] [She]3685-i turned off quickly . " [I]3685-i will . "[3685-i] [she]3685-i burst out , and [her]3685-i eye resting on [him]3686-i a moment , [she]3685-i turned back impulsively . " Do n't , do n't scorn [me]3685-i ! "[3685-i] [She]3685-i rushed up to [him]3686-i and , with [her]3685-i mouth on [his]3686-i , continued : " [I]3685-i must tell [you]3686-i - oh [I]3685-i must - [my]3685-i darling Love ! It has been - only a church marriage - an apparent marriage [I]3685-i mean ! [He]3686-i suggested it at the very first ! "[3685-i] " How ? "[3685-i] " [I]3685-i mean it is a nominal marriage only . Now , in the name of all [you]3685-i hold holy , tell [me]3686-i the truth , and no lie . [You]174-sue do love [me]3686-i still ? "[3686-i] " [I]3686-i do ! [You]174-sue know it too well ! ... But [I]3686-i MUSTN'T do this ! [I]3686-i must n't kiss [you]3685-i back as [I]3686-i would ! "[3686-i] " But do ! Do n't follow [me]3687-she - do n't look at [me]3687-she . Leave [me]3687-she , for pity 's sake ! "[3687-she] [She]3687-she ran up [the church]4809-the church to [the east end]3689-the east end , and [Jude]180-jude did as [she]3687-she requested . [He]180-jude did not turn [his]180-jude head , but took up [his]180-jude blanket , which [she]3687-she had not seen , and went straight out . As [he]180-jude passed the end of [the church]4809-the church [she]3687-she heard [his]180-jude coughs mingling with the rain on the windows , and in a last instinct of human affection , even now unsubdued by [her]3687-she fetters , [she]3687-she sprang up as if to go and succour [him]180-jude . But [she]3687-she knelt down again , and stopped [her]3687-she ears with [her]3687-she hands till all possible sound of [him]180-jude had passed away . [He]180-jude was by this time at the corner of [the green]464-the green , from which the path ran across [the fields in which [he]180-jude had scared [rooks]3693-rooks as [a boy]4566-a boy]3692-the fields in which he had scared rooks as a boy . [He]180-jude turned and looked back , once , at [the building which still contained [Sue]174-sue]3695-the building which still contained sue ; and then went on , knowing that [his]180-jude eyes would light on that scene no more . There are cold spots up and down [Wessex]10-wessex in autumn and winter weather ; but the coldest of all when a north or east wind is blowing is the crest of the down by [the Brown House]790-the brown house , where [the road to [Alfredston]20-alfredston]4492-the road to alfredston crosses [the old Ridgeway]3698-the old ridgeway . Here the first winter sleets and snows fall and lie , and here the spring frost lingers last unthawed . Here in the teeth of the north - east wind and rain [Jude]180-jude now pursued [his]180-jude way , wet through , the necessary slowness of [his]180-jude walk from lack of [his]180-jude former strength being insufficent to maintain [his]180-jude heat . [He]180-jude came to [the milestone]4576-the milestone , and , raining as it was , spread [his]180-jude blanket and lay down there to rest . Before moving on [he]180-jude went and felt at the back of the stone for [his]180-jude own carving . It was still there ; but nearly obliterated by moss . [He]180-jude passed the spot where the gibbet of [[his]180-jude ancestor]3700-his ancestor and [Sue]174-sue 's had stood , and descended [the hill]564-the hill . It was dark when [he]180-jude reached [Alfredston]20-alfredston , where [he]180-jude had a cup of tea , the deadly chill that began to creep into [his]180-jude bones being too much for [him]180-jude to endure fasting . To get [home]3897-home [he]180-jude had to travel by [a steam tram - car]3703-a steam tram - car , and [two branches of railway]3704-two branches of railway , with much waiting at [a junction]3705-a junction . [He]180-jude did not reach [Christminster]180-jude till ten o'clock . [IX]231-ix On [the platform]1291-the platform stood [Arabella]305-arabella . [She]305-arabella looked [him]180-jude up and down . " [You]180-jude 've been to see [her]305-arabella ? "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella asked . " [I]180-jude have , "[180-jude] said [Jude]180-jude , literally tottering with cold and lassitude . " Well , now [you]305-arabella 'd best march along [home]3897-home . "[180-jude] The water ran out of [him]180-jude as [he]180-jude went , and [he]180-jude was compelled to lean against the wall to support [himself]180-jude while coughing . " [You]180-jude 've done for [yourself]180-jude by this , [young man]3930-young man , "[305-arabella] said [she]305-arabella . " [I]305-arabella do n't know whether [you]180-jude know it . "[305-arabella] " Of course [I]305-arabella do . [I]305-arabella meant to do for [myself]305-arabella . "[305-arabella] " What - to commit suicide ? "[305-arabella] " Certainly . [You]305-arabella think [you]305-arabella are the stronger ; and so [you]305-arabella are , in a physical sense , now . [You]305-arabella could push [me]305-arabella over like a nine - pin . [You]305-arabella did not send that letter the other day , and [I]305-arabella could not resent [your]305-arabella conduct . But [I]305-arabella am not so weak in another way as [you]305-arabella think . [I]305-arabella made up [my]305-arabella mind that [a man confined to [[his]7562-a man confined to his room room]4314-his room]7562-a man confined to his room by inflammation of the lungs , [a fellow who had only two wishes left in]7564-a fellow who had only two wishes left in [the world]706-the world , to see [a particular woman , and then to die]7566-a particular woman , and then to die , could neatly accomplish those two wishes at one stroke by taking this journey in the rain . That [I]305-arabella 've done . [I]305-arabella have seen [her]7567-her for the last time , and [I]305-arabella 've finished [myself]305-arabella - put an end to a feverish life which ought never to have been begun ! "[180-jude] The expression of [Jude]180-jude 's corpselike face in the watery lamplight was indeed as if [he]180-jude saw [people]658-people where there was [nobody]4069-nobody . [Sue]174-sue unlatched the other chamber door , and , as if seized with faintness , sank down outside [it]3730-it . Getting up again [she]174-sue half opened the door , and said " [Richard]258-phillotson . "[174-sue] As the word came out of [her]174-sue mouth [she]174-sue visibly shuddered . The snoring had quite ceased for some time , but [he]543-a man did not reply . [Sue]174-sue seemed relieved , and hurried back to [[Mrs. Edlin]313-mrs. edlin 's chamber]3731-mrs. edlin 's chamber . " [I]5702-the widow be old and slow , and it takes [me]5702-the widow a long while to un - ray . [I]5702-the widow han't unlaced [my]5702-the widow jumps yet . Times have changed since then ! "[5702-the widow] X Despite [himself]3740-i [Jude]180-jude recovered somewhat , and worked at [his]3740-i trade for several weeks . "[305-arabella] [she]305-arabella would say , " to get [a nurse]7636-a nurse for nothing by marrying [me]305-arabella ! "[305-arabella] [Jude]180-jude was absolutely indifferent to what [she]305-arabella said , and indeed , often regarded [her]305-arabella abuse in a humorous light . Sometimes [his]3740-i mood was more earnest , and as [he]3740-i lay [he]3740-i often rambled on upon the defeat of [his]3740-i early aims . " [Every man]7637-every man has some little power in some one direction , "[3740-i] [he]3740-i would say . " [I]3740-i was never really stout enough for the stone trade , particularly the fixing . Moving the blocks always used to strain [me]3740-i , and standing the trying draughts in [buildings]7638-buildings before the windows are in always gave [me]3740-i colds , and [I]3740-i think that began the mischief inside . But [I]3740-i felt [I]3740-i could do one thing if [I]3740-i had the opportunity . [I]3740-i could accumulate ideas , and impart them to [others]4093-others . [I]3740-i wonder if [the founders]7640-the founders had such as [I]3740-i in [their]7640-the founders minds - [a fellow good for nothing else but that particular thing]7641-a fellow good for nothing else but that particular thing ? ... [I]3740-i hear that soon there is going to be a better chance for [such helpless students]7642-such helpless students as [I]3740-i was . And it is too late , too late for [me]3740-i ! Ah - and for how many worthier ones before [me]3740-i ! "[3740-i] " How [you]3747-you keep a - mumbling ! "[305-arabella] said [Arabella]305-arabella . "[305-arabella] One day [he]3749-he received a surprise . [Mrs. Edlin]313-mrs. edlin came to see [him]3749-he , quite on [her]313-mrs. edlin own account .
